column22: str
column23: str
column24: str

column22: Emphatic talk shape, conversation motion.
column23: Document talk shape, looped behavior gestures.
column24: Eerie talk shape, looped angry gestures.

column22: Y!
column23: R!
column24: P!

column22: Ahhh, that was grrreat! <burp>
column23: I tell ye, ain't no place what serves tastier meals than here!

column22: Basic stance and standing reaction test. (Handing over item.)
column23: Shifting to “behavior reaction greeting.”

column22: Basic stance and standing reaction test. (Receiving item.)
column23: Shifting to “behavior reaction thinking.”

column22: Basic stance and standing reaction test. (Conversation item.)
column23: Shifting to “behavior reaction anger.”

column22:
Basic stance and standing reaction test.
Normal seated → normal stance → standing reaction.

Basic stance and standing reaction test.
Flashy stance → normal stance → standing reaction.

Basic stance and standing reaction test.
Flashy seated → normal seated → normal stance → standing reaction.

Basic stance and standing reaction test.
Unique → normal stance → standing reaction.
I can see the sky! Wonderful!
As you can see, I am a minstrel.
column23: Mayhap I can play for you a sweet lullaby?

column22: I am a giver of quests, nothing more and nothing less.
Page break test, here we go! Page ONE!
column23: Page TWO!
column24: Page THREE!

column22:
Line break test, are you ready!?
Bam! It is done!
Hey, did you know? There's a place in Meguro where you can gorge yourself on meat of unrivaled epicness.
Just testing some default talk. Nothing to see here.
I'm testing some default talk! Don't bother me!
It is a default talk test.
I don't believe I've seen your face before. New to Gridania, I take it?
column23: Then you're required to register at the Carline Canopy. Don't let me catch you strolling about until you've done so.

column22: Make yourself known at the Carline Canopy, where the local Adventurers' Guild is headquartered. Speak to Mother Miounne within, and she will take you in hand.
column23: So long as you are within Gridanian territory, you must abide by Gridanian laws. Go now, and do as I have instructed.

column22: Yer one o' them adventurers, ain't ye? Gridania fair swarms with outsiders o' late. Can't walk ten bloody yalms without bumpin' into one o' ye.
column23: Don't be takin' this the wrong way─we appreciate the hard work ye do, an' all─but 'tis hard to be at ease when scores o' strangers walk through yer home every day.

column22: It is by the blessing of the elementals that we Gridanians dwell in the Twelveswood. As you go about your business, be ever mindful of their presence and respectful of their will.
It is by the blessing of the elementals that we Gridanians dwell in the Twelveswood.
column23: See to it that you do naught which brings our people to grief.

column22: I don't understand these Gridanians. They make a great show of doubting us adventurers, yet place their trust in beings they can't even see. Where is the reason in that, I ask you?
I heard that the elementals show themselves when enraged. Call me reckless, but I'd <Emphasis>love</Emphasis> to see one in the flesh...or whatever the hells it is they're made of.
Welcome to the Carline Canopy, a place of respite for adventurers like yourself.
column23: As you may imagine, the Twelveswood has scarcely begun to recover from the devastation wrought by the Calamity, and Gridania wants for all the help it can get. I hope we can count on yours.
column24: Though I will not deny there are those among us who view outsiders with suspicion, if you play your part, they will come to see that adventurers are the very salve our nation so sorely needs.

column22: You stand before the Adders' Nest, the headquarters of the Order of the Twin Adder, Gridania's own Grand Company. It is here that our nation draws together its military, economic, and technological resources that we may bring their combined might to bear against our foes.
Though our trials and tribulations be endless, never must we allow ourselves to become lost to hope.
column23: For as the Elder Seedseer teaches, ever do the elementals watch over us. So long as we trust to them and each do our part, all shall be well.

column22: I was told playing with the younglings would make me a better carpenter. I...I don't think it's working.

column23: Mummy told me to wait here until she gets back.

column22: The younglings at the Acorn Orchard have all had it rough.
column23: I'm the grown-up around here, so it's my job to look after them.

column22: You stand before the White Wolf Gate. The road beyond leads to regions rife with danger, and the gate is to remain closed until further notice.
column23: Curiosity has been the demise of many an adventurer, but it need not be yours. Move along now.

column22: Gridania is but a part of the Twelveswood.
column23: Whether you are within her walls or without, pray remember to pay the elementals due deference.

column22: No thief's gonna get his grubby bloody hands on our grain while I'm on watch. Nay, not so much as a single mangy squirrel!
You know who Mother Miounne is, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>sister<Else/>brother</If>? You'd do well to take her advice to heart.
column23: There's some as say she's overbearing, but without her, we adventurers wouldn't be able to get by here in the Black Shroud. I myself owe her much and more.

column22: Why, hello there, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. I take it you've come to see about a retainer?
column23: Well, I'm sorry to disappoint, but we're not in a position to introduce anyone to you at present. If you visit us again at a later date, we will of course do our utmost to accommodate your needs. Apologies again for the inconvenience.

column22: This here's the Bannock, where Twin Adder recruits are drilled.
column23: You're free to observe, but see to it you don't get in anyone's way.

column22: You stand within the Archers' Guild, where men and women gather to learn the way of the bow, as passed down to us from the Elezen sentries and Miqo'te hunters of eld.
column23: I am tasked with providing guidance to those who seek membership here. Let me know if I can assist you in any way.

column22: It was my people, the Elezen, who gave rise to the noble tradition of archery.
column23:
To see it thus...<Emphasis>parodied</Emphasis> by outsiders...
It is an outrage.

column22: The world can seem clearer when viewed down an arrow's shaft, but an archer must think of more than just the target.
Mih Khetto's Amphitheatre is open to citizens and outsiders alike.
column23: We ask only that you use the facility with care, out of respect for the kind-hearted souls who took such pains to rebuild it.

column22: Some five years ago, a great scholar stood vigil before these waters. It's said he came here to rally all of Eorzea in the fight against the Garlean Empire.
column23: I do wonder what became of the man... I should like the chance to meet him in person.

column22: My wife and child... The men and women with whom I shared a stage... They're gone, every last one of them. There's nothing left in my life worth a damn.
The district beyond is home to distinguished Gridanians. Commoners may not enter. That includes <Emphasis>you</Emphasis>, adventurer.
column23: Go back whence you came, or I will be forced to remind you of your place.

column22: Greetings and welcome to the Lancers' Guild. Here you may train in the polearm and learn to conquer your fears.
column23: It is my duty to provide guidance to those who would enroll. If there is aught you wish to know, I should be glad to assist you.

column22: The Wailing Barracks lies beyond. If you have no business here, I would thank you to return whence you came.
I came all the way from Ul'dah to sell my wares, but the locals are proving an unreceptive lot.
column23: Why, it's as if they're averse to novelty─to change and progress! I'm going to need a new approach if I'm to make any coin here...or perhaps an <Emphasis>old</Emphasis> one?

column22: Down this path and across the lake lies the East Shroud.
column23: You'll need to take the ferry if you have business in the Honey Yard or Nine Ivies.

column22: That godsdamned merchant from Ul'dah... I wish she'd bugger off back to where she came from!
column23: I swear, every time she opens her mouth, it's about coin, coin, and more bloody coin!

column22: Gridania's markets are divided into two main rows of stalls, named Ebony and Rosewood. Medicine and sundry goods can be had at the former, while arms and armor are found at the latter.
You'll find none with greater skill or deeper passion than the leatherworkers of our guild.
As the Twelveswood changes, so too must we change. To evolve and grow is the nature of life.
column23: We endured the Calamity not by fearing the forest, but by following its example and adapting to survive.

column22: Welcome to the Leatherworkers' Guild, where the most magnificent leather goods in all the realm take shape.
The guild's reputation for peerless craftsmanship is acknowledged even in Ul'dah.
column23: Hence do the products of Fen–Yll Fineries command such high prices. And no right-thinking person with so much as an <Emphasis>onze</Emphasis> of taste would deny that they are worth every gil.
column24: Why, I often visit Gridania just to look upon the exquisite quality of their work.

column22:
We're closed. Come back later.
<sigh> Would that every day could be a festival...
Mind the flowerpots! You break it, you bought it!

column23: You know, it was only after I became a botanist that I came to appreciate the hard work necessary to bring even a single flower into bloom.

column22: Hello there, and welcome to the Botanists' Guild. We manage all the plots of the Greatloam Growery.
The nerve of some outsiders, waltzing into Gridania as if they were the elementals' gift to the Twelveswood... I'll wager most of them don't even know what a hoe is!

Go quietly within these caverns.
...Lest you misunderstand, I speak not of such sounds as one's ears might hear.
column23: Here we open our hearts to the whispers of the elementals. Take care that you do not disturb this communion by bringing in tumultuous thoughts.

column22: Breathe deep. Focus on the flow as you draw the energies into your body. Exhale and observe the changes within and without.
column23: These forces of creation envelop and permeate us all. Fully comprehending this truth shall make you a superior conjurer.

column22: Pfarahr always treats me like a child. It fair drives me up the wall!
Memama never listens to me! I've told her countless times not to venture outside without her parents' permission, yet she never bothers to ask them.
Welcome to the airship landing.
I'm terribly sorry, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, but our services are restricted to those who possess airship passes.
Greetings, traveler, and welcome to Gridania's airship landing. How may I be of service?
You are come to Stillglade Fane, home of the Conjurers' Guild.
column23: All may learn the art of conjury if our guildmaster accepts their supplication.
Ow! That smarts!

column22: As an apprentice, I assist the conjurers in all manner of work, from the treatment of visitors to the observance of auguries.
column23: There is no greater honor than to serve the people of Gridania.

column22: Only those of the Gods' Quiver are permitted past this point. I suggest you step away from the doors.

Why the Archers' Guild, you ask? Hmmm... Perchance you are familiar with the popular saying about “keeping one's friends close,” and so on? Yes, well, I strongly disagree with its sentiments on enemies.
Welcome to the Carpenters' Guild. Here we produce all manner of wooden products─from weapons to wardrobes, shields to stools, and much more.
There is no such thing as an all-purpose wood. An archer's bow is quite unlike a scholar's bookshelf.
column23: Different parts of the same tree can have different uses as well. Mind you, these are but the fundamentals of carpentry.

column22: None are as selfless as the trees. They sacrifice their mortal shells that we might live to die another day. This is not a gift to be accepted lightly.
How does he do it? Such clean cuts and alacritous assembly... I cannot hope to mimic such mastery!
When we must risk incurring the wrath of the elementals, we Wood Wailers and the archers of the Gods' Quiver wear these masks.
column23: However, more than a few of us are beginning to think them naught but superstitious trinkets. I, for one, would be sorely troubled were it revealed that the guardians of the Twelveswood could be so easily deceived...

column22: The Wood Wailers were wise to allow the Lancers' Guild the use of their facilities.
column23: Training together can only lead to mutual improvement─and better qualified recruits for the Order of the Twin Adder.

column22: The new recruits are quite promising. If they continue to hone their skills, who knows how strong they will become?
You are come to the Wailing Barracks, home of the Wood Wailers─the keepers of the peace within Gridania.
column23: Visitors are welcome to observe the lancers in training. More than a few have been inspired to join after doing so.

column22: The Calamity forced many a local merchant out of business. It was only when the Ul'dahns appeared that the markets began to regain a semblance of their former life.
column23: Profits are high, but so is tension between locals and outsiders. While it can't be denied that the Ul'dahns have helped us greatly, their presence gives rise to new problems.

column22: My brother Hadrefort and I oversee the Rosewood Stalls, while that Ul'dahn merchant Rishushu is responsible for the Ebony Stalls. 'Course, Master Parsemontret holds the real power in the markets.
column23: Hadrefort thinks Rishushu is a decent enough lass, but I say that Ul'dahn wench can't be trusted. Aye, she's always dealt fairly with me, but it doesn't pay to ignore one's instincts in business...

column22: This is the aetheryte plaza, hub of the Gridanian Aethernet.
column23: It used to be situated in the western part of the city, but it was moved here after the Calamity. Veteran adventurers who return after a long absence are wont to find the change somewhat disorientating.

column22: You know why this place is called Apkallu Falls?
column23: Someone once tried to breed apkallus here, or so the story goes. Looks like it didn't go too well, though...unless they're <Emphasis>really</Emphasis> good at hiding.

column22: I heard that the Order of the Twin Adder was officially reformed right here, in Mih Khetto's Amphitheatre. That was before the amphitheatre was moved, of course.
Well do I remember the day the Order of the Twin Adder was reformed─the day I first laid eyes upon the Elder Seedseer.
column23: Graceful yet strong, with a voice like song... When I close my eyes I can still see her standing there, clear as day.

column22: We learn much by tending the gardens─not only about plants, but ourselves as well. As we help the plants to grow, so too do they help us.
These gates lead outside the city. Take the road north if you seek Hyrstmill, and keep west if you're headed to Fallgourd Float.
Please be informed that Atelier Fen–Yll is not accepting orders for bristletail boots at present.
column23: The hunting of bristletail marmots has been prohibited due to incessant poaching. As a result, we have been forced to cease production until further notice.

column22: Damn those stubborn leatherworkers! I spent a fortune on this marmot pelt, but they refuse to use it in my order! Gods' sakes, the blasted creature's already <Emphasis>dead</Emphasis>! Surely, it'd be the greater crime <Emphasis>not</Emphasis> to make it into a pair of boots!
This here's the Leatherworkers' Guild, renowned throughout Eorzea for producin' the best leather goods that gil can buy.
column23: ...If you're willin' to wait two years, that is. They've more orders than they can fill, see─which is why it's become necessary to maintain a Wailer presence here. Suffice to say, some customers ain't used to disappointment.
column24: Like that prickly fellow over yonder. Wonder when he'll give up and go home...

column23: Back off, will you? It's hot enough without you breathing down my neck.

column22: What is today a tiny sprout may one day grow into a mighty oak and spread its seeds throughout the land.
column23: It is no different with men. We are all equals in the circle of life, seeking only to survive.

column22: Welcome to Fen–Yll Fineries! It would be my pleasure to serve you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>...
column23: ...if you had an order placed, that is. We only deal in bespoke items, you see.

column22: ...Aye! 'Tis the perfect plan! If I can just get the trim right, these “genuine Fen–Yll fashions” will net me an Admiral's ransom back in Lims─
column23: H-Hey, what's that look for? I'm simply <Emphasis>considering</Emphasis> a purchase for...my mum! Y–Yes, only the <Emphasis>finest</Emphasis> leathers for my <Emphasis>dearest</Emphasis> mum!

column22: Greetings, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. Might you be looking to secure the services of a retainer?
column23: My sincerest apologies, but we currently have no retainers available for hire.

column22: Greetings, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. Please feel free to use the market board to search for any items you desire.

This shop usually sells only to the Wood Wailers and the Gods' Quiver. But I am never one to turn down a <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> with coin in <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> purse.
These gates are to remain closed until further notice. If you wish to venture outside the walls, you can ride the ferry from Westshore Pier south of the Lancers' Guild.
You... Could you possibly be...?
column23: ...N-No, forget I said anything. My mistake.

column22: Mih Khetto's Amphitheatre, so named for the legendary minstrel, once stood just beyond this rubble.
column23: That all changed five years ago, when the Calamity laid it to waste. The amphitheatre has since been rebuilt at the center of our city, thanks to the tireless efforts of the carpenters of the Oak Atrium.

column22: Lost your way, have you? This path here will take you to Mih Khetto's Amphitheatre and the Leatherworkers' Guild.
I-I'm fine. Nothing wrong at all, no need to concern yourself.
Nophica's Altar is a holy place. It is here that the Hearers communicate the will of the elementals to men.
column23: The elementals govern all aspects of life in the Twelveswood, from the creatures we may hunt to the articles we may bring into their domain. As a result, foreign merchants dread visiting this place, conscious that their wares may be unwanted.

column22: Listen, adventurer, to the rustling leaves, the flowing rivers─to the very pulse of this land. We conjurers of Stillglade Fane interpret these whispers of the elementals and convey them to the people of Gridania.
Bettin' all me earnin's on the auguries, I am. I cannae take another bad harvest.
Otherworldly voices have been waking me in the night, but I haven't the faintest idea why. I have done naught to incur the elementals' ire.
You are come to participate in the meditations, I presume?
Ahead you shall find Stillglade Fane, where the conjurers conduct their meditations. If you have business with them, you may proceed.
Welcome to the Oak Atrium, headquarters of the Carpenters' Guild.
column23: Perhaps you glimpsed the giant waterwheel on the path from the Blue Badger Gate? That would be Figaga's Gift, a triumph of engineering and the pride of our guild.

column22: We're discussing how best to deal with the Ixali threat. Perhaps an adventurer such as you could offer a fresh perspective on the matter?
Ahead lies Quiver's Hold, home to the Gods' Quiver, the defenders of Gridania. It also houses the Archers' Guild, if you seek training in the ways of the bow.
There's coin to be had hunting bandits, I'll grant you that. But there're times when I long to do something more worthy of song.
Gridanian food is as bland as it gets. I had heard the rumors, but gods, the water had more flavor!

<crunch> <crunch>
<crunch> <crunch>
...My father always said─<burp>─“Masticate in moderation.”
I don't give two shites about how the food tastes. All I needs is drink.
Love to 'elp you <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>mate</If>, but we ain't nowhere near ready.
The Order of the Twin Adder makes no distinction between newcome adventurers and forestborn Gridanians. Your worth as a soldier is measured by your dedication to the cause.

No matter how true their arrows fly, archers with eyes only for their targets have no place on the battlefield. One must always mind one's surroundings, and strike where and when the enemy at large will feel it most keenly.
Galfrid Mossback has led many good men into battle, and done his damndest to see them home safely.
column23: He knows all too well what terrors the forest holds, and his determination to prepare our recruits to face them is expressed in his relentless approach to training.

column22: Meals here at the Bannock are filling, but once in a while, it would be nice to have something with a dash of...well...<Emphasis>flavor</Emphasis>.
We once relied on the elementals to protect the Twelveswood, but with their power now diminished, it falls to us to shoulder this burden.
column23: The Bannock was built for this very purpose. It is a tangible symbol of the commitment both the Elder Seedseer and the Order of the Twin Adder have made to maintaining the balance of the forest.

column22: Even a forestborn Gridanian must take care when abroad in the Twelveswood. I would not plan any romantic moonlit strolls through the trees if I were you.
Spirithold has been overrun by malicious imps. Have a care you do not fall prey to their subtle glamours.
You must beseech the elementals' consent if you would partake of the forest's bounty.
column23: And only through the Hearers may the will of the elementals be known.

column22: I got my first wood axe at the age of eight, an' I've never once looked back.
column23: Can't say as I know much about aught else, but the loggin' trade's done alright by me.

column22: Do not judge the Twelveswood by what you see on the surface. With the presence of the elementals grown faint, the smallest patch of rot could spread to threaten the entire forest.
column23: To prevent such a fate, we Hearers strain to catch even the slightest whisper of a troubled spirit.

column22: Good to see you out here, adventurer. The name's Gabineaux. I oversee the logging in these parts.
column23: In return for the trees we take from the forest, it falls to us lumberjacks to tend to the saplings and keep the soil rich and vital.
column24: All of which would be fine if it weren't for the damned monsters. My blood fair boils to think of the Twelveswood being defiled by foul beasts and parasites!

column22: I recall the face of every adventurer who has passed my post.
column23: But my duty extends beyond merely monitoring the movements of strangers. As a member of the Gods' Quiver, I am also charged with identifying those men and women possessed of potentially useful talent.

column22: Ommm......
column23: Ommm......
column24: Omm─ Ahem, if you don't mind, I am trying to meditate.

column22: The Bannock is to the southeast of here. If it is Bentbranch Meadows you seek, cross the bridge and follow the road south.
column23: Should you decide to venture over the bridge, be warned that the creatures in that neck of the woods are far more deadly in nature than the pests found in the shadow of the city walls.

column22: You are come to the hamlet of Hyrstmill. Lest you wonder, our outskirts are tightly patrolled to counter the Ixali threat.
column23: I may add that those same patrols will not hesitate to deal with <Emphasis>any</Emphasis> who threaten the peace of our citizens. Do not imagine yourself above our laws.

column22: This is where we store the Mun–Tuy beans. Hyrstmill is famous for them, you know.
column23: We use every part of the bean, from the juice to the pulped husk. It would be the perfect food, if not for the horrendous smell...

column22: Caught a spear in the thigh once during a tussle with the birdmen. Aches like the seven hells when bad weather is on the way, but at least I know when to stay indoors!
Keep an eye out on your travels for odd feathers on the ground. Chances are the Ixal are not far away.
column23: The birdmen often adorn themselves with feathered decorations, you see─seems the wretched creatures are trying to emulate the wings with which their ancestors were born.

column22: I once witnessed the Ixal tearing my friends to pieces, and my only thought was to flee in terror. Perhaps an adventurer is hardened to such sights...
column23: But me? That sight will haunt me for the rest of my days...

column22: Though we may soothe the suffering of our people, there is little we can do to dispel their fears.
column23: When opposites collide, it is nature's way that the greater force prevails. Lend us your strength, adventurer, that we might overcome our enemies.

column22: No time to prattle! I've meals to prepare and a table to set before the workers come in from the fields!
What do you think of our waterwheel? It may not be as impressive as the grand wheels in Gridania, but it does give the place a certain charm.
column23: The constant flow of the stream, the churning of the blades... Ah, like balm for the soul, it is.

column22: A word, adventurer. If ye want our trust, ye'll have to earn it. And that ain't no mean feat, let me tell ye.
column23: 'Tis more'n worth the trouble, though. For once ye've proven yerself a friend, ye'll never want for stauncher allies than us.

column22: You need not fear the Ixal here. Hyrstmill lies under the protection of the elementals and the Elder Seedseer herself.
The waterwheel is the pride of Hyrstmill. Many here would gladly lay down their lives to defend it.

Packs of bloodthirsty Ixal have been spotted not far from the city walls, and in the vicinity of several of the camps besides. You may think yourself a match for them─you may even be <Emphasis>right</Emphasis>─but I would advise you to exercise caution all the same.
Those conjurers are somethin', aren't they? Healin' the sick, and communin' with those “elementals” and such.
column23: Truly amazin'. Ahem. Don't suppose you could tell me what an “elemental” is now, could you?

column22: We conjurers are by no means all-powerful. It is only with the aid of others that we may begin to achieve our true potential.
Have you perhaps heard mention of the Ixali tribe of beastmen? Long beaks? Sharp talons? They are a brutal race, preying on both man and beast with equal savagery.
column23: It is not an exaggeration to call them our most bitter enemies. And now we have frequent reports of the birdmen seen not a stone's throw from the city walls. Have a care not to end up in one of their stew pots, stripling.

column22: Continue down this path if you wish to enter Old Gridania.
column23: There you shall find Atelier Fen–Yll─a gathering place for the finest leatherworkers in Eorzea. And should you seek somewhere pleasant to rest your feet, I recommend Mih Khetto's Amphitheatre.

column22: Welcome to Treespeak Stables. This is where we train the chocobos that were bred out at Bentbranch Meadows in the Central Shroud.
column23: By all means have a look around, but I would ask you to refrain from entering the stables proper─the younger birds take fright easily enough without an unending procession of adventurers gaping at them.

column22: Feast your eyes upon the Ebony and Rosewood Stalls─the two most bustling branches of Gridania's marketplace.
column23: Ahhh, my soul soars to the sound of clinking coins and haggling peddlers once more! In the dark days after the Calamity, so many merchants gave up the trade that I feared my ears would never hear its like again.

column22: Hyrstmill may be a quaint village compared to the great cities, but this simple settlement is no less precious to those who live here.
column23: There's something to be said for having such a comforting place to come home to.

column22: Does not the scent and sight of flowers set your mind at ease? There is no greater joy than knowing that the blooms I tended myself bring happiness to all who gaze upon them.

It is seldom acknowledged, but leatherworkers shoulder a heavy responsibility─our raw materials come at the price of an animal's life, after all. Some of our crafters even give up the trade, unable to bear the guilt.
column23: Of course, rather <Emphasis>more</Emphasis> of our crafters give up the trade because they are unable to bear our master's scorn...

column22: Each Grand Company has its own words─the core tenet which guides its every endeavor. “Wood's will be done” is ours, and by them we discharge our duty.
column23: Whether you belong to an organization or fancy yourself a lone wolf, we all need principles to live by.

column22: Have you business with me, adventurer?
column23: Maisenta of Black Rabbit Traders, at your service. I welcome opportunities for profit and mutual benefit, but I'm afraid you appear to offer neither.

column22: As much as I enjoy reminding adventurers of their ignorance of our ways, I'm afraid our stock of supplies requires my attention. It takes more than just gysahl greens and whistles to raise chocobos, you know.
I am tasked with keeping the people in and around Josselin's Spire supplied.

I was once quartermaster at a lightly guarded camp constantly harried by foul beasts, but now I hold the post at this quiet settlement. A less perilous duty, I concede, though one which requires no less effort.

Forgive me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>─my shop is not open for business at present.
...Though I daresay I have little that would interest you if it were.
Welcome to Fullflower Comb. As you may have deduced, we are in the business of raising honeybees.
column23: And what industrious little creatures they are. Where would we be without their honey to sweeten our meals, and their wax to make the candles that brighten our nights?

column22: This here's Hawthorne Hut, my family's hearth and home. Now that I've given up the adventuring life, I thought it was time to settle down with the wife and return to my roots.
column23: Nothing better than sitting back with a flagon of Rosa's finest mead, and swapping stories with the spire guards or the odd wandering adventurer.

column22: The lads and I are certainly glad of the Hawthornes and their hut. A sentry's work is tedious and tiring, so having a place where we can relax and let our guard down is truly invaluable.
Hearing the tales that Rolfe and visiting adventurers tell, I can't help wondering if I picked the right path in life.
column23: Just once, it'd be grand to sail the seas on a proud galley, and spy the towers of a distant city glowing golden in the rays of the morning sun... Well, a man can dream, can't he?

column22: Do you smell the honey? It may not compare to Mother's mead, but it's a lot nicer than the first batch I made. That one smelled like wet chocobo...
If this is your first visit to Josselin's Spire, fear not─the tower is manned day and night by members of the Gods' Quiver and Wood Wailer units stationed here in Nine Ivies.

Are the aetherytes not a glorious invention? I can only imagine how inconvenient it must have been for adventurers when the Calamity disrupted the aetherial flow and made instantaneous travel all but impossible.
column23: The aetheryte here is relatively new, of course. And this wonderful tower was built to protect it.
column24: It is called “Josselin's Spire” in honor of the captain of the first ever company of Wood Wailers. <Emphasis>Fascinating</Emphasis>, wouldn't you agree?

column22: Have yer travels taken ye to Bentbranch Meadows out in the Central Shroud? They're part o' the Moogle's Gift family o' stables, just as we are.
column23: If ye haven't already, ye might go and offer 'em a helpin' hand. I'm certain they'd have a use fer an adventurer who ain't afraid to muddy <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> boots.

column22: If it's Hyrstmill you want, then head north. If you simply wish to stretch your legs, I'd suggest doing it somewhere safer. Take a leisurely stroll around those parts, and you're like to end up fodder for a slavering beast.
Welcome to Treespeak Stables. This is where most of Gridania's chocobos are broken in for riding prior to beginning their working lives as rental birds or Twin Adder mounts.
Chocobos are sensitive and timid creatures by nature, but they are more than capable of defending themselves if they must.
column23: Why, just the other day I carelessly trod on a bird's toe, and received a nasty peck on the rear for my trouble. Thankfully my leathers prevented serious injury, but sitting is still rather painful...

column22: Our main task here at Treespeak Stables is to train the chocobos, but we also grow greens for the birds and make our own fertilizer.
column23: Well, I say we make it─the chocobos do the actual...making. Ahem. It's high–quality stuff, anyway. We receive orders from botanists as far afield as Hyrstmill and the city of Gridania.

column22: Have you tried Rosa's mead? It's simply to die for! Well...perhaps not “die” as such, but I would certainly suffer a few stings for a mug. She and those honeybees of hers have a hit on their hands.
column23: It was shortly after the spire sentries developed a taste for the stuff that word began to spread, then before we knew it, customers were turning up from as far afield as Limsa Lominsa! Still, men have traveled further for less!

column22: Do not be alarmed. The sylphs here at Little Solace are of no mind to cause us harm.
column23: The sylphs you should fear are the ones who dwell to the northeast, in the woodland tribe's homeland.
column24: I am not privy to the details, but it appears some manner of quarrel has divided their people. I suggest you remain wary should you venture beyond the boundaries of this settlement.

column22: Out of all the watchtowers manned by the Wood Wailers an' Gods' Quiver, Amarissaix's Spire here is the newest.
column23: Cast your eyes to the south. You see that fortress? That's why we're here. To keep an eye on the comin's an' goin's of the Empire's curs.

column22: Begging your pardon, friend, but our chocobos are not for hire at the moment.
They say Buscarron used to serve as a sentry at a lookout post north of here.
column23: Why he chose to give up the soldier's life and become a tavernkeep is a deeper tale, but to cut a long story short, the local lads and lasses are glad he did.

column22: Welcome, welcome. I'm Buscarron, and this is my place.
column23: Soldier, merchant, adventurer─it don't matter to me as long as you follow Druthers etiquette. That is: sit down, forget your worries, and savor your ale.

column22: Ho there, friend! Is this your first visit to the Druthers?
column23: If so, then we drink to new acquaintances. If not, then we drink to old companions. A toast, I say, a toast to the best tavern in Eorzea!

column22: Found yer way to Buscarron's Druthers, did ye? Ye wouldn't be the first to be drawn in by the scent o' quality grog.
column23: Don't be afeared to drink yer fill, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>─them Redbelly thugs won't give ye no trouble in here.

column22: A word, if you will. The lands beyond this point belong to the sylphs. Unlike the gentle souls in Little Solace, the vicious woodland sprites out there will slaughter any outsider that dares cross their borders.
column23: You're free to travel where you please, but know that none will come to your rescue should you stride blithely into the jaws of danger.

column22: The creatures in these parts can be monstrous, but they are mewling babes compared to the nightmares found in Sorrel Haven. I would caution you against ranging too deeply into the forest.
What brings you to Quarrymill, adventurer? Mayhap you heard that our pact with the elementals permits hunting in this area? Do not think that gives you leave to strip the forest bare.
column23: Such freedom is only granted to those who temper their actions with restraint. Any who would do harm to the Twelveswood...well, I'm sure you have heard tales of the consequences.

column22: Poachers, brigands, fugitives... If I had ten pairs of hands, they would still be full─and full of troublemakers at that. Do me a favor, adventurer, and do not add to my list of woes.
Refugees must first spend a night here in Quarrymill that the elementals might judge them worthy of living in the Twelveswood.
column23: Their decision cannot be appealed. Every one of us, Gridanians included, dwell here only by the elementals' leave.

column22: By the seven hells! We leave behind the only home we've ever known and risk our lives to travel here, and now you mean to kick us out on our arses!?
column23: No room for Ala Mhigans who venerate Rhalgr, is that it? The Destroyer take you and your infernal elementals!

column22: The forest belongs to itself, and no other. It is our duty as conjurers to impart the will of the elementals, not to change it. Even should we beg until the moon waxed full, the will of the forest would remain immutable.
The stream of refugees from Ala Mhigo is unending. But we have not the resources to welcome those who have nothing to offer the forest in return.
column23: Any who fail to secure the elementals' blessing must be cast out. Curse me for a bloodless demon if you will─it is a role I shall gladly play if it be to the benefit of the Twelveswood and the people of Gridania.

column22: Be at ease, adventurer. Rosa raises her honeybees here with the blessing of the elementals.
I used to run with a gang o' bandits, me. Nasty, they was. Killers an' worse. 'Course, that was before Buscarron set me on the straight an' narrow.
column23: Now the Druthers is like me second home─and I'd gladly gut any bandit who came in here lookin' to make trouble!

column22: New in town, eh? You and me, we must be fond of the road indeed to brave the journey to this godsforsaken city.

I thought a remote town like this would be the perfect place to turn a profit. But it seems that no matter where you go, success is invariably achieved through the usual combination of labor and luck. Hmph.
The number of visitors in Gridania is on the rise with every passing day. A pity their arrival seems to bring an equal share of trouble...
Another adventurer in search of work, are we? Ah, if you have but recently arrived in town, I must insist that you first register your presence with Miounne.
That's as far as you go, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>son</If>. Head on over to Bertennant, and mind you do as he says.
Gridania can be such a bore sometimes. All the people talk about is trees and elementals...
column23: Perhaps I should try my fortune in a city with a touch more excitement. They say the streets of Ul'dah are paved with gold, and the pirates of Limsa Lominsa will slit your throat as soon as look at you!

column22: Bland cuisine apart, I have begun to grow fond of this city and its people.
column23: The women, especially. I would not have believed the Black Shroud concealed such grace and beauty!

column22: <crunch> Hm...? <crunch> Shouldn't you be speaking with...<crunch>...Mother Miounne? <crunch> <crunch> <crunch>
They say the Seventh Umbral Era is corrupting the wildlife in the woods─making the beasts stronger, more aggressive. I look forward to meeting them.

Ah, a new adventurer. I do so love meeting fledgling heroes─so young, so daring, so ambitious!
Tell me, have you made a will?

Not another step, adventurer. This path leads into the territory of such creatures as would swiftly deal a man his death. Only the most battle-hardened of heroes would have a hope of emerging from their midst unscathed.
column23: None shall call you craven should you choose to walk away. Indeed, it takes true courage to recognize one's limitations.

column22: <sigh> Why is my finishing touch always but a fingernail's breadth away from perfection?
column23: I fear my mentor has lost all patience with me. At this rate, I shall never join the ranks of the Fen–Yll artisans.

column22: As quartermaster of the Wood Wailers of the First Spear, I am responsible for the procurement and distribution of all supplies.
column23: Should you have a talent for crafting or gathering, I would appreciate it if you could spare the time to complete one of our unit's guildleves.

column22: Ready to fish up that bastard Nepto Dragon? Just say the word, and I'll take ye to the ship.
Ready to head back to Costa, are ye?
All is as it should be─people running to and fro with their own concerns and free from the shadows of the past.
I hear you're in a spot of bother, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. Whatever happens, know that you'll always have a home here at the Druthers.
column23: By the way, do you know what's become of Laurentius? Last I heard, he'd turned over a new leaf and joined the Crystal Braves.

column22: I am afraid I cannot grant you entry to the Lotus Stand at this time. I will, however, say that the Elder Seedseer is doing all within her power to assist you in your plight. Have faith, my friend.
Marshal Tarupin bade me relay this message to you. All knowledge of the incident is being withheld from the public, and things shall remain as they were in Ul'dah...at least on the surface.
column23: You doubtless burn to act─to see justice served. So do we all. However, we must bide our time, for a single misstep could trigger a civil war, and Ul'dah would tear itself apart.

column22: Bentbranch Meadows is connected by the Furline to Coerthas in the northwest, and by the Lumberline to Thanalan in the south.
column23: When seen on a map, the place where the two roads meet resembles a bent branch─hence the name.

column22: Are these gysahl greens not the most luscious specimens you've ever seen? That they should flourish when the land at large is in a state of such turmoil is a testament to the tireless efforts of all who have nurtured them.
column23: Aye, these precious plants have been sheltered and tended to not only by botanists, but by Hearers and soldiers as well.

column22: Caring for chocobos is far more exhausting than it looks...
This is Bentbranch Meadows, adventurer. If you've business at the ranch, then be quick about it. If not, then begone. I've work to do.
Have you put a hand to our aetheryte yet? If you're planning on exploring the area, you'd be wise to attune yourself first.
Ye ever set foot on a ranch afore, stranger? Just mind ye don't rile up the chocobos, now.
Wander where you will, adventurer. But know that the forest will not suffer those who do not belong beneath its boughs to remain forever.
Never seen a chocobo up close before? Then have a care you don't stray too near and catch a friendly kick in the face.
Do I not speak the common tongue with sufficient facility? How might I convince you to part with a single chocobo?
column23: With the gil you earn selling one bird, you could raise three more. Really, do Gridanians have <Emphasis>no</Emphasis> understanding of simple economics?

column22: Have you heard a word I've said, merchant? I would not trust you with a feather from one of my chicks' heads.
column23: Do you honestly believe I would hand over the care of a chocobo to a soulless gil-grubber like you?

column22: Test 1
column23: Test 2
column24: Test 3

column22: To the west of here you'll find the Tam–Tara Deepcroft; to the east, the Mirror Planks.
column23: Both fall under the Wood Wailers' jurisdiction, so be sure to comport yourself respectfully should you pay either site a visit.

column22: The Mirror Planks are not just for fishermen. Captains transporting their logs on the lake use the pier as well.
To truly thrive out here, one must learn to work with nature, not against it.
column23: The bounty of the forest is a precious blessing, and we must not take more than can be replenished.

column22: I know there are times when we have no choice but to turn to outsiders for help in dealing with our problems. To adventurers like you, for instance.
column23: It's just that... <sigh> I wish I was brave enough or strong enough to protect the forest on my own.

column22: When the winds are calm, and the water still, you can see why they chose to call this lake the Mirror. The reflection is as true as any I have known.
The waterwheels make such a comforting sound. As long as I can hear them, I feel that everything is right with the world.
column23: There are those born in Hyrstmill who find themselves unable to rest without the constant creak and trickle to lull them to sleep.

column22: If you struggle to comprehend your purpose in life, merely strive to live well and all shall become plain in the fullness of time.

Until five years ago, this amphitheatre stood in the northern part of the city. Then the Calamity struck and all but leveled the poor place. Thankfully, the Carpenters' Guild collected up the pieces, carried them over here, and rebuilt it just as it was before.
column23: I cannot go a single day without looking it over, so afraid am I that some chip or stain has marred its perfection.

column22: I'm Keitha, head wrangler 'round these parts.
column23: There's a mountain o' work to be done on the ranch on any given day, but our main duty is keepin' the birds hale and healthy.

column22: The trick to chocobo breeding is not, as some assume, to slavishly adhere to an established set of procedures. No, one's main concern should be to maintain a safe and happy environment for the birds.
It is a sad fact that many who disrespect the ways of Gridania have not the slightest inkling that they have done so.

You stand on the threshold of the city of Gridania. Here, your status as an adventurer counts for naught─a fact you would do well to remember. Be fairly warned, outsider: if you foment trouble within our walls, you will never leave them.
The depths of the Twelveswood hold many dangers for the unwary. To the northwest lies the territory of the Ixal, whose borders even our soldiers are loath to cross.
Close your eyes, and open your ears to the world around you. Though you may not hear the voices of the elementals, I daresay you can sense their joy in the sounds of this place.
column23: As a Hearer, it has been my duty─and my great pleasure─to watch these plants emerge from the destruction wrought by the Calamity and thrive.

column22: We Wood Wailers of the Seventh Spear are charged with maintaining the security of the eastern reaches of the North Shroud, as well as Hyrstmill and its environs. It is also our responsibility to ensure that the roads are passable and free of bandits.
column23: Oh, and I almost forgot my most important duty: keeping a steady fire burning under our cookpot.

column22: If you travel to the west of here, you'll find Bentbranch Meadows and the Twin Adder training ground known as the Bannock. There are sure to be folks at either place who could do with a helping hand.
We grow gysahl greens right here at the stables. If you want to raise healthy chocobos, it helps to have quality feed on hand.
I but recently returned to Gridania to find the Twelveswood markedly recovered from the devastation left in the wake of the Calamity.
column23: My heart stirs to see new life sprouting amidst the ruin, truly it does...yet I cannot help but remember the land as it once was...

column22: Ah! Give a man a bloody fright, sneakin' up on me like that...
column23: Hm? Newly come to Gridania, are ye? Then I suggest ye continue on yer merry way to the Carline Canopy just behind me. Mother Miounne will want a word with ye.

column22: Beware of the dullahans. Consider yourself warned.
Do you truly mean to cross the bridge and venture into Fallgourd Float? Far be it from me to dissuade you from your course, but have you spent a moment to think this through?
column23: The creatures beyond this point will tear a novice adventurer limb from limb, then pick their teeth with the bones. Best stay close to the city gates and play with the squirrels and the ladybugs.

column22: The path west of here is no place for fledgling explorers. “Vicious” does not begin to describe the monsters that dwell across the bridge.
column23: Oh dear...I have kindled your curiosity, haven't I? Well, do not come running to me when some abomination bites you clean in half.

column22: I had me another business once, same name as this one. Drove me to the brink of madness it did, when I lost me livelihood to the Calamity.
column23: But I dug in me heels, worked hard, and built meself another Coffer & Coffin.

column22: The lads and I are in charge of protecting the interests of Amajina & Sons Mineral Concern. And that means dealing with any threats to the shipments that pass through these parts.
Thirty-one, thirty-two, thirty-three... Hm? Bah, now my careful count has been compromised!
The day the Calamity visited doom upon Eorzea, I expected nothing less than the end of existence. Yet Ul'dah once more bustles with business, as it did before.
column23: And here we stand, serenely casting lines into the worry-free waters. Was that terrifying event naught more than a nightmare?

column22: Welcome to the Coffer & Coffin! Be it belly-burning beverages or mouthwatering morsels, our refreshing repast shall renew your sagging spirits!
With all the traffic coming through Black Brush Station these days, I've had no shortage of customers. Enough extra business to indulge in a daily tankard or two of ale, anyroad.
I've seen more than a few traveling merchants dragging their sorry hides through that door after crossing the wastes of Thanalan.
column23: First thing they order is a cup of water─nothing tastes sweeter when your throat is choked with the dust of the road. It's not long until a mug of ale finds its way into their hands, though...

column22: When ye spend every day with yer blade half drawn and yer nerves strung up tighter than an Ul'dahn merchant's coinpurse, ye need a place where ye can sit down without somethin' tryin' to bite yer bleedin' arse off.
They say they reopened operations in the Nanawa Mines to meet a voracious demand for raw materials─not surprising with all the rebuilding going on since the Calamity.
column23: Me? I'm just glad the mines brought enough coin into the area to let Roger set up shop...and give me somewhere to stow my backside and drink while I avoid the unpleasantness of hard labor. Heh heh.

column22: This here operation takes the low-grade ore dug up in the Nanawa Mines and refines it.
column23: Now don't you fret none about the quality o' the minerals. Everythin' is overseen by agents of Eshtaime's Lapidaries, and that means our purification techniques produce only the finest results.

column22: Looking for Black Brush Station? Well, you've found it. This is where the wagonloads of ore from the Nanawa Mines end up.
column23: The raw materials are refined inside. With the furnace blazing away in there, the air becomes so stiflingly hot... I much prefer to wait on the shipments out here.

column22: The Brass Blades have been keeping the trade routes safe in the Thanalan region since before the coming of the Seventh Umbral Era.
column23: A veteran outfit like ours requires deep coffers to cover wages and upkeep, so it is fortunate that our employers include a number of Syndicate members. Keep that in mind, adventurer─this is no group of untested, two-gil rookies.

column22: The wagons from Black Brush have yet to veer into view. Ah, would that I could wander to the watering hole for a pint of precious pale ale.
Sultana Nanamo maintains these fields to provide provender for the poor. It is the wealthy, however, who end up purchasing our produce...

Even with wellsprings of water by the wayside, cultivating the dry domain of Thanalan was a daunting deed. Such an achievement could not have been attempted were it not blessed with the bounty of the sultana, and the boldness of our botanists.
column23: But sustaining such a swath presents a plethora of persistent problems. Conundrums that only copious carts of coin can conquer.

column22: Those thrice-damned peddlers of Ul'dah would demand the entire contents of your purse for one maggot-filled loaf of bread. Thus, some adventuring colleagues and I decided to save our gil and set up a camp outside the city.
column23: You share our profession, yes? If you should learn of any well-paying, low-risk jobs, we could certainly use the extra coin...

column22: Watch yourself, adventurer. These people obsess over coin and ever scheme against their brethren.
column23: Even nature conspires against us here. The heat is unbearable, and the sand─<Emphasis>gods</Emphasis>, the sand! It finds its way into every crack and crevasse!

column22: Ul'dah's known for its merchants, but making your way here as one is no easy thing.
column23: Three reasons for that─too many trends, too many rivals, and too many lies.

column22: Keep an eye on these tracks, an' sooner or later you'll see one of them magitek contraptions hauling a train of ore-filled wagons.
column23: Do we got problems with thugs an' thieves making off with the shipments? Not while the Stone Torches are on the job.

column22: All clear to the right! All clear to the left! All clear of any potential problems until the shipment from Black Brush passes through, I should imagine.
column23: I would slip away for a swift sip of spirits were my supervisors not possessed of such incredibly inconvenient timing for their inspections...

column22: What are you bloody gawkin' at? I ain't in no mood for talkin', so step back afore you break your ribs on my fists.
Oh g-gods! P-Please, I'll get the g-gil, I prom─ Wait, you ain't here to collect?
Arrzaneth Ossuary is a sacred structure where mortals may seek the favor of Thal, arbiter of the afterlife...
column23: ...for in death, we must <Emphasis>all</Emphasis> abide by Thal's final evaluation of our existence. Those deemed to have led lives of <Emphasis>richer</Emphasis> virtue are rewarded...
column24: ...with greater comfort for their eternal souls. I urge you to consider making a donation and enhancing your virtue, thus ensuring a <Emphasis>golden</Emphasis> paradise for your time in the realm beyond...

column22: Keeping that coinpurse bulging, are we? They say the streets of Ul'dah are made o' gold, but it's piles o' gil what pave your way.
Welcome to the Pugilists' Guild, friend. Step within, and witness the finest fistfighters in Eorzea trading blows and refining techniques as they travel the path towards martial perfection.
column23: I am Gagaruna, and I have the honor of receiving visitors to the guild. Please do not hesitate to call upon me should you require any assistance.

column22: Wherever there are places populated with people, you shall perforce find peddlers. Merchants often meet in such areas that they might make a mutually beneficial exchange of information.
Think I got it easy here in the lumberyard? The builders haul off a good forest's worth o' planks each day, and it's my job to make sure every little splinter is properly accounted fer.

Cedar. That's what ye were wonderin', weren't it? Each kind o' wood has its own use, ye see. Now cedar, that's a tree what grows straight and tall, makin' it the perfect choice for masts and yardarms and the like.
We shipwrights ain't all the same, ye know. Carpenters, smitties, armorers─takes all sorts o' craftin' skills comin' together to shape a ship.
column23: We do share one thing, though, and that's a Builder-blessed mastery in our chosen profession. Did you never wonder why a shipwright gets so much respect from the average, ale-swillin' Lominsan?

column22: I'm sorry, dearie, but these lunches are for the shipwrights. Naldiq & Vymelli's hired me to make sure their lads and lasses are fed, and fed well.
column23: The last thing you need is a hungry crafter fainting at the top of a mast and making a mess of the deck!

column22: Look at that handsome wench. From here you can see her whole body, admire the perfection of her curves.
column23: It'll be a glorious day indeed when we finally slip her into the water. Eh? I'm talking about the <Emphasis>Victory</Emphasis>, you gutter-dwellin' landlubber!

column22: Don't look like much right now, but when I'm done poundin', stretchin', and shapin', these sheets of iron'll fit snug to the hull o' the ship. Just like a shinin' suit of armor.
I remember when the Calamity sent a big ol' wave crashin' onto the coast o' Limsa. The Gods' Grip sheltered the docks from the worst of it, praise the Twelve.
column23: Lot o' folks weren't so lucky, though. A whole flotilla of battered ships limped into the bay not long after─like a field hospital for sea vessels, it were. And now these days we're puttin' together the damn things from scratch. Bloody marvelous.

column22: The day the Seventh Umbral Era came knockin', a flood o' ships came flounderin' into the docks─most of 'em as if they were like to sink at any moment.
column23: Even amidst all the gods-cursed confusion, Ahtbyrm did his level best to save those ailin' maidens. Once I seen that kind o' spirit, it were easy fer me to take a step back and devote me own time to cavortin' and carousin' with rosy-cheeked lasses. Never too old for a spot o' carousin', <If(PlayerParameter(4))>missy<Else/>sonny</If>.

column22: Rain, wind, or head-splittin' hailstorms, a candlekeep always keeps the torch shinin'. That's called a “sense o' responsibility,” <If(PlayerParameter(4))>missy<Else/>son</If>. The thought o' bein' haunted by sailors what were dashed upon the rocks also helps a man remember his duty.
The ferries that depart from Candlekeep Quay are the primary means of waterborne transportation between the island ports of Limsa Lominsa, Aleport, and the like.
column23: These vessels do more than simply carry passengers from one destination to another─they also carry foodstuffs and other essential provisions to the shipwrights of the Moraby Drydocks.

column22: The damage caused by the Calamity has seen a great number of artisans pulled away onto restoration projects. Here at the Moraby Drydocks, they've started taking on outsiders and adventurers to round out the roster.
column23: And with the extra hands, there's always going to be extra trouble. Pity no one thinks to bolster the ranks of the poor guards...

column22: The rear entrance to the docks is just as heavily guarded as the front. After all, who knows what manner of strangers are among the craftsmen and couriers sailing in from Candlekeep Quay?
Mealvaan's Gate assessors are not ordinarily stationed in Candlekeep Quay. There hasn't been a need since the port primarily deals in domestic cargo.
Greetings, and welcome to Arrzaneth Ossuary─a beacon to all who harbor a fascination with the powers of death and destruction.
column23: If you believe yourself possessed of unbending will and unflinching resolve, I shall be pleased to acquaint you further with the mysteries of the Thaumaturges' Guild.

column22: Welcome to the burning heart of the Grand Company of Ul'dah. We of the Immortal Flames remain ever vigilant against the threats presented by the Amalj'aa and the Garlean Empire.
column23: Do you dream of testing your mettle alongside soldiers of unwavering loyalty and spirit? Flame General Raubahn Aldynn stands ready to accept new recruits to our ranks.

column22: You've found your way to the Quicksand, friend. As you can see, we cater to a clientele with an adventurous streak.
column23: With the chaos left in the wake of the Calamity, the townsfolk'll be needin' the help of my patrons more than ever.

column22: The gambling halls of the Platinum Mirage are as an oasis of fortune─a glimmering, silvery dream to which one cannot help but be drawn.
column23: Beyond these doors are found fantastical amusements and thrilling games of chance to delight and entertain...assuming you are part of our exclusive membership.
column24: I regret to announce that this most privileged club is not currently open for applications. But do not lose heart! Hoard your gil and pile your precious stones in preparation for that day when a position opens, and you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, might purchase the right to stride across the threshold into paradise itself.

column22: Ah, the Moraby Drydocks, the site of Naldiq & Vymelli's and the grandest shipyard in all of Limsa Lominsa─the perfect place to build the Maelstrom's newest warship.
column23: We've doubled the guard around the <Emphasis>Victory</Emphasis> to keep an eye out for saboteurs and the like. If you want to keep your hide intact, I'd advise against any suspicious actions, adventurer.

column22: You lose something? All the sorry sods you see here lost something to the Calamity, you know. Merchant stock destroyed. Workshops burned down. Mercenaries left with injuries no healer could undo. Children wandering in a daze, no parents around to take their hands.
column23: They all have their sob stories, but in Ul'dah only the clink of gil gets heard. And so most of 'em end up selling all they got left: their homes and hearths.
column24: With no place to live, they drift away from the city and eventually find themselves in this place. All sorts of refugees here, friend, and not just from Ul'dah neither...

column22: <snore> Mmm...you got it, sweet cheeks, full speed ahead...

This is Fallgourd Float, adventurer. We've merchants if you need to resupply, and there are beds at the Bobbing Cork. You'll also find a contingent of the Order of the Twin Adder on the west side of the settlement─they're here to keep an eye on the Ixal.
Heading to the south? Not much out there but rocks and deadwood. I can't imagine why anyone would want to travel that way.
column23: I suppose you adventurers would consider that godsforsaken wasteland the perfect place to test your survival skills or some such.

column22: Hail, and welcome to the Bobbing Cork! Our beds are so soft you'll think you've closed your eyes on a luxury barge adrift on the gentlest sea.
This hallway leads to the guest rooms. Only patrons of the inn are permitted beyond this point. I suggest you head back downstairs if you haven't made a reservation.
By Nald and by Thal! This is a conspiracy! A dastardly plot!
column23: My chambers are spacious, the meals are superb, and the bed... Oh gods, that wonderful, bedeviled bed! How am I ever expected to return to my cramped quarters in Ul'dah!?

column22: Have you seen the spectacular view from the cliffs to the southwest? Boulders floating in midair? The massive, rune-carved wall thrusting upwards towards the heavens?
column23: Such are the scars left behind by the devastating claws of the Calamity. The scene so overwhelmed my senses I damn near tumbled over the edge into the abyss.

column22: I mean to brave the ice-rimmed passes and travel north to Coerthas. The journey is like to be brutal, thus I tarry here to build my reserves of strength before setting out.
If you wish to reside in the Twelveswood, you must exhibit the proper respect for nature.
column23: The Ixali beastmen hunt forest creatures for sport and topple trees for their misguided rituals. Will the elementals punish these savage intruders, you ask? It is not a question of “if,” adventurer, but “when.”

column22: The building behind me there is the Bobbing Cork. It's a popular establishment with merchants and adventurers alike.
column23: If you mean to explore the lands around Fallgourd, the Cork is the most comfortable place to make your preparations.

column22: I wouldn't take the path north, my friend. Proud Creek is thick with dullahans, and they'll be the least of your problems if you decide to stray from the road.
column23: Unless you've a small army of companions to make the journey with you, I'd find another way to get where you're going.

column22: Do you have business with the Order of the Twin Adder, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>? We would appreciate any reports on the Ixal and their movements.

Have your travels taken you west to the snow-covered highlands? I've not been there myself, but 'tis common knowledge that the Ixal roost in Coerthas in great numbers. Ever must we keep a wary eye on our borders...
Make sure yer kit's in order afore ye set out, adventurer. The best person to have lookin' out fer yer hide is yer own bloody self.
Some time ago, rumors got out that a flock of Ixal had settled near Fallgourd. This sent most o' the folk here packin', an' the place became somethin' of a ghost town.
column23: Thankfully, that didn't last long, for adventurers soon began arrivin' in droves. No one seems to know what brought 'em, but they breathed much-needed life back into the settlement.
column24: Feelin' safer for the adventurers' presence, them as fled eventually came back, an' now Fallgourd thrives as it's never thrived afore.

column22: What do you think of our little town, adventurer? It was built on top of the lake here so we wouldn't have to carve any wounds into the forest.
column23: “Fallgourd Float” might sound like an odd name, but it makes a good deal more sense once you see how the place was constructed.

column22: Come on in, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>, and take a seat. One of those adventurers, are you?
column23: Well then, welcome to Fallgourd Float. If you're looking to rub shoulders with more of your colleagues, you could also try the Bobbing Cork, north of the aetheryte.

column22: First time seeing Rootslake? These boulders have lain as you see them since the Calamity. Atop the largest lies Camp Tranquil.
column23: Mind your step as you go, adventurer. The fall may not kill you, but it's certain to leave a mark.

column22: Nothing remained of Camp Tranquil after the Calamity─no burnt cloth, no shattered timbers...and not a single survivor.
column23: The only life left in this accursed swamp is too damn stubborn to die. Aye, that goes for us too.

column22: I was bringing lumber to market long before the Calamity. I tell you, the things I've seen in the Twelveswood since then boggle the mind.
column23: The most bizarre beasts seem to congregate around that giant gate to the southwest and the Gelmorran ruins to the northeast. From which of the seven hells did those creatures come?

column22: If yer headed to Thanalan, know that travelin' with peddlers or by carriage ain't no guarantee of safety. Too many 'venturers oft forget that.
Ever since the Calamity, the flow of aether around Camp Tranquil has been unstable, and the land has struggled to heal its wounds.
column23: Lend us your strength and help slay the beasts ravaging the Twelveswood. Only then can the forest return to its former glory.

column22: The abandoned airship landing to the south has become a haven for poachers.
column23: Oh, we've tried to drive them off, and succeeded more often than not. But even should they scatter, in time they slink back to take shelter once more. It's like trying to catch greased marmots.

column22: Nature tends towards stability and order, and for ages this balance of forces was maintained.
column23: Yet, as you can see, the Calamity destroyed that delicate balance and severely weakened the land. The taint of corruption is even visible in some places.
column24: Snakemolt is one such location. Ever since the ruins were exposed five years ago, countless beasts have seen fit to make it their home. With such scars still fresh, I fear the forest will not completely recover for a long, long time...

column22: The hells with the godsdamned elementals, this godsdamned swamp, and this godsdamned Wood Wailer!
column23: How long must I wait to make one godsdamned delivery!? Gods...I should have never left Ul'dah!

column22: Matron's teats, those turtles are huge! If the damn things didn't move, ye'd think they were just another pile o' rocks!
Aren't you curious about that giant door to the southwest? They say it's sealed to prevent some poisonous mist from leaking out, but I'm not fool enough to fall for that.
column23: You know what I think it is? <Emphasis>Treasure</Emphasis>. Legendary weapons, sparkling jewels, and mountains of gil so thick you could bury yourself in them! Those stories of poison mist are just to keep us from getting too curious, you'll see.

column22: Greetings, and welcome to the main offices of Naldiq & Vymelli's.
column23: If you are an artisan working here at the docks, I can assist you with a variety of matters, including employment contracts, labor assignments, wage payments, even lunch deliveries. You name it, I am at your service.

column22: Have you spoken with Mimidoa out front? He holds a position at Naldiq & Vymelli's as an advisor now.
column23: Most know him, however, for his incredible skills as a blacksmith. Yet, despite his achievements, he is always willing to lend a kindly ear to those around him.

column22: My days are consumed with the construction of the new ship, <Emphasis>Victory</Emphasis>. My colleagues and I must constantly remind each other to push forward with our work, lest we grow obsessed with attaining perfection in every blow of the chisel.
As the sole entity responsible for the construction of Limsa Lominsa's seafaring vessels, it is only natural that Naldiq & Vymelli's would establish their main offices here at the Moraby Drydocks.
column23: For a shipwright, there can be no greater honor or privilege than to work for such a prestigious company.

column22: Oh, another adventurer. Move along─I have my hands full with this merchant.
column23: We have strict rules requiring all foreign goods to be inspected by a mage before crossing our borders. Alas, some outsiders remain ignorant...

column22: The birdmen have grown bold of late, approaching to within spitting distance of the walls. Should you spot any of their scouts, be sure to give them a reason to withdraw.
Take a seat and loosen your weapon belt, adventurer. The Wood Wailers keep the peace here in the Bobbing Cork.
Ahead lie the Mun–Tuy Cellars. If you are traveling to the East Shroud, you may use the passage within.
column23: Observe the brewers if you wish, but see that you do not interfere with their work.

column22: Here we ferment the Mun–Tuy beans to make all sorts of wonderful, delicious products.
column23: Oh how I love the smell of fermented beans! Shame my wife hates it─she won't touch me till I've bathed and washed my clothes.

column22: Believe it or not, these cellars once crawled with beasts. The Order of the Twin Adder came in and cleared them all out though, Twelve bless their hearts.
column23: I tell you, I'd love to split a cask of Mun–Tuy brew with the Adders that put me back to work!

column22: They say Mun–Tuy brew is an essential ingredient in many Gridanian dishes. If you ask me, it's just an excuse to let the chef drink without arousing suspicion.
This path leads to the Mun–Tuy Cellars, and through them the South Shroud.

With Castrum Oriens to the south and the Sylphlands to the north, we must remain vigilant for any signs of aggression. Every sentry that patrols the East Shroud knows well that we are surrounded by enemies at all times.
Before the Calamity made a mess of everything, there was a small village just north of here.
column23: When the surviving villagers tried to return from Gridania, they found those Redbelly bastards living on their land. Bad enough to lose your loved ones, but then to lose what little's left...

column22: We've tried so many times to take it back, but those Redbelly whoresons are veteran killers.
column23: Do you know how it feels? To see another man in your home, yet you're powerless to throw 'em out? For <Emphasis>years</Emphasis>!? <sigh> Gods damn them all...

column22: The Order of the Twin Adder has need of those willing and able to assist with daily operations.
column23: If you are skilled in the martial disciplines, you can join our efforts to combat beasts, brigands, and poachers. Or, if you wish to contribute in a different fashion, you can supply us with essential provisions when our stores run low.
column24: Should you meet with one of our many Serpents stationed throughout the Twelveswood, I implore you to speak with them and learn how you can help.

column22: This one begs! Walking ones must see our village saved! Away with touched ones! Away!
My apologies for the inconvenience, but the ferry for Old Gridania is presently out of service.
column23: This ferry will become available upon reaching level 10.

column22: We are aware of the vile accusations leveled against you. Suffice it to say we give them no credit. As ever, you are welcome here in Gridania, and may continue about your business unhindered. The Elder Seedseer herself has decreed this.
column23: And though we cannot offer you much in the way of assistance, so long as you have the freedom to act, we do not doubt that you will soon put matters to rights. May the elementals watch over you.

column22: She might be the boss, but Steelmaster H'naanza's work with the Armorers' Guild often takes her to Limsa Lominsa.
column23: While she's away, the day-to-day runnin' of the docks falls to Ahtbyrm, Moraby's foremost shipwright.

column22: Creatures have been attacking carriages en route from the South Shroud of late. See that you don't attract undue attention as well.
Do take sufficient precautions when traversing the Twelveswood. This area has an abundance of belligerent beasts, and even experienced Adders have had to seek my care.
Ten, twelve...alright, everythin' looks to be where I left it.
column23: Buscarron runs a tight ship, he does. No thievin' or fightin', and any folk who forget learn real quick that they ain't got no place here.

column22: We hold shipments here until their respective owners come and collect. Unless you have business to attend to, I cannot allow you to enter.
Tread softly if ye mean to head west beyond me shack, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. The Tam–Tara Deepcroft is hallowed ground, and the dead don't take kindly to 'em what forget that.
Chocobos are as smart as they are sensitive. If you train them with love and care, they'll reward you with their undying loyalty.
Sylphs are, by and large, a bright and happy kind of folk, but those who have left their homeland behind have grown nervous and wary. I would ask that you do nothing to startle them.
Kind walking ones─listening ones and masked ones─protect these ones, protect Little Solace from nasty ones who would steal these ones' home.
column23: Walking ones are kind and strong, but these ones cannot rely on walking ones alone. No, all ones must work together, that one day these ones may return home...

column22: This one is weaving cloth. All the pretty cloth that walking one can see was made by these ones.
column23: These ones keep the ways of weaving a secret. But even if this one taught walking one how to weave, this one doesn't think walking one could make cloth in the same way.

column22: Walking one's belly is rumbling? This one is not making a meal! This one is boiling bark and flower seeds to dye thread.
column23: If this one simmers the right amount of materials for the right amount of time, the thread will be joyously colorful.

column22: This one cannot follow walking one's words. This one begins to feel...sleepy...
column23: But walking one speaks with much eagerness. So this one...will try to...stay awake...

column22: Walking one should not go any further down this path. Those ones who summoned the primal one will do hurtful things to walking ones who enter those ones' territory.
Walking one has come to Little Solace, the new home to these ones. Gracious elder one of forest city allows these ones to live here.
column23: This one appreciates having a safe place to stay, but were it not for <Emphasis>those</Emphasis> ones, this one would much rather be back in these ones' old home.

column22: I hope you understand the risks involved with climbing the Matron's Lethe.
column23: Even should you survive a fall, the beasts below will be quick to take notice. An adventurer like you should have no illusions about what would happen next.

column22: The forest to the east is home to deathgazes and ziz, so don't go and cause a commotion unless you've no objections to being some beast's dinner.
The enormous hole you see before you, my friend, is the result of a great rock which fell from the sky five summers past. The impact exposed the ruins hidden underneath the surface.
column23: We have taken it upon ourselves to study these ancient ruins. I do not exaggerate when I say that every day brings us fascinating, exciting discoveries.

column22: I must insist that you exercise caution whilst walking around this site. Many relics were expelled from the hole in the impact years past.
column23: With but one careless step, you could crush underfoot Duskwight artifacts of untold significance.

column22: Apologies, but we're sweeping the ferry for vermin...
<sigh> There's no other choice. I must buy a new dress. I will not─nay, I <Emphasis>cannot</Emphasis> allow myself to be seen wearing these rags a moment longer!
Ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls! Tonight's main event: the prince of the bloodsands and pride of Ul'dah, the suave southern dandy─Franz the Fair!
I do not converse with commoners...
It is my life's work as an alchemist to brew an elixir of such potency that a single sip will cure any ailment. Why, people would shower me with gil for such a potion, would they not?
Can I help you? All you're going to find here are the poor and the desperate. Not the types to interest an adventurer looking for coin. Best move along, friend.
Welcome, <Emphasis>welcome</Emphasis>! If you seek a bargain, the Sapphire Avenue Exchange has wares for every conceivable taste and inclination!
Greetings, friend! You have entered the infamous training grounds of the Gladiators' Guild! See masters of the blade hone their skills for both deadly combat and stunning showmanship alike!
column23: Oh! My name is Lulutsu, by the way! You'll be wanting to talk to me if you have any questions about the guild!

column22: Were it not for your intervention, we might have failed to take the Hive. My thanks to you, adventurer.
They say Severaint Seven Splinter is a stubborn, vengeful whoreson. I've no doubt he'll try to retake the Hive. Best stay on guard.

The bandits made excellent use of the terrain when building the Hive. Attackers must advance uphill and break through multiple gates, and defenders can leap from the fortifications and strike them from behind.
This area is teeming with dangerous creatures. We're doing our part to keep everyone safe, but you must needs take care of yourself as well.
Seven hells, this place reeks! Do bandits even bathe!? Well, we'll just have to keep 'em out and hope the stink passes.
column23: But <Emphasis>gods</Emphasis>, just what <Emphasis>is</Emphasis> that foul stench!? It's like the inside of an adamantoise's arse!

column22: Leave it to us, adventurer─we won't let even one of those godsdamned wasps slip through!
Damn quiet for a port, ain't it? Hardly any ships making berth here no more.
column23: Hells, when I was just out my mammy, time was you couldn't find a spot to piss off the docks, so many were the ships. Wouldn't think it to look now, would ya?

column22: I think it's time I move on from this godsforsaken place. Haven't made a single bloody gil since I came.
The fish aren't biting today. But there's always tomorrow. Aye, there're always tomorrows.
