Unfriendly sort of folk, the U. Asked leave to use one of their empty bunks once and they near threw me out of town.

Southern Thanalan is rife with Amalj'aa. After a goodly number of parleys with the nunh of the U, we were able to establish an Immortal Flames outpost here. Now, we work together against the lizardmen.
The Allagans were a powerful people all right─but I'd venture to guess it was all this heat that did them in. One more year here and I'll be needin' a sarcophagus.
The sand gets in your head, I tell you. Some days I'm not even sure if I'm digging or burying. The Sagolii Desert's like a yellow-eyed harlot─knocks you flat and leaves you high and dry.
We U are a very cleanly people. Return home sticky with sweat, sand, and blood of the prey? These springs will see it all washed away.
You'd be wise to hold fast your weapon in these parts. Castrum Meridianum bears down on us from the north, the Garleans poised to strike at a moment's notice.
Each step north brings us closer to the Garlean threat, and each day brings us closer to war.
A dear friend of mine died by Garlean hands, and I joined the Immortal Flames to avenge him. But now that I'm here... <gulp>
I like to think that the fire in my heart burns as strongly as anyone else's. But when I behold the might of the Garleans, I can't help but be struck dumb.
It's trying, not knowing when death will finally come for you. My mind often wanders to the family I left behind.
Every day carries its share of lumps, bumps, strains, sprains, bruises, and broken bones.
column23: I've treated blacksmiths, goldsmiths, alchemists, botanists, armorers, leatherworkers, miners, carpenters, you name it─never lost a patient yet.

column22: I keep watch over yonder field for Garlean activity. Though half the time I can see nary ten yalms ahead for the accursed fog.
Sentry duty's mind-numbin' work at the best o' times. It takes the perseverance of a bleedin' saint to keep yer wits about ye for when ye actually <Emphasis>need</Emphasis> 'em.
The final phase of Operation Archon is at hand! The time is come for the Immortal Flames to burn hotter and brighter than ever before!
Nothing quenches the thirst and settles the mind quite like a glass of apple wine at the end of a hard day's work. 'Tis pure bliss!
Have y'ever seen apples so lovely? As red as a fine lass's rosy cheeks, and thrice as sweet!
We've got more than our fair share of problems here, but all's well that ends with a hearty meal at the end of the day!
Some of ours have had to remain outside the hamlet. They're hardened soldiers, all, and no strangers to discomfort, but it's a trying experience, being in a place that loves you not.

By Nophica's grace, the Twelveswood was not subjected to the transformative forces which forever altered Coerthas. At least, that was the case five years ago. Some say the snows creep ever southward...
Damn and blast, that hurts! The Ixal peck hard, curse their godless, feathered hearts...
Gods, heal already, I have places to be! I'll bet Miah Molkot didn't become what she is playing nursemaid to some clodpole.
A host of Ixal? I ssspit on numbers! The White Rams <Emphasis>hunt</Emphasis> the Ixal─oh yes, we live to spring unexpectedly on little birds and snap their wee necks!
Who are the Sons of Saint Coinach? We are but the finest minds in Eorzea, drawn together to decipher the ancient mysteries of the Allagan civilization.
The work goes well─or well enough, considering the challenges we face. The scourge of giants and forces inimical to scholarship rob me of my sleep...
Consider the lesser moon, Dalamud, and the ancient Allagan ruins. Add the speculative connection, divide by the Crystal Tower...
When there's this much snow in Coerthas, the trade route seals up tighter than a goobbue's arse. But you know the thing about cold─it sells a lot of firewood and firewater!
Let the rabble blither what they will over their rude cups. Fourth he may be of his father's loins, but Ser Francel is first in piety and discernment. Skyfire Locks can be in no better hands.
Know you the reason Skyfire Locks is thus devised─a handful of diamonds tossed upon a hillside, rather than a carcanet of brilliants decorously arranged?
column23: The Locks are shelter for our people against dragons. Scattered is safer─one cannot steal a necklace if there is none to steal.

column22: Curse Sylvaintel, that long-faced martinet! There never was a night as cold as this, yet he begrudges us more wood for the fire. I would gladly─especially if 'twere Sylvaintel─kill for a mug of warmwine.
See how the Observatorium pierces the very heavens! What a view those astrologians must have, high above the murk that you and I toil in...
What do you think? Larger and warmer than you expected, I'll warrant. This fort is also a place of shelter for the commonfolk. 'Tis better to rebuild a dragon-seared home than burn with it.
How fares the weather? A storm in these parts means no runners can be sent to the next fort, nor can any signals be seen. Once the whiteness falls, each Lock is as an island and must fend for itself.

A knight of Ishgard lives to serve, and lives to fall in battle. Every last one of us is fated for this holy duty long before we are born─and when the last dragon perishes, we shall meet again in the hall of our fathers.
The arms of House Fortemps is a unicorn, erased and wreathed in thorns. The unicorn is unique to Coerthas but...they are hardly to be found in these parts. A shame.
column23: Do you like the shield upon my back? The painter did excellent work, I feel. I do like the unicorn's horn.

column22: I never tire of watching the flames. And I've no complaints about the warmth!
How many years now since I left the Gods' Quiver for a life of a sellsword? Long enough to end up this far north, brrr. Wonder how Instructor Molkot's faring with all the green recruits...

Hm, an adventurer come from <Switch(PlayerParameter(70))><Case(1)>some forsaken place</Case><Case(2)>some forsaken place</Case><Case(3)>Ul'dah</Case></Switch>, huh? Well, I don't want your kind here. <Switch(PlayerParameter(70))><Case(1)>This here's a piece of precision equipment, see?</Case><Case(2)>This here's a piece of precision equipment, see?</Case><Case(3)>You cowry-kissers would sell the sandals right off of your mother's feet for the right price.</Case></Switch> Now off with you!
The dance with the dragons, the canker of unbelievers... We stand on the edge of the precipice, and beyond it, endless night bereft of the grace of Halone...
The light of the Holy See shines on Coerthas, and illumes it from the highest peaks to the blackest tunnels. What need we fear from dragons and unbelievers?

See you, what has become of the stately Gates of Judgement... I was but a babe in arms when first I passed under its fragrant shadow. A thousand curses upon the dragons─they would mar all that I hold dear.
I've a plan to retake the Stone Vigil, but a mountain of problems to solve before I can even go to my commander. A man dreams of glory, but an army must think of success...
Muahahaha! Cower, you vermin, crawl on your soft bellies! Receive the kiss of the dragon, renounce the wet pulp of your flesh!
Can't...keep...eyes...open... Card...game...ran...late... I lost anyway, what rotten luck! And...zzz...
It is all manner of cold outside: wet, dry, stinging, lancing. Unless I can get some hot food into those knights, it will take the heart from them.

I am a knight of Ishgard, the sworn lance of the Holy See, the scourge of unbelievers, and the foe implacable of dragonkind. It has ever been my dream to be one of the glorious dead, and receive my just reward from Halone in the heavenly garden.
column23: Yet life is sweet, and my friends are dear to me─none more so than my steed and her chocobokeep Maucolyn. The clerics say birds do not go to heaven, and to want otherwise is heresy─which makes an unbeliever of me if they but knew.

column22: Born into such a house as mine, where else to aim but the pinnacle? My destiny is to serve as a Temple Knight, for the greater glory of Ishgard!
I am a part of the expedition to Snowcloak, and there I am bound in short order. My task was to replenish the supplies─in the camp, food has grown almost as scarce as warmth.
You saw Snowcloak, I take it. There is a settlement further west, a hamlet by the name of Falcon's Nest─on the other side of the ice cliff now, of course.
I've my own reasons for volunteering for this expedition. This icy bulk holds my heart─and not a day or night in the last five years have I not felt the weight of winter upon my breast.

There are many pockets of terror in the west, and the Behemoth's Dominion is one of them. You will not be surprised to learn, I think, that there is to be found there a behemoth. Your renown is considerable, but this one will take all your arts.
Whitebrim Front's under the control of House Durendaire, one of the four High Houses of Ishgard. Whitebrim'll be where the thrust comes from, you'll see, when they retake the Stone Vigil.
Well met! I'm an adventurer myself, in the employ of Saint Coinach's Find. Ready coin and payment on time! I'm startin' to appreciate scholarship, me.
Even an experienced connoisseur can be misled by an elaborate label and elegant packaging. I, on the other hand, have no choice but to focus on the taste and texture of the wine itself.
column23: How ironic it is that what I once considered to be my greatest weakness has become my greatest asset.

column22: I need hardly tell you this, but the trammels of social convention compel it! This is of course Master Byrglaent himself, the greatest vintner in all of Eorzea, and the master of Wineport.
column23: A <Emphasis>vintner</Emphasis> is such a limiting term─plebeian, don't you find─and so I think of Master Byrglaent as a <Emphasis>vintian</Emphasis>. Someday, it shall be a word known to all, I fancy.

column22: I swear, tending the vineyard is more troublesome than caring for my newborn son. At least he'll tell me when he's feeling cold, instead of suffering in silence when winter comes.
I remember watching the vineyards burn five years ago. Broke my heart, it did. But look at Wineport now. The grapes are growing, the wines are flowing─aye, it'll only get better in future.
I'd think twice about venturing into Raincatcher Gully if I were you. Ever since the Calamity, it's been crawling with bizarre creatures, the likes of which no one's ever seen before.
Somehow... Someday... I'll... I'll find my way back to you...
True to its name, Wineport produces the finest vintages in the realm. I realize the temptation is high, but take care that you do not overindulge.
Ahhh, the sea calls to me! I ought to change into my bathing suit and go for a dip, responsibilities be damned!

The lights at Pharos Sirius once guided many a sailor home. Ever since the Calamity quenched its fire, it's seen many a ship run aground. But mark my words─one day I will see this beacon of hope restored.
What good's a lighthouse keeper without a lighthouse? Just a landbound wretch watchin' the ships flounder, wringin' his hands. Got to have the lights back on...

Pish on the sheven hells and choke on the shteam! Was <Emphasis>shupposed</Emphasis> to be easy. Wine...wine by the caskful and...mead...beer too, of course, beer too. Warn't shupposed to be no <Emphasis>real</Emphasis> shpi-spirits, ye see?

I <Emphasis>told</Emphasis> 'em 'twas a bad idea. These shipwrecks be <Emphasis>uncanny</Emphasis>, I said. I'm not sayin' I expected all these dead folk to be wandrin' about, but I said it was a bad idea!
The Admiral has charged us with holding the line that separates Sahagin hordes and innocent homes, and we guard it with our lives.
Aleport is a strategic location for the Maelstrom, and we're prepared to defend it at all costs. Our cannons are ready to fire at the first sign of trouble.
Give the firesand a wide berth, eh? Yer liable to sneeze us all to the high heavens.

We stand against beast tribes that seek to crush us, see us driven before them, and hear the lamentations of our women. Our very way of life stands or falls with these walls, which is why we must guard them with our very lives.
Camp Skull Valley is the site of our frontline defense against the Sahagin. The best offense is a good defense─we can ill afford to let our foe take the battle too close to Limsa's shores.
If you asked me, I'd say you'd be a fool to leave the safety of the bastion for the perils beyond─but you wouldn't be the first by any means.
And just where do you think you're going? Beyond South Tidegate, you'll be nothing but fish food.
I like to work up a bit o' sweat! Better than shedding tears and mooning about lichyards, I say! What's the matter? You missed a meal? I got good news, supper's fresh fish and you're catching it!

I've wondered, Aerghaemr, if you was affrighted. A man is usually, in battle─think I've fought enough to say so. But if I was to know like you did that there wasn't no living left, would I be more afeared, or less?
I do enjoy this work. Who would have thought a girl who didn't have two leather soles to slap together would make a fair quartermaster? Still, you don't get noticed much in this job...
Hark, the enemy approaches! Must think, must think...! Stand fast! Then, sit down with a mug of ale...
Hear that? There's an edge on that wind. But better blown than becalmed, aye.
This here's Cutter's Cry, a maze of caverns with quicksand to boot. Go right on in, if you're that sure of your adventurin' skills.

Highbridge was meant to become the next Emerald Avenue! Where are the throngs of pilgrims, come to marvel at the ruins below? And more importantly, where is their <Emphasis>coin</Emphasis>? <sigh> Why is business so fickle?

I <Emphasis>told</Emphasis> them I was afraid of heights, and they had to send me <Emphasis>here</Emphasis> for my first field study! I say, are there no sites of archaeological interest on flat ground!?

No matter how fruitful our research, funding is not so easily secured. Unearthing and restoring treasures of history costs good coin, and there are many who do not recognize the value of our discoveries.
Graaah! The sun, it burns! Noooooo! My hair, my precious hair! I can feel it screaming in anguish!
Pilgrim, merchant, adventurer...Thal judges you not by who you are or where you hail from. Open your heart to His blessing, and you will find respite in His halls.
Come, listen closely... Can you hear that beating? 'Tis the flow of aether, the very pulse of the land.
column23: Truly, Eorzea is a realm of endless wonders. Every day, my heart is set aflutter with a new discovery!

column22: Gods' sake, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If>, you're disrupting my research! I was in the midst of measuring the flow of aether, but you've gone and made me raise my voice! Now I can't feel a godsdamned thing! Bah, I say! Bah!
Thanks to the Calamity─no offense of course─this place is absolutely ringin' with crystals. It's a miner's dream, is what it is!
I was raised in a wealthy merchant family in Ul'dah, where my parents saw that I wanted for nothing. But when I heard of the refugees' plight, I simply could not stay put...
column23: Outsider. Sheltered, spoiled child. The names that they call me─all are true. Still, I only want to help them in whatever small way I can.

column22: <cough> <wheeze> The pain! I can bear it no longer!
Me chest... <wheeze> Is this my fate? To die in this dusty hellhole?
Me arm's as good as dead. A warrior with no sword arm's about as much good as a one-legged chocobo. Eh? You think that's funny, outsider? Go on, laugh! Laugh away!
Frustrated as they are, the young ones here will give you quarrel simply for want of something to do. All it takes is a stray gaze. Watch yourself.
I'd give what little life remains in me just to watch the sun set over Ala Mhigo once more. You could travel the world and never witness so lovely a sight.

Aaand what's he doing here, you might ask. Aaand I'd answer, a very...important...job. I <Emphasis>do</Emphasis> look forward to finishing it and returning to Ul'dah covered in glory─thank you, thank you...you may stop admiring me now. I've moved on.
Times change, but more quickly. I would speak most untruly if I said I recognized much of Eorzea these days. Here I am now, an old soldier─I've missed my death and must find another way out...
I keep my fresh ingredients outside. Tried bringing 'em back once─come mornin' they were hard as rock, and just about as tasty!
Urghhh! Ah, I thank you for your concern, but these are no battle wounds. I merely slipped and fell on my backside, that's all.

They call me a workin' man, I reckon that's what I am.♪
Drinkin' under the chief's nose, sneakin' out the back door.♪
Aaand nobody'll ever know.♪
Please conduct yourself with dignity whilst visiting Costa del Sol. If you behave inappropriately towards other guests, I may be forced to carry out punitive action.
These days, the ferry's mostly used to carry shipments from Wineport to Costa del Sol. Them wealthy folk sure do like their drink...

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Longstop is home of gobbieflock! Craftybuilt by gobbiehands!
column23: Then flighty-beast comes and claims Longstop as lair. Brayflox cannot abide─Brayflox and gobbieflock backtake with uplander hand-lending!

column22: Pardon me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>ma'am<Else/>sir</If>, I was wool-gathering. We've no black pudding today, I'm afraid, if you were so inclined. We do have some very nice bread pudding, though, with marmalade.
Know how many guards Master Gegeruju has? Too damn many, is what. The last time I checked, he wasn't Admiral Merlwyb. We need to stop playing around and put men where they're needed!

<sigh> Sometimes I question if opening the Flying Shark was the right decision. But if I wasn't bowing and scraping to some pretentious Ul'dahn merchant, I reckon I'd be doing the same to the Count de Dzemael. That may have suited my father and grandfather, but I've aspirations for a better life.
Welcome to trading post! Memeroon Trading Post. Good trading post. Many goodies for sale. You spend many shinies!
Not far from here, you'll come across a vast crater─a remnant from the Calamity. You'd do well to keep a wide berth from it...and from the abrasive Elezen lass on the scaffolding.
Hm? Are you one of my assistants? Or a research specimen, perhaps? If you're neither, I'll thank you to stay out of my way.
Why, oh why, did I ever decide to become a scholar? An adventurer's life would have afforded me more solitude!
No need to overthink things! So long as your heart is in it, the sylphs will understand you!
By virtue of the crystal trade, the sylphs have maintained friendly terms with most every race in Eorzea. Alas, the appearance of Ramuh has been as a storm cloud over relations.
column23: If peace is to be secured, we must reopen a dialogue with the sylphs before they have the chance to summon their god again.

column22: Why do you tarry, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Our work is not yet finished! We must press onward, until the harpy queen lies broken at our feet!
I had hoped that the sights and sounds of Coerthas might rekindle Cid's memories, but it seems that the changes wrought by the Calamity have removed all trace of the familiar.
column23: Nevertheless, I will continue my efforts to rehabilitate our friend. In the meantime, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I expect you to learn what you can of the <Emphasis>Enterprise</Emphasis>.

column22: Are...are you sure I've come here before? This place feels completely foreign to me...
If worse comes to worst, seek the aid of we who bear the sigil of the rose. House Haillenarte has battled the Dravanian Horde since the rise of Ishgard, and never shall we yield.
We came to find an airship, yet now we meddle in Ishgardian affairs of state?
column23: Gods, if Alisaie were here, I would never hear the end of it...

column22: I'm glad we left the Observatorium. The people there were not friendly.
column23: Though even here, I can feel eyes upon us. We...we are not safe.

column22: If the <Emphasis>Enterprise</Emphasis> is indeed inside the Stone Vigil, then we must convince Lord Drillemont to cooperate.
Time is a resource we can ill afford to squander. We must gain entrance to the Stone Vigil without further delay.
What? Searching for Cid's engineers? Ah, yes, very good. Oh, me? I am at present conducting inquiries via linkpearl. So you see, there is no need for me to leave the comfort of the fire.
Thank goodness you found me, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I would have frozen, or drowned, or been eaten by a mudpuppy if it wasn't for you!
Now that we've found Biggs and Wedge, there's no reason for us to remain here any longer. Let us make for Revenant's Toll in Mor Dhona. There we can make our plans to rescue the others.
I <Emphasis>knew</Emphasis> the chief was still alive! Deep down, I always knew. And he looks healthy, too─well, he could do with a shave, I suppose, but other than that...
In the wake of the Calamity, the XIVth Imperial Legion occupied what remained of Castrum Novum, eventually rebuilding and renaming it Castrum Centri.
column23: The stronghold contains immense manufacturing and storage facilities, and it is the primary supplier of materiel for imperial forces stationed throughout Eorzea.
column24: Consequently, it is heavily defended. Infiltrating will not be easy. Nevertheless, it is necessary.

column22: Stealth and subterfuge, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, are how we will free our friends. I have every confidence you can play the part of an imperial soldier.
Ever seen an Ironworks engineer at work? Well, you're in for a treat, then! Stand back and enjoy the show!
Oh, boy, I always wanted my own reaper! I would wash her and wax her and name her and...
Dressing up as soldiers and sneaking in the front door, eh? Well, if you've got the guts to go through with it, then so do I!
What do you think, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? She's a beauty, isn't she?
Greetings, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I thought it fitting that I seek you out and offer my gratitude for all that you have accomplished.
I yet have matters that bear investigation. Pray return to Limsa Lominsa and report the defeat of Titan to Commander R'ashaht Rhiki.
If...if there is anything I can do...please ask.
The Alliance leaders have gathered in the Fragrant Chamber. Let us hurry to them, and ensure that they do not act without the full knowledge of the consequences.
Sorry we had to resort to such dramatic methods to escape. Things escalated so quickly that Alphinaud and I saw no other alternative.
Once the people of Eorzea learn that the Scions of the Seventh Dawn have returned, they will surely rally to our cause. We need only sound the clarion call.
That wasn't at all how I expected things to play out, but at least we escaped with our lives.

Deep in the desert of my heart, a lonely flower blooms♪
Yearning for the heavens above to quench my thirst for you.♪
Trololololo～lololo～♪
column23: Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I hope my singing doesn't bother you. I'm rather fond of this little ditty─it reminds me of home.

column22: That weapon didn't destroy those primals─it <Emphasis>devoured</Emphasis> them. Gods only know what else it can do.
We should depart for Vesper Bay at once. The Waking Sands awaits.
Where in the hells are you, Gaius...
I'm one of the fortunate few Ala Mhigans the elementals've permitted to stay in their wood. While I count my blessings, it breaks my heart to see my compatriots without a place to go.
What is it, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Don't tell me you're having second thoughts at a time like this! Or do you truly wish to return to Gridania?

Not enough! I've not enough medicine, not enough supplies, not enough hands! Valor is all very fine and good, but <Emphasis>brave</Emphasis> is like to turn into <Emphasis>bedridden</Emphasis>, and ideals don't sharpen the saw blades!
Laurence... Please, be safe...
Do you mean to enter the Seagrot? Marvelous! Just bear in mind, though: if you perish in its labyrinthine depth, no one will come for your bones.
Our supplies're fast dwindling, fellas. It's past time we up and left this godsforsaken place.
The Immortal Flames oversee the protection of Little Ala Mhigo, but from the looks the locals give us, you'd think our two nations were still at war.
They say the clothes make the <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If>. Have you come looking to be remade, adventurer?
The Observatorium is under the protection of House Durendaire. We have no need of adventurers or sellswords.

Man has ever charted the movements of the celestial bodies, scrutinizing the patterns to see what wisdom can be wrought. But in Ishgard, we must also remain watchful for signs of Dravanian activity, for even a slight delay can be the difference between survival and death.

Being a customs officer often feels like a thankless job. On any given day, a dozen strangers will accuse you of high-sea robbery. I must constantly remind myself that what I do is for the good of the nation.
On a clear night, have you perchance looked to the heavens and spied a constellation of cobalt-silver stars?
column23: That, my friend, is the realm of Halone. In Her halls dwell the heroes of Ishgard, those valiant souls who gave their lives to defend us from the Dravanian Horde.

column22: Some twenty years past, the heir to House Durendaire was lost at sea. Accomplished he was and wise for one so young. 'Twas corsairs, they say.
column23: Had he lived, things might be very different indeed for the Observatorium─and for House Durendaire, as a matter of fact...

column22: Please, warm yourself by our hearth, take a rest from your journeys. Life is not a race, my friend─rush blindly forward without concern for your health, and you <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> one day pay the price.
In case you were unaware, House Fortemps is quite willing, even eager to employ adventurers and sellswords. The commander in particular is known to possess a soft spot for your type.
column23: Not everyone is of one mind in this matter, of course, but I have made it known to the others that I support this endeavor. <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Women<Else/>Men</If> like yourself can be quite helpful─or, if nothing else, quite fascinating.

column22: Must civilization one day descend into ruin? Are we truly powerless to halt the inevitable decline? Surely all is not lost...

Where has that daughter of mine gone? She cannot seem to stay in one place, bless her. You there, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>don't you go telling her any tales of the road; I've trouble enough as is!<Else/>keep your insolent eyes well away from my little girl; I know what you adventurers are like!</If>

Well, ain't you a <If(PlayerParameter(4))>sturdy lass<Else/>strappin' fellow</If>. If you want to keep it that way, take my advice: when haulin' heavy shite, lift with your legs, not your back. I learned that one the <Emphasis>hard</Emphasis> way.
Does my presence make you uncomfortable? Be at ease, my child. If you are a goodly, righteous <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If>, then you have naught to fear from an inquisitor.
You are fascinated by my armor, adventurer. I mind it not, for an observant <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> is a boon in such days as these. I am of House Haillenarte, you see.
column23: This Fortemps encampment is not far from our own Skyfire Locks. There is much truck between the two─'tis likely we will fight side by side someday soon.

column22: Adventurer, you are shivering. A warming drink may cure what ails you.
Lord Haurchefant is mindful in the extreme with regards to his food. He is often fond of saying, “Food that physicks makes flesh proof against cold.”

They who aid the dragons or deny the crusade are denounced as unbelievers and judged by the inquisition. Even if they were to flee, theirs would be a beast's life, for every hamlet would be closed to them.
column23: Once in the inquisitors' hands, there is only death. Death that proves innocence, or death that follows proof of guilt. It is cruel but...we cannot suffer a heretic to live, can we?

column22: That receptionist is something else. Did you perchance notice how small she's written the names in her roll? I couldn't make out a single one, no matter how hard I tried!
column23: ...Sorry, just trying to make idle conversation. This whole affair has me all worked up. I thought for sure that it was some sort of scam─that they were rounding up hapless adventurers for some nefarious ends.
column24: But now that I've seen the facilities for myself, I must confess it looks legitimate...

column22: The cold is hard on old bones, my dear. Oh, listen to me go on. My boy's not around no more to hear an old woman's gripes, mayhap that's a small blessing for him.
We're going to be traveling companions! Isn't it exciting?
Noraxia and I both wear a mask! We're going to get along famously, I just know it!
All right, let's do this! Let's go and rescue Minfilia and the others!
Hmph! Instead of gratitude for coming to his rescue, Papalymo called me a scatterbrain!
column23: The next time he gets caught by the Empire, I'm leaving him to rot!

column22: ...Sixty-two, sixty-three, sixty─
column23: Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Just warming up...<pant>...for the operation. We're going to accompany...<pant>...the Gridanians. Um...<pant>...how many times was that...?

column22: Heehee! We all decided to give you a special surprise welcome, just like the ones in heroic epics!
column23: Your story took many twists and turns, but you managed to get to the happy ending! Let's hope for more happy endings to come!

column22: So much has happened in this place... If the walls could talk, such tales they would be able to tell!
At the best of times, the sylphs are as our own younglings─naive and given to mischief.
column23: In the course of your dealings with them, it may be all you can do not to scream in frustration. But rest assured Yda and I will be there to share in the burden.

column22:
Look, Noraxia, I realize that this makes no sense to you, but you must <Emphasis>try</Emphasis> to be more discreet. Years ago, a law was enacted in Ul'dah whereby─
<sigh> Please, just trust me and stay out of sight...
Yda is on her way to Gridania to request aid of the Order of the Twin Adder. In the meantime, we must learn all we can of the primal Titan.
column23: Literature may yield us the odd morsel of useful information, but there is no surer way than to seek the former members of the Company of Heroes.

column22: Had I not intervened, that Garlean soldier may well have done for Yda. Lowering her guard in the heat of battle as though she were on an evening stroll─how much of a scatterbrain can she be?
column23: <sigh> Well, at least we cannot fault her for being inconsistent!

column22: Gods' sake, Yda! We have the operation to think about, and you're wearing yourself down by exercising!? Your form isn't even correct! It's <Emphasis>cheating</Emphasis> to swing your arms!
column23: I appreciate that you have nervous energy, but there will be no shortage of opportunities to expend it when we go toe-to-toe against the Garleans!

column22: So a new era has begun... On such a momentous occasion, I find it good for the soul to tie up loose ends.
column23: Hm? What would I suggest you do? Why, the same thing you always do after accomplishing a task: report to Minfilia. It ends where it begins, my friend.

column22: Just when we dared to believe that peace had arrived, another primal awakens. I say, has there <Emphasis>ever</Emphasis> been rest for the weary?
Ramuh, beloved primal of the sylphs. Rooted is he in the laws of eld, the stern arbiter of the forest.
column23: Legend hath it this thunderous entity appeareth in the guise of an elderly sage. Thus doth history oft speaketh of the “old man of the woods.”

column22: Knowest thou the import of the broken staff within the solar? It fell from the grasp of Archon Louisoix, the man who, in his abiding love for all Eorzeans, shielded us against the storm of the Calamity.
column23: The stars wheel across the heavens, and the skies brighten once more. The survivors gather, and ignite a fiery dawn to burn away the glowering shroud. Ah, but destiny, thou art beautiful...

column22: As the primals fall, so do our spirits soar. Though mine aid be but modest, I nonetheless am heartened in my duties.

<Emphasis>Souls from aether far, strangers from strange lands,
Yester with thine eyes, morrow by thine hands.</Emphasis>
column23: By my reckoning, these words from the <Emphasis>Divine Chronicles</Emphasis> tell of the Warriors of Light, those dauntless heroes who shall lead us from the darkness of the Seventh Umbral Era.
column24: With cloudless vision of the past, they forge the way into the future. Mine interpretation, it ringeth true with that which I have witnessed.

column22: The land my master sheltered from oblivion hath been delivered unto a new beginning by the hand of the Warrior of Light. Thus doth history mark the passing of an era.
column23: The dawn doth brighten the sky, and shineth o'er this nascent age of hope. And though the clouds gather to mute the sun's rising glory, I would walk far with thee under its gentle glow.

column22: With the addition of the two engineers you rescued, the Waking Sands has become lively indeed.
column23: Were you aware that entry to the Sands requires the fulfillment of certain conditions? One must either gain recognition from the Scions...or earn the approval of Tataru. Our Lalafellin clerk has quite a discerning eye for character.

column22: As you have doubtless witnessed in your travels, the lands of Eorzea are gasping under the pall of a suffocating darkness.
column23: I must wonder if it is this darkness that invites disaster, or simply that disaster has left such gloom in its wake. One thing is for certain: now is not the time to relax our vigilance.

column22: It is fortunate indeed that we were able to regroup here─I did not care much for my chances of surviving a foray into an imperial stronghold alone. But I am certain that together, we will find a way to rescue our fellow Scions.
We may have surmounted this latest trial, but the worst is yet to come.
column23: We must remain focused─I will not see our efforts wasted in futile regret. And as for Thancred... He and I have much to discuss.

column22: The Maelstrom has committed its forces to the operation. In fact, the pirates look forward to their part in this naval warfare with something approaching unholy glee.
column23: You need only concentrate on the task that lies before you. We stand vigilant at your back.

column22: Welcome back, Warrior of Light. We, all of us, prayed for your safe return.
column23: The Seventh Astral Era has dawned, setting in motion a myriad of new beginnings. I suspect our paths will diverge for a time... Have you said your farewells to the Scions?

column22: In bringing the struggle against the Empire to a decisive end, the nations of Eorzea spent much of their military strength.
column23: I fear the beast tribes have caught scent of this temporary weakness, and will give us scant leave to rest. A hero's work is never done, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.

column22: Traipsing around in the woods is hardly my forte. 'Tis only fitting that those two be the ones to assist you this time.
column23: Lest you harbor concerns about me and my idle hands, know that I will be busy conducting my own independent investigation while you entreat the sylphs.

column22: ...Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Pray do not concern yourself with my welfare. My current investigation has yielded some curious results, and at present I am pondering how best to proceed.
I realize I have been the cause of tremendous consternation, and for that I deeply apologize.
column23: Ah, but you haven't time to waste chatting with me. Minfilia is expecting you.

column22: Believe me, I am quite eager to resume active duties and redeem my good name. But I have not forgotten that similar sentiments nearly led me to my doom once before.
column23: I will not question the wisdom of our Baldesion colleagues. They have bid me rest, and so I shall.

column22: An imperial castrum... 'Twas to be expected, I suppose.
The counteroffensive to come will require the total commitment of every allied nation, as well as the flawless coordination of all forces. I pray the council understands this.
Each phase of Operation Archon must be executed to perfection, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. The fate of Eorzea hangs in the balance!
“Where men go as one, there is life. And where there is life, there is cause to hope.”
column23: The light of hope shines brilliantly within you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I only wish my grandfather were here to see it.

column22: Gaius may have called it a weapon of ancient Allag, but I saw extensive magitek modifications...

For many years I dedicated my life to the research and development of magitek, unable or unwilling to see the repercussions of my work. And though I have since left Garlemald behind, its scientists continue to build upon my work.
column23: I fear that this new weapon may be another example of that─an ancient relic enhanced with technologies I created. Yet even should that be the case, it would still require a brilliant mind to─
column24: No... No, he didn't...

column22: I think we could all do with a good rest, don't you? I know I could.
column23: I still haven't had time to think about everything that happened. About Nero...and Gaius...

column22: I understand you gave our fallen brothers and sisters a proper burial. I'm sure they appreciated it.
column23: When the Empire is beaten and all of this over, let us visit them at the church.

column22: The Antecedent made me an offer I couldn't refuse. Said that if I joined, I'd  get to fight against the primals and the imperials both to my heart's content.
column23: Aye, I know I could get the same by enlistin' in one of 'em Grand Companies. But I've never been partial to salutin', if ye know what I mean.

column22: Heh, so this boy has Garlean blood in him! Can't say I'm surprised. Everyone knows what happens when a city is sacked, even if the bards choose to omit that part.
column23: But Arenvald shouldn't be pitied. Boys like him have a clean slate, an opportunity to write their own story, free of the ties that bind the common man.

column22: They tell me ye were instrumental in Ifrit's defeat. Bravo, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, bravo!
column23: Perhaps ye heard of my exploits? The Flames and I struck a decisive blow against the lizardmen by destroyin' and pillagin' their stores of crystals. Aye, they won't be summonin' their primal again any time soon!

column22: A masked man? I vaguely recall some Amalj'aa rantin' about somethin' like that in the middle of a skirmish. 'Course, I wasn't listenin' too closely, on account of the fact their friends were tryin' to kill me.
column23: I don't mean to waste yer time, friend, but that's the only thing what comes to mind.

column22: Congratulate the boy, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Chosen by the Antecedent as the sylph's bodyguard! What an honor!
column23: ('Course, this means his dusty rags'll no longer suffice. I say we get the boy a shiny new suit of silver armor, the kind the Sultansworn wear. We split the cost evenly and surprise him. Not bad, eh?)

column22: The robberies and disappearances? The Amalj'aa are the most likely culprit, wouldn't you agree?
column23: Then again, this is Thanalan─one cannot discount the possibility that moneyed interests are involved.

column22: I must confess, I do rather miss that obnoxious Miqo'te's company.
column23: A'aba is taking part in a joint operation with the Immortal Flames. I imagine he's having the time of his life right now.

column22: I'm not sure I grasp the purpose of these remembrance ceremonies. Whether you remember or rewrite the past, what does it matter? It isn't as though you can repeat it.
column23: Our present-day enemies ought to serve as sufficient motivation, don't you think? The only lesson I believe we should take from the Calamity is that far greater threats can and <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> appear.

column22: Guarding Noraxia is a prestigious duty indeed. Arenvald is right to be excited.
column23: (But he has never crossed swords with a Garlean before. I worry what will happen if he is forced to confront his father's countrymen.)

column22: I had a dream unlike any other. I was myself, but then I became something...more. When I spoke of it to others, they directed me here. Did you have one too?
They say that those of us who have seen the dream are chosen, that we have within us the seed of greatness. That we could be heroes.
column23: Even me, an Ala Mhigan half-breed, cast out when his mother could no longer stand the sight of him. A half-breed who once took to banditry just to eat. Aye, I'm sure I'm just <Emphasis>brimming</Emphasis> with heroic potential...

column22: An experienced warrior like A'aba won't die so easily. He's strong, fast, cunning... Aye, he'll come back safe.
I hear you pledged yourself to a Grand Company. Me? I don't think I could do it. I'd never feel like one of them, no matter what the recruiters say.
(A'aba neglects to mention that our allied forces suffered heavy casualties. The operation succeeded, but at great cost.)
column23: (With an outcome like that, should we truly consider it a victory? A'aba says we should, but I'm not so sure.)

column22: I'm to meet with the Antecedent soon to discuss a matter of great import. A'aba thinks it's about my first official mission. I suppose it would be good if it was, yes? I mean, I'm not sure if I'm ready, but still...

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, have you heard!? I have been chosen to serve as Noraxia's bodyguard. There have been increasing reports of imperial activity in Thanalan, and so the Antecedent insists that our guest be escorted whenever venturing outside.
column23: I know how hard you of all people worked to endear us to the sylphs. I swear to you that I will guard our honored guest with my life, and not allow your efforts to come to naught.

column22: I should have done something, done <Emphasis>anything</Emphasis>. But I didn't, and now A'aba and Aulie are...
column23: I will not let it be for nothing. I...I will <Emphasis>earn</Emphasis> this.

column22: One day I hope to become a hero to the people like you. A hero like A'aba and Aulie were to me.
Why don't any o' these blokes know who I am!? I swear I was one o' 'em Scions o' the Seventh Dawn!
column23: Only we didn't have such a fancy name back then, an' the headquarters was in a far more convenient location.
column24: At least, I think it was... Or is me mind playin' tricks on me? Gods, what's wrong with me? Why can't I remember it more clearly?

column22:
<crunch> <crunch> ...
<crunch> <crunch> ...Oh, hello again, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>laddie</If>! Meet Percevains─we was thick as thieves in the old days. Least, I think we was.
column23: ...Or it might've been that he was a right creepy bastard, an' I did me best t' avoid him. Still, we was both members o' the old order, so either way we're in this together, eh?

column22: I've been chattin' with Percevains, an' we both swear there was another member of our crew. We still ain't figured out a way t' prove who we was, but just ye wait and see. It won't be long before everybody sees us for the heroes we is!
Guess what, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? We found our third man! 'Twas bleedin' Satzfloh. Bugger me, how could I <Emphasis>ever</Emphasis> forget about Satzfloh?
column23: Aye, the three of us was <Emphasis>always</Emphasis> together...I think.

column22: I'm startin' to wonder if it's worth the hassle to prove who we was.
column23: I mean, maybe some folk would say, “Good on ye, mate, thanks for fightin' to save Eorzea!” an' whatnot. But I reckon most would ask what we've done for 'em lately, if not spit in our faces for allowin' Bahamut to blow up half the godsdamned world...

column22: The Waking Sands sure is busy these days. Fresh-faced 'venturers eager t' make their mark, famous folk like you runnin' off t' face the bleedin' Lord o' Crags...
column23: Maybe it's time for me an' the boys to retire. 'Venturin's a dangerous callin', after all─be a little slow, be a little late, just once, an' that's that.

column22: Greetings, Scion. I come on behalf of the Students of Baldesion. You may address me as Clive.
column23: ...Is there some reason you are still here? Please, carry on. I am not here to see you.

column22: I am told you are one of our finest, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I suspect we will see much more of each other in future.
Have we met somewhere before? You must be quite the accomplished adventurer to be welcomed into these halls.
column23: Me? No one's ever expected much of me. And so far, I've done a fine job of living down to their expectations.

column22: Once upon a time, I aspired to make my name as an adventurer. It all came crashing down that fateful day when I lost the man who led my party─the man who had won my heart.
column23: If I could not protect my love, how could I hope to protect my realm? I sunk to the depths of despair.
column24: Pathetic, is it not? Others may have come to join some great cause, while I am here only because I have nowhere else to go.

column22: In recent days, I've resumed my training. Idle hands make for idle minds, and painful memories are all too quick to resurface.
You'll not believe it, but I've been summoned by Lady Minfilia! Do you suppose that she has an assignment for me?
column23: What I would not give to have something to fight for again! And yet, I must not be overeager...

column22: Walking ones from Ul'dah have not seen these ones before─this one knows. Still, must walking ones make such screaming sounds when seeing this one's face? This one cannot get a wink of rest!
This one has finally figured out a way to make walking ones be quiet. What does friendly one think? This one is very convincing, yes?
The name's Haribehrt. I've taken up residence here...for reasons I'd prefer not to delve into.
column23: I may not be of much use on the battlefield, but I know a thing or two about dealing with people. If you find yourself in a bind, you'd do well to avail yourself of my services.

column22: There are two types of Ala Mhigans─fools who wish to fight back but know not how, and cowards who've chosen to run from their worries.
column23: The young man over there is a striking example of the former. Me? I'm the latter, or couldn't you tell?

column22: With this many people here, we need a culinarian of our own. We can't subsist on rations and preserved foodstuffs forever.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? I thought it was you! Do you remember? It is I, Edda from Ul'dah!
column23: I'm ever so glad I found you. I've been meaning to repay you for the kindness you showed me when we last met. If I might be of assistance to you in any way, you need but say the word!

column22: I hear that Liavinne was here as well. She and I might not always have seen eye to eye, but once a comrade, always a comrade, yes?
column23: I am but a humble conjurer, yet I would do what I can to repay the Empire for their villainy.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! You've always been a hero to me, and now you've gone and become a hero to Eorzea as well!
column23: I, too, once dreamed of being a hero...but that dream died in the Tam–Tara Deepcroft. I am happy for you─truly I am─and yet I cannot say my heart is free from regrets.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I imagine that you'll soon be off on another grand adventure?
column23: I...have decided to remain here. I am a poor successor for you─this I know. Still, I would serve in whatever small way I can.

column22: Me dear sister drew her last breath here, in battle with the Empire. To her, the fight for Eorzea's future was more important than her homeland. True to her beliefs to the end, she was...
Tales of yer accomplishments travel far and wide. I can only hope that capable adventurers'll come to follow in yer footsteps.
column23: Then─and only then─can I be certain that me decision to part with me Yellowjacket comrades was the right one.

column22: No matter how dark the night, one day the dawn will break. As long as brave souls like yourself take up our cause, the Scions will never stand down!
I've seen many an adventurer come and go, but I've not seen one of your like in ages. Promise me that your legend has only just begun!
We haven't forgotten how you saved us, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Don't worry─Wedge and I mean to repay the favor in kind.
<sigh> If only Master Garlond were still with us...
column23: He was a brilliant man, full of life and purpose. Kind and generous, he taught us everything we know about engineering. Though believe me, he could also be a very hard person to please.
column24: He would force us to completely rebuild devices if even a single flaw was discovered. I can only imagine what he'd say if he saw the <Emphasis>Tiny Bronco</Emphasis>...

column22: If there's anything we can do to help, no matter how small, just ask. Broken carriage axle, cracked barrel─hells, even a leaky bucket. Say the word and we'll fix it.
What's next on the agenda? We're ready to get to work!
Watching you live the life of a free adventurer has helped me realize that I can't keep putting off my dreams forever.
column23: I've been talking with Wedge about opening a workshop, independent of Garlond Ironworks. Maybe in Vylbrand, I don't know...
column24: Working with the chief is great and all, but someday I want to build my own <Emphasis>Enterprise</Emphasis>, you know?

column22: I like it here! Safe, hidden─a bit dank and dingy, perhaps, but I've known worse. Plus the receptionist was rather charming, don't you think?
People in masks cannot be trusted? But Biggs and I wear masks all the time when welding!
I don't want to believe that Master Garlond is dead, but the chief wasn't the type to cut and run off. He would've gone to Carteneau. He would've been there when Dalamud fell. Which means...
(She hasn't said a word to me since the rescue. Was it all for nothing!?)
You're an inspiration to us all, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. An honest-to-gods hero that never gives up! Never gives in!
column23: (And neither will I. I'll win Tataru's heart! See if I don't!)

column22: <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(70),1))>Excuse me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>.<Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(70),2))>Wait a minute. I know you─the carriage into Gridania, right? It's me, Bremondt! How in the hells did you end up here, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>? Ah, never mind─you can tell me later. I've got to ask you somethin' first.<Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(70),3))>Excuse me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>.<Else/>Excuse me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>.</If></If></If> This might sound strange, but you haven't by chance seen a fella what looks exactly like me? I'm lookin' for my twin brothers, see, an' I heard they might've come through here.
column23: <sigh> They could be dead, for all I know. Least it feels like I've been chasin' ghosts for an eternity now.

column22: Looks like the Antecedent's found herself a good crop of aspirin' heroes. Aye, I reckon Eorzea'll be alright as long as these fine folk are around to protect her.

Listen to these two, swappin' their stories. Life ain't always got to be an adventure, I say. Me, I'm the sort who enjoys a nice, relaxin' carriage ride, paired with a bottle of Bacchus<Switch(PlayerParameter(70))><Case(1)>.</Case><Case(2)>─like that time I met you, come to think of it.</Case><Case(3)>.</Case></Switch>

Heh, you've come a long way since I first <Switch(PlayerParameter(70))><Case(1)>saw you runnin' around the Wakin' Sands</Case><Case(2)>met you on that carriage to Gridania</Case><Case(3)>saw you runnin' around the Wakin' Sands</Case></Switch>. <Switch(PlayerParameter(70))><Case(1)></Case><Case(2)>Guess this means we're square, eh?</Case><Case(3)></Case></Switch>

<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(70),1))>Hey, ain't you the <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If> that rode that boat into Limsa Lominsa with me? It is you, ain't it! Hah! Glad to see you've found a good home. What am I doin' here? Well, I heard tell one of me brothers came through not long ago. Looks like I just missed him, though.<Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(70),2))>I heard tell one of me brothers came through not long ago. Looks like I just missed him, though.<Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(70),3))>I heard tell one of me brothers came through not long ago. Looks like I just missed him, though.<Else/> I heard tell one of me brothers came through not long ago. Looks like I just missed him, though.</If></If></If>
column23: I ain't seen either one of 'em since the Calamity─didn't even know if they were still alive. But after runnin' into folk who swore they knew me time an' again, I reckoned they had to be out there somewhere.
column24: I've been travelin' an' peddlin' in the hopes I'd find me brothers ever since. If ye see a fella what looks like me, let him know that Brennan's lookin' for him, would you?

column22: The merchants told me it was Brendt that delivered their goods. Maybe if I wait a while, he'll come back with another shipment...

Bah, Brendt thinks he had it bad. Try bribin' a pirate an' see where that gets you! <Switch(PlayerParameter(70))><Case(1)>Good thing you an' me escaped those bastards way back when, eh?</Case><Case(2)></Case><Case(3)></Case></Switch>

<Switch(PlayerParameter(70))><Case(1)>I know I told you to become a storied personage I could brag about havin' met, but I never thought you'd go so far to oblige me!</Case><Case(2)>Hah! You sure gave those imperials what for! I knew you were somethin' special, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!</Case><Case(3)>Hah! You sure gave those imperials what for! I knew you were somethin' special, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!</Case></Switch>

<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(70),1))>Don't mind me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>.<Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(70),2))>Don't mind me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>.<Else/><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(70),3))>Well, if it ain't that <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If> from the carriage! Fancy meetin' you here of all places. Me?<Else/>Don't mind me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass.<Else/>lad</If></If></If></If> I'm just here to deliver a shipment. Now, where shall I tell 'em to put it...
Everythin' looks to be in order. Right─on to the next customer...

Have a seat, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>! I was just tellin' me brothers about the time these Amalj'aa saved me from the Brass Blades. <Switch(PlayerParameter(70))><Case(1)>Hard to believe, I know, but it's true!</Case><Case(2)>Hard to believe, I know, but it's true!</Case><Case(3)>You were there, remember?</Case></Switch>

I reckon a lot more folk'll take up adventurin' after hearin' about what you've done. Brave men and women all hopin' to become the next <Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>. <Switch(PlayerParameter(70))><Case(1)></Case><Case(2)></Case><Case(3)>At least I get to brag about havin' met the original, eh?</Case></Switch>
“No matter one's past transgressions, all who have seen the dream are welcome.” Even men such as we.
column23: I have heard offers such as these before. All were naught more than bait for the hangman's noose.

column22: This was all <Emphasis>his</Emphasis> idea. Yet, in the end, he was the one who had to go and... <sigh> Godsdamned fool.
By the gods, to think that this ragtag band of idealists could lay the XIVth low. 'Tis a tale straight from a story book.
column23: I imagine my former associates would find it most appealing. After all, what young ruffian hasn't at one point fancied himself a hero in the making?
column24: Aye, I think I may bring more than a few recruits back with me from the Twelveswood.

column22: Though the souls of the righteous ascend to Halone's halls, their earthly forms are not afforded the same honor. But goodly men and women deserve proper burials, and so all who come down must go up.
House Haillenarte's bumblings have cost us the Steel Vigil. Now the dragons hold that part of the north. I understand not why the captain stands with them!
I trust you are not come to Whitebrim Front on mere whim? We are the first line of defense against the Dravanian Horde, and we do <Emphasis>not</Emphasis> need hapless wanderers underfoot.
And what do you think <Emphasis>you're</Emphasis> doing here? These supplies are not to be touched without permission. Know that I will not hesitate to use force to stop you if necessary.

In the years after the Calamity, this place was a barren wasteland, with nary a shrub to be found. It was Guildmaster Fufucha─her skill, her knowledge, and her love for the trees most of all─who gave this forest new life.
column23: Were it not for her, I would not be here today. Nay...like as not, I would never have chosen the botanist's path. The profound joy and satisfaction that my life's work has brought me─I owe it all to her.

column22: A good fisher knows when to give back to the sea. Throw back a guppy today, and reel in ten fish tomorrow.
The wretched squalor of this place concerns the Ul'dahns not... And of those who flocked to help at first, only Father Iliud has remained steadfast.
So many tragedies have befallen us in recent years. The Calamity, the primals... Alas, it is only within our power to shepherd the souls of the fallen, and pray that they find peace in Thal's realm.
Water to fetch, weeds to pull... A shabby lichyard is a slight to the living and the dead alike.
Rest in peace, dear uncle. Technically, a cousin thrice removed, but who's counting? We're too busy dividing up that estate of yours.
Oh, there's work enough from the church but nothing you'd call <Emphasis>cheery</Emphasis>.
Though I am not qualified to assist with the rites, I offer what assistance I can to the priests. Sometimes I wonder if I'm just getting in the way, though...

Rhalgr take this desert heat! Ahhh, I'd give anythin' to be back in the crisp mountains of Ala Mhigo.
...Well, perhaps not my freedom.
To the south lies Amalj'aa territory, not to mention swarms of fell fiends. If you care for life and limb, north is where you want to go.
Grrr! My belly churns like a raging river at the mere sight of Amalj'aa! Is it not the same for you!?

Welcome to the Sunken Temple of Qarn─or what remains of it, at least. Used by ancient Belah'dians as a place to worship the sun goddess, Azeyma, much about the temple's history remains shrouded in mystery.
We're soldiers o' the Resistance, godsdammit! Every wakin' moment oughta be spent tryin' to liberate our people! But everywhere I look, I see nothin' but layabouts!
I went to Ul'dah hoping to find honest work, but there wasn't a single job to be had. At least nothing that didn't require me to give up my dignity.
The Ala Mhigans who ended up here are the ones who couldn't─or wouldn't─adapt to a new lifestyle. In a sense, we're Ala Mhigans through and through.
'Course I hate the Garleans─they took our homeland an' all that. But right now what I want most is to not feel hungry all the bleedin' time.
A ways northeast of here you'll find the Sepulchre─a frightfully named place, no? Fitting, though, seeing as how it's best known as home to the villainous Corpse Brigade.
column23: To think that the erstwhile kingsguard of Ala Mhigo could end up a band of murderers and thieves. Mind you, they had a less-than-pristine reputation in the old days as well.

column22: The folk you meet here may seem boorishly provincial, but do try to show them some mercy. Had you been driven from your home and forced to wallow in disease and poverty, I doubt you'd fare much better.

As much as I enjoy the creative aspect of goldsmithing─drawing out the hidden potential of Eorzea's natural bounty and so forth─I understand that it is first and foremost a means to an end. What use is a masterpiece if no one will purchase it?
Things are fairly calm at the present, but as soon as there is a sortie, we shall have our hands full again. We could use another chirurgeon, certainly.
You may partake of the warmth of our hearth, but never forget that within these walls the word of House Durendaire is law.
Common is the nation which has warred with its neighbors. But <Emphasis>our</Emphasis> neighbors are dragons─relentless and merciless creatures.
column23: Through generations of conflict and sacrifice, we have honed our warcraft with fire and blood. All to survive, all to triumph. Anything less, and we would not be here today.

column22: There's raw, and there's <Emphasis>raw</Emphasis>. I may still be green, but I can stand sentry now without limping afterwards. That counts for something.
<sigh> It's not uncommon for the men to make excuses in order to avoid their duties. I understand why, though. When the dragons come, the sentries standing guard are the first to die.
You're not going to make me leave, are you? I know I've no right to be here, but it's cold outside, a-and there were wolves chasing me...
An empty larder, a full barracks, and an inadequate kitchen. Is there any cook with a worse lot in life?
Gods, I'm so hungry! I must eat something soon, lest the sentries mistake the growling of my stomach for that of a ravenous scalekin!
How can I be expected to fight on an empty stomach? I'm not derelict in duty─I'm <Emphasis>incapable</Emphasis> of duty!
Strategy, sticky flummery! A spear held...thusly! Dragons skewered...thusly! What need for a plan beyond this, I ask?
Resources are extremely limited at the front lines, so some patients must make do with food and bed rest. We cannot be expected to dole out medicine to each and every one.
The cells here are home to all manner of cultists and heretics. You'd do well not to provoke them.
This bell is the very same one in the sigil of House Durendaire. It is a symbol more so than an instrument for raising alarum.

A hammer's a dangerous thing in a hand gone numb. The Smith of Winter has my fingers in her vice─I've a need of an occasional thaw by the fire, or I'm liable to send that hammer flying into a knightly noggin.
There is a hunter that stalks the sick and the wounded, and its name is winter. This far north, warm beds and nourishing food are not to be found in any great quantity...

In bygone times, the Stone Vigil was a staunch outpost against the dragons─nowadays, it's bloody crawling with the beasts. That's why this gate is sealed shut unless an order comes down saying otherwise.
You stand before Dzemael Darkhold─carved out of an extensive cavern system as a safe haven from dragon raids. I would invite you to take a tour, but I'm afraid that it's off-limits at the moment.
Dzemael Darkhold is a subterranean fortress excavated by the great Ishgardian house of the same name. None but authorized personnel may enter.
The air within the Aurum Vale is thick with noxious gases, fatal even in small doses. If you must enter, do so fully prepared.
You have done well to brave the frozen wilderness, adventurer. Stay awhile and be warm.
You are not leaving snow and ice in your wake, I hope? The melted stuff is right hazardous, mark you. Not a moon ago, I near broke my neck when I slipped and took a tumble.
column23: I have survived countless campaigns against the dragons; I would sooner not be remembered as the knight who was undone by a puddle. The laughter would surely follow me all the way to the great beyond.

column22: All adventurers worth their salt gather in Revenant's Toll. If you've a mind to rise above the sea of mediocrity, you've come to the right place.

Time was I took on every odd job offered me, runnin' messages an' cullin' pesky fauna like a good little adventurer. But I'm well past that now. These days there's only one thing on my mind, and it's what's brought me here.
It seems the fate of Monument Tower to watch the watcher. 'Twas built to guard the Fury's Gaze, and the stone beyond price hidden in its depth...
column23: And now it keeps vigil against the Garlean outpost, for the jewel that is Ishgard must never fall into the Empire's unclean hands.

column22: I can tell you're in the trade, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>sister<Else/>brother</If>! Welcome to Revenant's Toll, the place of 'venturers, the rest for the restless, the abode on the crossroads!
So many things cease to be wondrous to those who study them day in and day out, but not the Crystal Tower. What secrets must course warmly under that cool, bright skin...
Don't cozen yourself, the gil's good around here because the nasties are that nasty. But what you <Emphasis>really</Emphasis> need to reckon against are the Garleans.
In every and all things, I like my planning perfect and my execution precisely as predetermined. A stickler for detail─that is simply the way I am.
Prrray do not cause a disturbance whilst staying in Forgotten Springs. We have enough pressing concerns as it is.
Bloody 'ells me throat's parched! Can't wait till me shift's over so I can drown meself in ale! Aye, that an' a buxom bar wench to dandle on me lap!
This is where we detain pirates and smugglers and other such rogues till we decide as what to do with 'em. See to it you do naught as earns you a place here.

You know how ale's brewed, adventurer? You take malted barley, ferment it with yeast, then add herbs and spices to give it character. The stuff is a deal cheaper than wine, and for that it's loved by the smallfolk.

Ye need to keep stables warm, especially down on the ground. Chocobos are jus' like us, in that they ain't built for the cold. They can take it, to be sure, but that don't mean they don't suffer somethin' terrible.

Have you come in search of House Durendaire's protection? A wise decision if so. House Haillenarte may claim Skyfire Locks to be the most secure stronghold in this region, but even a fool can see how mistaken that is.
The manor I once served in was no less magnificent than those found in the Gentry's Ward yonder. And magnificent it should be, for it was formerly home to generations of Seedseers.
column23: However, the Elder Seedseer before the last declared that he needed not such extravagance, and the abode came into the ownership of the Dartancours family.

column22: We intend to establish a base of operations here, but the environs remain most inhospitable. Without Rolfe's aid, we'd be lost.

My friends and I call ourselves gold diggers. Why? Because we dream of striking it rich at a stroke! Hahaha!
...All right, it's not that funny. I'll shut up now. Ahem.
Sometimes I wonder which is harder to find: a vein of gold, or a good man. But I swear, one day I <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> find the mother lode!
My fellows and I live one day at a time, using the proceeds of the morning's haul to buy the evening's tankard. It is an unpredictable way of life, but I would not exchange it for aught else.
This spire is named for one of the heroes from the age of Gridania's founding. Ah, to have one's name immortalized so! Vortefaurt's Spire─yes, I daresay that rings rather nicely.
You need not watch the sky so long as House Durendaire holds the Observatorium. Should the Dravanians come, the golden bell will sound, and all of Ishgard shall hearken to its call.
We held a vigil at the church until word came of your success. I cannot express to you how relieved I am by your safe return, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
Your mission is to make contact with the sylphs, with the ultimate goal of finding a peaceful resolution to the threat posed by Ramuh.
column23: Be fairly warned: the sylphs are a unique people to say the least, and you may find yourself bewildered by their customs at first. Yet know that Yda and Papalymo will be on hand to support all your endeavors.

column22: To think that the Ascians have grown so brazen as to carry out their work in plain view...
column23: We must needs uncover their dark designs, that we might take measures against them. I am relying on you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.

column22: Thank you for agreeing to handle Titan and the kobolds. As Y'shtola mentioned, the mission will be fraught with danger, so we will want to spare no preparation.
column23: I shall look forward to your triumphant return, as shall all your comrades. Go with the blessing of the Crystal.

column22: You have become a symbol of hope to all the people of Eorzea, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, and I believe this to be no mere coincidence.
column23: The path you have walked and the battles you have fought─all were of your own choosing. Everything you are, you owe to the choices you have made.

column22: As briefed, you are to lead a squad of elite adventurers on infiltration missions. You will receive detailed orders at each staging point.
column23: The future of Eorzea hinges upon the success of Operation Archon, and casualties are inevitable. May the Crystal watch over us all.

column22: Have you been keeping well, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? We may have earned ourselves a respite, but there is still much and more to do. Together, let us continue to shine the Crystal's light upon Eorzea!
Buscarron is a good friend of ours, and there's no place like his for the latest gossip in the South Shroud!
The sylphs are known to avoid the South Shroud. What could have compelled the sylph elder to come here?
column23: But the question of motive must wait─finding him is our foremost priority. With things relatively calm over in Little Solace, we can focus our search effort on this area.

column22: The <Emphasis>Enterprise</Emphasis>... I...I have heard that name before, but where?
Welcome to the Arcanists' Guild. This institution was established at the express orders of Admiral Merlwyb, and the research and recruitment we conduct is funded by Limsa Lominsa's governing body.
Much like that gamble with the corrupted crystal, it's quite possible that this plan fails spectacularly. But it's a risk we'll have to take in order to free our friends.
Memeroon open shop! Open more shops. Many, many Memeroon shops! Make many shinies!
If ye want to commune with the sea an' 'er bounty, ye got to still yer spirit an' surrender yer senses. When the fish ain't bitin', ye might as well enjoy the peace an' quiet, eh?

Master Gegeruju is exceedingly particular when it comes to quality, so to be hired as his personal chef is quite the honor. It is, however, a daily trial to create dishes that meet his demanding expectations...
Oh gods, my aching feet. Hm? You wish to see me dance, do you? Then I would first see the color of your coin─I have three little ones at home whose bellies need filling.
I ain't never stayed too long at any one job, but I been 'ere fer a good while now. Might be as it 'as summat to do with that pretty dancer lass, Ealdgyth.
The creatures in these parts are terribly skittish of late─hardly good news for a hunter like me. What do you suppose has gotten into them?
What may appear to many as a pile of rags can sometimes turn out to be cloth of extraordinary value. It takes the trained eye of a merchant such as myself to judge the difference.
I think it's time I replaced my tired old wand. And since we have the Alchemists' Guild right here in Ul'dah, I might even treat myself to one of those more expensive, custom-made types.
The Company of Heroes is the most celebrated mercenary band in the history of Eorzea. Even so, I must admit I have never before met one of their members face-to-face.
column23: I imagined that a warrior who had toppled both Titan and Leviathan would seek to bask in a lifetime of fame and glory...yet he seems to have settled in a place distinctly bereft of adoring crowds.

column22: Whilst you were catering to the Company of Buffoons' every whim, I was gathering information on our feathered foe. As a result, I was not present when the Garleans came.
column23: I suppose we should be grateful for our good fortune─though it matters little should Garuda grow powerful enough to bring Eorzea to heel.

column22: (What do you think, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Was she impressed? Do you think she might consider...you know...)
Castrum Centri has been placed under high alert. Those found where they do not belong will be summarily punished.
What do you think you're doing? Get back to your station, or I'll report you to the centurion!
As if I didn't already have my hands full moving goods around, now I have to move <Emphasis>people</Emphasis>? <sigh> I really need to ask for a transfer...
<sigh> Would that I could hold you in my arms... Alas, we aren't meant to be...
Security's tight, just as we expected. We're going to need a special key if we want to get past this bulkhead.
H-How do I look, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Do I cut an imposing f–figure as a Garlean s–soldier?
Operation Archon is the most ambitious military strategy ever to be conducted on Eorzean soil, and you are its beating heart! You must not fail!
I'm Aelina, an' I work for Rowena. My dream's to one day trade places with that harridan an' work <Emphasis>her</Emphasis> as she does me─like a pack chocobo.
We've started dealing in Ironworks gear. As the name suggests, these items are made by Garlond Ironworks, and the quality is exceptional. And as you'd expect, you won't find them anywhere else.
column23: Picking up the scent of profit, Rowena quickly secured an exclusive deal to be the realm's sole supplier. The woman's purse continues to grow fat with coin, but we hirelings see nary a gil of it.
column24: ...Ahem. Anyway, I'm supposed to tell you that Ironworks gear can be enhanced. Just take them to Gerolt─or his apprentice, more like─and you can get the work done.

column22: Gods, I've been dry as a bone for the past six bells. M-Mead... Jus' give me enough mead to wet me lips...
I like to watch Gerolt pound away, but he spends far more time draining a bottle than holding his hammer. He drinks so much, he should've been born a cask of mead, kupo.
Beyond those gates awaits our foe. Are you prepared to meet with her?
The prisoners? They are being held in the storage tower...as you should know, soldier.
We apologize for the inconvenience, but services to Limsa Lominsa are suspended until further notice.
We apologize for the inconvenience, but services to Vesper Bay are suspended until further notice.
Milvaneth Sacrarium, dedicated to the worship of Nald, was extensively damaged during the Calamity. Repairs continue even to this day, to the great inconvenience of our adherents.
The Thousand Maws of Toto–Rak lies within the jurisdiction of the Fifth Spear Wood Wailers. For safety reasons, access is strictly prohibited to all but those with express permission.
Ever has man sought to better his life, all too often at the expense of his brother. That desire and hope can beget suffering and death is a regrettable yet undeniable truth.
The chief? To be honest, I don't know where he is or what he's up to at the moment. Probably busy doing something only he can do.
<sigh> Tataru... I suppose it wasn't meant to be...
Greetings, adventurer. I'm Kipih Jakkya, reporter for <Emphasis>The Raven</Emphasis>. You <Emphasis>have</Emphasis> heard of Gridania's leading tabloid, I trust?
column23: Our publication is known for its swift and thorough coverage of all manner of current events. Pick up a copy if you ever wish to learn of the realm's latest happenings!

column22: A hearty hail to you, adventurer. I am Dural Tharal, renowned reporter for the <Emphasis>Mythril Eye</Emphasis>.
column23: Our paper has proven to be the most popular publication in Ul'dah. If you've ever an idle instant, mayhap you would indulge my inclination for in-depth interviews?

column22: Greetings, friend. I am Petyr Winsome, reporter for the <Emphasis>Harbor Herald</Emphasis>.
column23: You won't find a more reliable source of information anywhere else in Limsa Lominsa. Entrust your tales of adventure to me, and I'll see them faithfully incorporated into a front-page article!

column22:
From spooks and shadows do not shy～♪
Come one, come all, for All Saints' Wake is nigh!♪

The festival known as All Saints' Wake dates back to ancient times. Once a year─as legend has it─the Twelve would show Their favor to the saints by inviting them to a magnificent feast in the celestial realm.
column23: Fearing for their safety in the absence of their guardians, the commonfolk took to adopting the guises of evil spooks and spirits, that they might frighten the terrors of the night away.
column24: Alas, the tradition has fallen out of favor in the years since the Calamity, much to the dismay of professional merrymakers such as myself.

column22: Hey, don't touch! I don't want no adventurer stink on my lovely mucus!
I've had a bellyful of elixirs. Gimme something sweet to eat!
A traveling circus troupe has set up shop in the Aftcastle, peddling seasonal trifles. All Saints' Wake is a fine tradition, but is this truly the time for idle revelry?
I enjoy mirth and merriment as much as anyone, mind you, but these monstrous guises are a most unneeded distraction for those in my profession.

When the sun and her children are tucked away in bed～♪
On All Saints' Wake, spooks and specters will tread～♪
Ah, the comforts of civilization! Where we come from─er, our <Emphasis>troupe</Emphasis>, that is─the environs are rather dark and dank.
My troupe boasts quite the colorful cast, don't you think? Yes, I daresay Eorzea is in for a night of devilish delights.
What YOU looking at!?
The Impresario gave me an elixir for my troubles! What a guy!

Charade or no, all these baleful creatures skulking about town leave me ill at ease. I have my reservations as to encouraging such idle revelry in these times of strife, but it is not my place to question the decisions of our leaders.
Carving lanterns out of pumpkins? I fear the elementals will not look kindly upon this...

Spooks and scares for all in sight～♪
All Saints' Wake is full of devilish delights～♪
Though the tradition has fallen out of favor in recent years, All Saints' Wake was quite the event back in the days before the Calamity.
column23: Perhaps you've heard of the commotion that was caused when a band of most ingenious imps escaped from their gaol, refusing to return unless adventurers solved the riddles they posed.
column24: I was there, and I can assure you that it was a most invigorating─er, exasperating─yes, a most exasperating occurrence!

column22: The last time someone scared me, my one good eyeball almost popped out! Why, oh why did I sign up for this?
I've had my fill of phonies and fakes! Gimme the real thing!
Those traveling performers are peddling pumpkin goods in front of the Quicksand. Just looking at them sends a shiver up my spine.
