All Saints' Wake, eh? Just another sorry excuse for laggards and layabouts to shirk their duties, if you ask me.
The nerve of some petitioners, engaging us as if we were a band of common mercenaries. I should be glad to refuse them all without a second thought.
How she has grown since last we spoke... She puts me to shame with her accomplishments, and for that I am full glad.
Hmmm... I still feel as though it lacks a certain...
column23: Oh, I don't know. Mayhap I simply long for the desert heat and the ocean breeze.

column22: As ravishing as ever. Perhaps, for old times' sake, she would─
column23: Gods, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Don't sneak up on me like that. We bards are an easily startled lot.

column22: As you can see, our Sharlayan allies have furnished us with a wealth of new tomes. 'Twould be prudent for you to broaden your knowledge as well.

So here we are. Completely independent and unquestionably neutral─or at least more so than before. Truth be told, I cannot say it feels <Emphasis>that</Emphasis> different. Of course, Yda begs to differ.
I love the smell of victory in the morning! It smells like sweat─ No, no... Mun–Tuy sauce! Nooo... <Emphasis>Victory</Emphasis>! Yeah, victory!
Is it not wonderful, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Nary a single presumptuous merchant has darkened our door.
column23: I know full well they will come in time, but for now let us enjoy the respite.

column22: Oh? You wish to help? That's very kind of you, but I can manage on my own. Besides, you should be out having grand adventures, not withering away here with me.
I take it you've come to study the tomes as well? It's very, very important to broaden your knowledge, as Y'shtola says.
column23: (Take me with you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, please! I said I wanted to take on greater responsibilities, but I didn't expect her to heap tomes on my desk in response...)

column22: <cough> <wheeze> The horror... The horror...
I did not realize the Scions had moved until I arrived in Vesper Bay. Thankfully, Urianger was kind enough to direct me here.
column23: I know I've only just joined, but if there is anything I can do to help, please let me know.

column22: 'Pologies, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>mate</If>, but we ain't doin' business jus' yet. Still tryin' to strike a deal with the botanists, see.
I would gladly sell you my wares...if I had any to sell. It's taking an <Emphasis>age</Emphasis> to secure a steady supply from those confounded botanists.
Well met, adventurer, and welcome to my humble shop. And I truly mean humble, for I have nothing to sell at present.
Sorry to disappoint, but we're still settin' up shop. Try back again later, would ye?
My apologies for the inconvenience, but we're not in a state to assist you right now. Please come back another time.
I'm terribly sorry, but we're still in the midst of preparations. When we do open for business, however, I hope we can rely upon your patronage.
You haven't seen a pickaxe lying around here, have you? My oaf of a husband was out drinking with his friends, and─
column23: Oh, Thal take that bloody pickaxe. Should've married a merchant...

column22: Sometimes I wish I could strut me stuff alongside the lasses. But then I remember I'm a serious businessman.
The city is verily vibrating with vivacity. Ever was Ul'dah a scene for stimulating the senses.

Khloe Bajhiri, top reporter for <Emphasis>The Raven</Emphasis>, at your service! Or mayhap <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> might be of service to <Emphasis>me</Emphasis>. You haven't overheard any tantalizing rumors on your adventures, perchance?
I'm a blacksmith with Naldiq & Vymelli's, come to assist in the Pharos Sirius restoration effort.
column23: Ever since I was a wee girl, it's been my dream to work with Master Mimidoa, who was mentor to both my father and brother.
column24: My skills may be raw, but I've devoted myself tirelessly to my training. I will not─I <Emphasis>cannot</Emphasis>─let him down!

column22: We of the Brotherhood of Ash seek to hone our martial prowess, and honor the blood of our ancestors. We keep to the old ways, of the desert nomad and of the warrior.
column23: Though we are but few in number, our discipline and courage will see us triumph over the endless depravities of our fanatic kin.

column22: My brothers and I uphold the glory of our past, and forge ourselves in the fires of righteous battle. Do not compare us to the groveling cravens that fill the ranks of Ifrit's worshipers.
The weapons we wield were born of flame, but committing one's life to one's blade is not the same as surrendering one's heart to Ifrit. The fools of Zanr'ak do not understand that simple difference.
You think it strange to find a Miqo'te among our ranks? Loonh Gah has trained with us since she was scarce more than a hatchling, and earned her place with fire and steel!
Business has finally returned to Aleport, but it pains me to say that smugglers have followed the trail of prosperity. The Yellowjackets will not rest until all lawbreakers are taken into custody.
Adventurers from the realm over pass through Revenant's Toll. Not the most hospitable of climes, but there's no better place to find yourself a hired hand or two.
Nothing gives these ones greater joy than playing tricks. One day, this one will play a trick so tricksy that even this one will be fooled. It will be this one's masterwork!
Hmph! Can't those two find an inn or something? If I have to watch them cuddle and coo for even a moment longer, I'm likely to lose my mind!
column23: At least I can comfort myself in knowing that it won't be long before the flames of their precious romance gutter, and their sweet nothings turn to grousings and grumblings, invectives, and the inevitable death threats. Just like...er, a friend of mine.
column24: ...Not a particularly close friend, mind you. More like an acquaintance...of an acquaintance. A stranger, really. I can't even recall the poor girl's name, but she was <Emphasis>far</Emphasis> too good for that muscle-bound goobbue's arse!

column22: Milkroot is tasty, and frees one's mind of care. But one must not partake too much, oh no!
These ones play tricks for fun. Nasty ones play tricks to hurt. Is hurting other ones fun for nasty ones? The thought alone makes this one sad.
Could there be a more fascinating subject of study than the sylphs? Each day is a veritable treasure trove of discovery and delight!
column23: Why, just yesterday I learned that─among their many acts of mischief─the sylphs rather enjoy stealing and concealing tomes and parchment!
column24: Just prior to that, I learned...what was it again? Forgive me, I seem to have, ah, misplaced my journal.

column22: Why the Seventh Heaven, you ask? Because no one would drink in the Seventh Hell!
column23: I also considered naming it Cloud Nine, but that felt a bit effeminate for our clientele.

column22: I believe congratulations are in order, adventurer. Why, rumors that you purged the evil from Amdapor Keep are flying hither and yon. Though I <Emphasis>had</Emphasis> wished to hear the tidings first from Brother Adestan...
column23: When next you meet, pray bid him come and see me. It has been nearly a year since we last broke bread and shared mead.

column22: My friend, I wish that peace would reign forever in Amdapor Keep. But you have cleansed its halls of voidsent twice now─mayhap you will have need to do so again.
Breathe deep the air of this place, adventurer. I am no Hearer, but even I can tell 'tis free of fell presence─all thanks to you!
I reckon it's time I stopped loathin' the tonberries. My best friend's long gone, and blamin' the creatures what killed him don't do an onze of good in bringin' him back.
column23: 'Course, I'll never call them my best mates or nothin'. But it was hatred what made them into monsters. If I live my life bearin' a grudge, what's to stop me from endin' up a monster too?

column22: It does me well to see you, my friend, and none the worse for your recent ordeal. Know that the Admiral unequivocally believes in your innocence─as do we all.
column23: While you are on Lominsan soil, you are under our protection. Nonetheless, I urge you to remain on constant guard wherever you go. There is no telling where agents of Ul'dah may be lurking.

column22: If I may say so, you are looking rather careworn, my friend. Capable as you are, I do not doubt that endless demands are being made of you.
column23: However, there is only so much responsibility one <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> can bear, and you must take care not to overtax yourself. I hope that old Riol isn't adding to your burdens...

column22: This ferry is bound for the Lavender Beds. Will you be traveling with us?
This ferry can either take you to another ward, or back to the Central Shroud. Are you coming aboard?

Traveling to distant lands, uncovering the secrets of long-lost civilizations... Such things have their appeal, but there's nothing quite like the visceral pleasure of trouncing your fellow man in the Pit.
column23: It's that feeling of exhilaration that brings us all here─your good self included, I do not doubt.

column22: Here to scout out potential opponents, I'd wager? Well, you're wasting your time─there's no way of knowing who you're going to face in the Pit until you actually face them.
column23: If you are serious about winning, you must learn to adapt to whatever is thrown at you. Either hit the ground running, or simply hit the ground.

column22: Ah, yet another ravenous wolf finds <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> way to the Den. If you would sate your hunger, then report to Captain Loetahlsyn within the ship yonder.
Boatloads of supplies and provisions are delivered daily, and it takes the better part of my shift to sort through them all.
column23: It's no small coup, keeping this place running smoothly, but we give it our best, that you adventurers might concentrate on beating each other senseless.

column22: Where travelers gather to slake their thirst, rumors flow as freely as the ale. Some will lead to riches and glory, while others are worth as much as a drunkard's piss. The astute adventurer can tell which is which.
The Seedseers conjecture that Nophica the Matron will be the new god ascendant. Would that it signifies a time of peace and prosperity...
Chocobo...chocobo...chocobo... Nothing but horsebirds in this stable. A sight to disturb Eastern eyes, to be sure.

I come from the east of the East, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>m'lady<Else/>m'lord</If>. For us, Heavensturn is an affirmation of earthly pleasures. I came of age in the year of the dragon and...well! Still, I have great hopes for the year of the horse.
Owww, my back. “Our legs we must be using,” he says. Like I need any lessons in lifting from some holier–than–thou northeasterner!
Kwehhh!
K–Kweh!
Kweh, kweh, kweh!
Sure, there's more chocobos around than usual. It's Heavensturn, or heaven't you noticed with that thing on your head? We've got to preen all the birds, get them looking their best.
column23: Mind you stay downwind, eh? Chocobo dander can be a mite ripe.

column22: You see this place, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>girl<Else/>boy</If>? It's not Coerthas, but we're growing carrots, and growing them big an' sweet!
Technology should never be allowed to imprison people. That's a hard lesson I learned from watching Gaius...and my father.
column23: If the secrets of the Crystal Tower are as dangerous as we expect, then I mean to keep them under lock and key. The terrible mistakes of history need not be repeated.

column22: The Allagan civilization thrived within the borders of a vast empire, producing marvels the likes of which this world has never seen again.
column23: It's said that its technology was so advanced, the magitek of Garlemald appears crude and childlike in comparison. When I first laid eyes on the Crystal Tower, I finally realized the truth of that claim...

column22: You just leave the business of sorting out the aftermath to us! Focus on clearing out the nasties, and we'll move in to survey what's left!
I have studied the legacy of the Allagan Empire for long years. Now that this expedition is at last underway, the very core of my historical infatuation lies within my grasp.
column23: It falls to us─to the fellowship of NOAH─to crack open the tomb of a fallen civilization, and bring the wealth of its history out of the shadows and into the light!

column22: I, Lisette de Valentione, have traveled to this realm to spread the joy of true love to one and all.
column23: For a land bereft of love is colder than the frozen plains of Coerthas. Tell me, friend...who shall warm your heart this night?

column22: Hail, adventurer! What say you set aside your mundane questings for the day and serve House Valentione in a far nobler crusade─the quest to spread ardor and affection across a lovelorn realm?
column23: Or perhaps you have already earned sweet tokens of affection from an admirer or two? Deliver it to a House Valentione butler or maid, and you shall be rewarded in kind.

column22: We deal in objects both rare and peculiar. If you find such oddities in your travels, then bring them to me and we'll talk business. Well, the business is, in fact, run by Rowena, and I merely stock the shelves. But one day, all that will change...
You wish to trade? Show your loyalty to the Brotherhood, and through deeds of courage and glory will you earn the right to browse my wares.

...Thus reunited with his father's sword, Eleazar ventured forth in search of adventure. Out of concern for his well-being (or perhaps due to their own desire for adventure), Inspector Hildibrand and his assistant chose to accompany the elderly gentleman on his journey.
column23: What wondrous experiences await them? Will Eleazar return home safely? Will the imbecile be devoured by a goobbue? Only time will tell.

column22: Walking one wants to buy this one's things? This one does not sell to just any one. Do something good for these ones, and this one will think about it.
Steel ones come to the forest, cause much trouble to these ones. This one understands well the touched ones' fears...
column23: Yet in trying to protect the forest, touched ones do more harm than any steel one. This one cannot forgive touched ones for this...

column22: Good day to you, friend. I trust the Little Ladies' Day festivities prove to your liking?
column23: We have spared no expense for this year's celebration, that the maidens of Eorzea may experience the pampered life of a princess for the day.
column24: I suspect you too wish to lavish gifts upon some fair lady, yes? Then I suggest you seek an audience with the Little Lady who stands before you here. Her wares are as sure to win your heart as her winsome smile.

column22: Good day to you, friend. I trust the Little Ladies' Day festivities prove to your liking?
column23: We have spared no expense for this year's celebration, that the maidens of Eorzea may experience the pampered life of a princess for the day.
column24: I suspect you too wish to lavish gifts upon some fair lady, yes? Then I suggest you seek an audience with the Little Lady who stands before you here. Her wares are as sure to win your heart as her winsome smile.

column22: Good day to you, friend. I trust the Little Ladies' Day festivities prove to your liking?
column23: We have spared no expense for this year's celebration, that the maidens of Eorzea may experience the pampered life of a princess for the day.
column24: I suspect you too wish to lavish gifts upon some fair lady, yes? Then I suggest you seek an audience with the Little Lady who stands before you here. Her wares are as sure to win your heart as her winsome smile.

column22: No matter where I look, all I see is stone. I fear the grains we brought with us will not grow here...
I was not expecting you to return so quickly, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Have Thancred and Y'shtola already identified the culprits? No? Oh.
To spend moons at sea, to travel such a distance... I cannot fathom how the Domans survived.
Did they really sail that half-rotted ship all the way from Othard? Isn't that dangerous? What if it had sprung a leak?
Eorzea may be a land of many cultures and creeds, but I nevertheless suspect that the Domans will struggle to adapt.
I wonder what herbs and spices they use in Doma. Maybe there's something I could add to my special tonic...
So many youths these days fail to understand that it is incumbent on everyone to help those in need. That's why it's so wonderful when young men like Hoary Boulder rise to the occasion.
<huff> <puff> This little thing? It's nothing compared to what─nnngh─to what the Domans have endured!
As is the case with other distant lands, I have heard rumors of mysterious magicks and martial arts. I dare not lend credence to these tales, but I cannot help but hope that some are true.
Alphinaud was right. These are grave tidings indeed.
Her soft features belie a strong will and quick wit. Aye, this Doman maiden would be─
column23: ...<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I think we may need to have a chat about your habit of sneaking up on people.

column22: I-I was merely resting my eyes as I...as I contemplated the plight of the Domans!
Hmmm... Many of these adventurers are skilled artisans as well. Mayhap it would be more efficient to contract their services.
I know what you're about to ask, and my answer is final! We can spare naught else. Inspect the manifests yourself if you yet harbor doubts.
You haven't come across a crate from Wineport, have you? No? Well, let me know if you do.
The more people we take in, the more problems we'll see.
There is much I would know of these Domans, but how best to broach the subject? Busy as they are, I doubt they are willing to indulge my curiosity...
I am amazed that none here knew of the war of succession until we arrived. Have you truly heard naught of what has transpired?
Mayhap I worry overmuch. With so many able-bodied adventurers about, what beasts could pose a threat?
I dared not give myself to hope in full, but for the first time in many moons, I am willing to do so.
The Garlean Empire is but one of many threats to Eorzea. With the imperial court divided by internal strife, however, we may turn our attention towards other matters of concern.
Y'shtola has been rather long away on her investigation. Barring any unexpected delays, I daresay she will report back any moment now.
The population of Revenant's Toll has fairly doubled overnight! At this rate, it'll grow into an honest–to–gods city before we know it!
While I am not averse to expanding our membership, the fact is it renders us more vulnerable to infiltration. We must needs tighten our vigil.
The Adventurers' Guild will oversee the delegation of tasks to our Doman friends. I shall request that this information be shared with the Scions.
I should scarce be surprised that Eorzea has myriad problems of its own to overcome. Nonetheless, it is heartening to know that the realm lies not beneath the Empire's shadow.
The people of Eorzea hold independence sacred, and will fight to the last to preserve it. To we who have suffered under imperial oppression, this land is a bastion of hope.
I am thankful that we have found a place of respite. Yet knowing Lady Yugiri, she is doubtless already making provisions for our next move.
This Leviathan business has everyone all wound up, but I say it's times like this that we need to get <Emphasis>un</Emphasis>wound.
If you are to hold the fort during missions, you must be no less than fully prepared. See that you dedicate every spare moment to your training.
Even though Thancred will be watching out for her, I cannot help but fear for Lady Minfilia...
As her mother, I am ever concerned for Minfilia's safety, but she is her own woman now. If she would venture into the midst of danger, I will not bar her way.
<pant> Must impress...Lady Yda! Yaaarrrgh!
<pant> <pant> Pain is but weakness leaving the body...
I can scarce believe that the Isle of Val is gone. I fear the worst for the Students of Baldesion.
Some fifteen years ago, a mission─hic─took me to Ul'dah. 'Twas then that I first chanced to gaze upon your beauty.
column23: I was utterly transfixed. I dared not blink, lest I─hic─deprive myself of even a split second of your radiance.

column22: Don't mind Papalymo─he's making a fuss over nothing as usual.
column23: Yozan's sense of balance is <Emphasis>amazing</Emphasis> for a boy his age. I wonder how he got so good.

column22: What in the seven hells are you doing up there? Get down here before you fall and break your neck!
History is our friend, young one. The answers to the problems of the present are oft to be found within the past. We need but seek them out.
On behalf of the Scions, I bid you welcome to the Rising Stones! With your cooperation, we hope to grow rich and transform this place into the Piling Gold! Tee hee!
column23: Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Forgive me, but I must see to the Domans' needs.

column22: You do flatter me, dear. And I do believe you have had a bit too much to drink.
Some of the Domans wanted to learn how to fight, and it's fallen to me to oversee their training. First, I need to find suitable equipment for everyone...
An adventurer bends not to authority, but lives and acts according to his own beliefs. He is the master of his own destiny.
The Rising Stones... What a peculiar name for a sanctuary...
In my native land, there exist individuals not unlike these “adventurers.” Yet without a master to serve, how does one know the path that one must walk?
I have been tasked with helping out in the kitchen. Once I have grown accustomed to my duties, I hope to treat our hosts to traditional Doman cuisine.
You think this is impressive? In Doma, we train to run in the treetops!
What if you wanted to solve a problem that's already happened? Like the Garleans destroying Doma?
Curious about our investigation's progress, are you? I'm afraid I have naught to share.
column23: Y'shtola and I have our suspicions, of course, but we think it best to confirm them before delivering our report.

column22: You needn't concern yourself with affairs here, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I am more than capable of overseeing preparations for the remaining caravans.
column23: Should other Doman vessels arrive, I will inform the Antecedent at once.

column22: The area has been altered beyond recognition. 'Tis sad indeed when the places of your past may only be visited in memory.
Of late, this area has played host to many a bloody skirmish between Lominsan and Sahagin forces.
A soldier of the Maelstrom has kindly furnished me with information on the enemy. Armed with this knowledge, I promise you that my presence will count for something.
This land seems peaceful; its inhabitants kind. Mayhap they will accept us once we prove ourselves capable.
column23: But how long will it take for our weakest to regain the strength to stand, much less to till the soil?

column22: Ugh. I can smell their stench on the wind even here.
Everything's so different! The buildings, the people─ Even the <Emphasis>smells</Emphasis> are different!
Ahhh, it's been too long─too godsdamned long since I've traveled 'cross Eorzea! I can't wait to take to the road again!
Though we cannot command the sea itself, it is the Maelstrom's charge to ensure safe passage for all who sail upon it. Come hells and high water, we will perform our duty!
Even with the diversions, the path to the aetheryte is bound to be fraught with danger. Pray be on constant guard, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
Once everything has been set in motion, I, too, shall make my way to the aetheryte. As previously agreed, Lady Minfilia will be with me.
The summoning ritual is taking place at the beastman aetheryte deep within. Thither we must go.
column23: Obstructing our way is a multitude of checkpoints. It would be well advised to dispatch as many enemies as possible along the way, that we might avoid later interference.
column24: Let us take separate routes and merge before the aetheryte, the better to confuse the enemy sentinels.

column22: Jijiroon out dealing with dealers every day. Jijiroon talking talk with Memeroon every day, too, and smiling smiles just like old times!
Had only we arrived but a moment earlier... But there is no time to brood over what might have been. Leviathan is returned, and we must needs find a way to deal with him.
Though the mission ended in failure, I take solace in the knowledge that Minfilia is unharmed.
If we meet Leviathan on the open sea, we put ourselves at the primal's mercy. We must think of a way to face him on equal terms.
The gods of this realm are vengeful beings.
column23: 'Tis of little wonder the Garleans fear their kind so.

column22: I am always glad to see the professor, but preparing something to present at his symposiums takes time.
column23: Oh well, no rest for the greatest of the greatest.

column22: Hm? An <Emphasis>honorary</Emphasis> pupil, you say? I don't remember having any of those.
column23: Ahaha, I jest, I jest! Who could forget you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? In fact, I have a lesson just for you on my latest theory─ What? Oh, well, if you're busy, I suppose it can wait.

column22: Based upon the professor's laws of aspect conversion, deducing the boundary conditions for aspect-change within corrupted crystals is but a matter of finding the coefficients─
column23: Oh! I beg your pardon, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>─I did not mean to ignore you. Devising this theorem requires all my concentration─and even then, I worry about completing it in time for the next symposium...

column22: <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>Good evening<Else/>Good morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>Good day to you<Else/>Good evening</If></If>, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. How fare you in the egg hunt? I can only imagine how many eggs you've collected thus far.
column23: There is much and more to celebrate this Hatching-tide, and I pray you have found respite enough to enjoy the festivities to their fullest. You have more than earned it for the deeds you have done.

column22: Hello there, friend. You look like you could use a distraction; something to take your mind off the perils of day-to-day adventuring.
column23: Perhaps you would be interested in trying your hand at this year's Hatching-tide egg hunt? The rewards are quite splendid, and in abundance.

column22: <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))> Good evening<Else/>Good morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>Good day to you<Else/> Good evening</If></If>, friend. I say, have you tried your hand at this year's Hatching-tide egg hunt?
column23: The prizes to be won are generous, to say the least, and I guarantee you will not regret participating. Would that I had time to partake of the revelry myself.

column22: The Wells are a blessing from Nophica Herself. So show some respect and dispose of your refuse elsewhere.
Lady Durilda is taking the loss of the Treaty-Blade rather well, wouldn't you say? One moment she's utterly inconsolable, the next she's laughing like a child!
column23: The thief is still out there, too─plotting his next crime, mocking the authorities all the while...
column24: Frankly, I couldn't have asked for a better story! Here's hoping that the next chapter is just as entertaining, if not more so.

column22: Gimme an elixir!
This ferry is bound for the Lavender Beds. Will you be traveling with us?
This ferry can either take you to another ward, or to Gridania. Are you coming aboard?
This ferry is bound for Mist. Will you be traveling with us?
This ferry can either take you to another ward, or to Limsa Lominsa. Are you coming aboard?
Do you seek passage to the Goblet? If so, I will show you the way.
Do you seek passage to another ward, or to Ul'dah? If so, I will show you the way.
My apologies for the inconvenience, but this ferry is presently out of service.
My apologies for the inconvenience, but this ferry is presently out of service.
My apologies for the inconvenience, but this ferry is presently out of service.
My apologies for the inconvenience, but this ferry is presently out of service.
My apologies for the inconvenience, but I cannot assist you at present.
My apologies for the inconvenience, but I cannot assist you at present.
We're always on the lookout for new talent, what with the old talent getting mauled and killed. Proper training at a place such as this, now, that helps.
Two chum pails full already! How much more do you have in there?
The fish aren't biting in these parts, least not like they used to. World changes on you, you've got to change with it.
You should never stray too far from your roots, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>sister<Else/>brother</If> adventurer, no matter how far you rise! Remember: no one can spell “success” without “U”!
Got any grub─feed, fare, grub? Thinking up good excuses to shirk my duties is hard work, yes, and hard work makes Bo Zu a hungry kobold.
The 789th is known for sloth and sluggardy, yes. But Bo Gu is different─unique, distinctive, different.
column23: The others are incapable of work. Bo Gu could work, but chooses not to. See? Not the same. No, no, not at all.

column22: Lazy? I resent that remark─object, reject, resent.
column23: Bo Bu simply believes that the measure of a kobold is not the number of shiny rocks in his pocket, but in his courage. Yes, courage and conviction!
column24: Y-You don't think Zo Ga heard me just now, do you? No, no? Phew...

column22: An overdweller? My boss Zo Ga doesn't take kindly to strangers sneaking around his personal property, nuh-uh, nuh-uh.
column23: Yunz'll want to leave quickly, before we have an accident─a mishap, a misfortune, an <Emphasis>accident</Emphasis>, that sort of thing.

column22: The 789th might not look like much, but we still manage to <Emphasis>acquire</Emphasis> some enticing trinkets from time to time.
column23: We could sell them to you─yes, yes, we could─but what have you done for us? Hmm?

column22: This is Maelstrom Command. If you're expectin' an 'and-held tour of the facilities, ye'd best look elsewhere.

Pshhh... Though my ssscales have yet to harden, the clutchfather has entrusssted me with sssafeguarding the nursssery from intruders. Would that I could protect my ssspawnbrothers from their own foolishness.
When you shhhorewalkers shhhink under the water, you die if you breathe in the shhhea. Shhheems very...inconvenient.
column23: No fins, no shhhcales, and your bodies are covered in hair. I do not undershhhtand how you manage to shhhwim at all. Pshhh...

column22: Pshhh... Clutchfather Novv is both shhhtrong and wise. Under his firm counshhhel, my clutchmates and I will become lords of the shhhea!
What do you ssseek, finless one? I have wonders gathered from the far reaches of the world's oceans. With the clutchfather's permission, they are yours...for a price.
Clutchfather Novv named me ssseabeast tamer, and massster of the elbssst.
column23: The creatures I raise fear neither ssstorm nor maelssstrom. And I ssspeak not of your finless sssoldiers.

column22: Hunger's not the best sauce, by the onion, but hard work! And none work harder than adventurers, I say.
An adventurer is no mere swinger of swords. We are rolling stones, to be sure, and our destiny is to be worn smooth and even─skilled in crafting and gathering, as well as fighting.
Beyond this great portal is a ruined city of white mages. Greatly did it prosper in the Fifth Astral Era, before it met its doom. And now, the Calamity has sapped its earth aspect.
column23: A place of madness and horror, choked by poisonous spores and haunted by demons─none shall cross this threshold!
column24: ...Unless, of course, they have the proper paperwork.

column22: Dig, dig, and dig we do, but for nothing. No, to no avail.
column23: So these days, we do less digging and more sleeping. Suits me just fine. Yes, yes it does.

column22: Pshhh... I am Novv, clutchfather of this nursssery─all the ssspawnlings you sssee here are my children. Other Sssahagin may desire war with the finless ones, but I wishhh only to raise my clutch in peace.
I've only recently joined the Maelstrom, but <Emphasis>already</Emphasis> I'm stationed within a stone's throw of an imperial castrum. I believe this is called “drawing the short straw”...
Aye, it's 'igh time someone taught these scurvy milksops to stand up for themselves, and that someone might as well be me!
I'm a personal assistant of Master Wiscard hisself. Don't know the big man? Then, all the 'stounding wares I have─you don't know these either. Farewell!
You know Master Wiscard? Why didn't you say so! What can I get you?
Don't know ye, don't care to. Best be on yer way, 'fore me hammer finds yer backside.
Hm, Guiding Star thinks yer good enough? I hope he's right, or we're all goin' to be sorry...
Do ye know how many would-be marauders we've had knockin' on our door since ye felled that big, blasted aurochs? Seems all manner o' folk're lookin' to protect their loved ones by takin' up the axe.

I'm proud to have had a part in yer trainin', <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Ye've become one damn fine marauder, an' the example I point to when one o' me novices ain't swingin' as hard as <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If> should!
Ah, the <Emphasis>honorary</Emphasis> student. Have you any new findings?
column23: None at all, eh? Well, never fear─my thesis will make up for your lack of progress, and prove I am the greatest of the professor's students!

column22: The irrepressible <Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>! Come to spar with the new recruits? By all means, grant them the boon of your wisdom!
column23: Do be sure to pay your respects to the First Sword before leaving as well.

column22: In case you weren't aware, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, you have become something of a legend among our members.
column23: Oh, but it's true─your guildmates all speak of you in reverent tones. Your mere presence here serves to stoke their fighting spirit.

column22: Ah, always a pleasure, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Your deeds of late have brought much honor and recognition to the guild. We can all learn from your example. Aye, especially a certain <Emphasis>individual in a position of authority</Emphasis> who shall remain unnamed.
Hello there, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I trust you've been keeping up your training? Whenever you need a sparring partner, you need but ask!
Welcome home, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. We missed you in your absence.
column23: Mayhap you could favor us with a tale or two of your latest adventures? It would do much to motivate the young ones, I should think.

column22: Just once I'd like to pass a day without being lectured on my form...
column23: But like it or not, I'm stuck with that bloody Wildwood. You can pick your friends, but not your family, you know?

column22: I pray you do not take excessive pride in your achievements. Accomplished though you may be, your archery is far from perfect.
column23: Alas, Leih's training demands my undivided attention. You will have to wait your turn, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.

column22: You've built quite a reputation, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Our initiates whisper your name in awe and reverence, as befits your status as an avatar of devastation. Of course, <Emphasis>I</Emphasis> always knew that the fates had chosen you for greatness.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! How fare you in your feats of fiery fulmination?

Hm? Judge me by my stature, do you? You'll not be so dismissive once I bind your feet in ice and scorch off your eyebrows with─ Oh, it's you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Fine day for a spot of thaumaturgy, is it not?

Aha! I saw you coming this time! Thanks to you and your bold style of magery, I've learned to become more aware of my surroundings. Why, these days I'm rarely ever startled enough to accidentally incinerate aspiring initiates!
Your powers have grown considerably, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. But should your arcane conflagrations ever fail you, remember my last line of defense: unabashed sobbing.

Stillglade Fane welcomes your return, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. There are many initiates among our ranks who strive to emulate the harmonious balance you have achieved with both nature and the elementals.
Pray close your eyes and quiet your mind. You have saved Sylphie from her path of self-destruction, and the elementals would tell you of their joy.

Greetings, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I was pleased to hear that Sylphie has embraced the bounty of nature, and now grows daily in her mastery of conjury. The guildmaster tells me that her transformation is due in no small part to your gentle influence.

'Tis rare that an arcanist of your caliber has time to exchange greetings with the guild receptionist. You have become a personage of some note amongst the assessors of Mealvaan's Gate, especially since your victory over that blackguard, Doesmaga.
Not moments after your showing at the exhibition, our doors were nearly knocked off their hinges by a veritable horde of would-be leatherworkers.
column23: ...That was on the way in, mind you. The doors actually <Emphasis>did</Emphasis> come down when the same lot dashed out in tears after their first session with Guildmaster Geva. Never have I felt so fortunate that the Carpenters' Guild, too, calls Gridania home.

column22: Well, if it isn't the <Emphasis>second</Emphasis> finest carpenter in Gridania! Have you come to speak with Timbermaster Beatin? If so, you will find him inside at his usual post.

It is an honor and a pleasure, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>. It should come as no surprise that the guildmaster is terribly busy; nevertheless, I have no doubt that he would be glad to receive you.

I am glad that Guildmaster Severian has finally put to rest that desperate search of his. ...Not that I ever knew exactly what it was he sought. In any case, he appears to have found a measure of peace.
column23: Ah, I do not mean to imply the guildmaster has suddenly become tranquil in any way─he is not noticeably less...er, energetic in his pursuits or wildly unpredictable in his acceptance of guild commissions.
column24: But now when he drowses at his work table, his expression is one of contentment rather than troubled frustration. And I believe we have you to thank for that.

column22: The moment I laid eyes on that “Sultansworn,” I <Emphasis>knew</Emphasis> he couldn't be trusted. I saw how his gaze lingered on our wares─and on Mistress Serendipity.
column23: You did us a great service, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>. I cannot thank you enough.

column22: As the face of the Bismarck, the pressure for you to consistently produce perfection is doubtless great.
column23: But if there ever was a <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> who could handle that pressure in <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> stride, it is you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.

column22: I may not have half your talent, but I certainly don't lack for ambition, nor do I fear hard work.
column23: Mark my words, I won't rest until I surpass you and Master Lyngsath both.

column22: The marriage of taste and nourishment has ever posed a challenge to us culinarians. Indeed, foods that are good for the body don't necessarily satisfy the palate.
column23: But with knowledge, we can overcome an ingredient's shortcomings, as you've demonstrated to me on multiple occasions. Your successes have fairly inspired me to explore other possibilities.
column24: ...Mind you, this doesn't mean that I've stopped being cross with Master Lyngsath and his little schemes to make me healthy.

column22: Ever since the royal visit, we've had a nigh-endless stream of customers who specifically request that <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> prepare their dishes. I've fairly lost count of the times I've had to disappoint them.
column23: Perhaps you would consider permanent employment at the Bismarck?

column22: Hold yer head up high, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Thanks to yer efforts, guild steel's gettin' shipped far an' wide!
column23: Some of the less dedicated smitties're complainin' 'bout the long hours, but sod their lazy arses. Better busy than broke!

column22: Should you so desire, I've no doubt you could attain a position of authority within Naldiq & Vymelli's. The smithing skill and business acumen you've demonstrated far exceeds that of certain individuals, to say the least.
column23: You would do well to remember that adventuring is a trade for the young─and no one is young forever.

column22: My thoughts turn to you often, blacksmith─you and your weapons.
column23: They have served me well. <Emphasis>You</Emphasis> have served me well. I shall have to repay the favor in kind someday.

column22: Your contest with Blanstyr must've fired the imaginations of every lad and lass that ever dreamed o' holdin' a hammer.
column23: We've been receivin' more applicants than I know what to do with...but thankfully the forgemaster has the steel to turn away them as can't handle the heat o' the forge.

column22: Why're ye wastin' words on the poor sod ye bested? Ye know yer path, an' there ain't naught to stop ye from walkin' it.
Forgemaster H'naanza was my inspiration for joining the guild, and I believe I've made some small progress in attaining her skill with hammer and pliers.
column23: But when I see how swiftly you've learned─and mastered─the techniques of armorcraft, my accomplishments seem paltry indeed by comparison. I know not what more of my spirit I can surrender to this art...

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! How fare your efforts at the forge? I trust your growing fame hasn't convinced you to neglect your skills?
column23: We all need the abundant inspiration your impeccable armorcraft provides! Speaking of which, I must needs return to my latest creation─just as soon as I find my pliers...

column22: I've been rather more careful with the size of the commissions I accept these days. The forgemaster has been forgiving of my past mistakes, but I cannot remain a coddled novice forever.
Ever since Guildmaster Fufucha returned to the Growery, we've all observed a certain spring in her step.
column23: Has she found a new love, or merely rekindled an old one? This I cannot say, but we are all heartened to see her well.

column22: The nerve of some outsiders, waltzing into Gridania as if they were the elementals' gift to the Twelveswood... I'll wager most of them don't even know what a hoe is!
column23: ...But not you, my friend, oh no. As you have proven to us all, <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> are a <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> who knows <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> hoes.

column22: Mind the flowerpots! You break it, you bought it!
column23: ...And yes, that goes for you as well! If you think being Fufucha's favorite will earn you special treatment, you are gravely mistaken.

column22: If I have served in my own humble way to restore Fufucha's faith in her profession, it is the very least I could have done after all that she has imparted to me.
column23: Verily, there is much I would still learn from my mentor. I can but hope she will grace these bleak highlands with her presence once more.

column22: When I was first made the guild's registrar, I was grateful for the chance to be out of the scorching sun and the choking dust.
column23: But your adventures have gotten me itching to get my hands dirty again. The only problem is, I haven't done any digging for so long, I'm not sure I can even <Emphasis>lift</Emphasis> a sledgehammer anymore...

column22: You may have double mooched a Mazlaya marlin, but don't dismiss the remaining denizens of the deep!
column23: If you truly fancy yourself a formidable fisher, you'd best set about bringing in the biggest fish you can bag!

column22: You needn't nab the Nepto Dragon next, you know. Plenty of phenomenal prizes have yet to be plucked from Eorzea's waters.
column23: Therein lies another lesson for both love and our labor: let not the pursuit of perfection blind you to the next best thing!

column22: Well, well! Catching a Mazlaya marlin is no mean feat! Even the guildmaster would be hard-pressed to reel in such a beast.
column23: I wonder─ Did he see your prodigious potential from the start, or did he endorse your enrollment on a lark?

column22: Chuchuroon want to taste fish fished by <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> again! The smelly smell, the tasty taste!
column23: Chuchuroon try to fish fish for Chuchuroon with fake fish food, but fish no fool. No hope for hopeless Chuchuroon...

column22: Raya–O might be more affable than her brother, but she's not one to spout words of idle flattery.
column23: ...This I speak from experience. Yes, you've proven yourself a worthy white mage indeed, kupo!

column22: Why, I'd give my pom and tail to stand before the illustrious A–Towa–Cant!
column23: And yet now I stand before you─which as I've heard from Raya–O is the next best thing, kupo!

column22: On most days, the sylphs are a harmless enough bunch, but with the state of the realm of late, one can never exercise too much caution.
column23: I hear that denizens of Little Solace have taken a liking to you. Any further news you could glean from your fluttery friends would be most appreciated.

column22: Well, if it isn't <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If></If>, slayer of  “Great” King Moggle Mog XII─may he... <cough> Ahem.
column23: On behalf of our entire nation, I thank you for your heroic efforts. <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))>Gridania is indebted to you for your aid.<Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))>You are a model to your fellow Serpents.<Else/>Gridania is indebted to you for your aid.</If></If>

column22: Oft have we resorted to force to resolve our disputes with the beastmen, but not without heavy hearts. Voyce's exploits in Little Solace─in which you played an ample role, or so I hear─are welcome proof that peace is yet within our reach.
column23: For returning a measure of quietude to the Twelveswood, the elementals surely smile upon us. You have my thanks, <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If></If>.

column22: The list of victims falling prey to Amalj'aa thrall-takers grows longer by the day. Our forces in southern Thanalan are stretched thin, and your help is sorely needed.

<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/></If></If>, I must thank you once again for avenging my fallen scouts.
column23: Ifrit has ever been an untamable force of destruction, and I feared that the primal's latest incarnation was an inferno beyond anyone's ability to quench. Ul'dah is in your debt.

column22: Your actions in southern Thanalan have done much to restore peace to the region.
column23: Though I would be foolish to think the Amalj'aa cowed for good, this respite gives us the chance to recoup our strength. I will be sure to call upon you again should the need arise.

column22: If we cannot ensure the safety of merchants at sea, then trade in Limsa Lominsa will grind to a halt. We must bolster our forces in western La Noscea, and take the fight to the fishbacks. Can I count on your cooperation?

<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/><Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If></If>! I have heard word of your victory over that calamitous sea snake!
column23: Truly, the power manifested by Leviathan was unheard of. Had you failed, Limsa Lominsa─nay, all of La Noscea─would now be drowning under a hundred yalms of water. <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))>You are the pride of the Maelstrom<Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))>You are a true hero<Else/>You are a true hero</If></If>!

column22: As long as the Sahagin threaten Limsa Lominsa, the Maelstrom stands ready to throw them back into the sea.
column23: But your successes at Halfstone have proven that not all battles need be fought with a blade. Mayhap there is hope that a peaceful resolution to this conflict can be found.

column22: So we've rodents to thank for our stray shipment of saltpeter─and a real piss-poor pack of them, at that?
column23: I almost pity the furry buggers when I think of what awaits them at Skaetswys's 'ands. She's not one to suffer fools lightly...

column22: Ah, <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/><Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If></If>. Ye've done the Maelstrom proud.
column23: Peace with the kobolds won't come easily, but yer efforts have given us something to build on.
column24: That said, could ye not have befriended a more inspirin' lot?

column22: Your valorous deeds are well known among our soldiers, my friend. Indeed, so many of our recruits are striving to become the next <Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, 'tis all I can do to tell them not to overreach.
The boy gave ye no choice, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Ye just did what ye had to do. Ain't a Wailer here who'd say otherwise.
I'm sorry I involved you in my affairs, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. If I hadn't, perhaps Ailbert would not have... <sigh>

Have I mentioned that Leia's egg has hatched? We have yet to settle on a name, but the chick is healthy, spirited, and incurably inquisitive. She will receive the finest care, and shall one day grow into an exceptional chocobo.

Oh, aren't you the adventurer who was Emissary at Greenbliss? To be chosen for the role is a great honor, and doubly so if you're not forestborn. The Elder Seedseer doubtless sees great things in you.
How goes it, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Keeping your equipment in good condition? One should never forget the fundamentals!
You've taken a liking to our lovely little hamlet, haven't you? Or mayhap to the lovely little Kikipu?
column23: Oh, don't give me that look! A lady must indulge in pretension from time to time!

column22: I know full well that Baldewyn's arrest was but the first step towards regaining the public trust. As acting captain, I will continue to do my utmost to repair the Brass Blades' reputation!
During the course of my official tenure as a Sultansworn, I traveled the length and breadth of Eorzea. Those experiences molded me into the man I am today.
column23: You have been blessed with the skills and opportunities to do the same, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I pray you do not squander them.

column22: I would thank you again for rescuing the <Emphasis>Victory</Emphasis> from an explosive end, but mere words could never fully express my gratitude.
column23: The pirates' attempt at sabotaging the hope of Limsa Lominsa may have failed, but they <Emphasis>did</Emphasis> succeed in exposing the chinks in the armor of our vigilance. If we are to prevent any such incident from happening again, we cannot allow our lack of resources to serve as an excuse for negligence.

column22: I expect great things from you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. After all, 'twould be remiss of me as commodore to heap praise upon an adventurer who did naught but rest on <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> laurels!
column23: And I am certain there are many others within La Noscea who share my confidence in your continued success.

column22: With the false priest apprehended, the people of Camp Drybone may go about their lives with easier hearts. You have my gratitude, friend.
This one has not met such a kind walking one in many moons. Walking one will return, yes? Return, and make merry with these ones!
Noraxia is no longer with these ones, but this one does not weep. Noraxia has returned to the forest whence all ones are born.
column23: For every end, there is a beginning, and the cycle begins anew. Walking one will forever have this one's gratitude for bringing Noraxia home.

column22: Walking one has proven a true friend to these ones. From the first time walking one arrived in Little Solace, this one believed this day would come.
column23: Listen to the murmurs of the forest, walking one. Noraxia, too, is proud to call walking one friend.

column22: Friendly one walks like walking one, but friendly one's heart is one with these ones. Friendly one will forever have a home in Little Solace.
column23: Chosen One, Noraxia, this one─all ones watch over friendly one, that peace and happiness will follow wherever friendly one goes.

column22: Always a pleasure, my friend. No doubt you're weary from the road. Sit yourself down wherever you like.
column23: The Qiqirn firewater still wants for aging, but we've got no shortage of other quality brews.

column22: Seems you've been keeping busy of late, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. What's all this talk I hear about you becoming some great hero, eh?
column23: Well, whenever the weight of fame gets too heavy, you just bend your course hither. Whatever you might be outside, at the Druthers you're free to be just another soul seeking a moment of respite.

column22: Well, if it isn't <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I hear tell that you and the Scions've relocated to Mor Dhona.
column23: It's a long way from here, to be sure. Which gladdens me all the more that you've made time to pay old Buscarron visit.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, what a pleasant surprise! I heard they opened up a tavern at Revenant's Toll, and I was afraid you wouldn't come here any more.
column23: But of course, I needn't have worried. It ain't only the grog what brings people to the Druthers, but the camaraderie. And <Emphasis>that</Emphasis> is something we've got in abundance.

column22: Our brother Gallien yet lives thanks to you. As unwanted refugees in this land, we have little and less to offer by way of gratitude, but one day, I swear to repay your kindness thrice over.
How fare your travels, adventurer? Though it barely begins to repay the debt you are owed, you will always find a safe haven here.
column23: And you need not be concerned with young Wilred. The pain and regret he feels is a common burden amongst Ala Mhigans, and one we willingly bear─it reminds us to always strive for a better life.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I hear word that you've been seen in the company of Amalj'aa. And yet your actions against their kinsmen are not those of a tempered thrall.
column23: I know not what bonds you have forged, but I have seen how barriers of race and position mean little to one such as you. After all, you did not let our cold Ala Mhigan walls prevent you from saving us from our own folly.

column22: Seems to me the Amalj'aa have been unusually quiet of late. I wonder who we have to thank for that small miracle, hmmm?
column23: Though the effects of your actions may not be immediately apparent, rest assured that they are felt─and appreciated─long after you have moved on.

column22:
They call me a workin' man, I reckon that's what I am.♪
I work with me head, so others get tired instead.♪
At least until the word spreads.♪

They call me a workin' man, I reckon that's what I am.♪
Drinkin' under the chief's nose, sneakin' out the back door.♪
Aaand nobody'll ever know.♪
If I weren't bound by me duties here, I'd be out there crackin' imperial skulls right about now. Ah, the price of bein' an honorable soul!

They call me a workin' man, I reckon that's what I am.♪
Makin' friends with heroes, helpin' them to best their foes.♪
Aaand nobody'll ever know.♪
We are all praying for your success, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Now, go and send that bastard back to the depths from which he came.
You have earned your title, Titan's Bane.
column23: I pray it did not come at too great a cost.

column22: Come to think of it, I never did ask what sort of trouble she had gotten herself into. Now that it's been settled, mind telling me what it was?
column23: ...Cheese? <Emphasis>Again</Emphasis>!? I should have never asked.

column22: ...Not that it's any of my business, but the next time a nation is in danger of imminent destruction at the hands of a primal, you might consider consulting those who have fought and felled it before.
column23: In any case, I am glad to see you alive and well.

column22: You've nothing left to prove, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Nor do you require further assistance from me. You know what you must do next.
Word travels fast in the Company. Ground him beneath <Emphasis>your</Emphasis> heel, did you? Hah! A <If(PlayerParameter(4))>bloody harpy<Else/>magnificent bastard</If> after my own heart.
You are a skilled hunterrr, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. This I know. But your quarry is a god; this I also know.
column23: Blind rrrecklessness will avail you naught against such foes, regardless of what Landenel may claim.

column22: Although your victory over Titan was a foregone conclusion in mine eyes, I am nevertheless rrrelieved to see you healthy and hale.
Know that you will always be welcome in Forgotten Springs, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. The U do not forrrget their friends.

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Goodly uplander is talentful plansmaker! Will trade tongueflaps with Wheiskaet so all know of hand-lending!

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Mighty rockman no match for wily uplander and clever fighty-think! Brayflox happytoasts fall of rockman!

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Cheese is gobbie birthright! Gobbietreat for every gobbieflock! If Illuminati deephate Brayflox, then Brayflox backhate Illuminati!
To think that Drest would chance upon the key to reviving the Bacchus vineyards!
column23: I owe you many thanks as well, my friend, for you are the one who has set these events in motion.

column22: <sniff> <sniff> The scent of the Navel clings to you still.
column23: ...Did you truly think me that perceptive? No, no─I learned of your victory from Captain Wheiskaet. I raised a glass in your honor that very eve.

column22: <sniff> <sniff> I see you managed to find the perfumed lady. And...a goobbue? Oh dear.
column23: She is well? Thank the Twelve! For a moment, I was concerned you had arrived too late.

column22: I heard a most interesting rumor the other day. Apparently, Castrum Occidens was built primarily as a research facility, as the Garleans had taken an interest in certain subterranean caverns.
column23: Moreover, a certain adventurer was said to have infiltrated the castrum and located the entrance to the caverns in question! Fascinating, wouldn't you agree?
column24: ...Of course I know it was you. My ears are almost as sharp as my nose, in case you were unaware.

column22: You and Cid shall ever be in my thoughts, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Return whenever you require respite.
Have you perchance come here in search of Cid? If so, I fear I must disappoint you. Though he paid me a visit, it was regrettably brief, for he had more pressing matters to attend to in Mor Dhona.
Hildibrand? Why, yes, there is a gentleman interred here by that name. If you have come to pay your respects, I can─
column23: He has risen!? Thal forgive me, I thought we had rid the lichyard of zombies...

column22: Minfilia has been blessed with a rare opportunity. Most have no choice but to await passage into Thal's realm to reunite with the lost.
Your service to House Fortemps will not be forgotten, my friend. If ever you have need of me, do not hesitate to ask.
House Haillenarte is far from redeemed, but one day we will regain our standing. When that day comes, rest assured I will repay my debts to you and Lord Haurchefant.
I trust you will not discuss the events which transpired at Snowcloak too openly.
column23: The heretic is dead, and the lords of the High Houses know of your deeds. That is what matters.

column22: Now that you've driven off that pesky siren and slain her undead thralls, I suppose I can visit the Isles of Umbra for my research.
column23: On the other hand, it can be rather difficult to determine if the undead are sufficiently...dead.

column22: I must say, I'm impressed that you all managed to repair that suit of armor. I've a mind to go out and acquire my own now.
For obvious reasons, Castrum Centri has been quiet of late. I don't expect it will last, but for now we can focus on fortifying the Toll.
The Toll owes much to the generous contributions of the Elder Seedseer and the Antecedent.
column23: Heh heh, I know you were involved too, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Gave the Mogglesguard and their king what for, eh? Well done.

column22: Hah! First the Elder Seedseer favors us with provisions, and now the Admiral sees fit to do the same.
column23: She couldn't have chosen a more opportune time. These days, between the Domans and the adventurers, the Toll feels less an outpost and more an honest-to-gods city!

column22: To survive in this uncertain world, a man's gotta know both his talents an' his limits. I've done my part in the fight─the rest is up to you an' yours, my friend.
With the Black Wolf slain an' his pack scattered, Revenant's Toll's begun to take on new life. As for me, I daresay I'm beginnin' to see a future worth livin' for─a future not ruled by vengeance.
Ah, Titan's Bane! That is your title, yes? Pray partake of Costa del Sol's hospitality.
column23: However, do try to refrain from crude displays of martial prowess. This is a place of beauty and leisure─not the bloodsands.

column22: Why have you not yet returned to me, my beloved F'lhaminn!? What malevolent forces conspire to keep us apart!?
column23: ...A daughter, you say? Hmmm... If she bears even the slightest resemblance to her mother, I should like very much to meet her.

column22: Teteroon miss good Buscaroon. Must work hard. Must make many shinies. Then Teteroon go see Buscaroon!
Another day, another hundred pilgrims <Emphasis>not</Emphasis> coming to Highbridge and parting with their coin as they should. <sigh> But enough about my quandaries.
column23: Oh, have you chanced to meet my daughter at Little Ala Mhigo? She's ever been a dreamer, my Hihira, and headstrong besides. I've long given up on having her obey me─it's enough to know that she's alive and well.

column22: Graaaaaah! The sun, it <Emphasis>still</Emphasis> burns! Will my poor pate never know relief!? What other adorable critter's blood must I drench it with before my suffering is ended!?
Yer a bloody fool to be standin' here, but a bloody <Emphasis>strong</Emphasis> fool to do so without gettin' yerself killed.
column23: Ye'll find no respite on the front lines. If ye've a mind to stick around, I'll be trustin' ye to make yerself useful.

column22: Hush, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If>. I cannot focus on the flow of aether when your breathing is so loud!
column23: If you intend to remain in my presence, I must insist that you hold your breath.

column22: The professor's thesis also postulates the existence of corrupted crystals which could be likened to specialized converters, in that they could only be used to alter aether of a single aspect to aether of another aspect─say, earth to fire, for instance.
column23: Yet my research thus far suggests that such crystals do <Emphasis>not</Emphasis> exist. Could it be that the professor is─dare I say it─wrong?

column22: Again you disrupt my research─and for what!? You have your crystal. What more do you need?
column23: Whatever it is, I do not care. I, Hahasako, greatest of Professor Lamberteint's pupils, can suffer no further distractions! Away with you!

column22: Would that we could recognize your deeds more openly, but you know well our circumstance. That may change in future, but the present demands discretion.

We may have crushed the ambitions of the Serpent Reavers, but their fishback masters yet threaten our shores. Let them come, I say. No Sahagin force shall breach the tidegates─not while I remain in command!
So dutifully did I serve my lady in happier times, only to forsake her when she needed me most.
column23: My failures will forever haunt me. And yet with your brave deeds, mayhap my lady's tormented soul will find peace after so many years of woe.

column22: I presume the brave adventurer the Wood Wailer captain spoke of was you. I was in a state of astonishment at the time─to think that someone could enter the manor not merely once, but twice, and return to tell the tale.
column23: Oh, my lady... My poor, tormented lady... Will her soul know no reprieve from the clutches of darkness?
column24: My shame, my dishonor for my role in the fall of the Dartancours─these I must bear unto my grave. My only hope is that you have brought an end to these years of tragedy and woe.

column22: 'Tis my most fervent belief that the fellowship of NOAH will─piece by piece─lay bare the long-buried secrets of ancient Allag's history. But the doing of it will require all of your skill and more!
column23: Mayhap I can convince Master Garlond to allow me to accompany you, that I might see some of these horrific guardians in the flesh. I <Emphasis>am</Emphasis> quite proficient with the bow, you know!

column22: Though I don't doubt your abilities, none can say what dangers lurk beneath Castrum Occidens. For my lady's sake as well as your own, please spare neither preparation nor caution. Pray choose your companions well.

I understand you navigated your way to the deepest sector of the caverns beneath Castrum Occidens without incident. Seeing as you were handpicked by Lady Alisaie herself, your success came as no surprise, but that doesn't make it any less impressive.
column23: The investigation continues in other locales, to be sure, but I am reassured in the knowledge that my lady is in good hands.

column22: Honored ally, what brings you to the Ring of Ash?
column23: Should you bear wounds from the field of battle, then rest awhile and regain your strength. A warrior must stand proud and tall that <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If> might always stare death in the eye.

column22: Chosen One is but little one, yet knows more of the forest and its secrets than this one. This one is not worthy...
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! This one cannot thank you enough for─
column23: ...Ah, do forgive me. With all my time in Little Solace, this one─er, <Emphasis>I</Emphasis> seem to have picked up a few of our friends' quirks and mannerisms.
column24: Oh, don't look at me like that, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I can assure you I have no designs on your undergarments. Now where did I put my journal...?

column22: Have you noticed, overdweller? Changes have come to the 789th Order Dig─transformations, alterations, changes!
column23: Yes, yes, many changes at the dig. Firstly, nap time has been cut from four hours to three. Secondly, all pickmen must at least <Emphasis>think</Emphasis> about picking up their pickaxe once a day.
column24: Thirdly... <yawn> Ah, but Gi Gu must see to important business. Overdweller will return in three hours, yes?

column22: Ye'll not believe this, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, but I saw Gi Gu lift his pickaxe for the first time in nearly a fortnight.
column23: Promptly fell on 'is arse and dozed off before comin' within ten yalms of the mines, 'course. Still, progress is progress.

column22: Pshhh... <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, you are welcome in the nursssery. Ssstay, tell tall tales to the ssspawnlings, and partake of our bounty. There is always more fishhh broth for our shhhorewalker clutchmate!
Rumors are rife of late about an adventurer who set foot within that haunted manor and emerged to tell the tale.
column23: I recall the name <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/> being bandied about. Does that ring a bell with you, friend?

column22: Rumor has it a party of adventurers quelled the latest uprising by the hecatoncheires.
column23: Though, if the Stone Torches are to be believed, there never was another uprising.

column22: Arlh told you about that, did he? Bah, some people don't know when to keep their mouths shut.
column23: I'd be lying if I said I wasn't interested in paying a visit to Halatali myself. But for now, I'm content to drink and listen to the stories of others.

column22: Whatever company we kept then, we're cooks now and proud of it. Aye, no snow-lined ways for us!
column23: A shame he has to spend his days feeding wealthy ingrates, whereas I get to feed honest folk.

column22: Well, well! If it ain't wossname, the hardy <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If> what stood by me side when I single-handedly─well, guess it wasn't quite <Emphasis>single</Emphasis>handedly if ye were there, but who gives a wotsit?─drove that sea-spawned songstress back to the depths.
column23: Eh? Wasn't quite how it happened, ye say? That may well be, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>missy<Else/>sonny</If>, but when ye get to be ol' Mimidoa's age, such details are quick to slip from yer noggin─'specially when there's nails what need hammerin' and winsome lasses what need carousin'. Never too old for a spot o' carousin'.

column22: 'Nother 'nitiate, eh? Well, grab yerself a hammer an' some nails. With that hells-born harlot out of our hair, it's time we got down to the things what matter.
column23: Eh? Things like what, ye say? Fer 'nitiates like you, things like hammerin'. Fer me, things like watchin' <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> hammer, for one, an' carousin' with rosy-cheeked lasses. As a wise man─bugger me if I can remember 'is name─once said, ain't never too old for a spot o' carousin'.

column22: I cannot thank you enough, friend. With the siren silenced, the restoration effort has begun in earnest─and my lifelong dream of working under Master Mimidoa is realized at last.
column23: He's a hard taskmaster, and his eye's wont to wander from time to time, but still, there's no place that I'd rather be.
column24: Upon my father's and brother's graves, I swear─Pharos Sirius will again burn bright, and these hands will see it done.

column22: Welcome to the Drowning Wench, a place to leave your cares and troubles behind.
column23: I'll say that again: your cares and your troubles. You'll be taking the contents of your innards with you, or you'll not find the Wench so welcoming on your next visit.

column22: We've recently procured a shipment o' sands an' oil o' time. Ain't nothin' more effective for restorin' old arms an' armor to mint condition, I tell you. If you're interested, I can fix you with some in exchange for mark logs.
column23: These logs are kept by them as chase after elite marks in the Hunt, the bounty system what the Eorzean Alliance set up. In their lust for riches an' glory, hunters often end up dead, leavin' behind their worldly possessions.
column24: Why do we want these, you ask? Let's just say there's a small but dedicated group o' people who derive pleasure from gettin' a peek at the lives o' the dearly departed. There's good coin to be made in satisfyin' their morbid taste.

column22: I'm sorry, but can it wait? I'm rather busy right now with one of Rowena's thankless tasks.
The past belongs in the past, so they say. But there're things in life that refuse to stay there, no matter how much you will it. <sigh>
You're the adventurer what goes around slayin' gods, right? Then you ought to be familiar with those arms what're blessed by primals. Aye, them showy things what look like the beings.
column23: But did you know that some o' these arms can be made mightier? Take those as harbor the power o' Shiva, for instance─the <Emphasis>true Ice</Emphasis> somethin's. These can be made mightier if you've got a pinch o' this stuff called diamond dust.
column24: If you happen to have a true Ice weapon and some diamond dust, bring 'em to me and I'll see the former enhanced.

column22: I welcome you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> of the black. It was only with your aid that I did unearth the answers sought by my ancestors, and for this I thank you. And yet each answer is but a stepping-stone to yet another question...
column23: Tireless effort, unwavering focus. Harmony and unity of purpose, unobstructed by differences of tribe or nation. This is the goal I would strive for with the rest of my days─a goal that I am proud to share with you, friend.

column22: If we fail at this mission, Gridania's relations with the sylphs could be damaged beyond repair. We must succeed at all costs!
I do not regret turning away the petitioners. They must understand the reality of their situation. The refugee issue will not be solved by the Scions alone.
column23: That said, I am not without sympathy for their plight. I would do what I can to bring them some measure of succor. We are counting on your efforts, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.

column22: We will entrust the Lord of Levin to you. I have discussed the matter with Urianger as well. He may be able to offer some measure of assistance.
While the greatest challenges still lie ahead, we have earned a measure of peace for the moment.
column23: If you are looking to pass the time before your next mission, I suggest you walk the streets and turn an ear to those around you. Revenant's Toll abounds with colorful characters these days. You are like to find their stories entertaining and enlightening both.

column22: With the primal threat presently subdued, now is the perfect time to focus on new endeavors.
column23: Alphinaud has long been laying the groundwork for this organization of his, and he looks to you to help turn his proposal into reality. Pray lend him what aid you can.

column22: With the formation of the Crystal Braves, the Scions have gained a powerful ally, but with great power comes greater responsibility.
column23: We must ever remain focused on our ultimate goal, that we can use our newfound power wisely.

column22: Never is a woman more lovely than when she's hard at work, I say. A wild rose, strong and beautiful, blooming tall in the face of the frozen winds...
I told F'lhaminn all about our adventures in the Sylphlands, fake Thancred and all. Er, you won't tell the <Emphasis>real</Emphasis> Thancred, will you?
With the Doman younglings dashing around hither and yon, there's hardly a moment of peace to be had.
column23: That said, traveling with Yda, it's not as if I knew much peace to begin with...

column22: The storm has passed and a moment's quietude is ours. Tataru is using her newfound time to further her studies, and I would follow her example.
column23: If living in Eorzea has taught us anything at all, it's that such restful moments are fleeting. Dark clouds ever stir anew on the horizon.

column22: I do not know where we would be without Higiri─the girl has worked tirelessly for us every day since her arrival. Do you suppose all Doman women are so diligent?
Repetition and routine beget skill. Skill begets confidence. I would do what I can to see the Domans regain their strength of will.
Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Care to watch the lessons before you journey on your way? I daresay your presence would go far to inspire the younglings.
Many of my countrymen have found work as frontier hands, helping to transport supplies and continue the expansion of Revenant's Toll.
column23: I have been tasked with keeping the equipment here in good repair. It is not particularly glamorous work, but I would help in whatever way I can.

column22: Despite all the hardships they have faced, the younglings pursue their training with great zeal. We older ones would do well to follow their example.
One hundred thirty-seven, one hundred thirty-eight, one hundred thirty─oh, hello there!
column23: I've been charged with keeping inventory. F'lhaminn tells me it's a vitally important─ Oh dear! I seem to have lost count.

column22: Our lessons are through for the moment, but a true adventurer never shirks his duties. I say we shall go on a patrol of Revenant's Toll!
