Are you taking a rest, too? Promise you'll play with us again soon. That game of hide-and-seek in Vesper Bay was the most fun I've had in forever!
Yozan's always been the strongest of us, but even he's no match for Koharu when she's mad.
If I were as big as a mountain and strong as a bear like Mister Boulder is, maybe I would like fighting more...
I daresay they heard you talking a malm away. Yda and Thancred dashed out not moments ago. Will they <Emphasis>ever</Emphasis> start acting their age?
Just as some children possess wisdom beyond their years, some adults are little more than children writ large.
column23: Remember this, and it should save you a measure of frustration in your dealings with those around you.

column22: Nothing warms me inside quite like Higiri's tea. Truly, it is salve for the body and soul.
Higiri has told me about a Doman tea with a most remarkable fragrance. What I would not give to taste it for myself!
Where did everyone run off to all of a sudden? It is not that I mind so much─the quiet is most conducive to focusing on my tasks.

So turn we to heroes, of conscience unstained.♪
May all stop at naught till what's lost is regained.♪
column23: Oh, hello again. F'lhaminn has been teaching me some Eorzean ballads. Though I hail from a faraway land, there is something about music that truly transcends borders.

column22: You've done well, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Why don't you join me at the counter for a drink? My treat.
column23: Might I suggest those seats over there by F'lhaminn and Higiri? Though, of course, anywhere would suffice!

column22: I-I'm not sleeping! I was just engrossed in thought, th-that's all!
As is oft said, trouble arrives when you least expect it. It is precisely when things appear to be proceeding according to plan that we must needs steel ourselves for impending danger.
column23: ...Ahem! Are you listening, Yda!?

column22: Enjoy your respite, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, for you certainly have earned it. Just do not relax your guard overmuch─unlike a certain someone here.
With everyone coming back, it's gotten quite lively around here of late. Why, at times it almost reminds me of the old days at the Waking Sands.
Not only are Higiri's culinary creations positively delicious, you should see her at work in the kitchen! She wields a knife like nothing I've ever seen!
I spend the better part of my days crossing blades with children, but I approach these lessons with as much fire as any battle I've ever fought.
column23: The Domans may have found refuge here, but none are so naive as to think their troubles are over. I would prepare them in body and spirit for the challenges that yet lie ahead.

column22: Hoary Boulder's sparring practice grows more spirited by the day. I hope only that it is not <Emphasis>too</Emphasis> spirited for the younglings who face him.

Some might think the life of an adventurer a carefree one, but you and I know that this is far from the truth. While you may not be beholden to a single lord, you bear the weight of an entire realm's expectations on your shoulders.
Doma is lost, but if we keep our heads high and learn from our experiences in this place, perhaps aught may yet be done for our homeland.
Sadly, I lack the ingredients and seasonings needed to truly recreate the taste of my homeland. That said, I've come to enjoy this challenge to my culinary skills.
Mister Boulder is a demanding teacher, but we trained hard in Doma too! We'll not bend so easily!
Just you watch! Someday I'll be as strong as you, and I'll protect everyone from the Garleans!
Look at Mister Boulder, with his shining armor and his giant sword. Do you think I'll ever be strong enough to wield a blade like that?
Mister Boulder says we must be brave, but that's easy for him to say. He's big and strong, but I'm small and weak.
Take care, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I look forward to hearing all about your adventures when you return!
Duty calls? Well, no matter the task, I have faith you will see it through to the end.
Worried about leaving us alone? Don't be. While the Archons are away, Hoary Boulder will keep the little ones safe!
Mayhap one day we shall accompany you into the field. But for now, we must see to less glamorous duties.
The children are quick to take to Eorzean ways, but I cannot claim the same...flexibility.
Speaking with Master Coultenet has opened my eyes to a great many things. I had no idea the world outside Doma was so strange and wonderful!
I tried substituting native ingredients several times, but the result was but a pale imitation of authentic Doman cuisine...
<If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss<Else/>Mister</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Is it true you're going to go adventuring again? I'm so jealous!
Hey, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss<Else/>Mister</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, what's a “Ramuh”? Is it cute and fluffy like a horsebird?
After we parted in Ul'dah, I paid a visit to the refugees. Though a fundamental solution remains far off, I believe that at the very least there should be no armed uprisings in the near future.
column23: I am given to understand that you resolved the matter of Ramuh. I will ask Minfilia for a full report when next we speak. You have done well, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.

column22: My grandfather formed the Circle of Knowing in the hopes that, through the accumulation of knowledge, Eorzea might be saved from disaster foretold.
column23: A band of champions brought together by a common goal, to lead our realm to a better tomorrow. Though our means may differ, I would like to believe I do him proud in undertaking this new endeavor.

column22: Your bout with Hoary Boulder was more stirring than a hundred lines of my most passionate poetry. Mayhaps I should arrange a sparring match of my own...
I can't wait for Alphinaud to start his new company. I love making new friends!
I wish Yda were not so eager to look to the future when we have so many problems in the here and now...
I fear Yda's boundless optimism is beginning to affect my better judgment. And your tendency to triumph against the most terrible of foes is certainly not helping matters.
No, this won't do at all! And then I'll have to─ Oh, hello, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! If you don't mind, I'm terribly busy at the moment!
'Tis not enough that I am here for my daughter─I must do what little I can to help you all succeed in your monumental tasks.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I must thank you again for agreeing to our bout.
column23: ...And I must thank the gods 'twas not a duel to the death! I will, however, cherish the lesson of each scrape and bruise as I work to better my swordplay.

column22: I thought the idea foolish at first, but it seems that sparring match well served its purpose. Why, I can hardly wait to return to my studies and seek to improve upon my technique!

My people's spirits were thoroughly crushed by the loss of our homeland, but thanks to your courage and generosity I see their inner flames once more flicker back to life. I, too, have felt my strength of will make a gradual return.
Our Doman farming methods have been adopted here on the frontier. 'Tis too early yet to know if they will prove to be effective...
This place has become as a hive, and its bees flit about in constant motion. Perhaps a soothing pot of tea will coax one or two to alight and take a moment's rest.
Mister Boulder fought well, but he was no match for you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss<Else/>Mister</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!
column23: Just you wait! One day I'll be good enough to knock you from the top of your mountain!

column22: Mister Boulder is sore and beaten, but he said he'd return straight to his training. Heh heh, I don't think he likes to lose!
We need to decide who in our Adventurers' Guild will do what. I'm fairly sure Yozan will have to be the swordfighter─he always has to be in the thick of the action.
I like the way Mister Coultenet fought─no swords or fists. I wonder, if I studied hard, would I be able to cast spells like that too?
Ever since Higiri started preparing our meals, I swear I've never felt better.
column23: They say Doman cuisine is highly nourishing, but I'd sooner attribute it to the loving care she puts into her culinary creations.
column24: They say the fastest way to a man's heart is through his stomach, and I'm not wont to disagree.

column22: Papalymo refuses to spar with me. He says he has more important matters to attend to, but I think he's just afraid to lose!

Sparring bouts to raise awareness of the Crystal Braves? Intriguing, though I cannot help but feel there are more pressing tasks at hand. Perhaps Tataru requires aid in compiling the company roster...

Every time I speak to Riol, I realize how much there is that I do not yet understand about the kobolds. I am fortunate indeed to count a former member of the Company of Heroes as friend and confidant.
The Crystal Braves... 'Tis a most fitting name for a company of champions summoned together by the Mothercrystal, would you not agree?
column23: The blue of the uniform represents the Crystal's Light─pure and unadulterated, a beacon of hope. The crystal sword is the sign of those who would stand strong in the face of danger.
column24: Until the day that my Crystal Braves are a guiding light for all of Eorzea, I will not give up the fight.

column22: Ohgodsohgods! I thought I was finished with the roster, but I missed a name and had to start all over. As if I didn't have enough work to do already!
Anyone with a pair of eyes can see that Thancred is thoroughly besmitten with Higiri. Then again, subtlety has never been one of his strengths...
column23: Urianger has asked me to watch over the Doman women, that they do not come to any more suffering than they have already endured...

column22: 'Tis always inspiring to speak with a person of vision. If there is aught I might do to be of service to this new company, you know where to find me.
Come to mention it, the younglings seem to have run off somewhere. I do hope they're not up to any mischief...
I hear a new company has been formed. I would be of service in whatever humble way I can.
I am studying Eorzean military drills, in the hope that I might better understand this new organization.
Mister Thancred has taken quite a fancy to Doman cuisine. Several times a day he tells me that one of my dishes is the best he's ever tasted.
column23: His praise is most heartening, though I cannot help but feel he has a wont for exaggeration...

column22: The Crystal Braves! Why, just saying the name makes me feel strong!
column23: I've been thinking of changing the name of our guild to “The Doman Braves.” How does that sound to you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss<Else/>Mister</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>?

column22: We hereby name Yozan commander of the Doman Braves!
For the freedom of <Emphasis>all</Emphasis>! For the <Emphasis>freedom</Emphasis> of all! <Emphasis>For</Emphasis> the freedom of all!
column23: It just doesn't sound the same when I say it...

column22: Our Doman Adventurers' Guild could use a new name. Say, do you have any ideas?
Seein' this lass sure brings back memories. I was jus' sharin' a couple o' juicy secrets with her.
You've brought in quite a few new recruits, haven't you? Your reputation extends far beyond Little Ala Mhigo, it would seem, and deservedly so.
column23: Why, meeting you has given me something to strive for. Remember the name of Wilred! I shall hone both body and mind and do you and my fellow Braves proud.

column22: This uniform rather suits me, would you not say? Or perhaps it is I that suits it.
column23: After all my transgressions, I am grateful indeed for this chance to start anew. Buscarron! Laurentius shall do you proud!

column22: Alphinaud's words were most heart-stirring, would you not agree? Truth be told, I worry what I can offer to such a lofty organization, but I will do all in my power to make my fellow Braves proud!
The formation of the Crystal Braves has lifted everyone's spirits. My hopes are as high as the next man, but we'll not know what this company is truly made of till we face our first mission.
We've started dealing in Ironworks gear. As the name suggests, these items are made by Garlond Ironworks, and the quality is exceptional. And as you'd expect, you won't find them anywhere else.
column23: Picking up the scent of profit, Rowena quickly secured an exclusive deal to be the realm's sole supplier. The woman's purse continues to grow fat with coin, but we hirelings see nary a gil of it.
column24: ...Ahem. Anyway, I'm supposed to tell you that Ironworks gear can be enhanced. Just take them to Gerolt─or his apprentice, more like─and you can get the work done.

column22: Dreams are well and good, but if you live with your head in the clouds, sooner or later you'll find yourself on your rear. My sorry, drink-sodden son is an example of this.
The Stone Vigil returns to Ishgard! Hail, <Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, and bless you for the work you've done today.
column23: We'll have the perimeter sealed up, then make the place fit to garrison again. It'll be the jewel of our defenses, you'll see!

column22: I had plans for piercing the defenses, but fie! The Vigil was retaken ere I could bend my commander's ear. I must see to restoring the keep, the Fury save me.
It's House Durendaire that sees to Whitebrim Front, and a good thing too. Only the four High Houses have the coin and men to rebuild the Stone Vigil, and none're flusher than Durendaire.
'Twas well you came, else we would not have won this day. Only a knight errant may break a stalemate, my lady mother used to say.
column23: Your deeds are known to all at the Front─but false would I speak if I said you were accepted by all. Pride hardens resolve and hearts alike.

column22: Ishgard was all I knew until I was almost a woman grown. 'Twas to be a brief spell, my time on the road─but now I find myself mulling an adventurer's life.
News from Coerthas talks of naught but the part you played in the retaking of the Stone Vigil. I read you correctly, did I not? A <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> of rare quality.
If you see Spenser around, tell him to get his sorry arse back in here. Bastard stumbled out without paying his tab...again.
Master Bugaal Ja's passion for both bathing and dancing is truly unparalleled. I am sure it is but a matter of time before his art finds a receptive audience.
Havin' been founded by pirates, Limsa's long been the hub for piracy. But those days're comin' to an end, mark me words, an' it's all for the greater good.
...Eh? Who's the last Mistbeard, ye ask? Seven hells, yer a right daft sod, ain't ye? Me an' the chief was as subtle 'bout it as a bleedin' sledgehammer!
Gridania─lovely, dark, and deep. These woods are ours to guard, secure between the coils of honor and duty...
Vannes is me own flesh and blood, heir to the Brugaire Consortium. It barely needs sayin' that 'e'd settle for no less than the most storied beauty the realm over.
I am Vannes, heir to the chairmanship of the Brugaire Consortium. And who exactly were you, again?
column23: ...I'm sorry. I just realized that I don't particularly care.

column22: All I have done to raise Arabella to a beautiful young woman has been in anticipation of this day. I have never been more proud to call myself her father.
Good food, good drink, an' good tidin's. That today's announcement will send even more gil flowin' into our coffers only makes the wine taste all the sweeter.
Oh, how I am looking forward to meeting Miss Arabella. They say many a song is sung of her beauty.
column23: Mind you, there was a song or two sung of <Emphasis>me</Emphasis> in my day.

column22: Renting out Master Gegeruju's private property would be almost unthinkable for most folk. But gil talks, and neither the Brugaire Consortium nor the East Aldenard Trading Company are in any danger of running their coffers dry.
The phantom thief may have eluded us again, but his dramatic appearance at the banquet made for quite the story in itself.
column23: “I shall come to claim the victor's spoils,” the card said. I plan to head straight to the Coliseum to investigate.

column22: The flame is not the fuel, praise the Traders. The Immortal Flames depend not on any one soldier─not even Raubahn Aldynn. Low it may burn at times, but as long as there are men willing to serve, it is forever.
The poets can romanticize it all they want, but a life without coin is no life at all.

Vintage equipment's fallen out of favor of late. Though we still deal in them, at Rowena's behest, they're now bespoke items. She won't have valuable shelf space being taken up by wares that don't sell, you see.
Sorry, but I've my hands full assisting Eginolf with his orders. You're free to stand there and gape at the shelves all you wish, but if you need aught else, I'm afraid I cannot be of any assistance.
Titan's Bane! Master Gegeruju told me that this feast would draw esteemed personages from across the realm, but I was not expecting to see you among them.
column23: Felling primals, solving mysteries─you certainly know how to keep yourself busy.

column22: They tell me this Arabella is quite the beauty. Do you suppose she'd be interested in earning a bit of extra coin as one of my dancers?
You have recorded twenty vistas to your sightseeing log. Report to Millith Ironheart at Apkallu Falls in Gridania.
Is there aught I may do to serve you? I stand ever at the ready. For the freedom of all!
For the freedom of all! For the freedom of all! For the freedom of all!
column23: The first few times I said it, I must confess to feeling some embarrassment, but it's starting to grow on me.

column22: The greater our successes, the more our name will grow. The more our name grows, the greater the profits to be had. I can scarcely contain my anticipation for our first mission.
Any friend of Eginolf is more than welcome here. How might I help you?
Lord Ramuh judged walking one worthy? This one is duly impressed! Lord Ramuh turns most walking ones into toasty ones.

Being born with one red eye, I did not have the most pleasant of childhoods. You know what they say: children can be cruel. The end result being that I grew up determined to uncover the truth of the trait.
column23: Much and more yet remains beyond my knowing, but one thing is certain: the nearer I draw to the heart of the Crystal Tower, the more I am convinced that an important memory eludes me.

column22: Even without Dalamud in the heavens, the Crystal Tower is capable of generating vast amounts of energy. It's only a matter of time before the voidgate is thrown open fully.
column23: Knowing this, Nero used us in order to secure safe passage to the tower's apex. Though I doubt that any of us fell for his ruse, we let the scoundrel do as he pleased nonetheless. Deep down, we all want to believe that a man can change for the better...

column22: Voidgates and the like are a thaumaturge's domain. Engineers like me and Wedge are out of our depth.
column23: Having said that, we're not entirely useless here. The workings of the Crystal Tower itself are a language we understand. If there's something to decipher, we mean to decipher it.

column22: This is just my humble opinion, but a man like Emperor Xande wouldn't leave anything to chance. Before we arrived at the tower's apex, he would've completed his preparations to open the voidgate.
column23: That's why the gate manifested so soon after you defeated him, and poor Unei and Doga were sucked in. Thoroughness and the lust for nihility make for a dreadful combination...

column22: Ah, <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If></If>. I hear that you have quieted Ramuh's thunder once more. It is clear we entrusted the task to the right <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If>.
column23: As you know well by now, the sylphs are not as simple a people as they might seem to an outsider. In many ways, the complexity of the relationships between the various factions of their society rivals that of our own.

column22: This is the venue for the, um, cannon event for the Moonfire Faire. It's fun, it packs a punch, and─most important of all─it's family friendly!

I'm the chairman...or chief chaperone...or something of the Moonfire Faire. Sounds fancy, I know, but at the end of the day, I'm just another soul working to make the faire a rousing success. We're all in this together!
The Moonfire Faire's in full swing in Limsa Lominsa, and we're recruiting adventurers to help out with this year's festivities. Do tell all your friends!
The Adventurers' Guild is currently hosting the Moonfire Faire in Limsa Lominsa, and we're recruiting people to help make this year's festivities the merriest ever. Please spread the word!

<Emphasis>Moon–fire Fa–ire!</Emphasis>♪
<Emphasis>In Lim–sa Lo–minsa!</Emphasis>♪
Hah hah hah! Come join us for the Moonfire Faire, brought to you by the Adventurers' Guild!
Beating the heat─that's what any summer festival worth its salt offers participants, and the Moonfire Faire is no slouch. Here at the Rousing Douse event, refreshingly cool is the order of business!
No Moonfire Faire can be considered complete without dazzling fireworks. Here at the Very Cherry Bomb event, we set off lots and lots of them!
You've served this nation well. I've no doubt that even greater adventures lie in your future. Go forth and do Limsa proud!
Ah, what I wouldn't give to get out and see the realm from time to time. Do you reckon those moogles are still looking for help?
I wish I could promise you that my brother will learn from his experience, but he has proven to have a rather short memory in the past...
Spenser has not been around of late. Do you suppose he has freed himself from his demons at last?
How fares your chocobo? Should you discover anything noteworthy as you raise your bird, I would be most grateful if you could share your observations.
The chocobos are as varied as you and I in what they favor, aye. Grow a sundry of greens and you'll see that's so.

It would seem some entrepreneurs decided to take advantage of your hard work. They've set about renovating the facilities so that Halatali might once more serve as training grounds for Coliseum gladiators.

Full glad I was to be rid of the wild beasts, but now the new owners have brought even more bloodthirsty creatures─<Emphasis>and</Emphasis> men! I say, who is going to take responsibility when this spirals out of control!?
Hey, I know you! What with you followin' that half-crazed inspector hither and yon on his madcap cases, I reckon you've worked up quite a thirst. I've got a fine vintage I reckon you might fancy.

Thanks to you, this Moonfire Faire's been a rousing success. That said, the festivities still continue, so don't be slacking off just yet, eh? Keep having a good time, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, and see that others do the same!
I understand the appeal, I do. But a man can do more good living humbly for a cause than dying nobly for one.
That was some nasty work in the caves. Good that you did it, though. Wouldn't want our friends to get even more carried away.
column23: People ought to be more grateful for what they've got, don't you think?

column22: I wasn't there, and I won't presume to pass judgment, but... They will remember what you did─and so should you.

Once again, allow me to express my thanks, <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(54),127))><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If>. Were it not for your efforts, the violence might have continued unabated for some time.
column23: The situation is far from resolved, but I have faith that one day these events will be but a distant memory.

column22: We all have it coming, soldier. Don't think that you're an exception.
Beg your pardon, Scion, but I cannot permit you to enter the Fragrant Chamber at this time. Pray step away from the doors.
This one heard! This one felt! Walking one has been judged worthy by Lord Ramuh.
column23: Elder one is most grateful to walking one. These ones' crystal has found a good home with walking one.

column22: To think that I'd see the day when Revenant's Toll became a bustling hub for adventurers. Almost warrants giving the place a new name, wouldn't you say?
column23: That said, the influx of visitors doesn't come without problems─for Tataru most of all, and those of us who have to give an ear to her griping.

column22: What manner of supplies did the heretics abscond with, you ask? Worry yourself not─'twas naught that cannot be replaced.
column23: Save for one item to which I personally had taken a fancy. Are you perchance familiar with the dress of the Cascadiers?
column24: Needless to say, frippery so...revealing...is not so easily had in these parts. 'Tis a shame to see it lost.

column22: So Landenel has finally come to understand the commander's wish. That is well. With this realization, he may begin walking his own path and fulfill his true potential. Thank you for standing by him throughout his inner struggle.
Are you looking for something special today? Whether you seek a tasteful tribute to those lost in the Calamity or a symbol of our realm's rebirth, you're sure to find what you need!
column23: Just think how much more poignant those fireworks would be with something to remember them by. Blue comets are fleeting but a souvenir─a souvenir is forever!
column24: You seem fascinated by my raiments. I am flattered! My betrothed made them─as dextrous with a needle as she is with a sword, that one! A bit short-tempered, but we all have our faults, don't we?

column22: Look at that, fireworks. Just had 'em for the Moonfire Faire, didn't we? This lot's for the Calamity, though.
column23: Look at 'em colors! Musta been a deal of work for the pyromancers. That's what I call a tribute, aye.

column22: Funny thing, grief. You're a bow drawn, don't even know the strain till somethin' releases it─somethin' like these fireworks.
column23: Bawled like a baby the first night the Adventurers' Guild put on the display, I did. They say there's one in every city. A footloose <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If> could see 'em all...

column22: You see those fireworks? A tribute to the dead, they say, but not I─no. What do we know of the dead and their ways? They have their new duties in the halls of the Twelve.
column23: Those night-blooms are for us, for the living. Shall we scan the sky anxious as smallholders, cringing at every strange light? Or shall we remember what it was to stand tall and breathe deep?

column22: Seen the remembrance fireworks for the Calamity, have you? And here I was thinking 'twas more o' the Moonfire Faire!
column23: I look up and say a prayer for every burst. And then I'm at peace awhile. That there's the difference 'tween memory and remembrance...

column22: More fireworks at night, have you marked them? They say it's for the dead, that it's in remembrance of the Calamity.
column23: What I want is to forget, not remember. Am I to ooh and aah over fire in the sky? A rain of fire there was, and my brother, he...no, they are not for me, these fireworks.

column22: Oh no, these are not for the Moonfire Faire. These fireworks are in remembrance of the Calamity─and rebirth of the realm. It's the Adventurers' Guild that paints the night sky thus. Have you heard them singing?
column23:
Have light, will travel, if your nights be dark～♪
An adventure's naught if not done on a lark...♪
column24: A hardy lot, and merry too!

column22: Cast out, I once was, but by Chief Totoloc, I was saved! To repay this kindness, most able of Ehcatl, I shall become. My words, mark them well! Squahaha!
“Garuda! Garuda!” Ever cry out for the goddess, buzzards do. Yet care one whit for buzzards, Garuda does not. What use have Ehcatl for goddess like that!?
Sqwak sqwak! Knotcounter of Ehcatl, this one is. Sqwak! Money, time is, and time for chatter, this one has not. Sqwak!
Squawk! Disturb me, featherless one must not! Hard at work on revolutionary new control mechanism, I am! Go here, this does, and...squawk! Perfection!
Crafter, featherless one is? Caw! Good things, I hear, of featherless ones' crafting, but perfection, I demand. Pass my inspections, you shall, or peck out your eyes, I will. Caw!
Sqqquawk! Get underfoot, featherless one must not! Hard at work, engineers are! No rest for the Ehcatl Nine till Ayatlan, we reclaim!

Welcome to the Coerthas branch office of Highwind Skyways! ...Sounds all grand and official when you say it like that, but in truth, it's just poor little Templeton─banished to this godsforsaken waste because he rubbed a few of his superiors the wrong way.
column23: That said, being able to operate without constant supervision does afford certain...opportunities. Opportunities that might be mutually beneficial to those to whom I take a liking. <wink> <wink>

column22: Hello there, adventurer! This crafting facility is for the use of artisans with “special” tasks. If you don't have any special tasks, then I must ask you to step aside and let someone else take their turn.
Greetings! The crafting facility here at Treespeak Stables is primarily for the purpose of forging tools for the stablehands, but our doors─assuming we had any─are open to all!
Welcome to the Diamond Forge. Here we have but one goal: to offer the services of our crafting facilities in accordance with the wishes of the Revenant's Toll chapter of the Adventurers' Guild.
column23: If it's Rowena you seek, you'll find her out the door and to your right. If there is naught else we can help you with, however, then I must ask you to leave.

column22: In a place like Camp Dragonhead, there is no shortage of crafters eager to utilize our facilities. Some items are best forged in the cold, after all.
column23: Is it not wonderful that our benefactors are generous enough to grant access to all? Truly, there is naught more rewarding than aiding crafters with their artistic pursuits!

column22: Business is positively booming of late─thanks in no small part to you, friend!
column23: ...But while we'd like nothing more than to serve you a grand feast to repay you for your efforts, I'm afraid we're booked up for three moons hence. Ever so sorry about that.

column22: To fly higher than any other is Ehcatl Nine's dream. But before we can fly, make wings, we must! Squawk!
Supplies, I gather, swiftly and in bulk. Consumed, they are, and swifter still. Thankless work, this is. Squawk!

The more I learn of it, the more I come to understand what a remarkable airship the <Emphasis>Dezul Qualan</Emphasis> truly is! To be able to work on such a vessel─why, it is an engineer's dream come true!
My wares, I will trade, to friends of Ehcatl. Get nothing from me, featherless neukers will. Nothing but squawk. Squawwwk!
Skaetswys and I 'ave been together since our piratin' days. Always 'ad a knack for gettin' 'erself into trouble.
column23: ...An' gettin' others out of it, which is why we could never stay angry at 'er for too long.

column22: Well, if it isn't <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/><Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If></If>, the <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> who solved the matter o' the missin' beastmen. Ye just keep findin' ways to outdo yerself, don't ye?

I am not privy as to the particulars, but I am told that we have quite a crisis on our hands. Go safely, <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If></If>, and may the elementals watch over you.

Ah! <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If></If>, the champion of the day! Gridanian and sylph alike, all who call the Twelveswood home owe you a debt of gratitude for your efforts.

I cannot speak as to the details of the mission, but with the beastmen involved, we cannot afford to take any chances. The Immortal Flames are counting on your success, <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/></If></If>.
In resolving the matter of the missing beastmen and bringing Memeriga to justice, you have truly gone above and beyond the call of duty.
column23: Our greatest victories are in the battles we need never fight. In working to build a lasting peace with the beastmen, you have prevented needless bloodshed and loss. You have done Ul'dah proud, <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/></If></If>.

column22: To think that even with my encyclopedic knowledge of sylphic customs, I was unable to prevent this horrible tragedy! For shame!
Thanks to you, the little ones have made their safe return to Little Solace, and so have I!
column23: Upon witnessing my return, Elder Frixio put his head in his hands and started crying. Clearly, my absence had taken quite the toll on his gentle heart.

column22: Walking one, listen! Little ones have gone missing from Little Solace! Elder one's wings are all aflutter! Whatever shall these ones do?
Steel ones, touched ones, stealing ones... Why can't every one just leave these ones alone!? These ones have never hurt any one!
Pshhh... For shhhame! What is a clutchfather that cannot protect his children!? I will come for you, Bouu, this I ssswear on my life!
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>... Wheresssoever you journey, you will always be one of the clutch. I am proud to call you <If(PlayerParameter(4))>daughter<Else/>ssson</If>.
Pshhh... You are shhhtrong, and we are honored to call you <If(PlayerParameter(4))>shhhpawnsister<Else/>shhhpawnbrother</If>. But if we are to survive, we must learn to defend ourshhhelves...
Pshhh... I would say it cannot be, but I saw it with my own eyeshhh! My clutchfather, defeated by a shhhorewalker! And I could do nothing to shhhave him!
column23: I must grow shhhtronger! Fashhhter! Shhhmarter! That I might protect my shhhpawnbrothers from those that would do them harm.

column22: Pshhh! The clutchfather inshhhtructs me in the ways of the shhhpear! I must grow shhhtrong, for one day I may father my own clutch.

Nothin' like a good mystery to get the blood boilin', eh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? That said, couldn't they 'ave taken one o' these laggards instead o' poor Bi Bi? As if that lass 'asn't suffered enough...
I 'eard all about yer clash with the kidnappers, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. To think that sorry ol' Gi Gu even managed to make 'imself useful for once.
column23: Course, since 'e got back to the dig, 'e's been slackin' off more than ever. An 'ero needs 'is beauty rest, 'e says.

column22: My poor, poor Bi Bi kidnapped─abducted, snatched, kidnapped! Whatever is Gi Gu to do!?
column23: I know! Gi Gu will give you golden squiggly-squirmies if you save Bi Bi. This is good deal, yes? Yes, yes, it is!

column22: Phew! Being a hero is hard work─grueling, punishing, hard! Gi Gu has earned himself a ten-year nap, if he does say so himself. And he does─yes, yes, he does!
This place, Ehcatl, is place for building dreams. Big dreams, Ehcatl Nine dream!
column23: But dreams alone do not give us wings. And so wings, we build. Wings to fly higher than any other! Squawwwk!

column22: Steal Ixali young, featherless neuker would!? Fly away in airship, flaunt wings we have not? Pay, neuker will, and pay in blood! Squawk! Squawwwk!
Squawwwk! True ally to Ehcatl Nine, you are. Cover you with feathers and change our name to Ehcatl Ten, Sezul would! Squawwwk!
column23: ...But already more than nine, Ehcatl Nine are. Changing name would only add to confusion. And so Ehcatl Nine we stay. Squawk!

column22: Would you care to see my latest designs? I'm currently working on a new lightweight hull that will have the vessel soaring higher and farther than ever!
column23: When I close my eyes, why, I can almost see Ayatlan peeking through the clouds!

column22: As an engineer, it pains me deeply to think that the fruit of my colleagues' labor and ingenuity is being employed in the doing of these terrible deeds.
column23: We must catch this villain, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, and see to it that he never sets foot on an airship again!

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I heard all about your triumph at the Invisible City. It is a testament to what can be accomplished with the power of friendship and mutual trust.
column23: Thanks to you, I made many new allies as well. Skaetswys, Voyce, Loonh Gah, and Silbexio... When the <Emphasis>Dezul Qualan</Emphasis> is complete, I would like nothing more than to reunite for a victory flight!

column22: To featherless <If(PlayerParameter(4))>craftswoman<Else/>craftsman</If>'s talents, much is owed. Squa-hawk! To Yazel, embodiment of ableness, you are!
Words to express my gratitude to no-feathers, I have not─only squaaawk! Soon, to Ehcatl Nine, even mighty Garuda will bow!

Sqwak! Higher and higher, Sezul's dream soars. Contributed to this dream, featherless one has. Money, time is, this one always says. Valuable indeed, featherless one's time in Ehcatl has proven. Sqwak! Sqwak!

Squawk! Many ingenious new developments, I have made! Much help, you have provided. Proved not only a capable <If(PlayerParameter(4))>craftswoman<Else/>craftsman</If>, but a friend to Ehcatl, you have. On behalf of all, our gratitude, I offer.

Caw! Honored, I am, to have featherless one work on <Emphasis>Dezul Qualan</Emphasis>. A new standard of excellence, you have set, for the crafters here at Ehcatl. Jealous, they may be, but learn a great deal, they will.
Squee-squee... Right to trust in you, Chief Totoloc was. Were it not for your aid, forever earthbound buzzards, we would be.
If the words of our kin are true, we face a foe who has achieved absolute martial perfection. And yet I have seen your strength as well, honored ally, and would place my trust in you.
column23: Know that when you stand before this foe on the battlefield, the Brotherhood will stand with you.

column22: Our foe's martial prowess was awe-inspiring─but he was but one, and the strength of one cannot stand against the strength of many.
column23: But let this not deter you from striving for the limits of martial perfection, honored ally. For a brotherhood is only as strong as its weakest link.

column22: A mortal foe of the Brotherhood is no more, and his company lies in shambles. Not only this, but Loonh Gah at long last has her long-sought vengeance.
column23: I have no words to express my gratitude, honored ally─but I am proud to call you one of the Brotherhood.

column22: Honored ally. Thanks to you and your friend, I have returned home to the Ring of Ash─and was not forced to smash the bones of any small men along the way.
Our foe is defeated, and our hatchlings returned to the safety of the Ring of Ash. But the great battle waged by our Brotherhood rages on. Your strength is always welcome here, honored ally.
Squawk! Ixali oaknot, featherless neuker carries? Make trade with you, this one will!
Currency of Ixal, oaknot is. Oaknot, you find? Trade, we will make─even with featherless neuker. Squawk!
The wonder to the east is the Gate of the Sultana, built after the Calamity. Such is the power of Ul'dah! And beyond lie the Steps of Nald.
Careful─have you not heard the expression, “an aurochs in Scorpion Crossing”? This is the hub of trade in these parts, and any baubles you break may cost you dear.
Are you for Horizon? Across the bridge over Nophica's Wells, the road continues─follow it northward.
Time was, trade caravans would roll from the Silver Bazaar way, chock-full o' merchandise. Place ain't what it used to be, though.
Welcome to Horizon, the hub of trade, the navel of commerce, the middle of─uh, the middle of it all! The gate you see before you is the eastern portal, the Sunrise Gate.
Horizon is just through the tunnel. If you've a full load, speak to someone from the camp about using the winch contraption.
Beyond here, you shall find loathing and fear aplenty: the fell creatures of Parata's Peace, and should you survive, an imperial outpost. May Thal guide and keep you from harm.
The residential district for adventurers─why, the Goblet's practically within swinging reach of this gate. The resident caretaker's the one to speak to if you've a nesting urge.
Welcome to Ul'dah! Step up, step through, and keep on moving, please. Just my luck to pull duty for the Gate of Nald─only the most trafficked gate in the city!
Every traveler is welcome in Ul'dah, just as every grain of sand has a place in the dune! Just through the Gate of Thal is the Sapphire Avenue Exchange, one of the greatest markets in all of Eorzea.
Ain't no days when Black Brush Station isn't busy. Steel, copper, iron─demand's grown higher 'n' higher since the Calamity. Wish I could say the same of my pay!
The eastward route follows the ol' Royal Allagan Sunway. Takes you all the way to the Black Shroud by way of Camp Drybone and Highbridge.
This is Camp Drybone, the watch and ward on the Royal Allagan Sunway. Right now, 'tis the Amalj'aa we keep an eye out and a sword close at hand for.
May Thal lift their burdens and dry their tears! Sometimes it is more than I can stand, to look upon those who seek out the church.
Go due east on the Royal Allagan Sunway for Highbridge, or take the trail that branches north for the Golden Bazaar. Whichever way you go, you'll likely meet a lizardman or two.
We've naught to fear so long as we've our captain─'specially not the Qiqirn, those egg-eatin' shrews!
Can't trust those rat bastards, you can't. There's been word of suspicious activity, which is why we were sent to guard Highbridge.
Got to look good for Captain Longhaft, don't we?
Don't you worry none about Highbridge. We're Brass Blades of the Orchid, handpicked by Captain Hunberct himself!
Prickly, those Ala Mhigans. Don't know if they came that way or if it's the Garlean trouble, but best to give them wide berth.
Why do I want to go home to Ul'dah? Let's see, the folk are too rustic by half, there are more peistes than pieshops, and lizardmen are aprowl just a stone's throw away.
What would an adventurer want in Little Ala Mhigo? Whatever or whoever brings you here, I suggest you conclude your business with some alacrity.
Last oasis for the killing malms ahead, my water-plump friend. Know it and know it well, if you've a mind to venture into the Sagolii.
A fine hunter is U'lamana, most fiiine. Not many among the U make my tail curl so.
You'll find Ulhuadshi easy to discern, I think. A chiefess among sandworms, she is larger than most and is a pleasing shade of rose red.
Tell me, what stands between Ul'dah and Garlemald? The Immortal Flames. When the Empire marches southward, let it enjoy the hospitality of Camp Bluefog first!
Amajina & Sons may own the Ceruleum Processing Plant, aye. But with forces of Garlemald encamped so close by, it falls upon the Immortal Flames to provide the necessary degree of protection.
Before us is Raubahn's Push, and on the other side lies Castrum Meridianum. Beware, for foes as well as friends patrol the field.
This is one of the gates of Gridania, the Blue Badger Gate. A wise novice knows not to wander too far beyond these portals...
Walk softly─there are fell creatures in these parts. Remember that the Central Shroud has two faces, depending on whether you remain above or take the Matron's Lethe to the Jadeite Thick below.
You are always welcome at Dunstan's Spire, humble as it is. Stay awhile and rest your weary feet.
I keep my eyes peeled for desertin' recruits, not beasties. We Wailers work our young ones hard, I'll cry that.
This ain't the entrance, adventurer. Come on through if you must, but watch for stray arrows, eh? Green recruits about.
Sure look fluffy. Bet they'd like being scratched...hey! I'm on duty here─go talk to someone else!
Chocobos are the key to supply transport, and Bentbranch Meadows raises a fine flock.
Going south? Be prepared to fight─and to run. Some beasts that cannot be overcome can still be outrun.
I love the view of the Mirror from here. The bustle of folk, the tranquility of the water... Dear would I sell my life to protect this.
An adventurer, by the look of you. Smells sweet, does it not? Sweetbloom Pier it's called, and not for nothing.
Go east and you'll find less agreeable company─the sylphs. Stay well away unless you've good reason to see them.
Welcome! Welcome to the gracious Hawthorne Hut─not that it's mine to welcome you to, ha, far from it! Master Hawthorne is within, if you've a mind to speak to him.
Saw that ruin to the north, did you? Was a watchtower once, aye. Master Buscarron manned the ramparts there when he was a raw recruit.
Nobody's turned away from Buscarron's Druthers, not even lawbreakers and poachers. So long as you raise no hand 'gainst another within these walls, you're welcome at the Druthers!
An adventurer, eh? Well met! Hang up your cloak and wet your whistle─we'll keep watch for any beasties.
An adventurer. Ah. I've no objection to you staying in Quarrymill, but I won't countenance any...distress caused to the locals or elementals.
There's rich soil and plentiful water in Quarrymill. Trees do well here, aye─you will have heard of the orchards in these parts.
Even the bounty of the forest has its limits. To loot it for your own gains is to court the wrath of the elementals...
Does the sight shock you? You should have seen it before the Calamity. Sweet land, it was.
The plants and animals of Rootslake, you'll find nowhere else. Magnificent, this place, and terrible...
The wet and the stink─it's like living in a cheesemonger's sock. Worst. Assignment. Ever.
Take the Lumberline due north through the forest and she'll take you to Gridania...eventually.
This is the Yellow Serpent Gate, raised after the Calamity to serve as a new portal to Gridania.
Uh, if you'd be so kind as to not go poking into things? Training's a delicate time for chocobos.
You can't be too careful of Ixal around here. It wouldn't take much more than a well-aimed peck to take Hyrstmill, when it comes down to it.
Here I stand watch but...if one of those things out there decides to come calling, ain't much I can do by myself.
Part of our job's keeping the beasts of Alder Springs away from Gridania. 'Tis a mucky job, but someone's got to do it.
Make good use of the aetheryte, now. These broken lands are well loved by the most savage of creatures.
If it's Coerthas you're wanting to reach, just follow the road westward. Ware the cold─don't say I didn't warn you.
This is Fallgourd Float, the hamlet built right on the waters of a lake. Many a jape's been made on the matter, you can be sure.
The birdmen are too familiar a sight for comfort these days. Whatever they're planning, we'd better find out quick...
This here's the Zephyr Gate, the great threshold to Limsa Lominsa! Wind to dry the sweat on our brows, and cool the fever o' journey, eh? Eh? Ha!
Felt the wind that comes in from Moraby Bay, did ye? Fit to hull chestnuts! No wonder the gate back there's called the Tempest Gate.
Oschon's Embrace's still under construction, no sense looking accusing about it. It'll take you across all the same, so just count your blessings.
All along the shoreline here, there's a sight to write home about. Shards of the false moon Dalamud, that's how it happened.
column23: They say it was a rain of fire. The sea boiled off in moments and left those pillars of salt...

column22: Uh, the new crafter, are you? No!? What are you, then, a stevedore? A─oh. Beg pardon, adventurer!
Just through the gate is Mist, a residential area for adventurers built on the orders of Admiral Merlwyb herself.
Guard duty's dull duty... Good coin, though. Could say it's golden duty, can't ye? Gil makes all the difference, it does.
Blue skies, cascade of flowers, colors of the tropics... They say Master Gegeruju paid a pretty penny indeed for this view!
I volunteered to guard the beach and which beach do they send me to? Not the one with frolicking danseuses, oh no. Instead, I get to watch crabs scuttle.
You are in Wineport, under the protection of the Maelstrom! Identify yourself!
column23: No imperial forces shall pass by trick or force! Adventurers, however, are to be allowed through!

column22: Not much to see around here except the aetheryte. Don't know why they bothered to put one in a half-dead hamlet like Swiftperch.
Smell that? There's some fine ale being poured as we speak. Would go down well right about now.
Sahagin to the west, kobolds to the north─that's our sworn duty, to be a shield of Aleport against the beastmen. That, and dealing with mean drunks...
Outside the seawall, the Sahagin rule. Grabbed themselves more territory in the aftermath of the Calamity, damn their eyes.
column23: If the seawall's breached, they can come ashore in force. And that, the Maelstrom can't allow. Not today and not tomorrow!

column22: If you've an itch to go west of the wall, ask the medic for some unguent. There's nothing but fishbacks and death out there. Of course, some folk go for that sort of thing.
The healing baths here in Camp Bronze Lake date back to ancient Nym. You are welcome to soak the body and ease the mind─but not to bump and grind!
This is no place for a pleasure tour, outlander! The Observatorium is key to Ishgard's defense, and the Dravanians know it well.
That ravine once held a griffin's roost, you know. The nest is long gone, but Griffin Crossing marks the place. You'll find the bridge to the southeast, though it be impassable.
Camp Dragonhead welcomes all who would stand with House Fortemps─even a lowly adventurer.
A post by the fire makes sentry duty go faster. So warm. Like goose down and...and... Ahem! I am alert, alert I say!
Nothing but trouble and toil ahead, you know. Natalan crawls with Ixal, the Ogre's Belly has the worst sort of voidsent...and there're bedbugs in the barracks.
Conversation is an indulgence unbecoming the protectors of Ishgard. Never shall I drop my guard, for Dravanians and unbelievers rest not in their connivance.
I regard the scarred hulk of the Stone Vigil and wonder: how long must we sing this song, wait for this victory? A century...or two...? I pray it comes soon.
Our enemies lack nothing in ferity, whether they be mere dragonfly or thrustaevis─but we lack all caution. That is our strength, and their undoing.
You're home, adventurer, when you're in Revenant's Toll! There's both rest and work aplenty, courtesy of the Adventurers' Guild!
Sentry duty on the other side's a lark, but the Garlean outpost is on <Emphasis>this</Emphasis> side of the Toll. Always a bit too glad to see the end of the shift, know what I mean?
Adventuring and sentry duty sometimes don't mix. Every time I catch a glimpse of the Crystal Tower, all I can think is “How do I get inside?”
At Master Alphinaud's request, the Maelstrom has taken measures to deter any further exploration of the caverns beneath Castrum Occidens.
column23: So long as the castrum remains, however, we must keep watch for signs of imperial activity.

column22: Have a care when exploring the southern reaches of Alder Springs. Though I understand the desire to examine that massive structure up close, the surrounding area is rife with lumbering golems.

It is fortunate that no imperial forces bar your path into this fragment of Dalamud, but do not underestimate the dangers that lurk without. As for the dangers that lie within, I have little insight or advice to offer beyond the painfully obvious: prepare for the worst.
I know not what occurred within the fragment, but Lady Alisaie appeared most troubled upon her return. I will, of course, attend to her as best I can, but your aid should be welcome as well.
'Tis a burden to know what others cannot, to be unable to rejoice in our accomplishments. Yet I understand the reasons why.
column23: For what it is worth, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>, thank you. For Lady Alisaie, for her family...thank you.

column22: Quite a dazzling array of wares, wouldn't you say?
column23: Ever since you helped us bring an end to the ambushes and lure the Homunculi back to Gridania for good, the gil's been flowing in like a waterfall.
column24: But I didn't get to where I am today by resting on my laurels. Should you hear of any promising business ventures, you know where to find me!

column22: Greetings, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. Shall I show you inside?
Heretics, Dravanians─old, familiar enemies. This is something beyond all imagination.
So another caravan has been waylaid by the followers of Iceheart─a name which has reached my ears many times of late.
My knowledge of primals pales in comparison to your own. Nevertheless, the circumstances surrounding this particular summoning are...unique, no?
column23: 'Twould be most unfortunate if they were reproduced, I should think.

column22: One tailors their tactics to the enemy─in our case, Dravanians. Primals will require a somewhat different approach.
'Twould be foolish to dismiss alternative approaches when contending with such clever foes...
I think we can all agree that a formidable foe demands a calculated response.
Some still think these heretics do not pose a great threat. The slain House Fortemps knights would surely beg to differ.
'Twas less a wall and more a sieve, considering how many tunnels we discovered.
Do not your Braves hail from all across Eorzea? Why then did you choose to bring southrons to the highlands?
This is no place for a son of the sand! I tell you, if a merchant offered me wools at a premium, I would be fair tempted.
'Tis not a matter of training your eyes, I fear. Without foreknowledge or serendipity, we will never find every tunnel.
column23: The very land conspires against us─the broken ice ever reforming to conceal the entrances.

column22: 'Tis not as if I do not understand. In my youth, more than once did I find myself pressing forward, neglecting to pay sufficient heed to those around me. Let us hope that Alphinaud shows greater sense.
The Gates of Judgement have been opened but a crack. It will take considerable effort to see them flung wide once more.
Louisoix understood the risks inherent in summoning a higher power─but does Iceheart, I wonder?
column23: Salvation at the cost of your soul is anything but...

column22: Moenbryda is a brilliant and dedicated scholar. I would not have endorsed her plan were it not so.
The events of recent days have placed a terrible strain on us all. Ever more keenly do I feel the weight of responsibility upon my breast.
Eline, what have you done...?
How are we to know the unknowable─to comprehend the unfathomable? The one true god, the fallen lord among wyrms...even Mother Hydaelyn. Inscrutable entities, all, far beyond our ken.
A dazzling floral arrangement, each blossom a peerless beauty in her own right. Ahhh, the blessing─and the burden─of an overactive imagination.
Hm hm. Condemn refugees to death... Wait a minute, that's not right.
...In which event we must guide them to Little Ala Mhigo, else we condemn them to certain death─ Yda, what did I just tell you?
Yes, yes─'twould be foolish to sacrifice nutrition for flavor...
The inaugural ceremony was a tad premature, but rest assured that soon you will witness the power of Eorzea's new vanguard.
Uwaaah! From invoices to petitions to... It's a <Emphasis>war</Emphasis>, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. That desk is my front line...and I fear I have been overrun.
If Higiri and our more skilled culinarians worked closely together, I daresay they could create extraordinary dishes sure to satisfy Eorzean and Doman alike.
Look forward, never back. Devote yourself only to the present. This is what I've learned from the Domans.
Those azure uniforms are really rather striking, but I think I shall remain a Scion for the nonce. These walls have become my home, and the Scions my family.
column23: Besides, I'm not sure blue is really my color. The green in my cassock brings out my eyes, just as Hoary's breeches bring out the red in his.

column22: Where have those younglings disappeared to? Making the most of their newfound freedom, no doubt.
Many of my countrymen are skilled with bow or blade. I have made it my mission to rally those with such talents to the Braves' cause. I only hope we can be of some small assistance.

In traditional Doman cuisine, we strive for perfect balance, not only of flavor and texture, but also of nutrition. For a meal to be truly satisfying, it must nourish the body as well as delight the senses.
By a stroke of luck, Ephemie and I have been placed in the selfsame unit. As comrades-in-arms, we shall fight...for the freedom of all! Gods, I never tire of saying our words!

My heart was set on the 1st Unit, which answers directly to Captain Ilberd, but I have been assigned to the 2nd instead. I'd be lying if I said I wasn't disappointed, but you can be certain that, no matter where I am, I will do my utmost to bring honor to my uniform.
Ballads of bloody battles, valiant knights, heroic sacrifice... Trite fare, but who am I to question the preferences of Ishgardian noblewomen?
If you're going to be such a stickler for details, why not write it yourself!?
We cannot send this to Gridania! The figures are all wrong! And for the love of the Twelve, you misspelled the Elder Seedseer's name!
The key to successful negotiations is discerning the other party's motives─and the key to <Emphasis>that</Emphasis> is a comprehensive understanding of circumstances past and present.
...But if I <Emphasis>were</Emphasis> to become successful, the rewards would far exceed anything I could ever earn as a miner...

The fortunes of a songstress rise and fall with the whims of the crowd. Earning the favor of a wealthy patron or two might ameliorate the risk, 'tis true, but such relationships carry risks of their own...

Lady Tataru asked me to accompany her on her latest mining expedition—as a guard, you understand. But the moment she set eyes on that cobra, she ran back at full pelt. It was all I could do to keep up. Do I truly inspire so little confidence...?
Forgive me, but I cannot talk at the moment. I am in the midst of meditations to fortify my aetheric flow.
Domans fighting alongside the Crystal Braves? I wager there will be no shortage of volunteers eager to exact vengeance on our common foe.
We honed our skills in the fight to protect our country. Though our land may be lost, our people abide! We must unite against the Empire—let them see that Doma is not so easily defeated!
Their expertise in covert operations would serve them well in the battle against the Empire, it is true. And yet, I cannot help but shrink from this talk of more fighting...
Oh, hello there! Most everyone is out and about. No need for me to stay shackled to my desk...right?
The games children and adults play are not so different, really. The alliances, the betrayals, the naive wants and the petty hatreds...
column23: And therein lies the trouble: knowing when you have stepped beyond the boundaries of one world into the next.

column22: I had heard tales of the Doman shinobi, but to witness their powers firsthand... The speed of their attacks is bewildering!
I never thought I would fear for my life in a simple training exercise. These Domans are skilled indeed, and motivated to boot!
It has been many moons since last I trained with live steel, but it is only with true risk that one gains true reward.
Hoary Boulder and Coultenet have kindly agreed to assist us in our training. Soldiers...to your marks!
Does it surprise you to see me wielding these blades? You'll find my skills in the kitchen serve me more than well enough on the battlefield!
Mayhap I ought to delve into Ishgardian doctrine...appeal to her traditional values or some such? Hmmm... Where is that damned hymnal...
Just so you know, we're running low on parchment.
Confound it, Yda! His name is <Emphasis>Aymeric</Emphasis>! A-Y-M-E-R-I-C! Write it again!
Research into Ishgardian scripture has yielded little of value. That is, unless you've an interest in learning new epithets for Shiva.
column23: “Vile witch”...“traitorous heathen”...“mother of heresy”...“dragon whore”... Need I go on?

column22: I do so enjoy singing, but everything else she describes sounds rather trying.
No woman lacking in passion, dedication, or talent has ever been deemed a songstress.
column23: Ascilia did not lack for talent, but her interests lay elsewhere from an early age...

column22: Sparring with the Domans has lit a fire in my belly! I must redouble my efforts to hone both arm and eye—next time, they won't have it so easy!
This Doman art of ninjutsu is truly fascinating. The mudra they weave together must entail some manner of aetheric manipulation. That would make it nothing less than a novel form of magic!
Did you hear the news? It seems that more of our people have managed to escape Doma by ship. We can only pray for their safety...
They say that Doman steel is never blunted. It is time the Empire was made to understand that. The rallying of our scattered comrades may be the first step in achieving this goal.
The Empire can take our land, but they will never crush our spirit!
Yes, but─ Higiri, you're not─ you're missing the point! The individual doesn't matter. It was a <Emphasis>team</Emphasis> effort, and <Emphasis>I</Emphasis> was the one who...who...
Mwahahaha! I could do this all day! A-L-L-D-A-Y!
(She...she cannot seriously be considering it? Life as a street performer should be one's last resort, not their <Emphasis>first</Emphasis>!)
Tataru has grown beyond childish fantasies of becoming a songstress. Now she aspires to be...to be a legendary street performer.

Steady... Steady...!
Not bad, eh? With a little more practice, I could earn a fortune at the Ruby Road Exchange!
Hah hah hah! A rousing tale of a comrade's valor! Truly, we are fortunate to count Lady Yugiri a friend.
Hoo! Hah! Uaaargh! I cannot...go on...much longer...!
Strength, Hoary! On your honor as a Scion, I forbid you to surrender!
I must admit, this exercise of yours never fails to amuse me. While its movements appear comical, it does seem to be having the desired effect.
It's a battle of wills! A struggle for supremacy! Our fighting styles may differ, but this unyielding spirit is the same in warriors the world over!
Thancred's tales of Lady Yugiri almost beggar belief! My heart is fair fit to burst from admiration!
I shall pray for your safe return, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Yours and the others.
Over the years I've learned that it is better to busy yourself with things you can control rather than worry about things you cannot.
column23: A hot meal will be waiting for you when you return. Understood?

column22: It falls to you and I, Coultenet, to ensure those imperial dogs set no foot in the Rising Stones. The tragedy of the Waking Sands must never be repeated!
Quite right, Hoary. Yet I fear we two alone could not resist a full-scale assault. Mayhap we had best draft a plan of evacuation, should the worst come to the worst...
My father has agreed to take care of Yozan for me. The children need role models, and we must do whatever is in our power to provide them.
I am ready... Hozan, are your preparations complete?
Doware and Hozan are about to take up their posts. It seems even the children are starting to understand the gravity of the situation.
Hey... Hey... I jus' gotta say... Yer a─hic─a pretty─hic─a... A... Yer all right.
What you two do is your own business. Don't say I didn't warn you!
I do not fault Ser Aymeric for being less than forthcoming with his beliefs. Not even the highborn are beyond the reach of the inquisition.
True, young leaders can be more amenable to new ideas. Then again, their lack of experience and influence can hinder their ability to enact reforms.
Trying to tumble the <Emphasis>table</Emphasis> now, are we? Don't give up yet, boy! Yda! Line 'em up!
There's little fortune and far less fame in being a receptionist. But one must be realistic!
column23: ...Also, it would seem that I was grossly misinformed regarding the average earnings of a street performer.

column22: Ah, forgive me, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>... I thought I had prepared enough meals for everyone, but the others were most hungry...
Calm yourshelf, Coultenet! It'sh jusht a little ship after practish... Clearsh out the cobwebsh no end!
A sip before practice, a sip after practice, and all too often a sip <Emphasis>during</Emphasis> practice! I do believe Moenbryda is having quite the bad influence on you.
Our stocks of wine have nearly run dry. That Sharlayan scholar is drinking us out of house and home!
<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>! 'Tis always a pleasure! In Gridania for the Alliance meeting, I presume? So am I!
My fellow 2nd Unit Braves and I are here to provide additional security during the Alliance meeting, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>sir</If>!
I'm here on special security detail. And by “special,” I mean “dull as hells.” Nary a soul comes through this gate. <yawn>
We Braves're meant to be forerunners for a united Grand Company. Sounds impressive, aye, but guard duty's guard duty, no matter how fancy yer duds look.
We 2nd Unit Braves are in Gridania on special security detail. Any suspicious activity will be swiftly nipped in the bud!
Hear ye, hear ye! The Continental Circus is in town! Steel yourself for a pants-soilingly terrifying All Saints' Wake experience!
Ah, if it isn't my favorite adventurer. Thanks again for helping us here in Gridania. If you're not busy, I'd appreciate it if you could lend a hand to the festivities elsewhere as well.
I'm given to understand that the parade in Ul'dah was a resounding success. Then why is it still so...peaceful?
Did you know? The warding lanterns are crafted in the likeness of the Great Gourd, the archfiend who is said to appear during All Saints' Wake. You learn something new every day, eh?
I hadn't reckoned on the lanterns getting removed. And I poured my heart and soul into them... <sigh>
My fellow troupe members report that the parade in Ul'dah was a runaway success. If only my lanterns weren't thrown out, we might all be celebrating right now... <sigh>
This All Saints' Wake, the Continental Circus is hosting a splendidly spooky parade right here in Ul'dah! Participation is open to everyone with a penchant for having fun and making mischief!
The charm will take effect any moment now, I'm sure of it. Like...<Emphasis>now</Emphasis>!
column23: ...Or not? Well, worrying my little wings over it won't make it happen any faster. I'll just keep on hosting the parade in the meantime.

column22: If you come into any demonic cookies, be sure to bring them to me. I'll furnish you with fabulous All Saints' Wake-themed prizes in return!
Rorojaru's renounced the pursuit of profit─he pitched up at the guild to seek schooling as a fledgling fisherman. Am I right in reckoning he surrendered that star–spangled subligar to you?
column23: If so, I've a word of warning: be wary of wearing it in the water. The fish flock to bask in its brilliance, and the buggers'll bite.

column22: To confront Iceheart once more, with full knowledge of her talents... My friend, I am truly grateful for everything you have done, as is every man with knowledge of your deeds.
column23: Would that every Ishgardian could know. Yet even Master Alphinaud agrees that some tales are too dangerous to spread.

column22: My analysis of the specimen continues. What happened to those pirates in Sastasha is quite fascinating...from a purely <Emphasis>scientific</Emphasis> standpoint, of course.
Ah, it's grand to have cause to ply my trade again! I'll work twice as hard as ever to make Hihira's dreams come true─and if I earn a few gil for myself along the way, well, what's the harm in that?
Hm, not too bad, are they? The twins, I mean. Well, you're not dead and you're not weeping, are you? I'd call that a win.
column23: Truth be told, it's the odd ones you remember most fondly. That's what makes it an adventure, aye. A touch of danger in everything, even the client...

column22: Reyner and I, we've known each other since I was first starting out as a culinarian. We hardly see each other these days, though.
column23: I've invited him here a bunch of times, but the man's married to his duty─“another time,” he always tells me. If he ever manages to pay me visit, though, you can be sure I'll whip him up a meal fit for royalty.

column22: The White Rams <Emphasis>hunt</Emphasis> the Ixal─we live to spring on the little birds and snap their wee necks! If those whose lives I once spared even <Emphasis>think</Emphasis> of setting foot in the Twelveswood again, they'll answer to meow!
column23: ...Answer to meow. To <Emphasis>meeeeeeow</Emphasis>. Aaargh! I'll kill them, alright!?

column22: I shan't lie, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, the going is slow, and I've barely enough help to brew remedy for all the sick here.
column23: Still, I feel I've taken a step on the road towards saving the ailing─and if my father can be persuaded to walk it beside me, all the better.

column22: Always regretted never sayin' good-bye to Myrtha. Ain't many who find them they lost, an' I'm lucky to have learned she's alive.
column23: So, I've decided to share my good fortune, by givin' the money left over from our ceruleum venture to the refugee children. Maybe their smiles'll turn some bad folk good, eh?

column22: Do you know how much I lost speculating on those blasted rumors? If ever I hear the word ceruleum again, it will be too soon... <sniffle>

My dear <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, Syntgoht's Sundries has survived the ceruleum crash─in no small part due to your patronage. I do hope your employer sold his futures before the prices came tumbling down.
Ye lookin' to head inside?
All day, every day, we toil here at the docks, with naught but the sound of pounding hammers to mark the passage of time. If you've any tall tales to share, I'd be glad for the diversion.
How're you finding the job, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>? I've been so long a shipwright now that I twirl a hammer far better than I ever did the shortblades...

Hither comes the tamer of the terrible─and toothsome─Nepto Dragon! You are an authority among anglers, upon this all are agreed, but if you would fain fish at the forefront forever, never must you rest your reel-hand!
Say what you want about our many-faced thief, he hasn't lost his flair for the dramatic. With these promises of justice, doubtless he's won over a whole new legion of fans.
column23: Did you know that the <Emphasis>Mythril Eye</Emphasis> sometimes gets fan letters addressed to the many-faced thief? Just goes to show how my articles have won over the hearts of the people!
column24: Now, as much as I'd love to stand here and chat all <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>night<Else/>day</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>night</If></If>, I've got some relics to research!

column22: Would it kill them to station me a few yalms closer to the action? Gods forbid I actually get to <Emphasis>enjoy</Emphasis> the tourney after all my hard work...
Since the day I became a shinobi, my every action has been dictated by one mission or another.
column23: Now there is no duty that calls me. At first, the freedom was overwhelming.
column24: But I have found peace with it. I will take the time to see the world, and honor the memory of my fallen comrades...

column22: The heretics' aggression grows by leaps and bounds, but we of House Fortemps are not wont to cower behind our walls.
Is it true? The heretics...they <Emphasis>summoned</Emphasis> Shiva? And you laid her low? Fury take me...
Aye, it's past time we take the fight to the heretics! Why it's taken so long, I don't even know.
I heard about Snowcloak─what you faced there, I mean. I'm glad you're on our side, Scion.
Lookin' to join us in the shadows, are ye? Bene luck to ye, then.
The name's Bochard. I might be the eldest rogue left standin', but I'm happy to leave the guildmasterin' to young Jacke.
column23: I won't be givin' ye jobs or aught like that, but I can learn ye a thing or two about twirlin' them stabbers. All in good time, though, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>dove<Else/>colt</If>, all in good time.

column22: All right, then, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>dove<Else/>colt</If>? I expect ye've mastered the first step in the dance o' daggers, have ye? Aye, the Spinnin' Edge.
column23: Simple, direct, an' sets ye up for a fierce Gust Slash. That's where ye spin yer leg around quick enough to whip up a wind...then dart in to stick yer mark while he's wonderin' where that breeze come from.

column22: All right, then, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>dove<Else/>colt</If>? I see ye've been coatin' yer blades with venom. Aye, ye'll have an easier time millin' a cull what's been weakened by yer tainted cuts.
column23: Don't get too comfortable usin' just one type, though, eh? A proper dimber damber uses the right tool for the right job.

column22: All right, then, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>dove<Else/>colt</If>? I hear ye can swing them stabbers now like they was part o' yer daddles. A rogue strikes from the darkmans, aye, but for some marks ye need to go toe-to-toe.
column23: Once a cull's set to drop, though, don't be afeared to jump in for the mill. I never had a whid for me finishin' blow, but the young colts like to call that move “Assassinate.”

column22: All right, then, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>dove<Else/>colt</If>? I hear Jacke learned ye how to Mug a cove. Ah, that skill were more valued in the days when they called us Upright Thieves...
column23: Pirates was proper stubborn back then, see, an' ye had to know how to prise bitten goods from their cold bloody daddles.

column22: All right, then, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>dove<Else/>colt</If>? Not neglectin' yer Trick Attack, are ye? Click a cull from an angle where he don't see it comin' an' ye can save yerself a longer scrap.
column23: Aye, it's a dirty move, but a cove don't concern <If(PlayerParameter(4))>herself<Else/>himself</If> with “fair” when <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she's<Else/>he's</If> aimin' to get a job done.

column22: All right, then, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>dove<Else/>colt</If>? Whid 'round the guild says you was in on the job what saved half the bloody city from slidin' into the sea. Don't reckon there's aught this old cove has left to teach ye...
column23: Ye've learned all me dance steps, an' it's up to you how ye string 'em together. Hells, I expect the next time ye walk in, ye'll have a lesson or two for me!

column22: When Master Mutamix first showed me materia, he lit a fire within me. Imagine─all the spiritual energy swirling about the realm, harnessed in physical form! What awe-inspiring power!
column23: Yes, yesss, I shall become Master Mutamix's right hand, and learn all the secrets of materia! <Emphasis>All</Emphasis>, you hear me!

column22: Ah, the day I become Master Mutamix's right hand is nigh! All that bars the way to my rightful place is Hubairtin.
column23: But <Emphasis>his</Emphasis> days as the Bonfire's genius are numbered. In this game of materia we play, I shall be victorious!

column22: Where've they gotten─ Oi! What're you looking at?
Oh, hello there. We're just watching over our cart.
Only dockhands are authorized to enter the storehouse. Be on your way.
Welcome back, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. You may enter.

Pray do not mind me, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>─I'm just here to ensure that everything proceeds smoothly.
...You look positively <If(PlayerParameter(4))>radiant<Else/>dashing</If>, by the way!
