Ring the eternity bell should you wish to proceed to the next stage of the ceremony. Until that time, the floor is yours, and yours alone.
They say that even Daelic the Bold trembled when he received his Crown of Thorns from the Warden after the Battle of the Thirteen Bends, so I can only imagine the anxiety in your hearts here today.
I can think of, oh, at least <Emphasis>one</Emphasis> thing you'd be better off doing now than exchanging witty banter with a choir moogle, kupo.
ExChAnGe YoUr ☆FaLlEn StArS☆ hErE. SpEaK wItH tHe ☆StArLiGhT cElEbRaTiOn CrIeR☆ iF yOu ReQuIrE aDdItIoNaL fEsTiVaL iNfOrMaTiOn.

Good <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morrow</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If>, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>m'lady<Else/>m'lord</If>. I am here to investigate the popular perception of sheep in the Gridanian psyche, to see how best they might one day take their rightful place as lord and protector of the forest.
column23: Mayhap it is because I am a stranger here, but the people of this land seem singularly uninterested in engaging with my survey. <sigh> It is most dispiriting...

column22: Since I learned the traveling trader would not be bringing the good news to Gridania, I have tried to spread word of the lamb's deeds myself, but these woodsmen do all but stopple their ears to me. I am starting to believe the sheep is simply not in their blood.
column23: They claim that a flock of lambs would gnaw the roots of their beloved trees, and “anger the elementals,” of all things... Still, I will not let their rustic superstitions hold me back. Where there is a will, there is a way!

column22: <cough> <cough> Pardon me. The fleece on my helm seems to soak up the dust, and then drop it in my face. The Force will need regular shearing if it is to succeed in Thanalan...
column23: But tell me, adventurer: are you a sheep fancier? I mean no offense by it─I am one myself. Should you be interested in learning more about sheep, please speak with my superior, the hitsuji bugyo. You will find him in Limsa Lominsa, leading the Heavensturn festivities.

column22: It is only a matter of time before the Brass Blades make contact, and I make my very first sale. They'll be here soon... Any moment now...
column23: ...Why do they not contact me!? Do you think I should go to them? No, no─remember what they told you at Blade headquarters: “Don't call on us, we'll call on you.”

column22: I have come from the Far East, to show you La Nosceans how to celebrate Heavensturn. I must admit, I braced myself for pirates and cutpurses, but find myself most braced by this refreshing sea air!
column23: And yet, how doubly stimulating it would be if this air resounded with the bleating of sheep! Do you not agree, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>m'lady<Else/>m'lord</If>?

column22: Word of your victory travels fast, comrade. Each boat that sets in from Aleport brings fresh whisperings of the sheep that brought peace to the town. Gossip has it that even the boot-faced father has been able to hold the baby without triggering another downpour.
column23: But if the mother and father both have their hands full with the child, how do they propose to spread word of the Fleece Force? These people and their priorities, I tell you!

column22: The entire staff of <Emphasis>The Raven</Emphasis> stands in support of the Adventurers' Guild and its marvelous Starlight Celebration! Show your Starlight spirit, and contribute in any way you can!
I hear you have pledged to assist the celebrant with the running of the Starlight Celebration. As a professional journalist I feel qualified to say that's wonderful news!
I hope you are enjoying the celebration! May the magical atmosphere fill your spirit with boundless Starlight cheer!
I know only too well how that poor child must be feeling. There must be something we can do...

Allow me to once more express my gratitude, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. For your tireless efforts, and for restoring young Timothey's sense of wonder and joy, I thank you on behalf of all the saint's little helpers.

Welcome back to the Thaumaturges' Guild, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Do not fear─I bear you no ill will for investigating the allegations against me. Rather, I thank you for absolving me of any suspicion of wrongdoing.
column23: I am currently collating the evidence regarding my ability to divine a man's capabilities: the notes I made upon first meeting each initiate, and those made over the courses of their careers─some long, some short. I shall be taking a keen interest in your own progress.

column22: One...one day at a time. That's the only way we can live, isn't it? Live...and try to do better.
I do wish my son could pursue his dreams... Yet I cannot help but fear what will become of him after I am gone.
Have ye come for books? Or are ye just here to sniff about G'jusana!?
It ain't like to be easy, but I'll make G'jusana a free woman again, so I will!
There is always more left to learn, my friend. After all, he who strives to better his craft grows through greater challenge.
ExChAnGe YoUr ☆FaLlEn StArS☆ hErE. SpEaK wItH tHe ☆StArLiGhT cElEbRaTiOn CrIeR☆ iF yOu ReQuIrE aDdItIoNaL fEsTiVaL iNfOrMaTiOn.
ExChAnGe YoUr ☆FaLlEn StArS☆ hErE. SpEaK wItH tHe ☆StArLiGhT cElEbRaTiOn CrIeR☆ iF yOu ReQuIrE aDdItIoNaL fEsTiVaL iNfOrMaTiOn.
ExChAnGe YoUr ☆FaLlEn StArS☆ hErE. SpEaK wItH tHe ☆StArLiGhT cElEbRaTiOn CrIeR☆ iF yOu ReQuIrE aDdItIoNaL fEsTiVaL iNfOrMaTiOn.
ExChAnGe YoUr ☆FaLlEn StArS☆ hErE. SpEaK wItH tHe ☆StArLiGhT cElEbRaTiOn CrIeR☆ iF yOu ReQuIrE aDdItIoNaL fEsTiVaL iNfOrMaTiOn.
ExChAnGe YoUr ☆FaLlEn StArS☆ hErE. SpEaK wItH tHe ☆StArLiGhT cElEbRaTiOn CrIeR☆ iF yOu ReQuIrE aDdItIoNaL fEsTiVaL iNfOrMaTiOn.
Another storm has come and gone. These moments of peace never last long though, do they?
I am painfully aware of the hypocrisy of our request, and the self-inflicted nature of our predicament.
column23: But should it serve to deliver my people from their unkind fate, gladly shall I bow my head and beg for aid. I expect─nay, welcome─the coming storm of scorn and disdain.

column22:
Nidhogg...
<Emphasis>He</Emphasis> is the source of our suffering. If we do not fell the wyrm, these endless clashes count for naught.
If Marshal Tarupin is to be believed, the smallfolk will not be so easily deceived. At the very least, it should be safe for the Warrior of Light to travel with impunity.
column23: We must not give in to despair, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. We will prevail. The dawn's light will shine again...

column22: No matter how long it takes, I have faith we will find the others! With Lady Yugiri's shinobi, Urianger's intelligence, and my...versatility, there's nothing we cannot do!

The <Emphasis>Agrius</Emphasis> is a wonder to behold, but even that miracle of engineering was humbled by the mighty Midgardsormr. I've lost count of the hours I've spent gazing upon this deadly embrace, imagining the titanic contest that led to their mutual demise...
I keep telling the grown-ups that we're adventurers now, but they still won't let us out to explore. They say it's “too dangerous.”
column23: We'll just have to show them what the Doman Braves are capable of...

column22:
La-la-lah! La-di-dah-di-dah!♪
A child's joy will always brighten your day!♪
I'll show you a smile if you're happy to pay!♪
column23: Did that sound right? Tataru has been teaching me traditional Ul'dahn rhyming songs. The children of Ul'dah seem to spend an awful lot of time thinking about money...

column22: I like going to visit Rowena─she always has lots of interesting things in her store. Sometimes, though, I wonder why she needs to stock so much junk. ...Well, that's what it looks like to me, anyway!
I'm buying herbs to make into poultices. People are always getting hurt around here, you see, and you can never have enough medicine. A Doman Brave is always prepared!
Have you witnessed the scene over yonder? Such is the fate of he who would toy with women's hearts. Let us see how Thancred's silver tongue wags its way out of this one...
In Doma, fidelity is a highly prized virtue. Perhaps it is a difference in culture, but this...situation lies outside my comprehension.

Our every waking moment is consumed with the search for a viable means by which the Ascians might truly be destroyed.  While our efforts are thus occupied, I am certain Alphinaud will appreciate any support you can offer the Crystal Braves.

When first we laid the foundations, never did I imagine that we would receive an Ishgardian envoy here at the Rising Stones. 'Tis a refreshing reminder of how the world we take for granted can shift so quickly and completely...
I pray that Moenbryda's experiments will soon support the possibilities inherent in her theories...
We shall press onwards, as we have always done─I will not squander the sacrifices of our fallen friends by surrendering to a paralysis born of fear.
We have had reports from a number of frontier settlers... 'Twould seem the dragons have come as far as Mor Dhona.

'Tis impossible to predict how many will rally to Ishgard's call for reinforcements...
I do not envy those responsible for planning the city's defense.
You are a welcome sight, as always, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I thank the Twelve not only for Ishgard's salvation, but also your safe return.
When one is in need of precious commodities, it helps to have friends in the right places. Fortunately, I am well acquainted with the charming daughter of a successful Ul'dahn import merchant.
We needed a rare ore to modify the white auracite, and Thancred solved the problem using only his linkpearl. I mean, it's great and everything, but where's the fun in that...?
Moenbryda has charged us with acquiring some rather esoteric manuscripts, but I'm afraid the task is proving to be nigh impossible...
When the city of learning was abandoned, a great many tomes were scattered and lost. How smoothly our research might proceed were we able to peruse the archives of yesteryear.

These two have been telling me stories about the corrupted crystal formations that appeared following the Calamity. I'll need more data before I can draw a conclusion, but I'm intrigued by the potential of their untapped energies.
Hello, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Are you sleeping well? You must be absolutely <Emphasis>exhausted</Emphasis> from saving the realm on a daily basis!
Ever since Moenbryda arrived, the Rising Stones has been buzzing with excited energy. I must admit, her enthusiasm <Emphasis>is</Emphasis> rather contagious.
We were but stripling adventurers the night we saw fire rain from the sky and a pillar of light scorch the heavens. What a sight that was, eh, Coultenet?

Hoary and I were in eastern Thanalan when the colossal shards of Dalamud pierced the ground. We stood witness to the subsequent explosion of aether, and watched dumbfounded as the swirling energy solidified into those twisted crystal structures that we now know so well.
I am unfamiliar with the dishes of the lands to the north. Perhaps once Moenbryda has concluded her current research, she might deign to share with me her culinary knowledge.

In hindsight, mayhaps sending a lady in my stead was not the wisest of decisions...
Ah, pray ignore my ramblings!

I traveled to Ul'dah to meet with Thancred's friend─the one who promised us that rare ore?─and she began cursing me with words I've only ever heard from the mouths of pirates. I still have no idea what she was so angry about...

We were able to locate those elusive manuscripts in the archives of the Thaumaturges' Guild. I had not spoken much with the new guildmasters, but thankfully they were quite willing to accommodate us in our search.

Though it may seem tedious when compared with the smiting of terrible foes, poring over crumbling scrolls is one of a Scion's most important duties. Without the illumination of knowledge, we but vainly flail at specters in the dark.
I'm pushing ahead with my research as quickly as I dare. The next time you face an Ascian, I would have you fight with the proper weapon in hand.

As the receptionist of the Rising Stones, 'tis my job to receive all manner of guests with due courtesy! I've had to memorize the political positions and military ranks of half a dozen different nations...
That lady knight from Ishgard cuts quite a gallant figure, doesn't she?
I must confess, the relationship between those crystal formations and the destruction of the Ascians quite escapes me...
Professor Lamberteint has published a thorough study on corrupted crystals and their properties. I highly recommend you procure yourself a copy of his work.
Considering the sudden arrival of foreign envoys and the like, preparing suitable meals at the Rising Stones can prove to be an interesting challenge.
We must find some means of protecting ourselves from Ascian intrusions. There must be a way.
I don't feel much like talking at the moment. If you could just...give me some time.
I loathe to see Yda in such pain, but I have not the words to comfort her. Can you imagine it? I, Papalymo, the one who has an eloquent comment for every situation, am at a loss for words...
The Rising Stones feels somehow colder. Moenbryda always carried with her such an abundance of warmth and cheer.
If you're looking for the Scions, they've already left for the alliance nations. I do hope Ishgard will be saved...
Considering recent history, will there be any amongst the alliance willing to aid the Holy See? Ishgard has few friends at the bargaining table...
The town has been calm through all this talk of war, but if those dragons come to Revenant's Toll there'll be panic aplenty, I'd wager.
Should events take a turn for the worse, we are fortunate that this settlement is such a popular crossroads for so many veteran adventurers.
Though I have never seen one myself, it is said that dragons lair just beyond the borders of my homeland...
I am faced by a merciless mountain of administrative chores! Thankfully, this is one battle I am well equipped to fight!
So, Minfilia has committed the Scions to Ishgard's cause, has she?
column23: Though she makes her pronouncements with unshakable confidence, I can only imagine how agonizing it was for her to arrive at this decision. So many lives at stake...

column22: The threat of war sows panic and confusion, and routine tasks can offer a calming stability─being sure the larder is properly stocked, for instance.
Ladies, please, this is no way to─ Oh, hello, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!
column23: I was just, er, entertaining some friends! Ahahaha. Oh gods...

column22:
<snort> Hee hee...
Ahahaha! Oh gods! Make it stop! My sides are about to burst!
A primal shackles its faithful with the bonds of eternal devotion, but I fear the power Thancred wields over his admirers is rather more fickle.
column23: Especially when each realizes she is not the sole object of his affection...

column22:
<sigh>
Do we not have more pressing matters to attend to?
Here at the Gold Saucer, we strive to make all your dreams come true─even the dreams you never knew you had! Tee hee!
Welcome to the Gold Saucer, honored guest. There's no end to the wonders within these halls─pray don't be shy about partaking in them!
Newcomer or veteran, the Gold Saucer has something for everyone. Why not cast your worries aside for the day and delight in the myriad diversions we have to offer?
Beyond this door lie Chocobo Square and Minion Square, homes to the heart-pounding, hair-raising spectacles that are chocobo racing and Lord of Verminion.
My companion promised to meet me in Wonder Square, but she's nowhere to be seen! Do you think it's this fragrance I'm wearing? She's always had a most sensitive nose...
My companion promised to meet me in Wonder Square, but I can't find him anywhere! Do you think it's my dress? He's so particular when it comes to fashion...
If you've not yet done so, you must try wading in the water here. It's remarkably refreshing!
<yawn> All these bright lights and loud noises. I find it all so dreadfully...<Emphasis>tedious</Emphasis>. Or perhaps you've come to amuse me?
column23: ...No? Then go off and play your silly games, or whatever it is you've come to do. <sigh>

column22: Welcome, honored guest, to the Manderville Lounge. On behalf of Master Godbert, we shall do all in our power to see that your stay is a pleasant one.
Should you be looking to return to Entrance Square, this passage will lead you there.
This passage leads to the chocobo racing course. Unauthorized entrance is strictly prohibited.
When post time draws near, we will provide further instructions. If you are looking to enter a race, please wait patiently within the halls of Chocobo Square.

Hey, name's Joe. Nice to meet... Wait, we met before? No...maybe not. Hmmm... I can tell you've got a story...and I reckon it's pretty interesting. Aye, I have a feeling that we'll meet again. Then, until we meet again.
Fond of Triple Triad, are you? I can't play enough of the game myself. I've defeated so many opponents now, they started calling me “King.”
column23: And I must say, I've grown rather attached to the title. If you mean to topple me from my throne, then you'd best prepare yourself for a royal rumble!

column22: ...Stop. Before you utter a word, know that you address a Triple Triad champion. If you intend to challenge me, then pray do so only once your skills have reached their peak.
column23: Until then, mayhap Jonas of the Three Spades would provide you with a less...daunting adversary.

column22: Well, now, ain't ye a pretty one! I'll have me summat nice to look at while I'm takin' ye apart at the card table!
Ah, the cards are in my favor today! You'd best bring your finest decks against me, friend, because I am ON FIRE!
Fancy yourself a Triple Triad player, do you? I've built a fair reputation at the game myself─enough to earn a place in the Gold Saucer “court,” at any rate.
column23: So, you see, there's no need to take it easy on me...as I certainly won't be easy on you!

column22: A ticket is required for passage to the Manderville Gold Saucer. If you do not have one, I'm afraid I must ask you to be on your way.
Hello, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>cutie<Else/>handsome</If>. Come for the Cactpot...or for <Emphasis>me</Emphasis>? Either way, you're more than welcome to test your luck. Tee hee!
<If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss<Else/>Mister</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I'm playing hide-and-seek with the others, and I'm it!
Wow! I never thought you'd find me faster than Yozan!
Shhh! Not so loud, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss<Else/>Mister</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, or Yozan will catch me!
Yozan <Emphasis>always</Emphasis> finds Koharu first. It's always been that way─so I don't need to hide very well.
You... Easy now, friend─I'll not raise the alarm. I'm not fool enough to believe the rumors. That said, I cannot well let you pass. Orders are orders.
W-We need not fret overmuch─there are yet several layers of arcane protection that shield the city from invasion. Mother will be fine...
When I laid eyes upon Lady Iceheart...I felt the marrow freeze within my bones.
Heretic scum! How <Emphasis>dare</Emphasis> they meddle with our divine protections! I shall rid our nation of their blasphemy even if it means cutting them down one by one!
The Gates of Judgement are much more than mere doors─they are the outermost layer of Ishgard's magical wards. If our first line of defense can be so easily shattered...
I have my acquaintances here in the city attempting to round up volunteers.
column23: But I'm afraid the only cause the average Ul'dahn fights for is <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> own purse...

column22: I have had little success in recruiting soldiers for Ishgard's war. Few Lominsans care for the troubles of distant Coerthas...
Hello, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! How fare your recruiting efforts? I've been doing rather well, myself!
The large population of Elezen in Gridania is working to our advantage─at least, they certainly seem more sympathetic towards the plight of their brethren in Ishgard.
column23: And then, of course, there was that business with the Autumn War. The Ishgardians came to the forest city's aid during that conflict, and the Gridanians would return the favor.

column22: Nero never would've made it back without you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, and for that you have my thanks. I doubt he will hatch any more dastardly schemes for the present. He owes me his life, after all.
I'll tell you, that rift started closing up <Emphasis>fast</Emphasis>. Waiting for you three to pop out was the tensest few moments of my life!
No matter how many other clones are still out there, our Unei and Doga were special. I'm going to miss them...

Huh? Oh great, an adventurer. I know what you're thinking, but I'm not looking to pick a fight. I didn't even <Emphasis>want</Emphasis> to join the imperial army. <sigh> But Ma, she said to me, “Ye won't never make nothin' o' yerself fiddlin' wit' cards all day. Why can't ye be a real man, like yer pa!”
column23: A few arguments later, and next thing I knew, I was being fitted for an imperial uniform. If you leave me be, I promise I won't hurt anyone. I'd sooner fight with my cards than with my fists.

column22: No time for you, greenhorn. Me stock's reserved for the best of the best.
For the right people─and the right price─we've the right tools.

The Admiral informed me of your unjust treatment at the hands of the Ul'dahns. 'Tis not a tale known by many─the report was given only to the Maelstrom's upper echelons, so you'll not need to explain yourself to every commoner on the street.
column23: If I ever come across the scoundrels who framed you, however, they will certainly be explaining themselves to me!

column22: Greetings, adventurer. As you might have observed, my master has grand plans for this year's Little Ladies' Day─plans that I fear have hit something of a snag. Your services would be greatly welcome, should you be willing to offer them.

Hearts of Gridania, awake! For too long have you slept in silence, tucked beneath the suffocating blankets of reticence and reserve! I, Lisette de Valentione, am come to tear off your trappings, and let your love burst forth!
column23: Have you the courage to unbosom yourself to your one true love? The task may be daunting, but know this─the massed ranks of House Valentione stand with you, to usher you into the arms of your beloved!

column22: How fare you in assisting Ser Hortefense, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? The search for love may be trying, but the rewards are all the sweeter for it! Press on, adventurer, and follow in the footsteps of Countess Arabelle!
For Halone's sake, how did it ever come to this? To find my own true love was my dearest wish, but it's all just so sudden... My head's spinning... My heart's racing...
column23: Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, are you still here? I suppose I owe you my thanks, for guiding Hortefense to his...beloved. Countess Arabelle would be proud of you...

column22: What ho, adventurer! Have you a love in your heart that dare not speak its name? If so, my men and I would be only too glad to aid you in enouncing it. As emissaries of House Valentione, it is our sworn duty to offer pining souls what aid we can.

How goes the search, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>my lady<Else/>my lord</If>? Forgive me for burdening you with such an onerous task, but I have great faith that an adventurer of your abilities will succeed where we emissaries failed.

Hurrah, huzzah, and hurrah again! Never in all my life have I known such happiness! The dreams that have been my only comfort these lonely years have come true, and then some! Not only is my angel regained, but she consents to consort with me!
column23: Thank you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>my lady<Else/>my lord</If>! I have a new dream now, and if it should ever come true, it would be my highest privilege to have you serve me once more─as <If(PlayerParameter(4))>the most honorable maid of honor<Else/>the very best of best men</If>!

column22: Good <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>eve<Else/>morrow</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>eve</If></If> to you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>m'lady<Else/>m'lord</If>. Should you require the aid of the noble house of Valentione, you have only to ask. If you would offer us your own service, pray speak with my superior.

House Valentione and Gridania both stand in your debt today, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>m'lady<Else/>m'lord</If>. Thanks to you, the woods resound with sighs of bliss, and not of sorrow. It is my one regret that Ser Hortefense could not join in the chorus...

Ser Hortefense is a knight of high standing and bright prospect, with a gallant and noble character. Serving under him these past days has only served to lift him in my humble estimations. He would make a fine match for any noblewoman of Ishgard─my lady included.
column23: Though how she will receive him is anyone's guess. His description certainly rings true─she is indeed a lady of paramount virtue─but at times she can be rather...<Emphasis>pugnacious</Emphasis>. I only pray she doesn't return him to the state in which she found him.

column22: As you can no doubt tell from my attire, I am a retainer of House Valentione, come to assist my lady Lisette in spreading ardor and affection across Eorzea. If you have a heart to help us in our quest, prithee go to Gridania, and speak with my lady there.

I thank you again for your assistance, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>m'lady<Else/>m'lord</If>. Your heart must be positively overflowing with love for it to have guided you so quickly to the lady's missing beau. Would that we were all so attuned to such passions!
My congratulations, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>m'lady<Else/>m'lord</If>, on bringing together Ser Hortefense and his lost love! Whoever would have thought it was Lady Lisette all along?

Long have we journeyed from our Ishgardian home, to bring courage and joy to these far–flung lands. Should <If(PlayerParameter(4))>m'lady<Else/>m'lord</If> deign to assist us, pray make your way to Gridania and speak with Lady Lisette─the leader of our mission, and the queen of our hearts.

My thanks once again, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>m'lady<Else/>m'lord</If>! Where this day was once brackish with the salty tang of tears, you have made it sweet with the taste of chocolate! House Valentione stands in your debt, and we shall not forget it.

Joyous tidings, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>m'lady<Else/>m'lord</If>! Ser Hortefense sends word that he has finally found the lady he was searching for all these years, and she is every ilm as sweet and noble as he remembers. I wonder who it could be...?
Shall I simply tell my dear Ninimo that the task was beyond me? No, I could not live with myself were I to fail her so! Oh, whatever is this poor, pitiful father to do!?

Kind adventurer, I would be forever in your debt if you could assist me with the project I've undertaken for this year's Little Ladies' Day. I'm building a very special doll stand for my own precious little lady, you see!
Thanks to you, friend, Ninimo and I are spending more time together than ever, and let me say that I am enjoying every precious minute.
column23: No doubt this is how Sultan Baldric felt when he was finally able to build a relationship with his dear daughter. The years may pass, and dynasties rise and fall, but fatherly love is a thing to span the ages.

column22: 'Tis the season to pay tribute to all the precious little ladies who fill our realm with such rapture and joy. Verily so, adventurer─Little Ladies' Day is upon us!
column23: My master has a mind to make this year's observance a particularly special one for his own dear little lady. Yet if I might speak the truth, I fear for the success of his plan...

column22: The world's gone mad indeed when its saviors're branded criminals. Me dear sister would be turnin' in her grave...
It will take more than this to end the Scions! Warrior of Light─promise me you'll stand with us to the bitter end!
No matter how hopeless things seem, I will keep my chin up and press on. 'Tis the least I can do to honor the memory of my fallen comrades.
Even in these dark times, you think to pay this old man a visit... You are kind, my <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If>. Very kind indeed.
column23: But never you fear! Her Grace is alive and well, I am certain of it. That the incident has not been made public is proof positive of this.
column24: ...Or so I try to convince myself. I...I could not carry on otherwise...

column22: My child, the gods be praised for your preservation. To think that such an evil fate would befall the Scions...
column23: Yet know that the wicked shall eventually be cast down. The day will come when the light of truth will shine for all to see, and you and yours are freed from the pall of ignominy.

column22: Hail to you, adventurer. Tell me, how fares Wilred? I'm told he went to enlist in the Crystal Braves at your invitation.
column23: My people's toils continue, and our hopes rest upon young shoulders such as his. Well do I remember the time he went astray, and for that I all the more look forward to seeing the man he has become.

column22: This is the Gate of the Sultana. It was erected to commemorate the ascension of Her Majesty Nanamo Ul Namo to the throne.
column23: ...Speaking of the sultana, I am informed that she has taken ill. Let us pray for her swift recovery!

column22: We've received some peculiar orders of late: we're to report any sightings of the Scions of the Seventh Dawn.
column23: I...I don't understand. Aren't they the ones who oppose the Empire and fight the primals? Aren't they on <Emphasis>our</Emphasis> side?

column22: Memeroon learn new game, learn game very good. Customer play game with Memeroon? Memeroon hope customer likes losing!
Memeroon like this game! Memeroon like winning! If customer like losing, customer should come play with Memeroon again.
No, no, no! Memeroon no like losing. Today is customer's lucky day, but lucky customer will not be so lucky next time. That is Memeroon promise!
No win, no lose? Bah, Memeroon go easy on customer this time. Next time, Memeroon show no mercy. Customer should be ready for merciless Memeroon!
Lady Luck left your side the moment you arrived at my table, friend! She's dining with me this eve, and we'll toast my victory with the tears of your defeat!
Ha! Did I not foresee this triumph!? I am INVINCIBLE!
Argh, my winning streak! Who taught you to play like that!? Was it Aurifort!?
Gah, we can't leave it at that! Play me again while I'm still on a roll!
A game of Triple Triad? Business waits for no woman, but I suppose I can spare a moment between transactions.
You seem to have overestimated your abilities, friend. I suggest you improve your capacity for self-assessment─it will serve you well both in business and in life.
Your skill at cards cannot be denied, but if you intend to haggle with me over my wares, I would advise against it. I know of few who can best me at bargaining.
...A draw. Not a particularly satisfying conclusion, but a conclusion nonetheless. Thank you for the diversion, friend.
More'n a few customers in their cups've tried to best me. Think ye've got what it takes?
Had me sweatin' buckets fer a moment! Ye ain't half bad, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lassie<Else/>laddie</If>!
Can't say I'm accustomed to playin' folks when they're sober. Mayhap ye could have a pint before our next match to even the odds?
Well now, would ye look at that! Reckon we both best practice some more, eh?
So, it's a match you want, is it? I think you'll find old Guhtwint's as hard as the gems in his name!
Hmmm. Well, I may have won, but you certainly taught me a thing or two along the way. I'd best not rest on my laurels, eh?
...And so the diamonds are cracked once more. If I continue losing like this, they'll change my title to “Guhtwint of the Three Eggshells”!
You've quite a knack for this game─a sense for when to hold back...and when to strike. I'd consider it an honor if you would challenge me again.
Triple Triad? Well, I'm not otherwise occupied at the moment, so why not? Don't expect me to offer you much sport, though─I was never any good at the game.
The fun and games can wait till you've established yourself as an adventurer. For now, you'd do well to keep your nose to the grindstone.
Well, that was rather unexpected. Unexpected...but not unpleasant. We should do this more often!
I told you, didn't I? I'm not very good at this...
Oh, it's a draw, then? In my book, that's as good as winning!
Not to brag, but I've made a point o' bein' better'n good at Triple Triad. It lets me get close to the juiciest sources o' gossip, ye see.
There're times when I hold back, like when I need to keep me opponent sweet. This <Emphasis>wasn't</Emphasis> one o' them times. Hehehe...
Bah, this must be what they call 'venturer's luck...
Bugger me, I was sure I had ye. That'll teach me for gettin' cocky.
Far be it from me to turn down an invitation! But I warn you: I won't go down so easy!
Triple Triad? I'd love to, but I've yet to get the hang of it. So many rules, you know? Besides, I can think of a few things you ought to be doin' instead of playin' cards with me.
Did you see that? I won! I─ Ahem! I mean, splendid.
Ah, bested again. Seems I just can't keep up with you younglin's.
Hmmm, that's no good. Mayhap I should get one o' the regulars to teach me new techniques...
Ooh, a spot of Triple Triad would certainly break up the monotony of constant research. Shall we begin, then?
I only ever played for enjoyment, not victory. Still, 'tis comforting to know that my skills haven't departed me entirely.
Even in defeat, there is pleasure to be had! If you wish to play again, just say the word─I would be grateful for the diversion.
Thrilling to the last turn! Evenly matched bouts are the most rewarding, do you not agree?
Ready for a match, are you? Wonderful! ...I'm afraid I must deduct a number of MGP as per Triple Triad regulations, but rest assured that victory shall win you back those points and more!
column23: Now, it is my distinct pleasure to introduce you to the game that is sweeping the realm!
column24: You will now be invited to a Triple Triad match. Select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Challenge<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> to begin the game.

column22: ...Hmm, have you not built a deck, yet? Don't tell me you simply stuffed those cards into the bottom of your bag and forgot about them!
column23: Any new cards you obtain will be stored in your inventory. <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Use<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> a card to add it to your <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Card List<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, which can be viewed from the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Gold Saucer<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> options under <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Character<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> in the main menu.
column24: Next, select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Card Decks<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, also found under <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Gold Saucer<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, to build a five-card deck from your registered cards.

column22:
Ah, I seem to have beaten you...
Well, defeat is all part of the experience! And now that you have an understanding of the rules, it's time for you to go forth and seek out the many Triple Triad players found here in the Gold Saucer...and the world beyond!
column23: The game has gained an avid following, and you're sure to find willing participants in various locales across Eorzea!
column24: In addition to challenging your fellow adventurers, you can also play Triple Triad matches against NPCs who are marked with a special card-shaped icon above their <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>display name<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>. Simply speak with the NPC and select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Challenge<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> to begin a match.

column22: Oh, well done! Now that you have an understanding of the rules, it's time for you to go forth and seek out the many Triple Triad players found here in the Gold Saucer...and the world beyond!
column23: The game has gained an avid following, and you're sure to find willing participants in various locales across Eorzea!
column24: In addition to challenging your fellow adventurers, you can also play Triple Triad matches against NPCs who are marked with a special card-shaped icon above their <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>display name<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>. Simply speak with the NPC and select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Challenge<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> to begin a match.

column22: As we each have an equal number of cards under our control, the match has ended in a draw! Well fought! Now that you have an understanding of the rules, it's time for you to go forth and seek out the many Triple Triad players found here in the Gold Saucer...and the world beyond!
column23: The game has gained an avid following, and you're sure to find willing participants in various locales across Eorzea!
column24: In addition to challenging your fellow adventurers, you can also play Triple Triad matches against NPCs who are marked with a special card-shaped icon above their <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>display name<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>. Simply speak with the NPC and select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Challenge<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> to begin a match.

column22: A game? Why, it would be my pleasure! The boredom fair drove me mad, so long have I lain here, unable to train. But now, once more I shall take to the field of battle!
A careless mistake? Fear not. If ever you wish to challenge me again, I shall gladly accept!
By the Fury, have I grown so weak in both mind and body? Or is your skill so much greater than mine?
Ho, it seems we are evenly matched, you and I! Mayhap a rematch is in order? You need only ask!
Your thoughts are as an open book to me. Come, assail me with your “unbeatable” strategies...and I shall break them, every one.
Such dull and predictable tactics. You must needs expand your field of experience should you truly wish to conquer a champion of my puissance.
You stymied my efforts at every turn. Impressive. Could it be that our vaunted king shall finally meet his match...?
I have underestimated you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>sir</If>─there are few who have thus fought me to a standstill. We must have another match to decide the issue!
Hm, the forest <Emphasis>has</Emphasis> been quiet of late. I suppose now is as good a time as any. Come, then, and let us wage battle with cards in hand!
Apologies, friend, but I am presently on duty. Find me again later, and I shall gladly partake in a game of Triple Triad with you.
You played well, but the spirit of the great Josselin guides my hand. If you wish to have another round, I shall be here.
It...it is but a game. The result bothers me not in the least. Not in the least, I tell you!
A hard-fought draw! Truly, combat need not be mortal to set a man's heart to pounding!
Hah! Ye've got guts to challenge Trachtoum, undisputed champion o' the Swimmer's Pool! Very well, I'll give ye a match what minstrels'll sing of!

Hah! Ye've got guts to challenge Trachtoum, undisputed champion o' the Swimmer's Pool! Alas, I'm busy right now─the price o' fame an' all that. But if ye come back later, I'll give ye a match what minstrels'll sing of!
Gahaha! Don't take it too hard, eh? After all, I <Emphasis>am</Emphasis> the undisputed champion o' the Swimmer's Pool!
D-Doubtless ye could tell, but I went easy on ye. Wouldn't be, er, <Emphasis>seemly</Emphasis> for the undisputed champion o' the Swimmer's Pool to go all out against a hapless 'venturer.
Ahem... Blind luck though it was, ye can be proud o' this draw. Few can claim to have gone the distance with the undisputed champion o' the Swimmer's Pool.
What's that? 'Nother 'nitiate? No? Oho, why didn't ye say so sooner, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lassie<Else/>lad</If>!? Ol' Mimidoa's always lookin' fer a challenge!
'Nother 'nitiate, are ye? <Emphasis>Crippled dyads</Emphasis>? 'Fraid I can't help ye much with that, what with all these nails need hammerin'.
Well, bugger me if ol' Mimidoa doesn't still have it! This'll make for a rousin' tale next time I'm out carousin'─provided it sticks up here in me noggin.
Bah! If ye ask me, this Triple Triad's just a passin' craze anyhow. The barnacle toss, the spittin' contest...now those are games for <Emphasis>real</Emphasis> men o' the sea!
To duel ol' Mimidoa to a draw... Ye've got some skill, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss<Else/>Mister</If>─ah, what was yer name again, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lassie<Else/>lad</If>?
A game o' cards, is it? Well, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, yer about to regret challengin' the Drownin' Wench's reignin' Triple Triad champion!
Ye want to play cards? I thought ye was a bleedin' 'venturer! Ye should be out explorin' the realm an' makin' a name fer yerself! Go on─off with ye! I'll still be 'ere when ye get back!
An' victory is mine! Ah, but don't take it too 'ard, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. Lady Luck's got a sweet spot fer old rogues like meself!
Gods above, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, is there naught ye can't turn yer 'and to? Ye must get tired o' bein' the bloody best at everythin'!

There ain't many as can force me to a stalemate...
Aye, ye've some talent, alright, but the next match is mine!
You wish to challenge <Emphasis>me</Emphasis> to a game of Triple Triad? I...I know not what to say! I shall endeavor to not disappoint!
Forgive me, but while I am grateful for your invitation, my duties demand my undivided attention. Mayhap another time?
I...I won! That I could emerge victorious from such a mighty struggle... The feeling is indescribable!
A fine victory, as befits an experienced player! Would that I could devote more time to practice.
This too is a viable strategy? I see, I see... I must thank you for this lesson!
Aha! A challenge to set the mind in motion and stimulate the growth of hair! For the sake of my precious tresses─have at you!
What? A match? <Emphasis>Now</Emphasis>? I don't think so. The very idea of playing in the cold of night causes me stress...and you <Emphasis>know</Emphasis> what stress does to the scalp!

Ahaha, I win, I win! I owe it all to the scorching heat! I always play better in it.
...If only my <Emphasis>hair</Emphasis> would grow better in it, too...
Defeat... Oh, how it burns! From the bottom of my heart to the top of my once-plentiful head!
What did I do wrong? Was it the order...or the placement? N–No, I mustn't overthink! 'Tis poison for the scalp!
A game would be welcome indeed! This expedition is full of discovery, but greatly lacking in entertainment...
Cold hands can make clumsy players of us all, my friend. I await our next match eagerly.
By the ruth of Halone, you are a skillful one! When can we match wits again?
What a disappointing end! Challenge me again when you have a spare moment, and I will defeat you fair and square.
Ye must think yerself a deft hand alright if ye've come callin' in search of a match. But I'll tell ye now, love: the only hearts what break 'round here are those o' me challengers!
Awww, and ye tried so hard, too! Get yerself some better cards an' a more flexible strategy, love...then maybe ye'll stand a chance against me.
Huh. I ain't never lost to no one but the king... This wide ol' realm's just full o' surprises!
Phew, that was a close one, eh? Ye had me curiosity afore, sweetbun, but now ye've got me attention!

You <Emphasis>are</Emphasis> aware that it is <Emphasis>my</Emphasis> research into Eorzea's beastkin upon which the relative strengths of the Triple Triad cards are based, yes? I estimate your chances of defeating me at 0.00001 percent...and that's on a good day!
While I enjoy nothing more than engaging in frivolous contests with lesser minds, I fear I have pressing research to conduct on the acidity of morbol digestive fluids.
column23: Have you been swallowed by a morbol of late? No? Then what is the point of you, anyway!?

column22: It appears your knowledge of the cards at your disposal is woefully lacking. I would suggest reading my collected works to remedy your ignorance, but I doubt your puny mind would be able to comprehend the wisdom writ within.
Bah! What was I thinking wasting my time and prodigious mental faculties on this stupid <Emphasis>game</Emphasis>, when I could be saving Eorzea with my research!? Begone with you at once!
A tie? In other words, this has been a complete and utter waste of my all–too–precious time. Be a good adventurer and go bother someone else, why don't you.
Triple Triad? Gods, yes, I'm in! Let me tell you, I used to play like a man possessed back in the day!
Triple Triad? The gods know I'd love to play, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>, but the bar wants for tending. Come back later, will you?
Loser scrubs the tavern floor! ...Hah, just kidding, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. Off you go, back to your adventuring!
You got the better of me in the end, but that was some contest, eh? Without a doubt the best fun I've had in ages!
Whew, you're stronger than you let on, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. 'Twas all I could do to come out with a draw!
Squawk! Challenge Sezul to match, do you? Like playing with pretty cards, Sezul does!
Bother Sezul with games, do you!? Squawk! Let chief concentrate on new airship design idea, or use featherless one's hide for sails, Sezul will!
Belongs to Sezul, victory does! Mastered featherless ones' Triple Triad game, Sezul has!
Squaaawk! Wish to end on loss, Sezul does not! Challenge chief again, you shall!
Draw? Sit well in Sezul's belly, this does not! Win or lose! How life should be played, that is!
Looking to have a go, eh? A brief escape from the calm and quiet of this godsforsaken post is just what I needed. Have at you, then, that I might relive the thrill of days long past!
I see fire in your eyes, and though I would love to give you a good trouncing, I have duties to perform. Perhaps another time, friend.
Ahahaha! What bloody fun! I whipped you like a—erm, I mean... Good show, friend. I have to be more careful. All this excitement is like to sully my dutiful facade.
Bah! Hells take you <Emphasis>and</Emphasis> that deck of yours. I'll have you know I was without equal in the Company of Heroes. <sigh> Those were the days...
Well played, friend. Well played. I can't remember the last time I've met such a fierce opponent. Perhaps I shouldn't go so easy on you when next we duel.
A challenge, is it? Why, yes, I accept! King Elmer bows to no one!
Ah, such an invigorating battle! I only truly feel alive when I'm subjugating some upstart rival...on the field of Triple Triad, of course.
...Defeated? I? The great King Elmer?
column23: Nooooooooo! This cannot be! Y-You must've played some underhanded trick! ...Whatever will my adoring subjects think of me!?

column22: Ah...hahaha, you've fought me to a draw. You're quite skilled, I see, but you'll not yet have my crown!
I gladly accept your challenge! And though this be but a game, know that I am no less honored for the chance to test myself against you!
As much as I would like to enjoy a game of cards with you, I must focus on my duties.
Pray do not be discouraged by the result, my friend. After all, one cannot be unsurpassed at everything one does.
A humbling experience. In cards, at least, I believed that I could best you, but such naive anticipation sealed my defeat ere I picked my deck...
A rousing match, and one I shan't soon forget! You are a formidable opponent, and I look forward to our next encounter!
...Even I could do with a diversion from time to time. Very well! If you would pit yourself against the Flame's finest, then come, I say! Come!
I am not at liberty to indulge in games─and neither are you, I should think. Let us see to our duties first and discuss this anon.
Many officers play regularly to hone their minds, and I am no exception. Do not think I will be bested so easily.
And here I thought I was two steps ahead, when in truth I was three steps behind...
'Twas a joy to be tested so. Let us match wits again!
Hurrrggghhh... What's that? You want to play cards with me? Oh, you are too kind, my friend! All the others run away before I can even take out my deck. Do you think it's my odor?

My dear friend Sabotendrick gave me a deck of cards, but I'm afraid I accidentally, ah, ate them. But have no fear, it's only a matter of time before they fall out of one of the many holes in my innards...

I won!? Mayhap you were distracted by the way I was eyeing your flesh? I swear to the gods, I was simply admiring your skin tone. I've not snacked on so much as a pinkie finger in days. Days, I tell you!
...I lost? Ah, well. I suppose it shouldn't come as a surprise, what with another dollop of my brains having oozed out of my ear just yesterday.

Oh, for joy! You may be a great adventurer and I little more than an ambulatory hunk of rotted flesh, but on this day─this <Emphasis>glorious</Emphasis> day─we stand as equals! Thank you, friend; this will do wonders for my self-esteem!
You wish to play cards? Now, that's a skirmish I wouldn't mind joining! I may be rubbish with my knuckles, but I'm second to none with a deck in my hands!
Hah! You see that!? I haven't lost my touch just yet. I'm told you adventurers don't like losing, so how about we go another round? You just might edge closer to victory next time.
Damn it... I guess there's some truth to what they say about you adventurers being clever. Well, being clever can only get you so far. Next time you'll see what my deck is truly capable of.
A draw!? I fear serving the Garleans has left me rusty. That match should have been decided after the first two turns. Well, no matter. Next time I'll take you down in record time!
Triple Triad, eh? Aye, might help to pass the time, an' the cards I'm holdin' as collateral are good enough as to make for a lively match.
I <Emphasis>could</Emphasis> fiddle around with card games...or I could run my business an' make good coin. While I think on that, best you go off an' adventure.
You'll need a better deck than that to beat me. Better luck, too.
...You realize I went easy on you, right? Puttin' customers in a foul mood ain't exactly good business.
A bad end to a good game. If you ask me, even <Emphasis>losin'</Emphasis> is better than comin' out even. Let's have it again, eh?
<Emphasis>You</Emphasis> would challenge <Emphasis>me</Emphasis>? I am not sure if that is wise, my friend, for you see, I have something of a monopoly on the choicest cards in the realm...

While I would enjoy nothing more than a diversion, I fear that <Emphasis>other</Emphasis> forms of entertainment demand my undivided attention at the moment. Ahem! Sway those hips a bit more, would you, my dear?
And again, victory is mine, once again proving that skill is no substitute for money. Then again, I've no shortage of either!
Preposterous! I was told that was the best deck gil could buy! Say, would you be willing to part with some of those cards, friend? Needless to say, I would pay good coin for them!
A draw? Would I be correct in assuming that you spent a small fortune on your cards as well, friend?
I'm sorry? You wish to challenge me to a game of Triple Triad? I <Emphasis>am</Emphasis> on duty, but...I suppose one match couldn't hurt. For the glory of the Maelstrom!
I'm afraid I have not the time for such frivolities right now. Perhaps we might arrange a match for a later date...?
And to the victor go the spoils! Forgive me, adventurer, but even when the weapons are mere cards, we of the Maelstrom take our battles very seriously!
I must concede defeat. Though we both struggled against the currents of fortune, you were simply the better player. Well done.
You have proven a most worthy opponent! 'Tis a refreshing change compared to the lackluster players to be found within my own squad. We must face each other again!
When a nation shakes, lowly folk like us are the first to feel it. Mark my words: something bad's happened in Ul'dah.
column23: The high lords and ladies are being tight-lipped about it, but that only serves to reveal how dire the situation is. I don't know what's afoot right now, but it'll lead to no good end.

column22: Do not hesitate to call upon me, regardless of the hour. My home is your home, and I would see you afforded all comforts and courtesies.
column23: Rest and regain your strength, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. You shall have your redemption and your reckoning in due time─and when that day comes, I shall stand at your side.

column22: Let the Horde come. We shall rid ourselves of thousands of their number in one fell swoop.
Nay, I'll not deny it: without your skill and fortitude, the city would now be ash. Would that more of your adventuring brethren possessed such qualities.
The Dravanians mass for an assault on our defenses, do they? Foolish lizards. They do not understand that to challenge the blessed light of the Holy See is to perish.
You have served us well, adventurer─the Temple Knights would have been hard-pressed indeed to turn back the Horde alone. Mayhap 'tis time I returned to the practice yard...

What is worse than feeling as though the whole world is against you? Why, feeling as though the whole world is against you <Emphasis>and</Emphasis> being hungry. While it is not within my power to remedy the former, I <Emphasis>can</Emphasis> put a warm meal in you.
column23: Limited though it may be, we at Camp Dragonhead would offer you what support we can in this difficult time. As Lord Haurchefant's honored friend, you shall ever have a place at our hearth.

column22: My friend, it does my spirit well to see you again. Lord Haurchefant has apprised me of the misfortune that has befallen you and yours. A greater injustice I have never known.
column23: You risked life and limb to defend my innocence, and I should like nothing more than to return the favor. It shames me to say that I have not the means to do so. Pray forgive me...

column22: You're safe, thank the gods! I heard about what took place in Ul'dah─of the terrible things they say you did. Well, it goes without saying that I don't believe a word of it.
column23: I promise to do all I can to track down your fellow Scions. Knowing that you managed to escape unscathed, I'm hopeful of the others' survival.

column22: ...It's you! When the Crystal Braves stormed in and closed off the Rising Stones with nary an explanation, I feared the worst. I'm relieved that <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> are safe, at least.
column23: You look as though you've been through the seventh hell itself, and I'd love to offer you our hospitality, but 'twould be unwise for you to linger. There's no telling who may be watching.

column22: I'm glad to see you safe, adventurer. None quite knew what was happening when they sealed off the Rising Stones, but 'twas plain that something was amiss.
column23: I'm not privy to the particulars, and perhaps it is for the best that I remain ignorant. Whatever trouble is afoot, I pray for its swift resolution and your continued preservation.

column22: Thank Rhalgr, you're safe! I was watchin' when they stormed the Risin' Stones. The way your comrades were bein' manhandled, you would've thought they were criminals o' the worst order.
column23: That ain't no way to treat the heroes what saved the realm! What in the hells is goin' on...?

column22: Oi, did ye hear? Some adventurer─an' a bleedin' famous one at that─went on a rampage durin' the victory feast. Fair tore down the Fragrant Chamber, 'tis said. Rumor has it <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If>'s an imperial spy sent to do for the sultana.
Is it just me, or are there more soldiers on the streets of late? Everywhere I go, I feel as though I'm being watched. It's downright unsettling, I tell you.

Since the victory feast, one consortium after another has been going under, and with nary any warning. Only the Syndicate has the power to do such a thing, but to what end? Could the rumors of revolution be true?
<gasp> You shouldn't be here! If they find you, they'll arrest you like they did the others!
column23: Look, I didn't see you, alright? If you know what's good for you, you'll put a hundred malms between yourself and Ul'dah.

column22: Y-You! You have some n-nerve showing your face here, traitor! I ought to h-haul you in for your crimes, and I would...except you'd d-doubtless put up a fight...and I've been, er, <Emphasis>ordered</Emphasis> not to bring conflict into town.
column23: Our p-priority is to protect the people, and we c-can't risk innocent bystanders getting hurt. If I were to f-find you anywhere else, though, you'll not find me so lenient! C-Consider yourself warned!

column22: Thanks again, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I think... I think I'm going to be all right.

Yda seems to have regained a little of her spark.
...And I believe we have you to thank for that. I am most grateful, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Truly.
Like the unicorns which adorn our shields, we knights of House Fortemps aspire to nobility in the face of adversity.
column23: A knight pays no heed to the lies of lesser men. She carries herself with pride and dignity, secure in the knowledge that her deeds will be her vindication.

column22: I am sorry, adventurer, but my wares are reserved for those who have promised their aid to Master Nanapasi.

Master Nanapasi is greatly obliged to you for your aid, adventurer. If you are in search of a map to guide you to the Thorne doll remnants you seek, I would be happy to provide you with one─in return for, ah, a small <Emphasis>donation</Emphasis> to my master's cause.
column23: I also have stocked a host of festive items sure to liven up your Little Ladies' Day season. I would be more than happy to share some with you in return for your efforts on Master Nanapasi's behalf.

column22: Come one, come all, and witness the miracle of Hatching–tide! No doubt you'll have noticed the array of eggs that litter the highways and byways of this fair city. The famous egg hunt is well and truly underway!
column23: If you wish to join in the revelries, pray speak with one of our sylphic sorceresses and have her transfigure you into a spriggan. Not only is the disguise imbued with prophetic significance, but it's ever so fun!

column22: Welcome, my friend. Have you come to partake in the revelries? We've hatched the most exciting plans for this year's festival: adventurers the realm over are disguising themselves as spriggans, and hunting for the luckiest of lucky eggs!
column23: Why spriggans, you ask? Like everything we Dreamers do, it all serves to bring to life the vision of our good friend Jihli Aliapoh. If the Archons of times past show her spriggans, then spriggans it shall be!

column22: Greetings, friend. Has our array of beautifully decorated eggs caught your eye? It isn't the work of highly trained dodos, but of we Dreamers: all part and parcel of the Hatching–tide festivities.
column23: If you would like to play your own part in the festival, simply disguise yourself as a spriggan and head out hunting! The skies of Eorzea are heavy with enormous eggs, with rich rewards for whosoever should crack their stony shells.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I cannot begin to thank you. Because of you, the will of the Archons has been brought to life for a second year in succession, and the wondrous treasure is secure: a Hatching–tide of joy and laughter for now and always!
column23: So, let the egg hunt begin! For real this time, with no trace of artifice. As you hunt for your well-deserved prizes, know that the Archons of yore look down upon you with pride. May they bless you and keep you forevermore!

column22: Happy Hatching–tide, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I'm sorry for wrapping you up in our little drama, but I hope you'll agree that it was well worth it in the end. I've never seen Jihli so happy, or so surprised!
column23: The prophecy may be completed now, but the festivities certainly aren't! Who knows─there may be an even greater treasure out there, and you could be the one to find it! If you do, you'll remember your good friend Nono, won't you?

column22: Greetings, my friend! Have you a gift for me, or is it only fortune that you are the bearer of now? Ah, but forgive my jest─it seems I'm still in the party spirit!
column23: Seriously, though─it was not only fortune you brought, but a beaming smile to the face of my good friend Jihli. For that I am eternally thankful. May the Archons of yore bless you and keep you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!

column22: Oh, kind adventurer! Might I trouble you for a moment of your time? My master, the trader Nanapasi of Ul'dah, finds himself in a most terrible bind!
column23: He had great plans for this year's observance of Little Ladies' Day, you see, but you know what they say about the best-laid plans, yes?
column24: Should your journey take you to the sultanate, pray speak with my sophisticated associate there. Safe travels, friend, and my thanks for what aid you are willing and able to offer!

column22: Rumor has it that Master Nanapasi's grand plans for Little Ladies' Day proceed swimmingly, and that <Emphasis>you</Emphasis>, adventurer, have played no small part in this.
column23: For this, you have my thanks. Oh, but I can only imagine the smile that will beam on Miss Ninimo's face when the decorations are done!

column22: Though events might not have played out as he intended, Master Nanapasi would be the first to admit that this Little Ladies' Day has been everything he hoped it would be, and then some!
column23: Seeing my master and his dearest Ninimo together these days, it is as if I am gazing upon Sultan Baldric and Princess Edvya reborn! I have no words to express my gratitude, adventurer.

column22: Greetings, friend, and a happy Hatching–tide to you. If our array of decorative eggs has piqued your interest, pray speak with our leader, Miss Aliapoh, to learn more of this year's revelries.
column23: Or if you've already amassed a lucky egg or two, why not take a look at my selection of ovoid adornments? Each is a memento of the Twelve Archons of ages past, and pretty to boot!

column22: Greetings, adventurer. We come bearing eggs, of all shapes and sizes, with great prizes for all that lay their hands on them. If you have any lucky eggs you'd like to swap for fancier festoonery, you have only to say the word.
column23: Or should you seek a more wondrous treasure still, pray speak with our leader, Miss Jihli Aliapoh, in Gridania. She has been blessed with a vision of spriggans, and the promise of rich reward awaits any adventurer bold enough to bring her dreams to life.

column22: Greetings, friend! The season of Hatching–tide is upon us, and we Dreamers seek adventurers brave to bring Miss Aliapoh's visions to life. Would you be a good egg, and offer yourself to our cause? You'll find her in Gridania, taking center stage.
column23: If you've already joined the hunt, I'd be only too happy to swap any lucky eggs you've collected for a memento of the season. Each is a finely crafted replica of those fateful vessels that appeared to Jihli in her dream. They're as pretty as they are prophetic!

column22: If a lucky egg or two should come into your possession, I should be only too glad to exchange them for an array of gorgeous gifts, each exclusive to the season. Provided you can resist cracking them open first!

Would you like to take a look at my wares? I have a range of beautiful baubles to adorn the ear and delight the eyes of any bold adventurer, and all in exchange for a few lucky eggs. Who can say fairer than that?

Have you any lucky eggs? It's so satisfying to crack them open and collect the prize inside, but if you can forbear the temptation, I have a sumptuous selection of gifts to exchange for those with their shells intact.
Oho! That keen look in your eyes tells me that Triple Triad's piqued your interest. Why not speak with our resident Triple Triad master and let her walk you through the fundamentals?
Greetings, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, and welcome. Are you perchance a jockey in need of a new fledgling race chocobo? If so, Katering and I would be happy to assist you.

Morale among the Sixth Spear has never been higher. After a brief absence, Captain Landenel returned with renewed fervor for his work, the source of which he candidly revealed to us. This served only to reaffirm our faith in him. We are all of us proud to call him our captain.
Oh, what should I do next? Enter a chocobo race or play Triple Triad? Or do something else altogether!? For the life of me, I can't decide!

Beyond those doors is where we train race chocobos. Mayhap you prefer the raw excitement of a race, though? Believe me, there is much joy in watching the fledglings grow stronger and predicting how well they will perform.
Forgive my candor, but I mislike strangers. Have patience, though─the day may come when we can do business.
To you, I give a splendid weapon─one piece of mahatma at a time. But to Rowena, I bring happiness─one tomestone at a time.
Ho, friend! I trust your bird fares well? Ah, but the races are ever a sight to behold!
The Triple Triad tables are bustling with excitement as ever, no? I can scarcely wait to see who will claim victory in the next tournament!
So we meet again...and you could not have picked a better time to come! This event is one of my personal favorites─I heartily encourage you to take your place on stage!
Ah, yes, the ward. You may pass.
Crossing the Steps, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>?
You've business in the proving grounds? Very well.
Greetings, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. Are you for Camp Cloudtop?
Greetings, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. Do you require transport to the Blue Window?
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, was it? We've an airship standing by which can ferry you to Azys Lla.
Pray keep your voice down when inside the scholasticate.
Well come, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>. Shall I show you inside the manor?

Will you be leaving us <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>tonight<Else/>today</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>today<Else/>tonight</If></If>, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>?
Where's Koharu gone? I want to play hide-and-seek, too!
Thou art known to me, mortal.
You've come to purchase a kettle? I'm afraid we're short on stock at the moment. Perhaps if you come back later.
In spite of its appearance, that mechanical monstrosity is a primal, and it is causing us no end of worry.
column23: No sooner do we put down one primal than another appears to take its place. I am beginning to see a pattern...

column22: My apologies, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, but I am permitted to sell such wares only to jockeys.
My apologies, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, but I am permitted to sell training manuals only to jockeys.
We should be happy to serve you when you have sufficient funds, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>.
Throughout northern Thanalan, you'll see strange formations of corrupted crystals. Folk call them Dalamud's Talons, and they're grim monuments of the Seventh Umbral Era's calamitous arrival.
Just say the word, and I'll send you and yours to the internment hulk extending from the Burning Wall fragment. If you have any questions, now's the time to ask them.
As per milord and milady's orders, work is underway to seal off aetherial access to the internment hulks. My fellows and I will remain here till the deed is done.
Oooh, a challenge! What a wonderful way to pass the time! Heh heh heh...
column23: Steel yourself for a mighty struggle─for I, Tataru Taru, am the Scions' greatest Triple Triad player!

column22: Forgive me, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, but now is not the best time. Urianger will be contacting me via linkpearl any moment now.
column23: I do appreciate the offer, though! Mayhap we can play when I'm not so busy?

column22: Ahhh, there's naught more refreshing than victory! Thank you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I needed that!

No! Nooooooooo!
...Very well, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I admit defeat. You are the Scions' greatest Triple Triad player...for now!
I thank you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, for a most thrilling match. I trust it will not be our last?

Why, adventurer, I must say you bear a striking resemblance to one of those rogue Scions we have been ordered to apprehend on sight! I hope you have not suffered undue harassment at the hands of my men!
column23: (I received no explanation as to why you were to be detained, but even if I had, I would not believe it. As if the Scions of the Seventh Dawn could ever deserve such treatment!)

column22: Y-You shouldn't be here. There'll be hells to pay if word spreads.
column23: Maybe you can keep us safe when you're here, but when you're not?

column22: This is a place for those who have lost everything and have nowhere else to go. For those who have given up. So why are <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> here, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>?
I doubt they would be so careless as to be caught out by the Temple Knights. Nevertheless, it is only prudent that we ask.
At first, I had trouble getting to know people, but with a little effort─and a lot of parley─I've managed to make lots of friends!
...Rivet eight, check. Rivet nine, check. Rivet ten, ch─ Hm? If you could just let me finish this, I'll be with you in a moment! Ahem. Rivet...er. Oh blast.
Isn't she a beauty?
My lads have outdone themselves this time!

Gods above, I can't work through the night as easily as I used to. Must be getting old.
Ahem. ...That's when you say, “You're not that old, Cid.”
Seeing your ideas take shape before you... <Emphasis>This</Emphasis> is why I became an engineer.
This's one of our best works, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. No doubt about it.
Repeat after me: over, under, around, and through. Over, under, around, and through...
You know, I think waiting tables rather suits me! I get to meet all sorts of interesting people─and to top it all off, they pay me to do it!
column23: Now, now, don't go getting the wrong idea. This is purely for our benefit. I'm learning all about Ishgard, and all proceeds are going right into the Scions' coffers.

column22: I've begun working here as a server again! My old regulars have been terribly welcoming!
I made some supper for the tavern workers, and they liked it so much they put it on the menu! Might I suggest the dawn tea and loaghtan stew?
Weaving is far more difficult than I imagined! But just you wait─I'll be a <Emphasis>specialist</Emphasis> before you know it!
What do you think of my hair, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Goes well with my garb, does it not? Oh, and did I mention that I made the garb myself? Because I did! Hee hee!
A customer gifted me with a lovely pair of shoes. For the briefest of moments, I entertained the thought of making a living of this, but in the end, my true calling is with the Scions!
A magnificent view, is it not? When I need to think on something, I like to come here and watch the clouds glide by.
Have you heard? Rumor has it the Forgotten Knight has a spirited new waitress, and all who have beheld her say she is a rare beauty!
My lord, your coat button is undone! Pray do it up, else you are like to catch your death!
You and Master Alphinaud acquitted yourselves rather well, by all accounts. Against two of the Heavens' Ward, that is an impressive accomplishment indeed.
Be with you in a moment, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>.
My apologies, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, but all flights have been suspended until further notice on account of inclement weather.
The Observatorium bells have tolled. Either flee this place or make ready for war.

'Tis love! 'Tis love!♪
All-powerful, shining loooooove!♪
How many dragons would it take to darken the midday sky, do you think? A thousand? More? Too many, at any rate...
So, what do you think? Be honest─it's great, isn't it?
Once the giddiness wears off, I'll resume my duties at the Forgotten Knight. I hope Gibrillont was able to manage without me...
And so the moment you learned that your young companion was in danger, you hastened here with axe in hand? Such fighting spirit! We shall be fine friends, you and I.
It is an honor to have you with us, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>.
I confess, I know not where else you might seek sanctuary, but few places are like to be more perilous than a city under siege.
Ser Redwald and I are discussing how to deal with the heretics in this region. In the meantime, I ask that you see to other matters.
I say, old <If(PlayerParameter(4))>girl<Else/>boy</If>, this is rather not my cup of tea...
As you wish, my lord. Should I spy an outflyer, I will alert you immediately...
We'll stay in touch with your Temple Knight friend, don't you worry!
The <Emphasis>Enterprise</Emphasis> is ready to fly at a moment's notice. Just come running if you run afoul of something you can't handle.
Once more a primal rears its head, and once more the task of slaying it falls to you.
column23: Would that I, too, possessed the Echo...

column22: By the Fury... Must we now defeat a primal, that we might treat with a wyrm? I do begin to see how you gained your reputation for surmounting the insurmountable...
I did not expect our travels to bring us to a moogle village. I wonder if a similar settlement exists somewhere within the Twelveswood...
So exceedingly fluffy...
The Fury take these ridiculous flying rodents!
Just as their cousins in the Twelveswood, these Moghome moogles excel in the manipulation of aether. There are few who could detect them if they so chose not be detected.
How exciting to have relatives in the clouds, kupo!

Warrior of Light. We have not spoken since the trouble with Good King Moggle Mog, and I would proffer my apologies. Had I not been bound by my duty to protect the Elder Seedseer, I would have stood with you against your accusers in Ul'dah.
I owe the Elder Seedseer my life. My duty to protect her surpasses all other concerns.
Pray return to the young lord's side, Warrior of Light. Do not waste your concern on me─I have had long practice locking gazes thus with the wrathful Nidhogg.
What false god is this Shiva? What manner of phantom have I welcomed into my heart...?

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
By order of Chief Slowfix, none may pass without permission.
Promise me you'll take good care of Gilly! Don't let any harm come to her!
Should you need to return to Ishgard for supplies, you can use that standard to signal for an Ironworks airship, just as before.
column23: When your business below is done, let our man at the airship landing know, and he'll ferry you back here to resume the mission.

column22: First Maggie, and now Gilly... Maybe we should have let him have that dog...
The terminal is unresponsive.
The terminal is unresponsive.
The terminal is unresponsive.
The terminal is unresponsive.
The terminal is unresponsive.
You do not know how to operate the terminal.
You do not know how to operate the terminal.
It should be my pleasure to assist you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, once you have spoken with my superiors.
If you have any scrips in your possession, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, I should be glad to offer to you a selection of goods suited to your singular needs.
It is with great regret that I must inform you that the House of Splendors does not accept the custom of unapproved suppliers.
If you'd like to peruse my wares, you'll need to speak with Geimlona first. House's rules, you understand.
Got some scrips burning a hole in your pockets? Let's see what we can do about that.
Apologies, friend, but I'm not at liberty to assist anyone without the approval of Geimlona.
I am only permitted to offer my services to those who have been approved by the House of Splendors.
Ah, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>, yes? Come, come! We have only the best tools and gear for our esteemed suppliers!
Beg your pardon, but I am under strict orders not to engage with unsanctioned suppliers.

Hmm... Perhaps you have what it takes to become a collectables supplier. Regardless, I will let Morgayne be the judge of that. You may find her at Saint Reinette's Forum, in Ishgard, should you be interested.
If you have any questions regarding our latest ventures and how you may take part, pray do not hesitate to ask.

With the wonders of machinistry in their hands, a trained army of commoners could prove as effective as any company of knights. Thus, be you lowborn or highborn, we turn away none who profess an interest in learning the machinist trade.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! The manufactory has never seen so many new recruits! I have even placed firearms into the hands of several curious members of House Dzemael.
column23: Lord Tedalgrinche, it seems, has been true to his word, and is working to see our growing force of machinists integrated into Ishgard's defense.

column22: No unsolicited submissions! If you want to work as a collectables supplier, you'll have to see Lydirlona in Revenant's Toll.

Got anything good for us <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>this evening<Else/>today</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>today<Else/>this evening</If></If>? Go on and show it to our appraiser, then. I'm sure she's dying to have a look.
<sigh> Times are tough for the inquisition. People are happier and consorting with heretics less.
column23: To make matters worse, I've been ordered to keep an eye on the inspector, on account of my familiarity with his...activities.
column24: <sigh> O Halone, why have You forsaken me...

column22:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Illuminati have many manufactories for crafty-make gobmachines. So we say why not backstrike whizzlepops with whizzlepops?
