column23: Soon gobbieflock will have own manufactory for crafty-making! Maybe crafty-make own gobmachines of unimaginable destructive power!
column24: ...Or maybe we crafty-make less dangerous but still useful whizzlepops. Either way, uplander soon bigeyes!

column22: The House is proud to offer all manner of exclusive goods. Guaranteed to help you realize your every aspiration. Services are reserved for collectables suppliers.
The House is proud to offer all manner of exclusive goods. Guaranteed to help you realize your every aspiration. No refunds.

I have forged weapons and armor for heroes and catered banquets for royalty. I have concocted potions to heal the dying, woven great banners for nations, and just last week I won the Ishgardian Fine Woodworking Association Award for best chair. What have <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> built of late?
To be certified as a specialist is not an honor, but a responsibility.
column23: The Builder will stand in judgment of your works. As will I.

column22: We'll find the missing Scions, I promise you. Between us and the Immortal Flames, no stone in Eorzea will be left unturned.

I dunno if you know, but durin' that godsdamned feast, F'lhaminn got ambushed by some 3rd Unit curs over in Limsa. I'm told she danced free o' their noose, though. Ain't heard nothin' since, but my guess is she's lyin' low somewhere in the port...
<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>! I joined the Crystal Braves in the hopes of following in your footsteps, and I do not regret the decision─not even for a moment!
First things first, we must needs put the Rising Stones in order. We cannot have the Archons return to find their headquarters such a shambles!

If we scrutinize the Scions' records, they should provide us with likely locations to which the missing Archons might have fled. Put your mind at ease─it is for work just such as this that we have been trained.

I sent shinobi to spy upon the Brass Blades, and it would seem that Yda and Papalymo's resistance accounted for a sizable number of the company's soldiers. All we know for certain, however, is that our friends' corpses were not found amongst the bodies they left behind.

We must repair this damage if our minds are to find focus.
Now, where to begin...?
To help widen the net of our search efforts, I've recruited a small army of seasoned adventurers─friends from my own days in the dungeon-delving trade.
Riol and Lady Yugiri have already left to pursue rumors of the missing Scions. I think I might head to Gridania myself, and make some inquiries there.
<belch> Ah, there's naught like a well-earned drink after a hard day's work!
I am sorry that I refused your plea for aid. But aside from the very real dangers that Ishgard faced, I sensed...something not quite right about the Crystal Braves.
For a thousand days I walked along the edges of Abalathia's fiery craters, tempering both mind and body that I might withstand the rigors of battle at my brother's side.
column23: When at last I felt I was prepared, I traveled here to Mor Dhona...only to be greeted with the news that Hoary is nowhere to be found!

column22: It avails us naught to dwell upon that which we have lost. Nay, we must focus on protecting that which we yet have.
Father's spirit burns as fiercely as it ever has. I was proud of him when he ruled the bloodsands as the Bull of Ala Mhigo, and I am proud of him now.
If we are to see stability restored to Ul'dah, we must needs set aside our differences. No more can there be Monetarists or Royalists.
I was one of those to answer the Scions' call to arms, and volunteer my blade at the siege of Ishgard. 'Twas there that I made the acquaintance of this fair fellow...
My fellow Domans and I are glad to have been of service in the Flame General's rescue. If there is aught else we can do, know that we are ever at your disposal.
I've met a new man, but he spends more time talking about his lost sibling than aught else. Mayhap you've met the missing brother─I hear he used to work here...
Oh, Aenor, why must you always fall for these tragic types? And it is not as if we need another healer...
I came as soon as I heard the news of Alianne's capture. But these old bones do not move as quickly as they once did, and the worst of it had ended by the time I arrived in the Toll.
Estinien is a dear friend and comrade. Without him, we would not be where we are. Whatever it takes, let us find and rescue him from Nidhogg's clutches.
The search for our missing friends continues. Should I learn something, I'll be sure to let you know.
You will find shelter here in Falcon's Nest, but should you run afoul of beasts out in the wastes, you are on your own.
I hope you aren't thinking of joining the Convictors. There aren't enough dragons in the highlands for the both of us!
It's the rheums you've got to watch out for. Easy to miss when it snows, and then before you know it, a horde is upon you.
Come to buy your birds at the source? Welcome, welcome.
<click> <click> We will ever be watching.
Ahh, another gloriously uneventful─ Er, if you are looking for the aetheryte, it's right above us!
If netherling is ever in need of succor, I drive away beasts with blows furious as summer squall!
Fear not the kites nor the sprites! As netherling takes shelter to stay dry from rain, I make others feel the pain!
Triple Triad? Perhaps it will help me to forget...
I'm sorry, but I just want to be alone with my pain.
I suspect that you let me win to cheer me up...but I'm grateful all the same. My thanks for the distraction.
My thanks for the game. Brief though it was, I could forget all that I've lost.
Having something to do helps to dull the pain. If you can spare the time, I would be grateful for another game.
Look at all the lovely cards that my loyal admirers gave to me! Aren't they simply divine?
column23: A match? But I don't even know the rules, really. I just find the illustrations so gorgeous, you know? Well, if you insist...

column22: Forgive me, but could we speak another time? I'm late for a very important date...
Oh, look! I won! In cards and in love, I just seem to have all the luck these days. Tee hee!

It's not very sporting of you to beat up on a poor girl who scarcely knows the rules of the game, you know. <If(PlayerParameter(4))>But you'll not have such luck if you challenge me on the battlefield of love<Else/>And here I thought you were a gentleman</If>.
A draw? Perhaps you and I have more in common than I thought. How very...intriguing.
I know all the tricks of the Triple Triad trade! I'll give you a game, so long as you keep it secret from Sisipu.

Sorry, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>sister<Else/>son</If>, but I'm a bit too busy betting on the bo-bo─ I mean, teaching my trainees the angling art─to play at present. Look me up later and I'll give you a game.
Wah hah hah! Wawalago wins! Looks like Lady Luck's sitting on my shoulder and smiling!
Great galloping gobies, I came a cropper! Try me at Triple Triad again and I'll trounce you!
A draw's as disappointing as smooching your sister! How about we have another hand?
Triple Triad? Very well then. But you shall have to earn your victory─don't expect me to let you win!
I'm sorry, I simply don't have time to play right now. I have a truly dreadful amount of reading to get through. Perhaps some other time.
It seems that you still lack skill. If you wish to defeat me, you must first learn to overcome your limitations.
I have been defeated. This is quite the disappointment... But only by embracing death can one honor life. There are things to be learned even from such bitter defeats.
Hm? A draw? I daresay this result has left me near speechless.
Fancy yourself a gambler, eh? Let's play.
Another time. I've business to attend to.
Heh heh! You know, a pint'll help it go down easier.
Well, er... These things happen.
Must say, that was rather unexpected.
So you fancy a game of cards, do you? Be ready─huntin' ain't the only thing I'm good at!
I ain't got time for bloody cards─there's huntin' that needs to be done!
Cards're just like huntin', you see─wait for an openin', and then strike your prey while it's unawares.
Godsdammit! You've got a hunter's instincts, I'll give you that much.
That one almost got my blood pumpin'! We'll just have to wait till the next one to decide the winner.
Triple Triad? I suppose I can afford the time to play a match or two.
I'm terribly sorry, but I must attend to my surveillance duties. Perhaps another time.
Oh my! It seems all my practice is starting to pay off. Erm...that's not to say I have much time to practice, mind you.
But I've had so much success with this deck before. Oh well, I suppose you can't win them all.
Hmm, a tie isn't very exciting, now is it? If you care for another round, I'd be more than happy to oblige.
Well, aren't you bold as brass? I'd be happy to have a game. But I've got the best cards 'round here, and I wouldn't entertain the notion that you'll beat me.
Maybe another time, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>─I've other things that need attendin' to first.
Hah! Well, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>, best you find yourself a few new cards.
Ah well, some you win, some you don't. I'll have another go, whenever you're keen.
Good right up until the end─ain't that a pity. But I'll win the next one.
When I said distraction, I didn't mean I wanted a fight─ Oh, you wanna play Triple Triad? Anything to take my mind offa this mind-numbing lookout.

I'd do anything to make this lookout duty more exciting, but word is my commanding officer's making the rounds, looking for troops who're neglecting their duties. I'd best not muck about till he's done.
That was a good effort, but not enough! You see, about all I do is play cards in my head to pass the time, so you might say the deck was stacked against you from the start!
Godsdamn, that was a tough match! I'm gonna have to spend some time thinking about how to beat your deck─while I'm doing my duty, of course.
That's the distraction I needed! Triple Triad's about as deep a game as they come─ Don't see why we need to war when we could just play cards.
Triple Triad, kupopo!? I love playing against new opponents! Don't go easy on me just because I'm a moogle!
I'm terribly busy at the moment─I must clean my collection of shiny tools, kupo. We can play when I'm done!
I won, kupopo! I'm always ready for a challenge, so come back when you get better!
I can't believe I lost, kupo! But I won't give up─I'll keep playing until I win!
That match put my pom on edge, kupo! Let's play again─ I'll beat you this time!
Why'd they send me all the way to this godsforsaken place? I need a distraction else I'm like to jump off this cliff outta boredom.
Oh, it's you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I appreciate you coming by, but shouldn't you be at the Congregation? That's where the others are gathering, no?
<If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss, miss<Else/>Sir, sir</If>! You wouldn't happen to have any amber-encased vilekin for sale, would you? No one in Ishgard will offer you a better price! I promise!
You there, good <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>! Surely you should be glad to serve a good cause─and receive due compensation as well!
If you've come for work, speak with Ser Eloin.
The Supreme Sacred Tribunal of Halonic Inquisitory Doctrine is no place for outsiders─unless they are come to stand before the Fury and answer for their deeds.

This is Durendaire Manor, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. You may not enter without the leave of my lords, but if it is respite from the cold you seek, mayhap you could visit the cathedral.
The main entrance to Durendaire Manor is below. If you are here on official business, it would behoove you to present yourself there.
Excuse me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>, but I'm under strict orders not to permit anyone entry to Haillenarte Manor. I'll have to ask you to leave.
This is the residence of House Dzemael. Unless you have business with my lord, I cannot let you pass.
Too many young girls are quick to pledge themselves to the first house that will have them. They think one lord is as good as any, only to learn the truth the hard way.
Pray keep your voice down when─ Sorry, sorry. Used to serve as a guardsman over by the scholasticate. Force of habit. Carry on.
This gate? Leads to the western highlands, but it won't do you any good if you haven't got any wings.

Aye, this is indeed an airship landing, though it doesn't get all that much use. If you've got your own black chocobo or some other means of airborne conveyance, then you may feel free to use it to return to Ishgard.
Heretics and Dravanians are bad enough, but this blasted weather is something else...
Ishgard's proud standard flies over Falcon's Nest once more. We must see that it remains so.
At first, I thought I'd be grateful for a peaceful posting, but now I'm not so sure. Granted, I'm liable to live longer here, but I could do with a touch more excitement.
Oh, you are speaking to me? Sorry, I spend so much time alone with these old papers... Really, I do wish the soldiers had done a better job of organizing their records before the Calamity.
Hm? Isn't it obvious? I'm watching for my birds. What better vantage point from which to spy our enemies than the sky?
I tell you, it's been nothin' but work, work, work! But when I look around and see how far we've come─and in so bloody short a time─it makes it all worthwhile.
Ever since the Calamity wreaked havoc on the climate, there's been no end to the surveying. Though the work runs me ragged, I give thanks that I have work at all.
Don't let the troops' griping deter you! Traditional Coerthan soup really is delicious. Would you like to try some yourself? After all, the proof of the pudding─sorry, soup─is in the eating!
One day I'll tell my grandchildren about the day the Dravanian Horde fell upon us like an avalanche of flame─the whole sky blotted out by their black, leathery wings...
Beautiful, isn't it? The spitting image of Haldrath, first of the Azure Dragoons and one of Ishgard's founding fathers...

Nothing out of the ordinary so far...but who can say what the <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>morning<Else/>day</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>evening<Else/>morning</If></If> will bring.

One could conceivably pass through Snowcloak and exit somewhere in the central highlands...assuming that the tunnels did not collapse upon one's head. As unstable as the Warrens are, however, entry into the ice wall has been restricted to all but authorized surveyors.
By now, the Warrens of Snowcloak should have been fully explored, but the tunnels yet harbor a tenacious nest of heretics. Progress has been painfully slow...
Aye, you might call me the “leader” of the Convictors. The title, however, is entirely misleading─what I am is a wet nurse for the petty nobles who flock here seeking an easy path to glory.
column23: Of course, many of them perish long before they think to suckle at the teat of my wisdom. The stalwarts you see in camp are those who have managed to survive. I suppose if one does not die in the attempt, one eventually becomes rather good at slaying dragons.

column22: We Convictors are all here for the same reason─to try to prove ourselves and move up in the world. The best way to do that is with an impressive feat of combat.
column23: Jantellot may not be a master of spearmanship, but he's a great leader. It's ambition that counts, and nobody here wants to prove themselves to the realm more than he does.

column22: Oh yes, they're all very brave. Pity you can't feed and clothe yourself with bravery.
Honor, glory─men seek these things in battle. Alas, all too often, they find something else entirely.
Did you kiss one of them caelumtrees on your way in? If it weren't for the protection of their spreadin' boughs, you'd likely be restin' in a dragon's belly about now.
Say, you might make a pretty good hunter yourself! Haha, I'm just yankin' your leash─I know you've got much more excitin' prey in mind.
See these traps? Some bloody outlaws set them up, hoping for an easy catch. They're liable to injure the chocobos we catch to make our living, so it's our job to collect them before they do.
Our bows have gotta be in prime shape at all times, because we never know when the catch of a lifetime'll cross our paths.
Gysahl greens ain't just for raisin' chocobos, you see. They're a key component for the traps we use─the birds can't resist 'em.
Look at the sheen in the feathers, and the strong, sturdy legs─he'll make me some good coin at the markets, I'd wager.
Not all birds fetch a good price in the markets. Fortunately, they've plenty other uses, as you can well imagine.
Don't talk so bloody loud! I'm on the lookout for chocobos, and I can't very well concentrate with your yappin', now can I?
Let me know if there's any particularly feisty chocobos running about. I like myself a good hunt!
<click> <click> Leave our hive. There is nothing for you to hunt here.
We Vath work together and live in freedom. I pity the Onemind, that they know not the beauty of freedom. <click> <click>
<click> <click> Once, I was of the Onemind. Now, I am Cibleroit. Why Cibleroit? Why not?
Life can be hard and unpleasant. But for a generous hunter, there might be something more...
I can stand here in silence till the next Astral Era─just wait here if you don't believe me! A hunter can't hope to make a big catch if he ain't patient.
My kindred and I strive for tranquility, mortal. See that thou dost naught to imperil this peace...
We should be happy to serve you when you have sufficient funds, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>.
We have no quarrel with man, but the young ones are still prideful. They look upon man with contempt. In time, they will understand the folly in their judgment.
A child of man has come to Anyx Trine? Long has it been since your kind walked these lands. If only we could return to those peaceful times...
Without wings, you must take this passage to scale the tower. Above you will find more of my kin, but beware the cave of Mourn.
Bear, loaghtan, bandersnatch—I will feast on them all when I am a dragon grown.
The bridge beyond this chamber leads to Mourn. It is a place of silence. Tread softly through its halls.
Long ago, this land bathed in the flame of our ancestors. Molten rock still clings to the tower, a testament to their rage.
Hmph. You are welcome here for now... But remember, we are always watching.
There is no response.

...Burn it down...
Burn them...all... <snore>
While this posting may not afford the Rose Knights much glory, we are nevertheless responsible for the safety and security of Camp Cloudtop.
You're standing aboard the very first large-scale airship born of Ishgardian ingenuity—the <Emphasis>Protector</Emphasis>. This ship marked a monumental change in the war against the Horde.
column23: Or it would have, if we could get the bloody thing to fly. It seems for every malfunction fixed, three more take its place. I can only hope the war doesn't end before repairs are complete, if you can call that something to hope for.

column22: Despite the lack of danger here, ordering provisions for the men is always an uphill battle. Thankfully they understand the burden I bear in rationing what little we have. Well, everyone except Gildon, perhaps.
If you seek Lady Laniaitte, you can find her down at the Rosehouse. Down the stairs and follow the path. It's not far.

While not the glamorous life one expects of knighthood, it is an enjoyable one. I daresay there's something almost therapeutic about tending to these crops. Perhaps I should consider becoming a botanist.
Day in and day out we stand watch, but for what? We all know there's no danger here. <sigh> The sooner I'm relieved from duty, the better.
“Sheep can't survive in the Sea of Clouds,” they said. Well, I'll show 'em! These here sheep'll be the pride of Cloudtop. You wait an' see.
Sorry <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>, but you've caught me in the middle of surveillance duty. Whatever your trouble, it will have to wait.
It's not as though we have great expectations for our men. That being said, the profound lack of discipline some are exhibiting is a bit much.
Ok' Zundu is no place for netherlings. Away with you, lest you share in our ill fortune.
Like summer breeze which makes Vanu Vanu feel fine, netherlings are ever welcome in Ok' Zundu!
Chief Sonu is the leader of the Zundu, strong and wise. Netherling shows proper respect, and he will treat you with the gentleness of an autumn breeze.
Welcome to Ok' Zundu, netherling! Listen, hear cries of young Vanu ring out as they dance─netherling should watch, maybe <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If> dances as well!
Gales of laughter, raining down like hail big as stone─ Oh, netherling! When Guna Vanu thinks of Brother's failures, mind turns to dark places.
Feast your eyes, netherling! Flower as beauteous as sunset after first spring rain! None in Ok' Zundu can claim to raise one as splendid!
Like rain from cloudless sky, the White comes without warning to consume. All for the madness of the Vundu...
Netherling, if stomach growls like looming storm cloud, just tell Hinu Vali─Ok' Zundu home to countless tasty bugs, and Hinu Vali great cook!
Dance of Ok' Zundu as precious as rising sun that gives nourishment of light─does netherling's village have dance as well?
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>─I will not judge you by your curious name. What I will judge you by, however, is your performance during my Trials of Trustworthiness, kupo!
If your tummy's gloopy or your wings're droopy, I've a potion to fix that!
If you follow this path all the way to the top, you'll come out on the summit of Sohm Al. There's such a lovely view up there, kupo!
Go on, stare at me if you must, kupo! I have grown accustomed to such gazes of unadulterated adoration. Creatures of my surpassing beauty are rare in the lands below, I should imagine...
Have you ever seen such a splendid flower, kupo? I water it every day─ I can't wait to see it grow even more!

Are you surprised to see such a fierce-looking moogle, kupo? The Pomguard must defend Chieftain Moglin and all of Moghome. Mind your manners in front of the chieftain─and don't make him repeat himself.

Have you come to admire my latest piece, kupo? I have been attempting to capture in oils the essence of the humble kupo nut, but inspiration is fleeting. ...Especially when the rumble in my belly overpowers the passion in my heart.

No other place in Moghome gets more nourishing sunlight, so this is the ideal place to grow kupo trees, cloud mallows, and any other precious plants we want to protect from the brutish skylords, kupo.
I'm gonna build the biggest collection of shiny landlord treasures any moogle has ever seen, kupo! And then, I'll bask in the envy of everyone in Moghome!
Mognell and I are here to keep an eye on the dragons, kupo. Ever since Nidhogg roared, they've been up to no good.
The dragons look as small as kupo nuts from up here, and even I can crush a kupo nut, kupo! I'd go down and squish them, but I'm a little tired today. Maybe tomorrow...
When I see all the marvelous structures and glittering tools the landlords made, I can't help but want to know more about them, kupo!
Flowers are one of the most precious things that grow here, kupo. One day, I want to grow a whole field of them, and invite people from the surface to come gaze on their beauty.

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
This place is Idyllshire, heart of great new nation. Free nation built by all and free for all!

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Clicklox offers warm and hearty welcome to uplander! Join gobbieflock in grand experiment!

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
If only Illuminati leave us alone, Loudjox can eat without always looking over shoulder...
Pssshkoh... Woolnix is standing guard, keeping Idyllshire safe for gobbiekin!
Pssshkoh... Uplanders pack up things and leave buildings empty. So is gobbieflock coming, and becoming keepers of Sharlayan.
column23: Now this is pride of gobbieflock. Holepix will defend home, will not let anyone take Idyllshire!

column22: Shkohhh... Illuminati must be stopped! Halfsix is racking braincase for ways to defeat them─clever pranks or tricksy plans!

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
There are so many fun things here in Sharlayan! Drydox want to find them all. Drydox want to unmake them, see how they work!

Takes a certain kind of person to make it here, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. Us treasure hunters, we don't always follow the letter of the law, but we've got our own codes. If you're like-minded, maybe you've a place here. Elsewise, best find your way back to civilization.
This place ain't nothin' like Ul'dah. Sure, that place might be more established, but Idyllshire is a much nicer place to live.
I almost died in the Calamity. But Notched Bone saved me. I'll never leave his side─I owe him my life!

Your two eyes may be open, but if your heart is closed, you'll get no knowledge from me.
...What does that even mean, you ask? Fie, work it out for yourself!
Evol gnipeews s'tel, swish-swish-aroo! I'm disrespectful to dust. Can you see that I am serious?
Tsud eht etib llahs enon, swish-swish-aroo! Out of my way, adventurer. This is no place for adventuring!
I'm hopeless in battle, and I can't clean as well as the brooms... I'm good for absolutely nothing, ribbit.
column23: Oh, woe is me! I don't want to go back to being an ordinary toad! <croak>

column22: <blip> <blip> Greetings, loyal soldiers of the Allagan Imperial Military. Today's training will consist of... <buzzzzzz>
Cleaning in progress. <beep> Warning. Floor may be slippery when wet.

Warning! Warning! <beep> Attention all...<buzzzzzz>...Helix safeguard terminals are currently unable to...<buzzzzzz>...should retreat to a safe distance until such time as...<buzzzzzz>...risk of injury or death.
<blip> <blip> Emergency transmission from...<buzzzzzz>...loyal soldiers of the Allagan Empire. By official decree, all...<buzzzzzz>...not a drill. Repeat: this is not a drill.
An adventurer, eh? Well, call yourself whatever you please. When the dragons are finished with you, we'll call you something else.
Lost? Saint Valeroyant's Forum is just up these steps. So named for the former Azure Dragoon, in case you were unaware.
It's slow going, as you might expect. We didn't think to prepare for the worst, so here we are, picking up the pieces.
Can I help you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>? Bowl of beets? Small beer, perhaps?
column23: Ah, him? Lost his little girl to the pox. Best leave him be.

column22: If you want for coin, you might consider undertaking a leve or two. Some are rather more challenging than others, but the rewards are well worth the hassle.
Reports of Dravanian assaults hammer us down without cease. I fear keeping record of the destruction will soon be an impossible task.
Ser Aymeric has told me much and more about you. Suffice it to say my expectations are high.
They told me I was too old to take up arms against the Horde─that I couldn't possibly make a difference.
column23: Wasn't until the wyverns came that I realized they were right.

column22: These steps will take you to the Pillars, where you will find the manors of the High Houses, Saint Reymanaud's Cathedral, the Athenaeum Astrologicum, the Tribunal, and much more.
You stand before the Congregation of Our Knights Most Heavenly─the headquarters of we knights who have sworn to serve the Holy See.
Thought to take a stroll through the Brume and remind yourself how good you've got it? I swear, you people...
I can't...I can't feel the pain in my arm anymore. Can't feel much anything... That's good, right?
Outlanders are often surprised to learn of our ministrations to the poor. They find it to be at odds with the more militant activities of the faith.
column23: To them I would say judge not the teachings of Halone by the actions of those who would claim to know Her will.

column22: Aye, the days and nights of Ishgard grow colder, but the weather is not to blame. The bite of cold can be cruel at times, but the feeling of hopelessness and despair chills our people to the core.
Just a little more, that's all we're asking for! The children won't survive without enough food and blankets!
<sigh> I just wanted to go home to Falcon's Nest. But I now fear what I'll return to...
Welcome to the Holy Stables. I guarantee you'll find no finer stock of battle chocobos. Or if your gaze is fixed skyward, we also specialize in black chocobos trained for flight.
What's so holy about these stables, you ask? Well, it was established by the See to train mounts for the Temple Knights, for one.
column23: But if you ask me, it's because our birds are so brave and strong, why, they'd be fit for the Fury Herself to ride!

column22: I know we've fallen on hard times, but you ever see a war ended by cryin' and complainin'? Didn't think so. The moment we lose the resolve to keep goin', it's all over.
A warm welcome to you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>! Please, feel free to visit our many, many shops. You are bound to find something to satisfy your every need.
I am but a humble merchant, my dear <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>, but I pride myself on my selection. From folios for the scholasticate to chocobo fodder, I promise you I have it!
Up above you'll find Saint Reymanaud's Cathedral and the Holy Vault. Pray observe proper decorum should you wish to proceed.

May Halone bless you as She has blessed me this <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>day</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If>, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. Oh, if only you could have seen the wondrous temptations She saw fit to place before me in the Jeweled Crozier!
We came away with our lives. Though our losses weigh heavy in our hearts, we must carry on for those who have fallen.

I can hardly believe it! House Fortemps granting patronage to a common sellsword? Well, should I chance to meet this ragamuffin, I will say to <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>him</If> <Emphasis>good day</Emphasis>!
None may enter the Holy Vault without permission.
As the shepherd watches over his flock, so do we of Saint Reymanaud's Cathedral care for those who seek sanctuary in these trying times. May the grace of Halone keep you safe on your journey.
When my grandson became a knight of House Fortemps, I was so proud. But now, every day I come to pray for his safe return.
Where is your cassock!? You know how they─ Wait, you aren't a seminarian...

Oh! Er...pray pay me no mind, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. I am merely taking my <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>midday<Else/>evening</If></If> constitutional.
column23: I am <Emphasis>certainly</Emphasis> not hoping to catch the eye of Lord Artoirel, oh no. Heavens forfend, if a married woman of my station were to become involved with the young lord, why, think of the scandal!

column22: To most, gazing at the skies fills the heart with peace. Alas, it has long ceased to have that effect for me. In the silhouette of every bird, I see a dragon coming to raze our city.
It's bad enough when a merchant's wares “fall off the cart.” Have no doubt that it's far worse when that cart is an airship.
You have taken interest in the scholasticate robes? I remember how I longed for the privilege to wear them. But now that they make me a clear target for people's anger, I feel more guilt than joy.
Airships are quite the innovation, but I never imagined scheduling flights could be so infuriating. Snowstorms, thunderclouds, random Dravanian assaults—I swear if I have to cancel one more flight...

This is a star globe. Upon it you shall find a map of the very heavens above us. Any self-respecting astrologian would not fathom taking something so delicate out into the elements, let alone into battle...

While sailors use the pole star for guidance, we astrologians look to the dragon star, for its position and magnitude in relation with neighboring celestial bodies can reveal when and where the Dravanian Horde will strike next.
The ever-tightening grip of this unnatural winter has proven far more than a nuisance for many in my field.
column23: The stars can tell us little if their message is forever hidden behind a veil of storm clouds.

column22: ...Begone.
The Sun has spoken. See to your tasks.
A few free spirits were tempted to take advantage of the recent instability. Relieve a few blue bloods of their possessions and so forth. Don't worry─we put a stop to it.
I don't have much wits, but I've got wits enough to follow Hilda's orders!
The Brume's our home, and we'll take good care of it!

Hm? Oh, how rude of me. Welcome to the scholasticate! If there is aught that you need, whether a kind ear or a supportive voice, do not hesitate to ask. The others are preoccupied with their studies, but I will do what I can to help.
column23: These books can only teach so much of what it means to be a clergyman. It requires selflessness and compassion—the kindness that afforded an orphan like me the chance to pore over these books. Someday I will repay that kindness, and pay forward the good will of this church to the masses.

column22: I would avoid the scholasticate if I were you. If you're expecting a community of bright-eyed students, eager to follow the righteous path of Halone, you'll be sorely disappointed.
column23: In truth, it's more like a pit of vipers. It's almost embarrassing to admit I'm a seminarian of the scholasticate, but I at least have the sense not to study in such a foul place.

column22: Shhh. Please keep your voice down. If the matter is not urgent, it would be prudent to save it for another day. The others would not take kindly to anyone disturbing their studies.
column23: But do you not find that strange? I should like to think the duty of helping others comes <Emphasis>before</Emphasis> our studies. I daresay their preoccupation with these books leaves them blind to what it means to take up the cloth.

column22: Policy states that, regardless of station or birth, we are all seen as equals studying here in the scholasticate. Would that I had the authority to change that. Why? Well, to be frank, the clergy is simply no place for those of low birth.
column23: Consider, if you will, the responsibilities of the clergy. Teaching the doctrines of the orthodoxy, serving as leaders and upholding the laws of Ishgard—would you trust such tasks to the vermin scurrying about in the Brume?

column22: Off with you! I've neither the time nor the inclination to entertain travelers. There's work to be done and hardly any time to do it.
None in Tailfeather can come close to beatin' Leonulfe's stew in flavor, that's why I spend most my time here. Try a bowl, an' you might not want to ever leave!
<click> <click> The Gnath of the Onemind─every day they eat the same thing. They eat the same bland paste. They have no idea of all the yummy, delicious foods in the world!
If you're looking for Ser Jantellot, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>, you can find him by the fire.
I have one of the most important and difficult jobs in Moghome: watering the flowers, kupo! You can't put too much, and you can't put too little─truly, it is an art form!
Continue down this road and you'll get to Asah. My friend Mogmont's guarding the entrance there─it takes a courageous pom to stand guard with all the skylords about, kupo!
The statue stands as serene as ever, kupo. As long as my pom remains upright, I'll let none defile these sacred grounds.

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
This is watchguard post. It is important place. We watchguard for nasty monsters and evil Illuminati!

This is Asah, part of the great wyrm Hraesvelgr's domain. Nidhogg's meddlesome minions would like nothing more than to burn it down to rubble, so I must always remain diligent in my lookout duties, kupo!
Performing routine diagnostics of hybrid life-forms in...<buzzzzzz>...all specimens healthy. No abnormalities detected.
Incubation chambers all operating within acceptable parameters. In order to ensure optimal research conditions, please ensure that... <buzzzzzz>
<buzzzzzz> ...research laboratory employee hunting program─sponsored by...<buzzzzzz>...our exciting new hunting competition! For more information, please... <buzzzzzz>

<beep> Multiple intruders detected in Gamma Quadrant. Initializing expulsion protocol seven-four...<buzzzzzz>...software is provided “as is” and without any express or implied warranties, including, without limitation, the implied... <buzzzzzz>
<beep> Possible use of unregistered transportation terminals detected. Use of unregistered terminals is a violation of...<buzzzzzz>...immediately discontinue usage of all unregistered... <buzzzzzz>
This auditing system has identified multiple counterfeit replicas of Allagan technology. Illegal usage of Allagan...<buzzzzzz>...the fullest extent of the law.
<buzzzzzz> ...indicate that approximately 90% of manufacturing and assembly systems have halted. To reactivate systems, please ensure that... <buzzzzzz>

<buzzzzzz> ...has detected critical weakness in key restraining systems. Preliminary analyses suggest wear and tear caused by...<buzzzzzz>...recommends immediate maintenance or replacement of affected systems.

<buzzzzzz> ...show steady increase in population of unregistered dragons in vicinity of...<buzzzzzz>...rate of growth inconsistent with normal dragon breeding rates. Immediate investigation highly recommended.
Two thousand five hundred and fifty-one items are currently awaiting administrative review. Please ensure review by an authorized dragon breeding oversight official at your earliest convenience.
I-I say! Such fine...sand we've got here, wouldn't you agree? Pity I've no luck with chocobos─or other pursuits, for that matter... <sigh>
There was once a time that Falcon's Nest was no more than a small village. Now it is a key stronghold in the defense of the Coerthas highlands. Imagine if one of those villagers could see it now!

Ishgard has its problems, but eliminating the Horde is the first step to solving those problems. That's why I am here. I may not be a great warrior, but I can still do my part to help the land I call home.
Peews ot evil I, swish-swish-aroo! Sweep with me or die! Can you do any less?
Moghome is a wonderful place, but I like being under the sun so much more, kupo! Feeling the breeze on my pom and watching the sparkly stars is so relaxing!
Why am I here, you ask? To seize an opportunity, what else?
column23: Don't misunderstand, though. The House is still headquartered in Revenant's Toll, and I'm not about to change that.

column22: The more distant and harsh the frontier, the louder the call that beckons me there. That's the plight of the explorer, and I wouldn't trade it for anything.
The nearby air appears warped. You sense that concealing magicks are at work.
The nearby air appears warped. You sense that concealing magicks are at work.
I may be no more than a common ronin, but I am still committed to bringing the Wolf Burglar to justice.
column23: I hope I can count on your help in the future, my friend. And that of the inspector and his assistant, I suppose...

column22: Did you not desire truth? Go forth and find it.
Before coming to Camp Cloudtop, I considered myself a botanist of some skill. To my chagrin, much of my knowledge seems to count for naught here...
Welcome, welcome to Elde's House of Excellence! Our signboard is newly hung, but I promise you'll find no finer leatherwork in all of Ishgard.
<Emphasis>Wonderful</Emphasis> weather we're having lately, eh?
You be sure to let me know if you hear anything new about the Wolf Burglar! I'll do the same!

You stand in the Skysteel Manufactory, chief producer of Ishgard's dragonslaying siege weaponry. Should you be interested in learning the machinist profession, pray direct your queries toward Lord Stephanivien.
It's been so long since I've been back in Ishgard. Still, there's no rest for the wicked─it's high time I planned my next fishing trip!

...Not from Ishgard, are you? I'm from Ul'dah myself. Jus' come up to serve House Fortemps. The name's Haimirich, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>, cap'n of Oschon's Raiders─the finest company o' sellswords that ever lived!
Ala Mhigo belongs to the Ala Mhigans once more. One would hope this would mean an end to the refugee problem, and yet...
Once, I was head steward to Ishgard's finest house. Now, I work as a shopkeep's assistant. Such is life, I suppose. And at least I still have the strength to toil─poor comfort though that is.
Hm? I'm just a poor soldier from a poor family─what business does an adventurer have with me?
The beauty of Neverreap is like a rainbow in the sky on a summer's day. The cruel Vundu sully it with their presence, yet we are powerless to drive them away...
Wild beasts within, heretics without... Suffice it to say, we've many a reason to see that nothing and no one passes through the gates.
The Dotharl are fierce and brutal, but the Sun fears them not. Rather, we pity them their ignorance, as the shepherd pities the lamb.
<buzzzzzz> ...system offline. Maintenance request submitted... <buzzzzzz> Unable to establish connection with... <buzzzzzz> Please confirm status of transmission node in sector... <buzzzzzz>
Intrusion detected in sector...<buzzzzzz>...transmitted to safeguard node in... <buzzzzzz> Threat assessment in progress...
<buzzzzzz> ...Unauthorized user. Access denied. Senior military or laboratory administrator clearance required.
Welcome to Eshtaime's Aesthetics. Should you be of the inclination─and the means─to purchase our wares, I would direct you to the counter over there.

Are you here to report a crime, adventurer? No? Well, if you see something, do tell me. I'm here to bring enemies of the peace to justice. It hasn't been hard─a heretic caught attacking is guilty, as are adventurers brawling while in their cups.
column23: But lately, there's been a string of thefts that I can't make heads or tails of. Perhaps the criminals are growing more clever─or I'm getting older!

column22: Greetings and welcome to the Missing Member! No, really, all people are welcome to dine here! There is absolutely no danger of dismemberment!
The time for words has passed, traveler. Now is the time for war.
Pssshkoh... Giant of metal is holding fast to land, and Slowfix is telling Redbrix to keep eyes on big hand!

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Roundrox saw giant of whirlycogs stand three years ago.
column23: But Roundrox was very little, is thinking she only dreams it. And grown gobbies don't listen to younglings...

column22: Pssshkoh... Someday, Roundrox wants to live in place like giant, together with whirlycog things aplenty.
column23: But if giant moves, Father is worried. So Roundrox is thinking hard, and decides to build own castle from treasures!

column22: Once the confusion in Ul'dah has sorted itself out, it should prove a whole lot easier to search for our friends. Never fear, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Tataru Taru is on the case!
Everyone's on edge these days. They're drinking more─which is good for business, admittedly─but they're doing it for all the wrong reasons...
It was a near thing, convincing those heretics to stand down. But this is hardly the end of it.
There is much I wish I had said to him... Alas, as is all too often the case, it is a realization which comes too late.

Limited though my influence may be, I shall do mine utmost for the stability of Ishgard. With life and limb I shall protect the nation, as my brother did, and see it preserved for your return. So see to it that you return to us!
I confess, I found the ceremony unexpectedly stirring... Each of us must play our part in building a brighter future for Ishgard─we who profess to rule most of all.
I say, the tales they are telling in the streets! Lady Iceheart, infamous leader of the heretics─a ravishing beauty!?
column23:
They say her hair is white as ice. I wonder, what's the color of the ha─
Honoroit, my boy! You're still here. Fancy that.

column22: I still can't quite believe that he's gone. It's like a joke told in poor taste, except I've no one to heckle but the gods.

You're the leading <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>man</If>, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. You know what they say about the leading <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>man</If>? <If(PlayerParameter(4))>She<Else/>He</If> never dies. Now, go and do me proud!

There you are, old <If(PlayerParameter(4))>girl<Else/>boy</If>! We must go to the tavern together, and soon! My friends all demand to be introduced to the Warrior of Light, and they refuse to take no for an answer!
...My lord. <Emphasis>My lord</Emphasis>! That leer is most unbecoming!
My lord...
I-I mustn't cry... I swore to Lord Emmanellain that I wouldn't... Excuse me, I have something in my eye... <sniff>

Pray pay no heed to Lord Emmanellain, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>. I am certain you have far more pressing demands on your time. And for his part, my lord has <Emphasis>lessons</Emphasis> to attend...
column23: He has resumed training in the blade, you see, and has shown admirable dedication...for the most part. I believe he has a mind to take up Lord Haurchefant's mantle─but if he is to succeed in this, he will need all the help he can get, and as few <Emphasis>distractions</Emphasis> as possible.

column22: I know not what you are planning, Warrior of Light, but I pray for its success. In the event that your gambit fails, however, the Horde shall not find us unprepared...
I had been meaning to reveal the truth of my identity for a while now, but I could not seem to find the right moment. What better time than after saving your lives?
Go well, my friend. May the Fury bless you and keep you.
You are a true hero, my friend. The minstrels shall sing of your deeds for generations to come.
column23: The road to reform will be long and trying, but Ser Aymeric will not rest until he reaches its end. And I shall walk with him every step of the way.

column22: How narrowly did we avoid a grievous miscarriage of justice! Full glad am I that the Fury blessed you with the strength to overcome your foes!
'Tis in the very face of fire and ruin that one must remain calm and collected.
We were all terrified to learn of the events below. While we ourselves had no reason to fear, many of the servants─myself included─still have family in Foundation.
This...this is a black day for House Fortemps.

When first I bade you welcome before the Arc of the Worthy, little did I imagine that you would go on to steer the very course of our nation. I am proud to have borne witness to history in the making.
Mayhap it's cruel of me to say it, but any girl foolish enough to take a lordling to bed has no one to blame but herself in the end.
Before the rebellion, men from the south sometimes came to trade. Now? Much, much less.
I will allow that there is merit in preserving Coerthan traditions. That soup, though...it's practically Gridanian. I'll take a Brume bowl of beets over it any day.
Though it would seem that the crisis has since passed, the fact that heretics were able to enter the city in force is of great concern.
Well if it isn't the bandit hunter! Some House Haillenarte knights came through the other day singing your praises. Gave those southron buffoons what for, eh!?

Are you certain you won't consider joining the Convictors? With a <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>fellow</If> of your abilities under my command, I can only imagine the prestige we might win back in Ishgard...
Well, now, if it isn't the traveling companion of the Azure Dragoon. Surely one who travels with the esteemed Estinien would not be averse to the slaying of a few more dragons...?
Would that these brave souls had the good sense to bring more than arms and armor with them. Out here, a thick blanket's more precious than a steel breastplate.
...It's true, then? Ysayle is dead? Gods spit on us all! We'd heard rumors, but I weren't inclined to believe 'em...
Q'yantaa and Hudde'll do just fine together. Can't wait to see the chocobos they bring in!
Hudde's right, it ain't the pretty things that keep us fed. It takes most hunters a good long while to get cozy with that fact.
<click> <click> We are the Nonmind. The whispers of thought are grown silent, and with our voices aloud we must speak. Of necessity, then, was a storyteller chosen...
<click> <click> We did not know that your kind hunted gods. The Vath stand in awe of your deeds!
<click> <click> Generous hunter, you can relax here. The aroma of these herbs keeps the dragons at bay.
<click> <click> How liberating, to eat meat whensoever we wish. However, it is not as delicious as before. Is it of lower quality?
You are always welcome in Loth ast Vath, hunter. Your generosity is very appealing...yes, very appealing, indeed.
It was a good battle, but ultimately unsatisfying. The ironmen's machines make for poor sport, so repetitive and predictable their attacks. Victory was never in doubt.
So, thou didst choose the path of conflict. Such a road ought to have led to thy destruction...yet thou hast silenced the incarnation of vengeance itself.
Thou art welcome here, friend of Ysayle. I have heard all that hath come to pass.
column23: Ysayle was as a brood-sister to me, and her passing is no less tragic for man's fleeting life. May she rest in peace.

column22: You have taught my children much. I long for the day when they are safe, when man and dragon make amends.
You have shown me the glorious bounties of the hunt. To be a dragon grown must be a glorious thing indeed.
A flying feathered whale, was it? Well, if nothing else, the sentries should have no trouble spotting it.
Francel and I spent many summers with Haurchefant and his brothers. I...I know not what to say.
Word has reached us of your great victory over Bismarck. Is there no feat that is beyond you? On behalf of my knights, I offer you my humblest thanks.
If I didn't know better, I'd say Gildon was up to something. I wouldn't go so far as to say assisting him is a waste of time, but I have no doubt matters of greater import weigh upon your mind.

It seems I've misjudged Gildon all this time. He often thinks with his stomach, but he has a good heart, and his resolve to reinvigorate Cloudtop has inspired the men. Perhaps someday a post here will be something men aspire to, rather than deride.
Oh, hello there, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I'd love to talk, but I have to keep a lookout for suspicious activity. Perhaps we can have a chat later?

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, good to see you! Thanks again for your help with the Vanu. It was a harsh but necessary reminder of what we've been stationed here to do, and morale has never been higher.
column23: Even Fabrellet has been more cooperative of late! The next time you drop by, perhaps I can convince him to treat us to a nice meal.

column22: It's true what they say about fear being a good motivator. No one wants to be devoured by a giant whale, after all.
Hah! I daresay your victory over the white whale gave Lady Laniaitte cause to smile for the first time in days.
As saplings bask in the warmth of the sun, so too may netherlings partake of our hospitality.
Like zephyr winds and blue skies, netherlings are ever welcome in Ok' Zundu.
Thanks to netherling, Brother fills with confidence, holds chest high like cloud welling with rain! Guna Vanu's family remembers netherling until sun rises no longer!
A summer squall of thanks upon netherling hero. Falsehood of the White plain for all to see!

Ah, the oddly named <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I was most impressed by the sheer number of chores that you and your friends were able to complete in such a short amount of time, kupo. If you ever have need of our aid again, I'm sure we can come to some sort of labor-based arrangement...

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, your name rings oddly in my ears as always. When the day comes that moogles, landlords, and skylords can live peacefully together, I shall prepare a great feast of kupo nuts and moca leaves.

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I've thought long about this, and it's finally time to decide on a proper moogle name for you. I think Mog<Unknown2F>FF11022C0DFF07022903EB0203FF02200203</Unknown2F> would fit you perfectly, kupo.
Idyllshire has one important rule─always respect friends. If we all obey this rule, one day Idyllshire become great city!
You have done great hand-lending for nation of Idyllshire, uplander. To us, you are like cityfriend. Idyllshire's most important rule is to always respect friends. Now, that include you!

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Big trouble in Idyllshire! Giant of metal comes to life, threatens our way of life!
Pshkohhh... Slowfix hears of Roundrox's doings inside giant of iron.
column23: Roundrox loves finding junk, and Slowfix does not have heart to stop her. But please, please, keep Roundrox safe!

column22: Pshkohhh... For stopping giant, Idyllshire must shower uplanders with thanks!
column23: But Illuminati are not done, and magic walls still stand. Slowfix worries that this is not really end...

column22: You told the cap'n of Gevehard's passin', I take it? Thank you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. A man deserves to know when his brother dies a hero.
column23: Amazing thing, though, that you'd join the Raiders as a miner and dig up the truth behind the cap'n's family...

column22: I've heard you lot're makin' to knock that iron monstrosity into the Thaliak.
column23: Idyllshire's lucky to have friends like you. Puttin' down a great big thing like that's above what me and mine can manage.

column22: Adventurer! It's good to see you again. I've been working hard as a citizen of Idyllshire... To finally have a place where I feel needed─I ain't never been so happy in my life!
It's thanks to you that Notched Bone and I could become citizens here. We really, really appreciate what you did for us.
I don't care much for politics. Too much talk and not enough action.
column23: If I were you, I'd forget about all that racket and have some time to myself. Even you must see you've earned it.

column22: The primal at the river? Aye, I've heard. Shtola's yelping woke me from slumber.
column23: It's a nuisance, I tell you. I had just coaxed my weary bones to sleep...

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I understand you've bought us a moment's respite from the primal.
column23: But much as I'd like a rest, it's not to be. Our foes certainly won't be napping in that fortress of theirs.

column22: Ah, 'tis you, kind adventurer! Thanks to you, I have been entrusted with a task of great honor, and I mean to perform it to the best of my ability.
column23: With my mistress yet hale and hearty, for now I continue serving her tea seven times daily. But I stand ready to spring to my task at the first sign of her expiration, ribbit!

column22: A great many of our ballistas are beyond repair. They will be sorely missed when the beating of leathern wings fills the skies above Ishgard.
The dragoons are chronically undermanned, and more so now than ever before. We must needs rectify the situation, and soon, else we shall struggle to match our foes in the sky.
The heretics wreaked the greatest havoc in Foundation. In war, it is inevitably the weak and powerless who are made to suffer most of all...

Though you are no <If(PlayerParameter(4))>daughter<Else/>son</If> of Ishgard, you have shed blood with us and for us. Though I am no individual of any great import, I would express my gratitude all the same. Thank you, my friend.
Gibrillont has ever been a staunch supporter of our efforts, though he has since come to prefer more indirect methods.
column23: Time was, he would be here almost every day, working side by side with the other volunteers...

column22: Welcome back, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. Thinking of assisting Elde, are we? News travels quickly along the Crozier.
Hello again, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. In spite of the recent disturbance, it's business as usual here on the Crozier, and our merchants peddle on with purpose.
Elde's shop has become the jewel of the Crozier─but we of the guild believe she can do more, and neither Gerhardt nor I will not shy away from aiding her further.
Ishgard's return to the Eorzean Alliance has breathed new life into the Jeweled Crozier. The announcement had scarce been made when the merchants began eyeing opportunities in foreign markets.
Oh, an astrologian now, are we?
column23: Well, then perhaps you can show me the approximate degree of the dragon star's cyclical declination as a result of the precession of the equinoxes when coupled with annual parallax? No?

column22: Still playing astrologian with Lord Jannequinard? Might I ask how many Horde attacks you've predicted in the past moon? None?
“Lord” Rufin will soon find that her disguise has not fooled anyone.
column23: A quick cut and tousle doesn't change the fact that her hair is still purple.

column22: I could tell you that your decision to study under Lord Jannequinard was unwise, but that would imply that I cared.
Word is that Chief Astrologian Forlemort has become significantly less vocal in his objections of Lord Jannequinard's eccentricities.
column23: If you ask me, the only reasonable explanation is blackmail.

column22: Would you believe that the Observatorium has requested the drafting of new constellation-based celestial charts to supplement those we have used for the past four centuries?
column23: Of course you would. It was you and Lord Jannequinard who started this chaos.

column22: As a novitiate here at the Athenaeum, I have been assigned several important tasks outside my regular studies. One of those is delivering updated star maps to the Observatorium.
column23: Between you and me, I do not see why they cannot simply use moogles.

column22: As an Athenaeum courier, I am one of the few novitiates who has the honor of meeting with Chief Astrologian Forlemort on a regular basis.
column23: However, his foul mood as of late has me wishing I were assigned something─anything─else. Well, anything but receptionist duty with Lord Jannequinard.

column22: The Athenaeum headmaster has ordered me to begin training in Sharlayan astrology...
column23: What, I ask, did I do to deserve this fate? And don't you tell me Sharlayan astrology can show me the answer!

column22: No need to worry about us. I'll work with Ser Aymeric to preserve the peace. You just concentrate on settlin' the score with the archbishop, eh?
You know, seein' you flyin' in on dragonback helped put things in perspective. I mean, if man and dragon can put aside their differences, how hard can it be for the rest of us?
column23: To be sure, our lives won't change overnight, and it'll take effort to bridge the gulf between highborn and lowborn, but I'm confident it'll all work out in the end.

column22: We'll keep the city in one piece, don't you worry!
We've got Hilda's back, don't you worry!
We won't get up to no mischief while you're gone. Not <Emphasis>too</Emphasis> much, anyway!
We'll change Ishgard into a country we can <Emphasis>all</Emphasis> be proud of! Just you watch!
In light of recent events, the practices of the orthodoxy have been called into question. I fear those who once sought the church for guidance will lose their way.
column23: But that is precisely why we must redouble our efforts. Faith in the church must not give way to doubt and dismay.

column22: So, people are beginning to realize everything isn't all black and white. Good.
column23: No system is completely without corruption, but when I join the clergy, the unfaithful will be driven out. You have my word on that.

column22: To think there are those who would try to sully the reputation of the church. Meanwhile, I can do naught but spend countless hours poring over these books.
column23: I still have much to learn of the doctrine, this is true, but the clergy will not be subject to suspicion or ridicule after I take the cloth.

column22: The church is not without its faults. It was only a matter of time before the people were given an excuse to decry its teachings.
column23: But the Holy See has seen us through a thousand years of war. It has given us hope, something to unite the nation in our struggle for peace. I hardly see the fault in that.

column22: <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Milady<Else/>Milord</If> must be a warrior of some renown to keep company with the likes of the Azure Dragoon. Me? I'd be lucky to last three heartbeats with some of them big, nasty Dravanians...
I slay lesser dragon after lesser dragon, but each corpse only brings me a few gil. I keep at it, for my boy, but it's simply not enough.
column23: A greater dragon, on the other hand, would be worth a king's ransom...

column22: I told the Temple Knights the truth behind my father's death, and that Nguruvilu is dead by my hand.
column23: They've not accepted me into the order just yet. These things take time, after all. But they've paid for the dragon's head, and it's enough to keep Philipallais warm and fed till he's a man full-grown.
column24: The boy spends every spare moment practicing with that trident you made. Says he wants to slay dragons like his old man, and I'm worried he's getting just good enough to do it!

column22: I am a steward at heart, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>, not a merchant. Grateful though I am for the work, the sooner I am free of this shop, the better.

<If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>, you will be happy to learn that Baroness Laurisse has distinguished herself from her fellow squires with her usual...tact.
column23: Regardless, she <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> be the shining sword of Ishgard, bright and fearsome as the blade you forged for her. Perhaps you will think me a simple man for saying so, but I do truly have faith in her.

column22: Eshtaime's trusts me with the most important orders from its most prestigious customers, and I work hard not to betray that trust. My clients expect only the best, and the best is what I─and the artisans I call upon for my commissions─provide for them.
column23: “To give form to that which is formless and breathe a warm, beating heart into the coldest of metal”─each day I reflect upon the meaning of these words, and endeavor to provide each of my customers with a work of singular beauty that speaks deeply to their heightened aesthetic ideals.

column22: Why, if it isn't <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>! Once again, allow me to commend you on your sterling craftsmanship.
column23: It would be no understatement to say that the twin music boxes you created will stand for an eternity─not only on the mantel of our clients─but in the hearts of all who have laid eyes and ears upon this singular work of genius.

column22: Oh, hello again! Might I assume you've decided to aid in my enterprise, then?
column23: It's all right if you haven't, of course. I'm still drawing up plans for my shop's future─what we can sell, how best to garner attention, and that sort of thing. It will take some time, but please, <Emphasis>do</Emphasis> consider helping.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, welcome, welcome! I've been so busy, I scarce have time to eat! Keeping my products up to your standards is difficult, but I must─the brand carries your name, after all.
column23: Nor would you believe who my new advisor is─Ser Ortefauchel! The Temple Knights are sure to purchase more and more of my goods, and I'm putting his knowledge of the order to good use.
column24: That is the shape of things for the moment, my friend. I will continue onwards, ever striving for better quality at lower prices.

column22: Pay no mind to me. I'm just waiting for Elde to get in that shipment she promised.
By some strange turn of fate, I've taken your place at Elde's side. You have left some rather large boots to fill.
column23: I believe in the cause, mind you, but it is a dangerous position for me. If my wife catches wind that I'm “working” with a younger woman, my head and neck will soon be parted.

column22: We have suffered much during the past twenty years. However, I now finally feel that there was meaning to our pain. I'm glad we were able to hold strong and live to see this day.
I'm far too old to be any use on the battlefield nowadays. I try to make myself useful instead by concocting medicine for those that fight for us.

Chanene knows a fair bit about magic. She even tries her hand at it now and again. I, on the other hand, tend to the nitty-gritty of investigations─chasing culprits, helping them find their tongue, and so on.
column23: Together, we've solved more than a few cases. Most require little more than canvassing and common sense, but this one is just so damnably strange. As I said, it's a good thing we've got an alchemist to consult.

column22: Did I ever tell you how I met Severian, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? It began years back in Ul'dah, when I took a simple request from the Alchemists' Guild as a greenhorn.
column23: The guildmaster only needed a few ingredients. But you know how these things get away from you─a bard could easily've written a song about what I did for the bloody things. To this day, I'm not sure why I didn't just give up. Pride, I suppose.
column24: In any case, I gave the ingredients to Severian, and I got <Emphasis>a</Emphasis> word of thanks. One. So when I asked him for help with this Waoud business, I'd expected little more than a terse letter. But he sent you in his place, which leads me to wonder if he <Emphasis>did</Emphasis> feel indebted to me.

column22: Oh, hello there, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Thank you for coming by, but I'm afraid I have nothing new to report. As ever, that bastard H'mhasi Tia's bein' a right pain in the arse.
column23: Ack, there I go again with my cussing. Pray forgive me my poor manners─it ill becomes a waitress, I know.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, ye've got to 'ear this! Since 'e lost to ye an' left on 'is journey, H'mhasi Tia 'asn't sent me a single letter! Not a bloody one! <sigh> Even when 'e's not around, 'e manages to piss me off...
column23: In other news, I've begun helping out in the kitchen. It seemed to be the most natural thing to do. Just you watch, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>─next, it'll be me as 'umbles that cocksure whoreson!

column22: Professor! Joinin' me for a cup of ale? Then what do you say to a barrel?
Professor, how've you been keepin'? I've been thinkin' on Gevehard o' late. I owe you a pretty debt for learnin' how he breathed his last, I really do.
column23: The Raiders're doin' fine as well. Can't promise that we'll be here forever, but I've a mind to keep us here for the moment─the lads haven't made enough trouble to get us kicked out of Ishgard, an' House Fortemps still owes us.

column22: Why, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I didn't expect to see you here so soon. Couldn't wait to get started, I take it?
column23: Well, please be my guest and show yourself around. I imagine it'd make things that little bit easier for when we have a task for you.

column22: You're ever welcome here, my friend. It's thanks to you that I'm still able to do what I love.
column23: Our work continues, as you can see. There're still numerous challenges to overcome, but overcome them we will and make these isles rich with nature's bounty.

column22: Good <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morrow</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If> to you, my fishing friend! Caught any big ones recently? If I hear any promising rumors about where the fish are biting, you'll be the first to know.

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, it's good to see you! I expect you're here for the fishing contest. Sad to say, I've another battle on my hands at present─the one with my brother for control of House Rougecarpe.
column23: It's only a matter of time before he gives up the ghost, but I'm afraid our little competition will have to wait till then. I just hope that when the time comes, I'm not too rusty to give you a challenge!

column22: Thanks to you, Saintrelmaux is like a new man. It seems every word Ser Aymeric spoke of you was true. If I ever need help slaying a great and monstrous beast, I'll be sure to ask you first.

Your efforts have not only changed the Convictors for the better, but also brought about the first step in leading Ishgard to a bright and shining future. I daresay you are a greater hero than even Haldrath himself!
It's so great to have new friends from the Twelveswood, kupo! I've never had so much fun chasing around monsters before!

Word is you've performed yet another heroic feat. Came into some rare treasures while you were at it, too, I shouldn't doubt. Well, if you want to get the most out o' your trinkets, you know where to bring 'em.
...Come back soon.
I...I didn't ask for this. I didn't ask for anyone...for Fray to...
It's not that I don't appreciate their help, but...they really had no idea what they were singing about, did they?
For the first time in a long time, I'm not afraid to think of the future. And...when I do, I find myself...excited, perhaps?
column23: I don't expect it'll be easy...but that's all right. I've got Sid.

column22: Ah, our newest recruit. Was there aught with which I might aid you? Lord Stephanivien is best equipped to answer any questions you might have regarding machinists and machinistry.
Your battle against the dreaded Svara was the stuff of legends. Truly, 'tis the beginning of a new era.
column23: Long have I labored at this post with no more effort than duty requires─but no more. Now I might hold my head high, and announce the name of our manufactory with pride.

column22: The once-vibrant flower of House Haillenarte is much withered. Will machinistry be the miracle that helps it bloom anew...?

Welcome back, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Word of your deeds continues to spread, and the manufactory is beset daily by a veritable legion of aspiring machinists!
Pshkohhh... Mide is amazing! She can tell pretty junk from ugly almost as well as Roundrox!
column23: This whirlycog Roundrox finds seventy-two yalms north and west. And this one, this one is twenty-four yalms south and east of Arkhitekton!
column24:
Pshkohhh... Shiny junk and sparkly rocks,♪
Bittybobs and whirlycogs.♪

column22:
Pssshkoh... Shiny junk and sparkly rocks,♪
Bittybobs and whirlycogs.♪
column23: Sometimes Backrix is coming with Roundrox for junk hunting.
column24: Uplander will come next time, too?

column22: Pssshkoh... If uplander comes back safe from core unmaking, Roundrox will give one piece of secret treasure!
Pssshkoh... Wh-Where are treasures of Roundrox!?
The fates have been cruel to my lord. Aye, very cruel indeed. First they took his brother at the Steel Vigil, and now they have taken a bosom friend in Lord Haurchefant.
I am hopeful that Tsubame will persuade the village elders I should remain here. Eorzea has much yet to teach me, and I wish to learn it all before returning home.
Lest you wonder, Basyle and I trained as botanists together. You might even call us rivals, if you can imagine such a thing between people who grow and harvest plants.
column23: But even as we competed against one another, we held each other in esteem. So when it was decided that he would go to settle the frontier, I wished him every success. Please aid him in whatever way you can.

column22: Basyle wrote to me of all that has happened. Allow me to offer you my personal thanks for saving him.
column23: In his letter, he expressed his determination to continue the work you helped him start. It will be a few seasons yet before his efforts bear fruit, but I have no doubt that the crops and knowledge you have contributed will prove to be of immeasurable worth to Camp Cloudtop.

column22: With Ser Aymeric having taken the reins of our nation, I don't doubt that great change is on its way. We would do well to be ready when it arrives.
Sisipu says you've been dipping your digits even deeper into the Sea of Clouds. It seems so long since I've roved 'round the realm, with my rod at the ready and a song in my soul... <sigh>
column23: Not that I'm jealous of your journey─not a jot! While you're off finding fame and fortune fishing in far-flung faerielands, this likely lad's having all the luck with the ladies!

column22: Whatever the Defiant may be plotting, the dark magicks passed down by my ancestors shall remain with me and me alone. I have no intention of revealing them to anyone, least of all those shameless ne'er-do-wells.
column23: Even should they lay their rage upon me yet again, I shall not relent. In defense of what is right, my resolve shall not falter.

column22: Greetings, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> of the black. I am impressed by the harmony that your destructive magicks and Zhai'a Nelhah's healing attained. A truly remarkable achievement.
column23: Though I dream that this small seed of hope might bloom into a new age of cooperation between magi, I know that it cannot happen without magi such as you. I am honored to have known you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.

column22: What is it? I've no work for ye yet, if that's what ye want. Ye'd best get back to whatever it is ye do when ye ain't pesterin' me.
Ye've changed me life, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I've made some mistakes, aye, but me head's on straight now.
column23: Ye just watch─I'll take everythin' I've learned, an' prove to H'naanza that ol' Blanstyr's not ready for the scrap heap just yet. That contest is as good as won!

column22: The Brass Blades that were occupying the Rising Stones suddenly up and left. It's true, then? The Scions have been cleared of all wrongdoing?
column23: ...Gods, what a relief to leave that nasty business behind! I look forward to having all the old faces back. It just isn't the same without them.

column22: So the Scions have been exonerated... I'm truly happy for you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. It's a shame that the Crystal Braves had to be disbanded, though. So much hope had been placed in them.
column23: With so many people leaving, the town won't be as lively as it was before. But no matter where you and yours end up, know that you'll always have my best wishes.

column22: The Scions have been busy making new friends of late, and the place is lively again for their presence. I must say, it warms the heart to see folk come together in common cause.

I see that the Rising Stones is no longer under guard, and I take it as a turn for the better. I know not what has happened with the Crystal Braves, but it seems plain it wasn't a simple matter such as restructuring.
column23: But I shall refrain from prying further. Too much about this business remains shrouded in mystery, and I feel decidedly unqualified to bear the burden of knowledge.

column22: After all that commotion, I'm right relieved to see that the Risin' Stones is back in your hands. Whatever mess it was you were in, I knew you'd pull through, and you have! Now you can get back to the business o' savin' the world, eh!?
I recall when we were first given the task of reclaiming the Steel Vigil. There were those among us who resented House Haillenarte for placing us in so precarious a position.
column23: Lord Haurchefant chastised us for judging them so harshly. “We are all sons and daughters of Ishgard. Are they not deserving of our loyalty? Of our love?”
column24: ...We shall not look upon his like again.

column22: A knight of Ishgard lives to serve, and lives to fall in battle. Every last one of us is fated for this holy duty long before we are born─and when the last dragon perishes, we shall meet again in the hall of our fathers.
column23: Thus spoke my father to me, and his father to him. Thus did I speak to mine own son...and the count to his, I expect.

column22: He was a good man, Lord Haurchefant. Never failed to treat me with kindness and respect, even though I was not sworn to his service.
column23: As keenly as some here feel his loss, I fear my lord Francel's suffering beyond compare.

column22: House Haillenarte has known few friends as faithful as Lord Haurchefant. Even when the prudent course of action would have been to cast us aside, he embraced us as allies.
column23: We shall honor his memory and see that the ties between our two houses are never broken.

column22: The hearths burn low these days, and the servants are rather listless. I thought I heard someone sobbing the other day, but perchance it was just the wind. Oh well.
I don't recall a shield being part of Lord Haurchefant's memorial, but when I visited it the other day, there it was.
column23: A fitting addition sure to inspire others to carry on in his stead, for the sake of House Fortemps and Camp Dragonhead.

column22: It's about time they stopped spreading those awful rumors about you! Oh, but I do hope this doesn't mean you won't drop in anymore.
When he dined with us, he would never fail to ask us about our day, and favor us with that smile of his when we did...
column23: <sniffle> <sob> It's...it's all just a bad dream, isn't it!? When I wake up, it'll be the way it was, won't it!?

column22: I think the ceremony was just the thing to help everyone move forward.
column23: There will doubtless be times when we remember and weep, but I should think they will grow fewer and further between.

column22: The news of the archbishop's disappearance has been received with shock here at the garrison. At present, we know little beyond the fact that Ser Aymeric has stepped up to take charge of the situation.
column23: I have had occasion to meet the lord commander, and he struck me as a man of honor. With his proven leadership, I doubt not that he has matters well in hand, yet I would be lying were I to say that I am unperturbed by these developments.

column22: Though we endeavor to keep it from our faces, the turmoil which racks the See has left us with uneasy hearts. And for all the rumors of a truce, war remains the order of business here upon the front lines.
The recent revelations have driven some lowborn knights to question their place within the order.
column23: Yet it is no simple thing to leave the Temple Knights. When principles and practical considerations are at odds, what are we to do?

column22: They said you were there with him. At the end. Tell me...tell me it was...
column23: Forgive me, I haven't the words.

column22: He was rather fond of those cliffs, you know. On a clear day, they offer a fantastic view of the city.
