column23: The way he would look at it, with a smile that wasn't quite, and eyes that held the whole of the world...
column24: I would give anything to know what he felt in those moments.

column22: I knew the truth would out! 'Tis well that your innocence was proven, but I'm still of a mind to keelhaul the villains who sullied your good name!

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I was full glad to hear that the accusations against you had been dropped. And you must be relieved to need no longer check over your shoulder every few steps for the shadows of Ul'dahn agents.

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Brayflox thanks goodly uplander for lenthand against Illuminati. Brayflox returns from Sharlayan with junk muchly. Junk is making Brayflox rich gobbie for a long time!
Full glad are we to hear that the false accusations leveled against the Scions have all been cast out. Plainly, you have put such freedom as you were afforded to good use and cleared your names.
column23: Though the experience will doubtless have stung, the Elder Seedseer bids you be not disheartened by it. Pray lose not your faith in your fellow man, and forge on as boldly as you have...for the sake of the realm we share.

column22: The Lotus Stand lies beyond this grove, but the Elder Seedseer is not receiving visitors at present. Know, though, that my lady is most pleased for your exoneration.
...So the rumors about Laurentius are true!? That bloody fool! He had a golden chance to start over, and he went and shat all over it!
column23: I'd set aside a bottle of my best mead to celebrate his release, but it looks like we won't be opening it after all. Instead, I'm going to smash it over his head the next time I see him!

column22: Now that the Flame General has been reinstated to his post, we have regained a semblance of normality.
column23: There is still much and more to be done, but we can finally see a way forward─and we owe it all to you, <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(54),127))><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If>.

column22: This is the Gate of the Sultana. It was erected to commemorate the ascension of Her Majesty Nanamo Ul Namo to the throne.
column23: Let us give thanks for the sultana's swift recovery─may she reign forevermore!

column22: Blessedly, our orders to keep watch for the Scions of the Seventh Dawn were rescinded not long after the Flame General was formally reinstated.
column23: Hopefully this will go some way towards defusing the recent tensions between the Brass Blades and the Immortal Flames.

column22: And just like that, the worries of the wealthy elite seem to have come and gone. Not that it makes much of a difference to us.
At long last, my superiors have seen reason and rescinded their orders to apprehend the Scions.
column23: Thank heavens that I no longer have to play the fool! Much as it pains me to admit it, I simply haven't the knack for mummery.

column22: 'Twould seem that there is still some justice left in this world.
column23: A long overdue reminder to the melancholy among us that we are not wholly at the mercy of men and their machinations.

column22: Glad to have things back to normal, eh? No more unenforceable orders and all that.
column23: It was getting to be a bit uncomfortable, lying every time someone came through asking after you.

column22: I <Emphasis>knew</Emphasis> it could not be true! In my heart of hearts, I knew that Her Grace was still alive!
column23: It must come as a great comfort to you as well, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, to be able to come and go as you please once more.

column22: It brings me joy to see that the Scions' good name has been restored.
column23: Yet it would be naive to think that the wrongs done to you and yours can ever truly be redressed.

column22: I heard ye pulled General Aldynn from the graspin' fingers of Thal Himself. It pains me, it does, to see that proud warrior less an arm...
I knew ye'd prove them accusations wrong, so I just hunkered down until the storm had passed. No sense in wastin' energy on battles ye've got no need of fightin'.
It is time for the Scions to strike back! The winds have changed, Warrior of Light, and we must ride this gale as far as it will carry us!
Urianger has us working day and night, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. We won't stop looking until we find each and every one─none of us will!
Thank the gods you're all right. 'Twas a mighty struggle, from what I heard. Would that I could have fought by your side.
Now that we need not fear reprisals, we can focus our efforts on locating the missing Scions.
column23: It may be that they too are lost to us...but so long as there is hope, we must try.

column22: It looks like your training is going well! You must needs further your mastery of the techniques of eld, for the sake of both Broken Mountain and Curious Gorge.
column23: Curious Gorge looked after his brother day and night while he was recovering─it's a godssend he's been able to recover so wholly. I'll do whatever I can to help them, as I'm sure you would.

column22: Riol came and told me the Crystal Braves have disbanded. I expressed my regrets and offered him a place here, but he declined with a smile, saying that he means stay on with the Scions of the Seventh Dawn.
column23: It appears that the fellow has found his purpose, and for that I am glad. Do take care of him for me.

column22: Curious Gorge and Broken Mountain are forging the Maelstrom recruits into fine warriors. It won't be long before you hear about their ferocity on the battlefield.
We know of Wilred's death─a man of the Crystal Braves came bearing the news.
column23: He left Little Ala Mhigo with naught but a blade at his hip and hope in his heart. Naught of him but his blade has returned to us. Once more, fate spits in our faces...
column24: But though his life's journey was cut short, Wilred walked a path of his own choosing, and proudly. In this knowledge, I find a small measure of solace. May he go to his rest in peace.

column22: The Brass Blades have been ordered to cease their pursuit of the Scions, but we've received no new instructions. What are we supposed to do now?
Y-You! We rejoice at your return, O esteemed and...and <Emphasis>merciful</Emphasis> Warrior of Light! P-Please have mercy on me... <sob>

Full glad I am that your names have been cleared. I feared it only a matter of time before your accusers grew bold enough to send their minions here─though I cannot say I would not have welcomed the opportunity.
Sometimes I think I see him sitting there, out of the corner of my eye. But when I turn to look...
After speaking with the others, we have decided to leave the intercessory vacant for the time being. You are more than welcome to make use of it as you see fit.
column23: I dismissed it as a mere jest at first, but I suspect Lord Haurchefant was quite serious when he suggested calling it the “Falling Snows.”

column22: Ever a sight to lift the spirits, my friend. I should like nothing more than to accompany you in all your doings, but my duties keep me here.
column23: Though it is a poor substitute for adventuring, you must allow me to take you on a tour of the city when things have settled.

column22: I see that you have once again chosen the most perilous path. But I shall not seek to dissuade you with some unseemly display of concern! Nay, my friend, I have faith that you shall carry out your duty, and return to us a greater champion than ever before.
column23: ...My dear mother was a woman both beautiful and righteous, yet terribly, terribly frail. Thus, have I ever been fascinated by those blessed with physical fortitude and spiritual conviction in equal measure.
column24: In your relentless quest for Eorzea's salvation, you have proven time and again how hardship but serves to temper your heroic qualities. It is with breathless anticipation, then, that I await the changes the rigors of this journey shall work upon you!

column22: So your good names have been cleared, and matters are resolved with the Crystal Braves? Praise be unto the Fury!
column23: Thus relieved of the burden of suspicion, you may resume your endeavors in the name of the realm with easier hearts. But remember, no matter how far you may roam, you may ever consider this place your home.

column22: The heavens are boundless. One would have to live a thousand lifetimes to grasp but a sliver of the knowledge locked away in their dark recesses.
Mine uncle was but one of our problems─a large one, but still one. I fear the worst is yet to come.
column23: This is no augury. Merely a knot in my gut that has refused to unravel since learning of Sharlayan's involvement in Lady Leveva's pursuit.

column22: Welcome back, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. It is always a pleasure to see you here in the Athenaeum.
column23: Things have been quite hectic as of late, what with <Emphasis>Lord Rufin</Emphasis> traveling about the countryside preaching the merits of our field. Why, the number of applications for novitiate positions has increased tenfold over the past moon.
column24: And now, the Observatorium has begun requesting reports on domicile, modality, cadence... Dare I say we needn't wait much longer for the day when Sharlayan and Ishgardian astrologies have joined back together as one?

column22: Oooh, a game of Triple Triad? Challenge accepted! Be warned, though, that I've been spending all my spare time polishing my strategy!
column23: As a matter of fact, I've yet to meet anyone in Ishgard who can provide me with even a semblance of sport. So steel yourself, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!

column22: I'd love to play a game, but right now I really must focus on the search for our friends. Please ask me again another time.
Tee hee, my strategy worked like a charm! My thanks for the distraction, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Now I feel all refreshed and ready to tackle my duties again!
No! Nooooooooo! And I thought I played a perfect hand! <sigh> I suppose my deck just isn't strong enough...
column23: But just you watch, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. One day, I'll have the strongest deck in all of Eorzea, and you'll be begging for mercy!

column22: Whew, that was a close match! It seems I'm not the only one who's been practicing hard!
Hmmm, I just can't seem to make it into the top ten. Mayhap I should select my minions by their merit, rather than their adorability...
Continue straight ahead to register your chocobo at the race counter. The Lord of Verminion tables can be found to the right.

Ah, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Lady<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>! Your minion army is in good trim, I trust? I, for one, would not wish to contend with a seasoned adventurer, no matter the field of battle!
Greetings, I'm Toshio Murouchi from the Community Team. When people ask, that's how I explain my position, but I also do a lot of work for the operations and marketing teams.
column23: I can hardly believe we're already celebrating two years for A Realm Reborn! I fly all over the world for FFXIV-related events, and I recently calculated the distance I've traveled over the course of the last twelve months...
column24: ...A total of 154,750 kilometers! Oh, that is just insane... Not that it will stop me from flitting across the globe for the next twelve months to share in the hopes and dreams of our fans! ...Speaking of which, it's about time I started planning for the next Fan Festival!

column22: A pleasure to meet you─I'm Koji Shirasugi from the Online Business Management Division. You may also have seen me embarrassing myself as Annie...
column23: As part of my duties on the marketing team, I do my best to introduce as many people as possible to the fine MMORPG that is FFXIV.
column24: Together with everyone involved in the making of the FINAL FANTASY XIV channel, it will be our pleasure to continue recruiting the new heroes who are to become your future adventuring companions.

column22: Assistant director and lead battle planner Mitsutoshi Gondai, at your service.
column23: It's been two years since the release of A Realm Reborn, and, thanks to our loyal players, we've been able to put out our first expansion!
column24: We won't stop there, of course─everyone on the dev team will continue working their hardest to create quality content. Hmmm, maybe we'll go with the final boss for the next extreme battle...

column22: Right. I've finished writing this quest, sent the request for that animation, and implemented that other thing...now it's time to speak with Soken about the music, and ask Hiroshi when he wants to do Alexand─ Whoa!
column23: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, it's you! I'm Maehiro, the main scenario writer. I'd been hoping to meet you <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(76),1))>since before the Calamity<Else/>for the longest time</If>!
column24: On this, the second anniversary of A Realm Reborn, I am thrilled to find you here, enjoying our game. May you continue to enjoy the story of Eorzea for many moons to come!

column22: Greetings! I'm Nobuaki Komoto, the lead planner. Amongst a multitude of other tasks, it's my job to coordinate between the planners and the programmers, and help balance development with operations.
column23: Day in and day out, the dev team is working hard to bring you a steady stream of enjoyment.
column24: We're listening to all your requests, criticisms, and encouragement, and are looking forward to shaping an ever bigger and brighter Eorzea right alongside you!

column22: Man, I'm never gonna get that Atma of the Scales... Hm?
column23: You're an adventurer, aren't you? I can tell. I'm Hiroshi Takai, assistant director on FFXIV. It's wonderful to meet you!
column24: Without you and your fellow players, we wouldn't be here, celebrating our two-year anniversary. We are deeply grateful for your support! Thank you, and see you in the game!

column22: Greetings, I'm Hiroshi Minagawa, the lead UI and web artist. I'm usually in charge of how the interface looks and feels, but this time around I was also fortunate enough to be involved with light and shadow adjustments for background maps.
column23: As he did for A Realm Reborn, Yoshitaka Amano created both the logo silhouette and concept art for Heavensward. ...And he also threw in a bonus piece above and beyond what we asked for.
column24: This bonus art can be seen in the collector's edition─the shiny, silver illustration. It's a cool piece, and I highly recommend you check it out. Thanks for stopping by! I hope you continue to enjoy the game for a long time to come!

column22: Wait─you can see me? This is...most interesting. Why? Because I'm not here. There is no possible way I could be here...at least according to the rules which govern Hydaelyn. And it was I who helped create those rules─at least I think I did... But if I'm here, then where is the “real” me? Any number of theories are possible, I suppose.
column23: It could be that the Calamity has somehow split my being in two─half of the aether gathering here, the other half...elsewhere. The western continent, perhaps? The moon? It could be that what you see before you is but a clone, grown in some laboratorium by the selfsame scholars who created those terrible simulacra for Emperor Xande. And, it could be that this world is being generated by some ancient Allagan machine still humming away thousands of years after the fall of their civilization─a virtual representation of the realm within which I truly reside.
column24: Or, it could simply be that I am a song passed down by Eorzea's bards so often that I have become manifest in a method similar to how primals are summoned by the beast tribes. Or, it could be that this is all a dream...but that would be stupid. I'll have to give this further thought.

column22: Hello! I'm Takeo Suzuki, the lead designer. My position has me overseeing the graphics for the entire game, which includes all the characters, animations, backgrounds, and cutscenes.
column23: Thank you for coming to visit us here on the Eighteenth Floor! We love to hear from our players─your interest and support are always a source of enthusiasm and encouragement.
column24: We want to meet all your expectations, and will keep coming up with interesting new equipment and dungeons! Let's enjoy this journey together!

column22: Hi there! I'm Hideyuki Kasuga, the lead programmer. I'm in charge of all of FFXIV's engineering-related tasks.
column23: There is so much I would like to tell you about the technical side of things...but I'm afraid my explanations tend to get a bit long-winded. Probably best if we skip that for now.
column24: Tech matters aside, I'm glad to see you having fun with the game. There's a lot more excitement to come, so keep an eye out for future announcements!

column22: I'm Masayoshi Soken, sound director for FFXIV.
column23: Day an' night I'm here, workin' on ways to enhance our players' gamin' experience...but who wants to talk about that?
column24: Somehow, someday, I wanna see this room filled with a crowd of Warriors of Light wearin' Arachne culottes of healin'!

column22: We've barely ushered Heavensward out the door, and already we need to decide on a direction for the next expansion. The deadline for that opening movie storyboard is right around the corner...
column23: Where should we base this new adventure? Under the sea? Under the ground? On the moon, mayhap...? Even if we do have a fair amount of time until release, we have to plan out announcements, and coming up with a brand-new scenario is never an easy task.
column24: And then there'll have to be new jobs, of course. Samurai? Or how about red mage? Hmmm... Oh! You'll keep these idle musings to yourself, won't you!?

column22: How will we ever turn back this unrelenting tide of bugs? Is there no gallant hero to whom we might turn?
Oh, it's you! Our visitors to Ul'dah seem to be enjoying the anniversary celebrations immensely.
column23: Thanks to you and that wonderful minstrel, we have naught more to fear from those bugs. I am truly and deeply grateful!

column22: Did you wish to hear those verses again? The song that transports you to that creator's paradise...?

See all those balloons? That's right, the Moonfire Faire's back, and promises to be the most explosive yet! What's the Moonfire Faire, you ask? Well, the first one was held five years ago, to beat back the Bombards that threatened to burn the realm to ashes.
column23: Now, it's been a while since anyone's seen a Bombard, but that doesn't mean we can't celebrate every year─and maybe even get a few more interested in joining the guild while we're at it.

column22: It's up to the Adventurers' Guild to make this Moonfire Faire unforgettable, so we'll offer them all the support we can.
It's time for the Moonfire Faire in Costa del Sol! We're always in need of helping hands, but first you need to speak to the grand chaperone, Haermaga, in Limsa Lominsa.
Thanks to you, that pirate has decided to join the Adventurers' Guild.
column23: It seems the other pirates've expressed interest as well. More members and a peaceful beach─couldn't ask for a better outcome! The Adventurers' Guild will be more lively than ever after this faire is done.

column22: Godsdammit, who would've thought the life of a fishmonger could be so difficult? How am I supposed to approach those pretty ladies when I reek of fish?
A fresh fish is the most important ingredient, and there's plenty to be had off the beaches.
The Moonfire Faire is underway! We're calling on the realm's adventurers for help. Make your way to Limsa Lominsa to join in the festivities!
The Adventurers' Guild is once again hosting the Moonfire Faire. I'd be there myself, but I'm on the lookout for anyone willing to lend a hand. Go to Limsa Lominsa─we need you!
My friend hasn't ever seen fireworks. I wanted to show her, but it's not as magical with so many pirates around!
Is it me, or is the beach a lot more quiet lately? I hope they're all gone by the time the fireworks start.
Thanks to the Adventurers' Guild, the pirates trouble us no longer! We'll be able to watch the fireworks in peace!
We were finally able to enjoy the fireworks! But it seems my friend here is more interested in the Adventurers' Guild now. Your struggle with the pirates has her smitten!
Are you looking for something special today? Whether you seek a tasteful tribute to those lost in the Calamity or a symbol of our realm's rebirth, you're sure to find what you need!
column23: Just think how much more poignant those fireworks would be with something to remember them by. Blue comets are fleeting but a souvenir─a souvenir is forever!
column24: ...You seem rather fixated on my face. Do I have aught stuck betwixt my teeth? Or...have I suddenly gained an ardent admirer?

column22: Greetings, and welcome to Minion Square! If you've a stalwart stable of mighty minions, then Lord of Verminion is the game for you!
column23: Feel free to test your tactical talents at any of the tables available. Every gaming station has a rule book on hand, so newcomers can study up before they throw down!
column24: Should your forces feel feeble, our minion trader stands ready to provide fresh fodder for the field. And if the intensity of tournaments tickles your fancy, the recordkeeper to my left will sign you up with a swiftness.

column22: The chamber for the headmistress of Saint Endalim's Scholasticate lies beyond. As she is quite busy these days, those without arrangements for an audience will be asked to leave.
Salutations! Would you care to purchase the latest copy of Aesthetician Jandelaine's <Emphasis>Modern Aesthetics</Emphasis>?
column23: It contains a collection of styles based on the opinions and preferences of honest-to-gods adventurers. Have you ever heard of such a revolutionary catalog? And all for a pittance in MGP!

column22: Never did I think to see a knight of Ishgard come unto Anyx Trine bearing words instead of steel...
column23: Would that the Gnath could show the same restraint. Too many children have fallen to their spears and muskets.

column22: How long it hath been since I called upon men in their homes. I shall have to remember to tread softly.
Fleeting though thy time may be, it is worthy of preservation─and celebration.
To the ends of the world and back again... Yes, we know of your deeds in the West. What will come of them, only the gods know, but for now...welcome home.
If you are looking for Krile, you should find her at the Rising Stones. She was asking after Thancred, though she did not explain why.
I still cannot figure out how Minfilia managed to escape the Sil'dih Aqueducts. All signs point to some magical means, yet if it was not Flow, then that leaves...
column23: Well, there's no use speculating until I learn more. Fortunately, Master Matoya has graciously allowed me to peruse her tomes, so I am confident it is but a matter of time until I uncover the answer.

column22: Though it be born of a lie, our legacy need not end in disgrace. House Fortemps will live on─for the people's sake.
...Sorry, old <If(PlayerParameter(4))>girl<Else/>boy</If>, but I'm not in the mood right now. We'll have that drink another time, shall we?
(Usually when he slips away from his lessons I have to search every tavern to find him, but this time...)
column23: (Do...do you have any ideas? I've never seen him like this before!)

column22: It's a good thing we found Thancred. Right now, we need all the help we can get...
To think I'll be able to witness that sunset once more... <sniffle>
I have an idea how we might find Minfilia, but I'm still working through the details. Tell you later?
If I have to descend into the bowels of the seventh hell to find her, I will. Whatever it takes, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Whatever it takes.

Excuse me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. I came here to secure the services of an experienced adventurer on behalf of the <Emphasis>Harbor Herald</Emphasis>. Would you happen to know anyone seeking a bit of work?
I can't believe Roundrox is gone. Every time I glance at her treasures, I expect to see her crooning over them.
column23: The Shortstop is so lonely without her. I won't rest until she's safe from the Illuminati's clutches.

column22: Have you read our visitors' log? Graduates of the Hall often pen entries with advice for their fellow adventurers─mayhap they've left you some practical pearls of wisdom!

Welcome to the Hall of the Novice. If you're looking to train in the ways of cooperative combat, then look no further! An adventurer who has studied at the feet of our masters will be prepared to fight in any party.

I, too, have once checked out volume eleven of the <Emphasis>Articles of Halonic Polity</Emphasis>. When I went to return it, however, I had the misfortune of being spotted by one of our most conservative seniors.
column23: After being reprimanded for hours on how “the far-fetched notions penned within corrupt the mind,” I shan't be caught dead with it again.

column22: It pains me greatly to see the nonchalance most of the students here have displayed regarding Ulaa's disappearance. It seems they are too busy to feel concern for anyone but themselves─a very impious attitude to take if you ask me. As pupils of the seminary, it is our burden to put another's needs before our own.
Until recently, the students paid little heed to volume eleven's existence. It was only once it vanished off the shelves, along with Ulaa, that their interest was finally piqued.
column23: As one of the few to have leafed through its pages, I'm now constantly being besieged with questions. What they fail to realize is that a single sweep of the text does not constitute a deeper understanding of what is written within.

column22: That Ulaa could be taken hostage by those hooligans from the Brume goes to show our teachers have become far too lax in their duties.
column23: Had they taken their responsibilities more seriously, such misfortune would never have befallen the girl and I would not be forced to contend with a gaggle of panicked students.

column22: 'Tis a true pity. While the scholasticate isn't known for its warm and inviting atmosphere, never has it been so austere.
column23: If Blaisie were here things would be a tad more bearable, but she has very little time for me as of late...

column22: Kidnapped... I scarce believe it, even now. Thank the Fury she was found uninjured! <sigh> Sadly, not everyone is so relieved to hear the good news. I suggest you avoid <Emphasis>him</Emphasis>, over by the bookshelves, lest you also be forced to endure a lengthy speech on the dangers of welcoming separatists back into the school.

All manner of rumors have been flying around regarding Ulaa's kidnapping, and it has become practically impossible to discern the truth from the lies. I only hope they don't serve to reignite the flames of hate that have finally begun to dwindle.

More often than not, I find myself at odds with Ulaa's interpretation of the scripture. Nevertheless, we are both children of Halone. What happened to her is an act that defies the will of the Fury Herself! May the men responsible be struck down by Her mighty spear!

Everyone has their own theory on what happened to Ulaa and who might be responsible for her kidnapping, myself included. While I've no proof, I have a feeling that... <sigh> Never mind. It's going to sound crazy. What's most important is that Ulaa is now safe and sound.
Still snooping about are we? Well, you're wasting your time─you shall find no would-be clues to piece together here.
column23: Just as I have told the others, I tell you now: we are free to choose whether we stay or go, and Ulaa <Emphasis>chose</Emphasis> to <Emphasis>go</Emphasis>─a decision which was to the great benefit of those around her.

column22: The students do not realize how much Archombadin does for them. Without his firm hand guiding the way, the scholasticate would be in absolute chaos by now!

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, words are not enough to express my gratitude. Had it not been for you and Inspector Briardien's unyielding efforts, we might not have discovered what had become of our dear Ulaa until it was too late.
column23: <sigh> She has been attempting to sleep this whole ordeal off, but something so terrible as this is not easily forgotten. I only pray that she recovers soon and that this affair will not leave her with any mental scars.

column22: Praise Halone Ulaa did not come to any harm! While this should be a most joyous occasion, there is unfortunately little time to celebrate her return, for I sense something terrible is fast approaching. Surely, you must feel it too, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>?
Theomocent is right to be concerned. While we may have finally learned the terrifying reason behind Ulaa's disappearance, the bastard that arranged this whole affair still remains at large...

On behalf of the scholasticate, I would like to thank you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I shudder to think what would have become of our dear Ulaa had you and the inspector not been there to deliver her from harm.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, while we can rest easy for now knowing Ulaa is in safe hands, I fear our work here has only just begun.
column23: I trust, however, that with you at my side, our perpetrator's machinations will soon become clear and they will be put to an end before it's too late.

column22: No doubt Ulaa would be able to identify the vile fiend who attempted to frame Archombadin! Where is she? We must begin questioning her straightaway!
It seems that the Alliance forces have at last begun to move. I hear you too have been fighting to free our homeland. You've my thanks, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
column23: We've been doing what we can to help by keeping the Immortal Flames informed and sending supplies to the Resistance. Though I wish we could do more.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>... I don't know what to say.
column23: So much time has passed and so many lives have been lost since the Empire took our home from us. Allow me to thank you on Wilred's behalf. He wanted nothing more than to bear witness to an Ala Mhigo free from imperial control.

column22: I've been helping guide the Immortal Flames reinforcements to Gyr Abania of late. I must say, considering I failed to find any work In Ul'dah, it is rather nice to have folks from there coming and asking me for help.
It was...enlightening, to converse with the Dravanians.
column23: A young dragon was most insistent that I make him an omelette, after I had told him it was a favorite food of mine. Suffice it to say, it did not agree with his palate.
column24: Hardly surprising, I suppose. I have no interest in the culinary arts. The only reason I thought to oblige him was because the lord commander had taught me the recipe─or tried to.

column22: It is as Ser Aymeric hoped. There are none within Ishgard who have not yet heard the tale of the young girl and the dragon who saved her life.
column23: Nevertheless, I am not naive enough to think the fundamentalist cause defeated. We must remain vigilant.

column22: Gibrillont said I could come and go as I pleased! Isn't that great? If we're ever in need of a little spending money, I can just work a few shifts!
At first I thought it was just a horrible tragedy, but now they're saying it was arson? What kind of person would do such a thing...
No one ever comes around for tea anymore. No, it's always saving this, preventing that, or mending the godsforsaken other. Anyone would think I wasn't good company.
So, this is Gundu's new home? It makes Linu Vanu uneasy to accept charity from the Zundu, but he must nonetheless be grateful for netherling's help, and Sister's.
Netherling has thanks of whole Gundu tribe. Independence has long been our dream. With netherling's help, our dream becomes reality.
When Eenu Vanu thinks about all of the tasty cloudfish he can catch, his stomach begins to growl like distant thunder. Maybe he should have a snack so he does not scare away fish...
Gundu may become impatient with scarce food on island, but Ranu Vali cannot rush sowing of seeds. Like raising strong nestlings, good crops come to Vanu who tend them carefully.
Birch tree or maple? Hmm, or maybe cedar? Ginu Vanu will build many great huts for Ok' Gundu Nakki. But choosing proper wood is very important.
Greetings, netherling! Perhaps Luna Vanu forgets to mention, but he is merchant of Ok' Gundu Nakki!
column23: Under Vundu rule, he must work always with sanuwas, but with Gundu independence, he is free to find new work and new life!

column22: You wish to play a game of Triple Triad? Normally I only deal in matters of coin, but very well.
Terribly sorry, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>, but I am expecting a rather important client to arrive at any moment. Perhaps another time.
With more challengers than customers in recent days, I suppose my skill at this game has improved.
You would make an excellent <If(PlayerParameter(4))>businesswoman<Else/>businessman</If> with such skill. Have you considered taking up a trade here at the Jeweled Crozier?
A good business deal leaves both sides better off... But this is no business deal. I insist that we play again.
Who am I to turn down a challenge from the <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> that slew the ajattara?
The Horde still stirs, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. I'm afraid I just haven't the time for fun and games right now. I hate to be rude, but...please, bother someone else.
Thank you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. Life at the Convictory is harsh, and the thrill of victory—even in Triple Triad—is a welcome distraction.
This loss comes as something of a shock, but I shall not be discouraged—far from it! It shall galvanize my resolve. Challenge me again. I shall not be so easily defeated.
This may not be a victory, but I have learned a great deal. Next time, I shall use what I've gleaned from this encounter to defeat you.
These cards taste terrible! But perhaps if we use them to challenge you, generous hunter, we can enjoy the sweet taste of victory! <click> <click>
We are sorry, generous hunter, but we are busy right now. We are busy thinking how to catch nankas and farm nankas for their delicious eggs...
<click> <click> This victory is ours! This victory is delicious, and it is ours and ours alone. Sometimes we are truly happy to be of the Nonmind.
<click> <click> You may be generous, but we know you do not surrender victory lightly. A hunter like you fights to the end. Generous hunter fights to the bitter end, even in games.
This game is fun, but a draw is unsatisfying! We are unsatisfied, generous hunter! Let us play one more game!
Triple Triad, huh? Sure, I ain't got any customers waiting. But you should know that I've picked up a trick or two on the road!
Sorry, ain't got time for games right now what with all the orders pouring in from the House. I'll play you when I can take a break.
All right! That was a close match, but it looks like I've still got it!
Bah, everyone knows victory depends on timing, and you just got lucky this round!

Eh, that match left something to be desired. 
I've still got some time before the next job comes in. Come on, let's play again!

<If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>, what a pleasant surprise! A game of Triple Triad, you say? All right, but I won't hold back!

<If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>, it's good to see you! A game of Triple Triad? I would love to, but my duties demand my full attention at present. Mayhap we can play later?
I win! You were indeed a worthy opponent, but a knight of Ishgard yields not in combat nor card games.
...I suppose I am not as proficient with cards as I am with the sword. Nevertheless, it was a pleasure.
Aha! 'Twould seem we are evenly matched! Would you care for another round?
You challenge <Emphasis>me</Emphasis> to Triple Triad? Well, I suppose I have nothing better to do.
Triple Triad? You don't really look like you're worth the time it would take to draw my deck. <yawn> Go and play with someone else.
<sigh>  I just knew this would happen. Yet another boring match. Run along, now. You've wasted enough of my time.
I <Emphasis>lost</Emphasis>? That is...quite interesting. With all of the banal matches I've had of late, I suppose I underestimated you. Well done.
Oh. Well that was...<Emphasis>something</Emphasis>. I guess. <Emphasis2>...Do you want to play again?
Thank you for helping me with that story on Iroha. <sigh> I only wish the information we obtained from it was worth the trouble.
column23: A time-traveling warrior from another world? Who would believe such a thing? There's no way I could proclaim it to be true, but it did make for a nice piece of fiction in the papers. Better luck next time, eh?

column22: Vundu make Ronu Vali teach dance day and night. When Ronu learns of Ok' Gundu Nakki, she escapes at first chance.
column23: Even Vundu tell story of Chief Honu's defeat around cooking fires. Ronu ensures all Gundu dance with ferocity!

column22: The fabled Azys Lla. Is it not inspiring? Ah, if only my master were here to witness its wonders.

Sorry, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, but if it ain't about the anima weapon, I got no time for it. <sigh> What I wouldn't give to be hammerin' out a nice kettle back in Hyrstmill...
Do you think that dragon's comin' back? If she does, do you think she'll let me ride her again?
Hear about that priest? Seems the inquisition can't make him talk, even with all their toys.
column23: They say he just sits there, eyes all glass and a smile. Waste of bloody time. Ask me, you should've let him jump.

column22: That'll teach the bastards to put our homes to the torch!
Gibrillont's takin' donations from folk for buildin' new homes. Ain't been long and we've already got a respectable sum, would you believe that?
Praise the Twelve, they found him! Riol found Hoary!
column23: He's in Thavnair looking after Miss F'lhaminn, it seems. Hah, imagine that! My brother, bodyguard to the Antecedent's mother! He sure has come a long way...

column22: It feels as though all we do is track crystal shipments and spy upon beastmen strongholds. I know it's important work, but sometimes you want to be in the thick of it, you know?
You should've seen the way my man jumped for joy when he heard about his brother!
column23: By the by, you don't happen to know a reputable goldsmith, do you? I'm thinking of commissioning a pair of rings...

column22: While Riol commands our efforts in the field, I tend to administrative matters here.
column23: You might say my experiences with the Crystal Braves helped prepare me for these duties. A pity I never had the chance to “thank” Captain Ilberd. For everything.

column22: I never realized shinobi were capable of such amazing feats! Mayhap I too should take up the shortblades...
I'd wager those Ala Mhigans know where Yda and Papalymo went. In fact, I would not be surprised if they helped them to flee the city─not that they would ever admit to such.
column23: After all, half the Braves up and turned their cloaks during a royal banquet. What reason do they have to believe us when we claim we're friends?

column22: The way the refugees looked away when we showed them the linkpearl fragments... Aye, I think Aergmhus may have the right of it.
column23: He is a good man, but I can tell the betrayal yet weighs on his mind. Would that more of the Braves had been like him.

column22: Aenor, you cannot be serious! He must be three times your size! I mean, how would you even... Surely you haven't...
column23: No, no, don't tell me. I don't want to know. I don't want to know...

column22: You should hear some of the mischief Homei here got up to back in the old country! It's enough to make me think I still have a few good years of adventuring left in me.
Talking with Isildaure, I cannot help but wonder if we met long ago. It certainly feels as though we've known each other for years, if not decades.
The fundamentalists can deny the ancient truths all they like. Vidofnir's deed will not be so easily dismissed.
column23: If we must take advantage of this tragedy to forge a lasting peace, then so be it. It cannot be in vain. It cannot.

column22: It sure is great to have Thancred back! You know, at this rate, I think it won't be long before we get the whole gang back together!
The first commander─and you─have been entrusted with a mission of grave import. For Ishgard's sake, it must not fail.
We received word from the first commander not long ago. Though I would have preferred a swifter resolution, I am relieved to hear that our invitation is receiving due consideration.
The lord commander of the Temple Knights, assaulted in the streets! What madness has gripped our fair city...
Words cannot well express our gratitude, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Thank you for rescuing the hostages...and for keeping the lord commander safe.
By the grace of the Fury, Count Edmont and Lord Artoirel were with Ser Aymeric when he was attacked.
column23: The count managed to stanch the bleeding while his son wrestled the would-be assassin to the ground.
column24: I shudder to think what might have happened had they not been there to help...

column22: While we are proud that Lord Artoirel acquitted himself with honor in the Vault, I am rather more relieved that he returned to us hale and healthy.
Me? I'm Baenfaeld, the celebrant for this year's Starlight Celebration. I'm a bit bleedin' busy with festival business right now though, so if ye don't mind...
I have to thank ye again for all ye've done, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Ye've helped steer us back to the road we ought to have been walkin' in the first place.
column23: Now, if ye don't mind, I've more younglin's to delight with that enchantin' melody. Mark me words, I'll have the whole bloody realm smilin' afore this festival's done!

column22: The children are in for a treat this year!
The Saint of Nymeia sent word of the success of our collaboration. 'Tis gratifying to hear that the magic of my arrangement brought smiles to the little ones' faces!
I don't know what we would've done without you. The celebration's a huge success─and for all the right reasons!
Heard about the watch from the lord commander, did you? Aye, it's true. Feels queer to be operatin' so openly, but I couldn't say no after he batted them eyelashes of his.
Hah, would you look at us! Honest-to-gods watchmen! Hey, how's this sound? “You there─move along!” Not bad, eh?
You can hardly call us a proper watch when we ain't got no uniforms or trainin'. That'll all come with time, though, I hope.

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I have been praying for your well-being. At this moment, I am considering the ways in which we may better convey our desire for reformation, to unite the other students in our cause. Unfortunately, it has not been easy convincing others to look beyond the class rankings...

Theo and Crammevoix have been seeking out students who might be receptive to our ideas, but many won't even look us in the eye. It seems a certain <Emphasis>someone</Emphasis> has been using his ill-gotten clout.
Father Saturnois makes gathering allies sound so simple, yet it is becoming clear that Theo and Leigh are lacking in social grace. I suppose we will have to rely on the charms of yours truly.

I am considering ways to alleviate animosity and unite the seminarians of the scholasticate, yet it is a daunting task. It is always easier to fuel the flames than to put the fire out, and there are some who are clearly provoking my peers.
I have no interest in this shortsighted squabble over seat rankings. It is only natural people would try to take advantage of an unfortunate situation.
column23: Find a way to atone for the distortions of truth, and guide the people back to the faith in a peaceful manner. This is what I will focus my efforts on.

column22: Crammevoix can say what he pleases, yet it does not mean it is the truth. In a state of confusion, even blatant lies can seem like rational thought to the desperate.
column23: Faith in the church must be restored not through word, but virtuous deed. Is that not what we seminarians should consider in determining the future?

column22: I'm sure you're always wondering why I stare at Theomocent. He always seems so confident, so I thought maybe I could learn from him.
column23: I don't really have any outstanding talents. And I get discouraged easily. But when he's around, I feel more positive about what I can accomplish.

column22: If we are to diagnose the root of the scholasticate's ailments, Ulaa and the missing volume eleven must be found.
column23: And in following the clues to their whereabouts, we will be closer to ascertaining whether someone of the scholasticate is involved in their disappearance. I am counting on you, my associate.

column22: To rely on the Zundu makes Linu Vanu uneasy, but any arrangement is better than suffering under Vundu.
column23: A chief must protect his people. Linu keeps Gundu safe from Vundu menace!

column22: Netherling, for generations will they tell tales of Chief Honu's defeat! Zundu and Gundu celebrate their victory as brothers!
column23: As long as our tribes stand together as one, then we have nothing to fear from the Vundu!

column22: Netherling wishes to speak with Muna Vanu? Muna's life is turbulent sea of ups and downs, full of stories both joyous and grim.
column23: If Muna speaks stories to netherling, talking stretches long into night like sky into horizon. Maybe another time...

column22: Long does Linu Vanu fly fierce into headwind of Vundu oppression. It is little surprise that Ok' Zundu's ways ruffle his feathers.
column23: But they save his sister. Bounds of Linu Vanu's love for Linu Vali are endless, and matched only by unbounded gratitude to Zundu.

column22: Free of ceaseless interference from Vundu menace, Ok' Gundu Nakki continues to thrive. One day, Muna tells netherling of his stories. But not today.
column23: Gundu still have many requests to make of <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, but like sanuwa that carries master from dawn to dusk, netherling earns <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> rest.

column22: Under Vundu rule, even if Eenu Vanu catches plump cloudfish, Vundu grab for themselves. Gundu only allowed to eat meager ones from bottom of fishing basket.
column23: But now Eenu Vanu is free to take whatever fish zephyr winds bring to him. He dreams of great hauls, so every Gundu in the village can eat their fill!

column22: Eenu Vanu understands chief's feelings about Zundu paying tribute to Vundu. If Gundu and Zundu work together, no Vanu need to give tribute to Vundu.
column23: If one small fish floats in cloud sea alone, it will be eaten by larger fish. But if many small fish swim in numbers, big fish becomes afraid and will not eat them. Eenu Vanu thinks the same of Zundu and Gundu working together.

column22: Villagers grow in number, and bring big appetite with them to Ok' Gundu Nakki. Eenu Vanu knows this because he was catching enough fish to feed whole village by midday. Now he fishes from sunrise to sunset!
Ranu Vali remembers when she was nestling, she wants to live in sea of flowers. But most beautiful flowers bloom where sun shines brightest.
column23: Ranu comes to Ok' Gundu Nakki where sun shines bright, but she sees nothing but rocks and dirt. So Ranu knows she must help the sun, and sow the sea of flowers on her own.

column22: Zundu are kind to give land to Gundu for tilling, but like flowers without sun, Zundu will wilt under shadow of Vundu.
column23: Ranu thinks that if all Vanu fall under the same shadow of Vundu, then no Vanu can flourish like blooming field. This is what Vundu want.

column22: Gundu and Zundu can work together to reap the earth now. Soon, every Vanu will be adorned with precious flowers and enjoy the gift of fruit from Gundu soil!
Foundation of first hut is complete, but this one must be special. Ginu Vanu is making home for Linu Vanu. It must be grand, like majestic sanuwa flying over rainbow—a hut worthy of new chief.
Does netherling see hut of Linu Vanu? Like moon hanging overhead, this hut is sign of hope in dark times. But together with Zundu, Ginu Vanu thinks tribe is safe.
column23: Vundu tribe is strong, but Zundu tribe is smart. They give offerings to keep the Vundu from attacking.

column22: Ok' Gundu Nakki began as lonely seed, but now it blooms—Gundu tribe grows bigger every day. Ginu Vanu has many, many huts to build.
Hello again, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Luna Vanu is merchant at heart, but under yoke of Vundu oppression, he must always work with sanuwas.
column23: Luna masters his trade and trains sanuwas well, but he has no love for them, and no passion for his work. In Ok' Gundu Nakki, he is his own boss. Perhaps soon, he is merchant again.

column22: Greetings again, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. As population of Ok' Gundu Nakki grows, so too does demand for goods. And now Luna Vanu enjoys life as merchant.
column23: Luna has no doubt that amongst his goods are items not easily found elsewhere. But for netherling who makes all this possible, Luna offers all at most reasonable prices.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Luna Vanu now sells sanuwas! Beasts are fine and strong. If one catches netherling's eye, please let Luna know.
I trust Ok' Gundu Nakki's development proceeds apace? To honor Uunu Vanu's memory, Zundu offers Gundu any aid they require.
Vundu may not invade our borders now, but the threat they pose is plain.
column23: The Gundu's tale makes Sonu realize that current circumstances cannot stand. Change is coming, but whether for good or ill, Sonu knows not.

column22: The Zundu and Gundu talk of netherling's dance─<If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If> is worthy to dance alongside fiercest Vanu warrior!
column23: Our tribes grow closer by the day. Together, we no longer fear the Vundu!

column22: Zundu use Nakki Island as grounds for celebration. Many in tribe look forward to seeing dances of greatest warriors, but now where will they dance?
Zundu wish not to fight─it is not our nature. We only wish to live peacefully, as still clouds on calm summer day.
Linu Vanu is a formidable dancer. When Zundu and Gundu dance as one, Vundu run away faster than scared korrigans.

I am the saru bugyo, come from the Far East to celebrate Heavensturn with the people of Eorzea. Without the aid of one who is as skilled as <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If> is generous, however, I fear the festivities shall fall flat this year...
With your generous help, our mochi has made it into the hands of the masses, and softened the people's hearts towards the mischievous monkeys.
column23: And as our custom has been so well received, we have decided to continue making and distributing rice cakes for the duration of the festival. We would be most appreciative should you choose to aid us again!

column22: I am the mochi daikan, and the making of mochi is my calling! But if we fail to even bring rice cakes to the festival, then it may as well be my heart being pounded in those mortars...
If people have begun to see monkeys in a more favorable light, then our mission here is a success. May the sticky goodness of mochi bind us all closer together! Gahahaha!
Greetings. I have come with the delegation to introduce our customs to Eorzea, and my particular duties involve training and caring for our monkey performers.
column23: This splendid creature is Jiromaru. Though many find his size and girth intimidating, I assure you that he is possessed of a most gentle spirit.

column22: Thanks to you, the festival is a grand success! And as Jiromaru's handler, I could not have been prouder to see how his careful distribution of the rice cakes won over the crowd!

Rowena wouldn't even give me a stall, but just you wait and see. A few more customers and I'll make <Emphasis>big</Emphasis> profits, then I'll have my own stall─wait, no. A whole building, bigger than the House of Splendors!

'Member I wanted to invite yer <If(PlayerParameter(4))>ol' mum<Else/>ol' man</If> to carousin' with the locals and a mug o' me strongest grog. But soon as I turn 'round, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>'e</If> was gone like laughter on the mornin' after! Maybe when ye grow into <If(PlayerParameter(4))>'er<Else/>'is</If> boots, I'll show ye 'ow a real 'ero celebrates, eh?

Pharos Sirius is undergoing additional repairs to fix the damage caused by the kobolds' bombs, but it is nothing Naldiq and Vymelli's can't handle! On my word as a smith, I will do all that I can to make the lighthouse into a place of honor.
Even now the men can't stop talkin' 'bout yer mad dash through Pharos Sirius. An' them kobolds 'aven't made so much as a peep since! Ye sure gave 'em rascals a poundin'! Maelstrom's much obliged!

I can't say botany's the kind of work we're used to around here, but Sawney's proven himself to be a capable sort. Before long Idyllshire'll be producin' vegetables that bring in customers from malms around!
Another lovelorn heart has come in search of true romance! I am Lisette de Valentione, of House Valentione, at your service!
column23: My retainers and I have traveled all the way from Ishgard to give the peoples of Eorzea the chance to meet their one true love!

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, what joy it brings to see you again! You have my thanks for bringing to light Hortefense's and my affinity for each other. The ceremony shall be held soon, and we both expect your presence!
I have heard tell of the great battle of Ala Mhigo. Another land once ruled by the ironmen, now free.
column23: Soil is like blood. Easily claimed, easily lost. But in such battles our souls burn bright, and that is enough.

column22: What ho, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>my lady<Else/>my lord</If>! We have crossed the frosty fields of Ishgard to bring the warmth of love to the realm's many citizens! If you would partake in the festivities, prithee speak to our lovely Lady Lisette!
You there! Would you like to know if you are meant for love? If so, then present yourself. If not, pray go somewhere else. This is not a show for the unromantic to gawk at!
I can sense it─you have the air of someone who has found <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> love! Go, seize the day and celebrate!
Do riches lie in your future, or rags? If you would like to find out, you need only present me with your Valentione's card.
I trust your partner is faring well? Even the strongest bond can be served by an influx of wealth. For the sake of you both, I hope the riches you seek become yours.
I shall test your compatibility with any adventurer who strikes your fancy. Simply hand me your Valentione's card, and the reading shall begin!
Did your partner take the reading well? May your future adventures yield great rewards!
I did not know true happiness until now! To think, Lady Lisette shall be my wife!
column23: Are you an adventurer, or an angel? Ah, it does not matter! You have my undying gratitude! Our friends in Ishgard shall be ecstatic to hear the news!

column22: Here you can trade your certificates of collaboration for any Little Ladies' Day items of your choice.

Good <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If>, adventurer! Would you like to trade in your certificates of collaboration for some of our exclusive Little Ladies' Day items?
Why do you tarry? The next battle lies to the south. Make ready and call for us. I grow impatient.
Welcome to the tutorial for Lord of Verminion!
column23: In this one-on-one battle, each player fields an army of minions in an attempt to shatter their opponent's Arcana Stones. Victory is achieved when all of an opponent's Arcana Stones have been destroyed.

column22: The briefing period has begun! This is a short, pre-battle phase within which you can prepare your initial forces.
column23: The minions you select during the briefing will be placed in your summoning queue, and summoned to the field when the battle commences.
column24: First, let's try selecting a minion from your minion hotbar.

column22: You have successfully selected a minion! It will now be placed into your summoning queue.

Each minion has a summoning “cost” which ranges from 10 to 30 points. As long as the total cost does not exceed the capacity of your summoning gauge, you may summon the same unit multiple times, or select any combination of minions you wish from those you have available.
column23: During the briefing period, your summoning gauge is capped at 60 points.
column24: You must be quick with your decisions, however, as this preparation phase has a time limit of 20 seconds. Familiarize yourself with the costs and abilities of your minions before a match so that you may quickly select the ideal starting lineup.

column22: Your view of the field is controlled by the camera. Try using the <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(80),0))>movement keys<Else/>left analog stick</If> to shift your viewpoint around.
The battle has begun! All the minions placed in your summoning queue during the briefing period will now appear on the field.
column23: You can now give orders to these summoned minions, and commence your assault on your opponent's Arcana Stones.
column24: Note that your summoning capacity has been expanded to 240 points. The gauge displaying your current summoning costs and maximum capacity can be found on the minion hotbar.

column22: Summoned minions will enter the field from your currently selected gate. The middle of the three gates, Gate B, is selected by default.
column23: <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(80),0))>Left-click on<Else/>Press the <Gui(17)/> button to select</If> the “A” found on the hotbar display, and try summoning a minion from Gate A.

column22: By summoning units from the gate closest to your intended objective, you can cut down on your minions' travel time.

Once the battle is underway, summoning minions in quick succession will incur a penalty in the form of a recast timer. The length of this recast timer is determined by the cost of the previously summoned unit.
column23: While the recast timer is in effect, subsequent attempts to summon will place the selected minions into the summoning queue.
column24: Try summoning several minions, and see this feature for yourself.

column22: Your summoning queue is now filled with ready minions! A minion will spawn each time the recast timer resets, in the order in which it was selected.
column23: A maximum of 10 minions can be placed into the summoning queue. Keep an eye on your summoning gauge─and the demands of the battlefield─to make the best use of this feature.

column22: For the next part of the tutorial, a wayward hatchling has volunteered its services to help demonstrate minion movement.
To move a minion, you must first select the unit, then select the unit's intended destination.
column23: <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(80),0))>Left-click on the minion to select it.<Else/>Hold down the <CommandIcon(11)/> button to display the selection circle, then position the circle over the minion to select it.</If>
column24: <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(80),0))>With the minion selected, right-click on the desired destination to send the unit to that location.<Else/>Releasing the <CommandIcon(11)/> button after making a selection will display a destination pointer. Move the pointer to the desired destination, then press the <CommandIcon(8)/> button to send the minion to that location.</If>

column22: <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(80),0))>Now try selecting the wayward hatchling, and moving it inside the yellow circle. Remember: left-click to select a minion, and right-click to select the destination.<Else/>Now try selecting the wayward hatchling, and moving it inside the yellow circle. Remember: hold down the <CommandIcon(11)/> button to select a minion with the selection circle, and then press the <CommandIcon(8)/> button to select the destination.</If>
Your obedient wayward hatchling has marched to the yellow circle!
Now let's try selecting multiple minions, and moving them as a group.
column23: <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(80),0))>Left-click and drag the cursor to create a selection square. Upon releasing the left mouse button, all minions inside the square will be selected.<Else/>Hold the <CommandIcon(11)/> button to display the selection circle. Upon releasing the <CommandIcon(11)/> button, all minions inside the circle will be selected.</If>
column24: Try selecting all the wayward hatchlings on the field, and then move them to the yellow circle.

column22: Look out! Your opponent's minions have appeared on the field! To triumph in Lord of Verminion, you must engage and defeat enemy units as the situation demands.
column23: Your minions will automatically initiate attacks against any nearby enemy units, and will continue fighting until the enemy moves out of auto-attack range.
column24: Select the wayward hatchlings once more, and send them against your foes.

column22: It seems your opponent has taken advantage of the confusion to launch an assault upon one of your Arcana Stones!
column23: Should an Arcana Stone be surrounded by nothing but enemy minions, the structure will begin taking damage and ultimately be destroyed.
column24: You will lose the battle once all three of your Arcana Stones have been shattered, so be ready to deploy your minions in defense of these key positions.

column22: Move the wayward hatchlings to the center of the field, and defeat the minions that threaten Arcana Stone B.
Your opponent has unleashed a pair of baby behemoths!
There are four types of minions, and three of these─monster, critter, and poppet─will fight at either an advantage or a disadvantage depending on the nature of their opponent.
column23: Minion type affinities are as follows: monsters are strong against critters; critters are strong against poppets; poppets are strong against monsters.
column24: The final type─gadgets─are neither strong nor weak against any type. Remembering these affinities may make the difference between jubilant victory and crushing defeat.

column22: Baby behemoths are a monster-type minion, and are thus strong against your quartet of critter-type hatchlings.
column23: To make matters worse, the behemoths execute area attacks as opposed to your hatchlings' single-target attacks, and are capable of inflicting damage against all nearby units simultaneously.
column24: You still have the advantage of numbers, however, giving your minions a better chance to prevail against their otherwise superior enemies. Send your hatchlings against the behemoths, and dispatch the monsters in a valiant flurry of feathers!

column22: Each minion is capable of executing a special action which, when used to good effect, can help turn the tide of the battle.
column23: To execute a special action, you must first group together four minions of the exact same variety into what is known as an “action party.” Each member of the action party must also have the maximum number of action points─a resource that accumulates over time.
column24: <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(80),0))>Select the individual minion with which you wish to execute the action, then click the Execute Action button on the minion hotbar.<Else/>Use <CommandIcon(12)/>＋<CommandIcon(7)/> to select an individual minion, then press the <CommandIcon(12)/> button ＋ the <Gui(10)/> button to execute the special action.</If>

column22: Try this now by selecting one of the wayward hatchlings, and performing a special action on a baby behemoth.
Your hatchlings' special action has allowed them to triumph over a foe who would otherwise prove a near-impossible challenge!
You will notice, however, that the rigors of battle have taken their toll on the hatchlings' HP. To restore a minion's HP, simply send the unit back to one of your gate areas.
column23: Select your wayward hatchlings, and return them to a gate to lick their wounds.

column22: The hatchlings have arrived at your gate.
column23: Gate areas function as a form of sanctuary. While within these areas, your minions will recover HP, and are safe from the attacks of enemy units.
column24: Conversely, minions inside a gate area are also unable to launch attacks of their own, so you must weigh the temporary loss of offensive strength against the benefits of refreshing your weary troops.

column22: In addition to the sanctuary they provide, gates have yet another useful function: teleportation. Minions inside a gate area can be transported to another gate instantaneously.
column23: Select your wayward hatchlings once more, then try sending them to another one of your gates.

column22: Your minions have been teleported to the selected gate!
column23: Using this function can allow you to quickly send minions from one side of the field to the other, and assault lightly defended enemy structures from the nearest gate.

column22: The time has come to lay waste to your opponent's Arcana Stones!
column23: Select the hatchling action party, and move them to the enemy's Arcana Stone B in the center of the field.

column22: The hatchlings have begun attacking Arcana Stone B!
column23: Your minions will inflict damage on an opponent's Arcana Stone when no enemy units are present inside the red circle surrounding the structure.

column22: The condition of each Arcana Stone is displayed by the crystal-like icons found at the top of the screen. As a crystal takes damage, the corresponding icon will be gradually chipped away.
column23: The total remaining HP of both your and your opponent's Arcana Stones is also displayed at the top of the screen in the form of HP bars, allowing you to assess the progress of the battle at a glance.
column24: Continue your assault on the enemy's Arcana Stone B.

column22: Each variety of minion is attributed with certain “strengths,” unrelated to their type affinity. These strengths allow a minion to be particularly effective against certain structures.
For example, the mammet #001 is naturally strong against Arcana Stones, allowing it to inflict greater damage to those structures.
column23: Watch how much more quickly the HP of the Arcana Stone is depleted when the mammets join the fray.

column22: The Shield provides additional defense to Arcana Stones. Destroy this structure, and your opponent's crystals will become even easier to shatter.
This is where the innate strengths of the cherry bomb come into play. Try directing this group of cherry bombs against your opponent's Shield.
column23: The enemy Shield can be attacked by positioning your minions in the red square in front of the structure.

column22: Your opponent's Shield has been destroyed! Enemy Arcana Stones will now fall far more quickly to your attacks.
column23: Be sure to take swift advantage of a deactivated Shield! All structures except for Arcana Stones will regenerate after sufficient time has passed, enabling them to once more apply their effects to the battlefield.
column24: Should you allow the enemy Shield to reactivate, for example, it will restore its defensive properties to your opponent's Arcana Stones, decreasing the amount of damage your minions can inflict to the crystals.

column22: Continue your attacks on Arcana Stone B, and shatter the crystal completely.
Arcana Stone B has been shattered!
column23: This is an example of how different strategies can aid you to more efficiently destroy an Arcana Stone. Shatter all of your opponent's Arcana Stones, and victory will be yours!
column24: In addition to Shields, there are other special structures that you will encounter on the field. For more detailed information, check the relevant active help windows, or read the play guide provided at the Lord of Verminion tables.

column22: This tutorial is now concluded. Learn well your minions' strengths and weaknesses, and conquer all before you!

It's been a rocky start for the Songbirds but maybe if we were to─<Emphasis>Gah!</Emphasis> M–My apologies, <If(PlayerParameter(4))> madam<Else/>sir</If>. I did not see you standing there. Ahem. Is there anything I can help you with?

Magnificent, isn't it? Progress marches ever onward...
...I suppose I shall have to start looking for a new job, then.
My girls are always lookin' to make a deal. They've got a hunger for it─wouldn't be here if they didn't.
column23: So long as a girl's got that hunger, I can teach her the trade. Even if she hasn't got a gil to her name. Hells, I give 'em new ones as it is. Aye, the House provides, adventurer. The House provides.

column22: If the urge to have your fortunes told strikes again, simply speak to me. I shall provide you with as many Valentione's cards as you desire!
Come one, come all! Purchase your exclusive Little Ladies' Day items here!
column23: Please keep in mind, we only accept payment in certificates of collaboration, so be sure to have those in hand as you get in line! For those not in possession of any, please seek out the royal seneschal in Ul'dah.

column22: Ladies and gentlemen, young and old! Manifold are the delights of this magical season, and this year we have had the good fortune to be blessed with more than most!
column23: We have some very special guests who will be lighting up the stages for this Little Ladies' Day, so be sure not to miss out on the highlight of the year─the Songbirds!

column22: Now that Lady F'lhaminn and the others have returned, we can redouble our efforts to find Yda and Papalymo. If only we had some inkling of where they went when they left Pearl Lane...
A shame that Higiri was not here to welcome Lady F'lhaminn home. Still, it shall be a pleasure to see the look on her face when she returns and learns of her homecoming!
'Bout time everyone came back to the Toll! Though there's still a few missing, like young Wilred. Been too long since that boy and I had a drink!
Lately I've been practicing calisthenics every morning to stay loose and limber. In fact, I think I might be fit to venture out into the field once more!
A warrior should not boast or brag of his accomplishments. So it was taught to me by my father, and by his father before him.
column23: Yet I must admit that I delight in hearing the young ones tell of their adventures. Their eagerness, their boldness─it is comforting and inspirational both. When the time comes to reclaim what was lost, I know they will rise to the challenge.

column22: ...Mayhap it is for the best that I remain ignorant of the details. Otherwise, I might be tempted to do something rash.
column23: I will place my faith in you all, and the Twelve to see her returned to me.

column22: But enough about me, Brother─what of your escapades? And what of this fetching young lady with whom you seem so well acquainted?
Looks like Hoary is off to a smashing start. Mayhap I should leave them to it and set about being sociable myself.
column23: Besides, I'd rather not be around when these two rising stones begin to clash.

column22: (I know, I know. I will look after him and see that he is fit for duty.)
Perceptive as ever, Brother! Aye, Aenor and I have taken part in many a mission together, and through adversity have forged unbreakable bonds!
column23: Indeed, her skillful ministrations have provided much comfort...

column22: We'll keep things running smoothly while you're away, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. You should devote all your attention to the search for the missing Scions.
Mmm... Why not both?
But I don't understand! I was the healer on those expeditions! How could she have─
column23: Oh...oh gods... I was sleeping less than ten fulms away! I...<sniffle> <sob>...I have no sister!

column22: It won't be long until we're able to resume all our operations─which means we'll need to secure some new sources of revenue...
column23: Hmm... If worse comes to worst, I could always fall back on the skills I learned in the Forgotten Knight. And with F'lhaminn's sage guidance...yeees, I can see it now!
column24: “She sings! She dances! She can help you pay your taxes! Tataru!” Why, I daresay folk would come from malms around to come and see my show! What do you think?

column22: We've come a long way, me and the boys. From dirty Brume rats fightin' against the powers that be to respectable folk workin' openly with them.
column23: In the end, you do whatever it takes to ensure that you and yours survive. Fight when you've got to, make peace when you can. So aye, if there's nothing for it, we'll fight that damn wyrm. We've come this far, and we're not about to stop.

column22: Bet them Alliance fellas never had to go toe-to-toe with a woman the likes of Hilda before, eh? Cor, wish I could've been out there with you all, instead of stuck here keeping the peace─important though it may be.
More'n a few of our folk were at Falcon's Nest, hopin' to be a part of history...only to come back callin' for that damned wyrm's head. <sigh>

Good <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If> to you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>, and welcome home. As Lord Edmont embraces you as family, so too do we.

Well met, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Would that we could have spoken before leaving Falcon's Nest, but the situation demanded that Ser Aymeric return to the city at once.
column23: Nidhogg has made his intentions clear. One way or another, the coming battle will mark the end of the war.

column22: 'Twas the first time I had occasion to lay eyes upon the accursed wyrm. His power, his presence... Never before have I seen his like.
column23: Aye, I felt fear and doubt, as any man would. As any knight would. But this is my city─my home, and I will defend her and her people to my dying breath.

column22: You know, old <If(PlayerParameter(4))>girl<Else/>boy</If>, I've been thinking... Maybe it's not all bad?
column23: True, the peace conference was a complete disaster...but it did serve to unite the people, after a fashion, did it not?
column24: All we have to do now is, er, kill the dread wyrm that has seized control of the Azure Dragoon and is planning to lead the Horde in an assault on our fair city any day now. Any day now...

column22: Ah, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>... I believe I have yet to properly express my gratitude to you for coming to my aid. Pray accept my most sincere apologies and my heartfelt gratitude.
column23: (I should also express my thanks for looking after my lord during the grand melee. Though he appears to have benefited from the experience, I have no doubt that he will stray from his chosen course once more...but when that time comes, I shall do my utmost to keep him on the path.)

column22: I am through with making sacrifices, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I will not conscience another─not if I can do aught to prevent it. If I must defy the gods themselves to wrest Estinien from Nidhogg's grasp, I will.
The Scions will find a way! I just know we will!
'Tis a blessed few who get to choose how and when and for what they die.
column23: Not that you need reminding, I suppose. But that boy... <sigh>
column24: For all the suffering he has known, he still clings to the notion that there is a cosmic justice, a morality by which we are saved or condemned. And there isn't.

column22:
<blip> Activating verification systems. Confirming identification code...
Error. Triad Control clearance denied.

<blip> Activating verification systems...
Identification code accepted. Triad Control clearance granted.
...Ah. Thou art concerned for my well being? 'Tis naught compared to the still-gaping wound which divideth our peoples.
column23: Peace ever was a bitter draught for the merciless. To his dying breath, he will rage. We who do not join in the chorus will share in the misery. Such was his vow.
column24: But I too swore a vow─that the dream of peace shall be ours once more. No matter what trials may come, I shall be true to my word...and to my heart.

column22: "From His pitcher poured forth the waters of knowledge, and in His honor were they named.“
column23: A story passed down from the days of the first Sharlayan settlers. Days which have long since passed into history...
column24: New peoples, new cultures, new traditions─and new names, too, aye. Let us pray they put a modicum of thought into it when the time comes.

column22: Pssshkoh... Uplander, please rescue Roundrox! Uplander is Roundrox's best hope!
column23: Slowfix knew gobbieflock would face difficulties in Idyllshire, but did not think daughter would be put in danger. When she returns, Slowfix will buy her heaps of new junk!

column22: As one of the Smiths, I provide guidance for those just starting out on the path of the adventurer. For the present, I suggest you learn your way around the city─an endeavor with which Mother Miounne shall no doubt wish to aid you.

As one of the Smiths, I provide guidance for those just starting out on the path of the adventurer. For the present, I suggest you learn your way around the city─an endeavor with which Baderon shall no doubt wish to aid you.

As one of the Smiths, I provide guidance for those just starting out on the path of the adventurer. For the present, I suggest you learn your way around the city─an endeavor with which Momodi shall no doubt wish to aid you.
A thousand pardons, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, but if you wish to make use of the training grounds, you must first make arrangements in Idyllshire.
The Gold Saucer relies on its loyal patrons, and from time to time we like to give back to show of appreciation! That's why for a limited time, all attractions will reward 50% more MGP!
column23: Fill your coinpurse until it's overflowing, and revel in the Gold Saucer's myriad delights!

column22: Why are you here and not with the Mol? Do you not intend to fight in the Naadam? You, who showed such bravery as to dive deep into the waters of Azim Khaat?
Ah, you're in luck. I just finished work on a very special selection of kettles, inspired by Master Gerolt's latest masterpiece.
After we learned of what occurred at Falcon's Nest, the mood here at the manor was...as you might expect.
