column23: That said, for all his anger...I suspect my lord the count was relieved that his sons did not come to harm.

column22: Ah, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>. You should know that Lord Edmont is most grateful for all you have done for Lord Emmanellain.
column23: He believes you to have been a most sobering influence on the young lord─though whether or not it will last remains to be seen. I believe he is already out and about with Honoroit...

column22: Haven't you heard? The Horde is coming, and soon. If you haven't got reason to be here, you'd best hop on your chocobo and ride as far from here as you can.
Rather than worrying about Nidhogg, I would turn my attention to the Horde. Numerous and deadly though they are, against them we can hold the line─so long as we are not caught unawares.
The fight. Always, the fight... This is what we do. All we've ever done.
column23: What's a soldier without a war─without an enemy? How are we to live in a peaceful world...?
column24: I know I'm not the only one who thinks it, even if the others won't say it.

column22: I heard the white dragon got hurt durin' the conference! It's not bad, is it?
column23: We haven't got much medicine here, and I don't know if it'd be any good for a dragon anyway, but...there's got to be somethin' I can do for her, isn't there?

column22: Oh! Uh...good day to you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. You must be the sells─ahem, the esteemed adventurer of whom so much has been spoken!
column23: Rider of dragons, dueler of generals─a peerless warrior who has bested countless foes all over the realm. Ahem. On behalf of the people of Ishgard, I salute you!
column24: I must say, I never thought to see you here, in, er, more civilized parts. Not that there's anything wrong with that! By all accounts, you spend most of your time roaming battlefields and traipsing about dark dungeons...

column22: I don't suppose you've visited Falcon's Nest, have you? I heard they unveiled a fantastic new relief there, during the ceremony. Right before Nidhogg came along, that is.
column23: I suppose it's another reason I ought to go and visit my little brother over there. He cooks for the garrison, like I do here─not as well, mind, but he's got potential, I'll grant you that.

column22: He was not wrong to want to subdue the leader as quickly as able, for she may have spurred others to further violence.
column23: But to fire on her as the crowd looked on was beyond reckless.

column22: No wonder he did not interfere with our preparations. It was Nidhogg's plan from the beginning to use this occasion to deliver his proclamation─to deprive us of hope and leave us with naught but despair.
column23: But we will not be so easily cowed. When the time comes, the golden bell will sound, and every man and woman of House Durendaire will hearken to its call!

column22: It wasn't just young ones struggling with the guards. Older folk attacked them as well, screaming bloody murder...
Even now, their voices echo in my ears. I do not think I shall ever forget it.
column23: I had hoped that I might soon put up my sword, but now...

column22: She seemed like such a nice girl. Always greeted me with a smile when she passed. Never would've guessed she had it in her.
I do wonder what became of that girl, though. Could've sworn I saw her shed a tear during Ser Aymeric's speech...
Seven hells, the least he could've done is stop the bloody fool before he shot the second arrow!

And just like that, everythin' we've worked so hard to build is in danger of bein' torn down. But that's the way of the world, isn't it? If they succeed, then we'll just have to build it back up again, harder and stronger.
Pray forgive me, my <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If>. It's been chaos since preparations for the conference began, and I needed all the help I could get, and...and... How was I to know!?
column23: I only realized what had happened after we inspected the mug. Master Thancred tells me it was a sleeping agent of some sort...

column22: In times like these, it's especially important for a cook to keep his people well fed.
column23: My brother down in Whitebrim, now there's a cook who could feed a garrison for weeks with popotoes and mudpuppy tails and still have them in high spirits. But I'm no slouch myself!

column22: You should've seen the looks on their faces as they left. There's no fixing this.
First the protest, now <Emphasis>Nidhogg</Emphasis>!? I never imagined that a remote posting could know so much tragedy in such a short time.
This was to be the end of it. Casualties at a peace conference, Fury take me...
It is so much more than a mere relief. It is a symbol of what once was, and what could be again. To see it stained with blood...
Yes, yes, all here have been informed of Ser Aymeric's wishes, and I have instructed them not to engage any dragons without ample provocation.
column23: That being said, I trust you understand that I cannot be held responsible for the actions of all who claim the title of Convictor. There are those whose hatred runs far too deep, who would rather quit this camp and continue their campaign alone than sheathe their swords.

column22: This incident only serves to underscore the necessity of the Convictors in these troubled times. For every dragon that chooses to abide by Vidofnir's peace, there will be another who chooses to break it.
column23: Of course, we must henceforth take care to determine the allegiance of a Dravanian before attacking, but the point stands. So long as these belligerents continue to harry our people, there will be honor and glory to be had in slaying them.

column22: The first commander is tending to the preparations at Falcon's Nest. If all goes to plan, this will mark a new day for Ishgard!
We must have the strength to stand unwavering in the face of the enemy. 'Tis the only way we will weather this storm and deliver our people into a new era.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> also battles with cards? Game becomes more popular in village than paissa fights! Linu Vali gladly accepts challenge!
Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, Linu is busy rebuilding Ok' Gundu Nakki, much too busy for card games. Ask again when work is complete, and Linu gladly accepts challenge!
Victory! Pride in Linu Vali's chest burns more fiercely than morning sun!
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>'s skill at cards surpasses even Brother's! Linu Vali will learn from this loss, and not cry like newborn hatchling... <sniff>

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> is clever opponent! Linu will practice every night, and surprise <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> with new strategies next match!
<click> <click> A card game? Very well. I have already surpassed the hunters who taught me. I will not lose to you!
<click> <click> We have no time to play games. The guild must be tended to. So busy with tasks. Yes, very busy.
<click> <click> I did it! I surpassed Master's skills! I revel in my victory. Even a small victory. Yes, very small.
<click> <click> To lose even at cards... But an adventurer does not pout. I thank you for this lesson. I have learned much.
<click> <click> This was not expected. But now my mandibles itch for a victory. Surely we could play more? Yes, more.
You wish to play cards? Well, I had been hoping for a reprieve from my work. Even the most diligent researcher must rest from time to time. Very well─here's to a thrilling match!
Cards? Normally I'd accept, but I'm on the verge of a breakthrough in my research on the Allagans, and must focus. Pray leave me be for now.
Ah, I've won already? Don't take it too hard. When we're not working, many of us researchers keep our mind sharp with Triple Triad.
A well-deserved victory! I'll have to tell my fellow researchers about your prowess at cards!
Now that got the juices flowing! I look forward to more exhilarating matches with you! That is, as long as my research doesn't stand in the way.

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Cards are popular in Idyllshire! Tapklix learns rules, and Tapklix wins! And sometimes, Tapklix loses!

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Tapklix is busy with watchguard duty! Too busy to waste time with uplander!

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Tapklix wins! Tapklix wins! What is it uplanders say when winning... Do not take it too hard!

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Mean uplander! Tapklix is just beginner! Be nice, and use weaker cards next time!
Pssshkoh... No victory, and no defeat... Tapklix is bored! Tapklix wants to challenge uplander again!
It would be my pleasure, my <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If>, but be warned: I play for the honor and the glory of House Fortemps!
A thousand pardons, my <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If>, but I would remiss in my duties were I to play you at this time...
If I may, your choice of cards was most perplexing. Perchance you are holding back? If so, you need not be so considerate. I would rather you played to the best of your ability.
As skilled in the gambling halls as on the battlefield. Victory is yours, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>.
Mayhap a draw is the best I could hope to achieve. It is somewhat encouraging to have not been defeated, at the least. Do let me know if you would like to play again.
<click> <click> Master, did you notice my scarf? The storyteller gave it to me. I wanted a scarf that suits my purpose. All who visit the guild will find me easily.
column23: But I must convince others of my purpose as well. Marcechamp laughed when I told him my new name. He said I have yet to grow into it. Perhaps this is true.

column22: <click> <click> When I visit the dragonslayer camp, Jantellot always calls me “crab.” I thought this may be a sign of friendship.
column23: So I tried to give him a name, too. When he called me a “crab,” I called him a “yeti.” He looked confused. Your kind are difficult to understand.

column22: <click> <click> Master, I saw it! I saw Drydox's true face! When we were snacking on nanka eggs, I took a “sneakypeek.” It is <Emphasis>much</Emphasis> more endearing than her mask! Very much so!
column23: But it makes me a little sad. If I lose myself to the Onemind, will I forget her too? I do not like to think such sad thoughts. Yes, too sad.

column22: <click> <click> I thought one of the benefits of being Vath was the ability to make choices. To decide on our own. But now I know such things can also be a curse. Are we really to go to war?
<click> <click> Master, what a pleasant surprise! Such busy days I have. Training, journeying, teaching... I never expected such a life. And I am happy to live it.
column23: What brings you to Loth ast Vath? Come to undertake tasks, like old times? Yes, old times. Come, come, show the others how it is done!

column22: Tell me, fleshling: have you ever eaten chocobo? <click> <click> They look delicious, but the hunters of Tailfeather say they are for riding, rather than eating.
column23: This practice of riding chocobos, rather than eating them, is very strange. Yes, very strange. Still, we would like to try. We have decided to raise a chocobo. Hopefully the others will not eat it.

column22: The Convictors are a very strange sort. Yes, very strange. They willingly slay dragons, but not for food or other goods.
column23: When we ask why, they say they do it for “fame,” so that other fleshlings will take notice. We do not understand fighting for free. Is this “fame” really so valuable?

column22: Goblin masks are amusing, yes? We cannot help but laugh when seeing them. <click> <click>
column23: Still, we were surprised to hear they live with other fleshlings, like you. The goblins are very adaptable. Yes, very adaptable. We can learn much from their example.

column22: Never did we imagine making allies of the dragons. Our mandibles still quiver each time we journey to Anyx Trine. We are always nervous there. Yes, very nervous.
column23: Such powerful allies are quite favorable for the Vath. Their help has lifted our spirits greatly. We feel much safer. If only we had treated sooner...

column22: <click> <click> We were hesitant to stay at the Adventurers' Guild. But here, we found there is always something new to discover. We enjoy meeting new people, exploring new places.
column23: We have learned much working with you, great hunter. You will continue to visit our guild in the future, yes?

column22: Forgive us. <click> <click> We are but a humble merchant. But we have been working hard─yes, very hard─to increase our selections of wares. We shall do all within our power to help you find something you like!

Welcome, mighty hunter! Do you see them? Yes, we now sell kongamato! <click> <click> The kintamer was most unhelpful, so we were forced to capture them all by ourselves. <shudder> It was terrifying, but a stick peddler must provide for his customers!
He loves to fly. <click> <click> Yes, he loves it so much that even in his sleep, his wings do not stop fluttering.
He is my first kongamato. <click> <click> We have been through much together. He is the sole reason we are known as the kintamer.

<click> <click> The deftarm seems to have taken quite a liking to you, hunter. He often talks of his “fearless Master,” and how much he wishes to be like you. You have given him much hope in fulfilling his duty to the hive.
column23: We are very grateful to you for guiding him, very grateful indeed. Yet we as a colony wish to avoid too much dependence on others. We will try not to be a burden to you.

column22: <click> <click> The deftarm must overcome his struggle with the link. Yet we worry about him. He who has built something in our hive that cannot easily be entrusted to another.
column23: Should he be lured away from us by the Onemind, what will become of his guild? What of the alliances he has made? Perhaps we should keep a closer eye on him...

column22: As Vath, we have the ability to make our own decisions. But sometimes those decisions come with a price that the Onemind do not pay. We talk of remorse.
column23: The Overmind's thralls are not burdened by such feelings. They submit themselves entirely to his orders. If he tells them to kill, they kill without question. But should the Vath go to war, we may linger on the actions we take against our own kind. We must think very carefully.

column22: <click> <click> Our dear <If(PlayerParameter(4))>sister<Else/>brother</If>, welcome back to Loth ast Vath. Look around, our hive flourishes.  We are ever grateful for your guidance, for leading us to this new way of life.
column23: What of the Overmind? He yet seethes in his hive. But we are certain he will think twice before threatening us again. As long as we have the Adventurers' Guild and our cherished friends.

column22: <click> <click> We asked our hivebuilders to clear space. For the Adventurers' Guild. It was difficult, given our cramped quarters. Very difficult. But we trust it will be worth it to keep our rewards in a safe place.
<click> <click> We did not expect to receive so many rewards so soon. If only we could procure clay, we could expand our walls. Yes, we could store more rewards.

<click> <click> Our colony buzzes with activity. Many adventurers are attracted to the guild. Man and Vath alike. But we now know it has attracted unwanted visitors as well. We dread the day the Overmind visits.

<click> <click> We must admit we were doubtful at first. Yes, doubtful. But with your guidance, we no longer hunger. We have allies. We know now that our colony does not need to isolate itself. We are very grateful.
Hear ye, hear all! The Twelve Archons of yore have delivered unto me a prophecy─ A prophecy of gold! All are welcome to join in the festivities, and rejoice in the miracle of Hatching–tide!

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I had nearly forgotten to thank you for your part in making my dream come true. Before long the Twelve Archons will return to grace the realm; we only need to believe. Until then, enjoy the rest of the festival!

Although the brightness blinded Jihli to the true nature of the golden gift, I reckon anything from the Archons is bound to be glamorous. Whether it be a leafed statue, or a gilded chalice, or a handful of coins...

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, welcome back! I had to explain everything to the other Dreamers when we returned. While they seem thrilled with the news of the prophecy's fulfillment, I admit I still find myself wishing the Archons' gift was of a more...metallic nature? <sigh>

I know Jihli told me to stand here just like in the dream, but I feel so restless! There's so many activities to join, and so many prizes to win. But most of all, I want to ride atop that giant egg, just like an Archon!

When Jihli left to check on the preparations for the Hatching Hour, I stole away to chase after that giant egg. I waited until just the right moment to jump on top─or at least, I thought I did─but it  rolled away and I fell right on my behind. Oh, I'm still so sore...
Judging by those arms of yours, you must enjoy a fair bit of eggsercise! Boy, do I have the game for you. Just tell Miss Aliapoh that you're interested in playing.

Curious about the enormous enchanted egg, are you? The sylphs are quite the masters of illusion. I was there when they worked their magicks. Where you see an unbreakable egg rolling through the streets, I see...something less interesting, unfortunately.
Have you introduced yourself to Miss Aliapoh? She is an inspiration to us all. Would that I too could meet the Archons in my dreams... I see naught but spriggans!

Scrambled eggs, oh my lass has got such lovely...♪
Ah, hello there, friend. You will have to pass the beginner eggsaminer's round before you challenge mine.
Some Dreamers paint eggs, some gather them. And then there are Dreamers who count. Think you have what it takes, adventurer? I'll be waiting.
Ah, Vanu Vanu goods pique netherling's interest, yes? Patience, for as the hunter waits to catch perfect quarry, so too must the merchant wait for most splendid stock.
If you haven't got Centurio Seals, then I haven't got anything for you. I don't make the rules, I just follow them.
Got yourself some Centurio Seals, have you? Then perhaps I can offer you a few knickknacks in exchange.
Can you believe they found a labyrinth teeming with all manner of ghosts and ghouls down there? I wish they had never found that accursed gateway!
I care not about all this talk of mazes and monsters. I would see Gelmorra restored to its former glory, that we Duskwights might call it home again. For that, our work must continue!
Our spriggans are spry and set to scurry! Talk to Motte over in front of the amphitheatre stage if you wish to participate!

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
As disciples of the great Master Mutamix, we have much knowledge of stonyshine. Uplanders love stonyshine, yes? We make for you, best price!
Noble causes, hmph. I can't count how many times I've seen what began with the best of intentions be twisted into something altogether different in service to a “noble” cause.
column23: Louisoix was a good man, aye. Pure of heart and unwavering in the face of certain death, as we all know. And when the time comes, we will know what sort of man his grandson is.

column22: <buzzzzzz> ...Commencing overwrite of compliance policy... <buzzzzzz> ...Bypassing protocols for protection of intellectual property... <buzzzzzz> ...Replication process authorized.
My apologies, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, but I am permitted to sell such wares only to jockeys.

It's begun, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Inquisitors are being released from their positions and told to seek employment elsewhere. “Wasteful expenditures must be purged,” they say.
column23: Just the thought of being cast out onto the streets sends a shiver up my spine. I mean, my skills are not exactly suited to other professions! I can't just up and become a bloody baker!

column22: <chirp> <chirp>

When I was lost in those deep woods, I met a fluffy little creature who was white as snow and floated through the air like a cloud, only to vanish before my eyes. Could it be that I had my first encounter with an Eorzean Yo-kai?

You're asking about my curious collectible? Well, he's...uh... I actually have no idea what he is. But I'm assuming his armor is based on some sort of ancient relic, and that makes him a good deal rarer.

Isn't he positively <Emphasis>adorable</Emphasis>? ...What is he, you ask? Erm, well, judging by the crescent moon and his ice blue armor, I think he's supposed to be a guardian of Menphina or some such?
It's a minion-eat-minion world out there, and with Komasan, I'll be unstoppable.

The foe gathers for one last mighty assault...
But this shall not be our end! Ishgard will endure!
The Horde is routed, aye, but I will not count this war over until each blackened stone has been replaced.
While the Temple Knights stand, Ishgard shall not fall!
'Tis you! The champion who slew Nidhogg! Your deeds shall pass into legend, yet I am honored to speak with you thus in the flesh!
At long last, I can return to my home─to Falcon's Nest. How I have dreamed of this moment...
Seems this place is to become a battlefield before long...
So much is lost in war, but cryin' and complainin' won't bring naught back. It's best we count our blessin's for what we have, don't you think?

The members of the new House of Commons, they...they listened to our pleas. We now have enough food and blankets for all the children.
...I can scarce believe how much the city has changed.
Estinien is resting in our infirmary. The sickbeds are our frontline now, and the battle to save the wounded continues unabated...
Your deeds have scattered the dark clouds that have long loomed over Ishgard. On my oath, we shall not squander the bright future you have won for us...
We are redeploying the city's defenses in anticipation of the coming attack. The High Houses have placed their forces at our command, and together we shall form a wall of impervious steel!
Though our principal foe lies defeated, we shall continue to keep order inside the walls and protect the citizenry. In that much at least, the duties of the Temple Knights remain unchanged.
A single Dravanian is terrible enough, but to face the entire Horde at once...? Nay, we must not surrender to fear, lest we accept defeat ere the battle has begun.
The Horde is fled, and there is much cause to celebrate...but I shall keep one eye on the horizon nonetheless.
Everything I had, I left behind to fight for Ishgard. Now that the time has come, there is naught for me to lose...

After centuries of fighting, are we finally at peace...?
Bah! What a mawkish old fool I've become! I must needs return to my duties!
The people of the Brume have elected me to the House of Commons...
column23: I do not think myself well suited to such a position, but mayhap I can effect some good nonetheless. In fact, I already have several proposals in mind...

column22: You're always welcome here in the Brume, you are. You've given hope back to them folk as need it the most.
Is it true? Is Nidhogg attackin' our home again!?
You killed him, didn't you? Nidhogg, I mean. He's gone forever?
column23: Will the white dragon come back now? Every night, I dream about ridin' on her back through a sky filled with stars...

column22: Don't you worry: the watch'll defend the Brume! I'll not see a repeat of what happened the last time those scaly bastards got in here!
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! They say you skewered old Nidhogg himself! We'll be raisin' a pint or two in your honor, you can be sure of that!
I don't rightly understand the relation, but ever since the House of Commons was founded, we've been gettin' a flood of folk lookin' to sign up for the watch.
column23: Could be that seein' their fellows accomplish somethin' worthwhile has given 'em a hunger to do the same. I'd say they've found themselves a bit of pride in their home, eh?

column22: Sh-Shaking? N-Not me! S-Solid as a rock, I am!
So...it's over then, is it?
It's <Emphasis>my</Emphasis> job to watch Hilda's back! I don't trust anyone else to keep her safe!
Let them dragons come! We've been trainin' for this!
Seems we both lived through this one, eh?
Ever since all this new blood's joined the watch, Symme's been actin' a bit odd. Like he's eager to prove himself, or somethin'...
It feels as if the entire city is holding its breath. I just want to hold people's hands and tell them it's going to be okay!
I have the utmost faith in you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, but I'll say a little prayer...just in case.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I knew you could do it! I just knew it!
Will the birth of these new “Houses” change how the highborn treat the low? Makes me wonder how things might've been for that poor girl if this had happened years ago...
A splendid day to you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>! What an honor to speak with the valiant hero who slew the dreaded Nidhogg right before our very gates!
column23: I would shake your hand, but to do so would betray the trembling of my fingers! You have brought hope and light to our fair city, and on behalf of Ishgard's people, I salute you!
column24: I suppose you'll soon be off to fight other wars and delve into far-flung ruins? Quite an exciting life you sells─ahem, adventurers lead!

column22: My father has relinquished the title of count, and named me as his official successor. I expected to feel...different, but the truth is little has changed aside from the manner in which people address me.
column23: I am the same man I was yesterday, though I know not what the morrow may bring...

column22: Wonderful to see you, old <If(PlayerParameter(4))>girl<Else/>boy</If>! Come to fulfill a craving for the latest sordid gossip, have we?
column23: Well, I am sorry to say that I have naught for you. My knightly duties have kept me far too busy to stay abreast of the talk of the town!

column22: (My lord has been most conscientious with his duties of late. I worry that mayhap he was struck in the head by a stray projectile during the last battle...)
Why has Halone forsaken us? Is it the fate of my beloved marketplace to play host to bloody battle?
I will not allow the dragons to defile our most holy places...
The Supreme Sacred Tribunal of Halonic Inquisitory Doctrine is a place where penitents come to stand before the Fury and answer for their sins.

I really must hurry home!
Mayhap some young lord will see fit to escort me to my estate...

The founding of the Houses of Lords and Commons will greatly impact the manner in which Ishgard is governed. No longer will we be able to ensure our prosperity by pandering to the needs of the nobles.
Should the battle encroach upon the Pillars, I am prepared to take spear in hand and stand alongside our soldiers in defense of the manor!

I had my spear at the ready, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>, and I am proud to say that my hand only trembled ever so slightly...
Now that my lord Artoirel has assumed the mantle of count, the mood of the manor has shifted somewhat. I do not mean for the worse, of course!
column23: Though my lord seeks to succeed his father in word and deed, the demands of a new era necessarily dictate a new direction. And wheresoever the count leads us, the servants of House Fortemps shall follow!

column22: 'Twould seem that our dear friend Estinien has slipped from his sickbed and vanished from the city.
column23: Were it anyone else I might expect a word of farewell, but such is not his way. Nevertheless, I shall thoroughly berate him for his lack of manners the next time we meet!

column22: When the Horde began their assault, I made sure to have my trusty grimoire to hand and incantations at the ready!
column23: It had been some time since I last conjured Carbuncle, however, and...well, it's probably best that we not discuss how that ended.

column22: <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>! I... Saulette! My name is Saulette!
column23: I'm s-sorry! I've just begun working here, and I'm not... You're rather famous, you see, and... P-Pray excuse me!

column22: Well, well! Who should walk through my door but the wyrmslayer <If(PlayerParameter(4))>herself<Else/>himself</If>! I must say, I never would have suspected from our first meeting that you would go on to rid Ishgard of its most terrible foe.
column23: Should you ever require aught of me or the Observatorium, pray do not hesitate to ask!

column22: Lord Stephanivien changes the face of battle with his machinists, Lord Aurvael charts the unknown, and Lady Laniaitte has her valiant Rose Knights...
column23: They each make incredible contributions to the honor and prosperity of House Haillenarte, while the best I can manage is to not perish of frostbite!

column22: The strength to carry on comes not from ourselves, but from that which we hold dear. From those we failed and those we will not.
column23: And so, in that darkest hour, you won. The fates smiled on you. And, perhaps, so did he...
column24: ...I try, I truly do. It's what he would want. But sometimes it's just so damn hard...

column22: (You needn't worry. Though not often, he nevertheless smiles more frequently. The bitterness begins to fade, and he finds it easier to remember better times.)

Though we continue our hunt for heretics, there has been scant work for the inquisitors of late. Has evil truly left men's hearts, or have men merely become more cunning in concealing it? I suspect the latter...

I hear word that many heretics are choosing to surrender themselves for their crimes. Some may be pardoned, but I expect those who were involved in the summoning of Lady Shiva will be shown little clemency...
<sniffle> <sob> Hm? Oh, I'm sorry, it's just that... In the quieter moments, all the memories come rushing back.
column23: Were Lord Haurchefant still here, he might make some good-natured quip about my tears spoiling the broth! When I think about things that way, I suppose he'll never really leave us. Not really.

column22: I fear no Dravanian living, but their master... Nidhogg is a demon of nightmare risen from the deepest hell.

The light of the Holy See has faded, and the wyrm's shadow darkens our walls no more. Yet while lords and ladies must learn to govern alongside the commonfolk, our duty to defend Ishgard remains unchanging.
The Fury lend me strength...
Ser Aymeric has proven his leadership a thousand times over. What other commander would have conceived of defending Ishgard by setting one great wyrm against another?
<sigh> I suppose I must relieve the guard. One would think that with their master slain, the Dravanians would harry the sentries with far less frequency. One would think.
'Twas my plan to spit the dreaded wyrm on the point of my lance, but it seems you have stolen my chance at glory!
You honor Whitebrim with your presence. On behalf of the garrison, I salute your momentous victory over the dreaded wyrm.
column23: Your deeds have laid the foundation for true change in Ishgard─for a lasting peace. As always, however, there remain those stone-headed few who persist in clinging to the old ways...

column22: New heads may have sprouted to oversee the governance of Ishgard, but such revolution hardly matters to the soldiers here. No matter who sits in the golden chair, our days are always the same: training, followed by a patrol, and then back for more training.
Our brave soldiers sallied forth to thin the numbers of the Horde before it surged onwards to the city. 'Twas a valiant effort that swamped our chirurgeons with a legion of burned and bleeding...
The worst of the wounded were borne away to the infirmary in Ishgard. As such, our beds are now given over to those with rather less serious injuries.
Whitebrim Front is a vital keystone in Ishgard's frontline defense. Surely they would not dream of dismantling the garrison...?
...You heard the roar, I trust? Soon, the heavens will be filled with the leathery snap of countless wings... Let us make a pact to share a flagon should we both survive the coming storm!

<If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>! I believe the time has come for that flagon! I will not be offended, however, should other duties demand your attention. I shall gladly drink for the two of us, and hoist a mug in memory of the fallen...
May the Fury watch over us all...
When the Horde took flight, its numbers darkened the very skies. Should I live to see a hundred winters, I shall never forget that terrible sight...
I wonder how it must have felt for that serving woman when she learned of Nidhogg's death...
The reclamation of the western highlands can resume in earnest now that...well, I am sure you of all people least need an explanation as to why.
column23: As for myself, I shall be kept busy preparing pot after pot of soup. There is naught better to fill hungry bellies and bring warmth back to snow-chilled limbs!

column22: Now the real task begins! It'll be a mountain of work puttin' these lands back the way they were, but no true craftsman shies away from a challenge!

The Horde has lost its head, aye, but don't be fooled: the snows are still home to more than a few dragons. And that's not even counting the other beasts out there that'll risk a blade in the guts for a taste of man-flesh...

Well, you just had to slay the biggest dragon of the lot, didn't you? My dreams of one day slipping directly into the well-heeled boots of a landed lord have evaporated with the morning mist... Hm. I suppose there is still glory to be had in keeping the roads safe from the odd marauding Dravanian.
column23: And besides, what would my young Convictors do were I to abandon our camp? Why, I suspect they'd wander straight into the jaws of the nearest wyvern.

column22: You're standing aboard the very first large-scale airship born of Ishgardian ingenuity—the <Emphasis>Protector</Emphasis>. This ship would have marked a monumental change in the war against the Horde.
column23: ...Assuming Nidhogg hadn't been slain, and his minions scattered to the winds, of course. I suppose I shall have to convince our investors that other threats lurk amongst the clouds if we are to guarantee further funding...

column22: We have heard the tidings from the Steps of Faith! For some time now I have known you as a hero of great renown, but to slay Nidhogg himself...
column23: <sigh> ...If only that preening fool had but a thousandth of your valor! Nay, 'tis folly to pray for that which the gods did not see fit to bestow.

column22: We've had a steady trickle of pilgrims makin' their way through the forest, lookin' to visit with Hraesvelgr's brood up at the towers. I'm almost surprised when they make it back in one piece, to be honest.
column23: Ysayle always hoped there'd be peace again 'twixt man and dragon, an' it's a damn shame she's not around to see her dream comin' true...

column22:
'Tis folly to believe thy words might sway the heart of my sire.
...Yet I wish thee fortune in thy endeavor, nonetheless.
I will not distract thee from thy deadly task with idle parley. Go with courage, warrior of warriors.
...Thou hast conquered the shade, warrior of warriors. I praise thee for thine efforts.
column23: Yet though he did plunge a lance into my back, I take no joy in Nidhogg's death. He was a wyrm of the first brood, and one by one their irreplaceable number doth dwindle.
column24: We must make certain of this peace betwixt our kinds, lest the rivers of blood shed by either side stain the ground in vain.

column22: Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I think your, uh, <Emphasis>unique</Emphasis> name is beginning to grow on me, kupo! Ahem. If we happen to fight a duel again in the future, maybe─just maybe!─you could not box my pom quite so enthusiastically, hm?
Your duel against the chieftain was amazing, kupo! Naturally I took no satisfaction in seeing him so soundly beaten. None at all, kupo!
How fares the Leveilleur boy? He was in and out of my cave every day for a while, getting under my feet, and making a mess of my bookshelves.
column23: Judging by the tomes he left open on the table and what I could hear of his frenzied mumbling, he was searching for a method to untangle entwined sources of aether. In his haste, he asked no advice and I offered none─sometimes it is best to let a student make his own discoveries.

column22: Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Lady F'lhaminn and I were just discussing the possibility of a special dinner for when Riol returns...

<huff> <puff> <huff> <puff>
Any day now, my time will come, and then I'll show those greenhorns how it's done!
(Yes, yes, I am sure he will leave a lasting impression on them...)

Our impromptu excursion to the Near East afforded me the opportunity to sample authentic Thavnairian cuisine. I should like to introduce it to the Scions, but achieving the perfect balance of spices is key...
Timing, Ocher, timing! Mark well my movements, know my mind, that we might strike as one!

The alchemists of Radz–at–Han are heirs to an ancient and storied tradition, which has seen the creation of countless medicines still in use today. The Domans have their own tradition as well, though the philosophy behind it is markedly different, from what I understand.
Splendid, Brother, splendid! I shall take your words to heart, that I might aid and protect you with my magicks!
We've been tasked with a somewhat dangerous assignment, so it's only prudent that we bring along additional support.
One to mete out punishment, another to soothe your hurts... Mmm... Brotherly love...
"Mete out punishment?“ But a warrior ought to <Emphasis>take</Emphasis> it, not─
column23: Oh, gods! I mean, no, that's not what I...I...

column22: Do I know Triple Triad? Why, of course, kupo! It was all the rage in Moghome not too long ago, and I'm not bragging when I say I'm one of the best among us! Hee hee! I doubt even you'll be able to beat me!
Oh, I'd love nothing more than to play you, kupo! Unfortunately, with the restoration of Zenith underway, I'm afraid I don't have a moment to spare for cards!

Hehehe! I won, kupo! I won! Wait a second... I know that face! Don't tell me you think I cheated! We moogles love a good prank more than anyone, but we'd never do <Emphasis>that</Emphasis>─especially not to you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!
I-I cannot believe it! My cards... Have they truly failed me? Kupopooo! Please, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, you must play me again!

Ah, what a stimulating game that was─I haven't faced a challenge like that in years! Well, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, do you truly want to leave it at a draw? I, for one, won't be satisfied until I win at least one match against you!
Challengin' <Emphasis>me</Emphasis> to a game of cards, is ye? Bahaha! Well, brace yerself, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>─the winds tell me the tides of luck be in me favor today!

Ye daft, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>!? With the thrice-damned curs a-swipin' our hard-earned swag and leavin' us naught but the boils on our arses, I haven't the time fer bloody card games!

Ahahahaha! Keep yer cards, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>─victory is reward enough for me. Besides, it seems ye need 'em a great deal more than I do. Now, scurry along before I change me mind!
Cap'n Rhoswen's beaten me on the rare occasion, but ne'er did I think I'd be bested by one of ye landlubbers! Next ye come this way, I won't be holdin' back none, ye hear?
Ain't many what can hold their own against me like that. Ye'd make a damn fine pirate, ye would. Pity ye still seem so awful keen on adventurin'.

I may be one of the fiercest sailors on the five seas, but that don't mean I don't derive pleasure from a bit o' friendly competition every now and again. In fact, ever since comin' ashore I've been findin' meself with more an' more time to invest in the game, and reckon I ain't 'alf bad!

By Llymlaen's teats, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>! Can't ye see, I'm busy standin' watch!? With reports of 'em bloomin' Sanguine Sirens pokin' about our affairs, me cap'n will 'ave me guts for garters if 'e catches me so much as blinkin' on the job!

Would ye take a look at that! Ol' Mordyn's still got it in 'im! Haha─ Ah, don't take it too 'ard, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>─with these beauties I been collectin' since me seafarin' days, I ain't easy to beat!

Well played, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>, but don't be lettin' this one victory go to yer 'ead now. There be bigger 'n better fish out there than this ol' salt─me cap'n, for one. Aye, 'e'd be pickin' 'is teeth wiv yer bones right now, 'e would!
The one thing I 'ate more than losin' is tyin'─there just ain't no satisfaction in it. What'd ye say to another round so we can declare a true winner?
Your flying machines are clever, but a wyvern's mastery of the winds will never be surpassed by mortal inventions.
Just goes to show ye can't take the buck out o' the buccaneer, even if he's a disciplined ol' salt like the chief. Even so, his loyalty to the Maelstrom is second to none.

The anniversary is a time for reflection, that we might be reminded of the selfless sacrifices of those we lost. To that end, the Crystal Caravan has come to Ul'dah, to put on a performance in remembrance of the Calamity. We have spared no effort to ensure such a solemn event is done proper justice, and would very much appreciate your attendance.
The reputation of the Crystal Caravan is riding on the success of this play. Please, if you would take the stage, we would be forever in your debt!

Your portrayal was met with critical acclaim! Why, I've lost count of the number of people who've asked when they might see you act again! Pray take the stage once more─you wouldn't want to disappoint your admirers now, would you?

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, how good to see you. I trust the anima is doing well? If you should note any changes, do be sure to inform Lady Ulan. No doubt it would be of use in her research.

Me? Why, I am but a humble servant of Master Mutamix, charged with aiding those who wish to avail themselves of the power of materia but lack the skills to do so. If you would know more, mayhap it would be best if you sought out Swynbroes at the Bonfire in central Thanalan.
Me? Why, I am but a humble servant of Master Mutamix, charged with aiding those who wish to avail themselves of the power of materia but lack the skills to do so.
column23: That is to say, I can affix materia to your items, provided you supply me with both─and that the item in question has an open materia slot.
column24: And of course, I will require compensation. Much as I enjoy my trade, I cannot work for free.

column22:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Beloved brother Mutamix is brilliant gobbie! Has braincase full of knowings of airy-self and materia, ever eager to share with uplander and <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> kin.

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Beloved brother Mutamix is brilliant gobbie! Has braincase full of knowings of airy-self and materia, ever eager to share with uplander and <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> kin.
column23: Poofchox too knows materia muchly─can even join fighty-tool to materia for uplander! ...Er, if secret joiny-skill is not needed, that is.
column24: One day Poofchox will be just as wise and worldly as Mutamix, though! Mark her tongueflaps!

column22:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Huzzah! Stickqix's Bangpots is glorious monument to gobbie ingenuity!
column23: Backstrike whizzlepops with whizzlepops! Combat Illuminati gobmachines with brainfruit of gobbies and uplanders, crafty-made in great manufactory!
column24: Such is potential of egalitarian utopia! Come one, come all─join in blastydoom plansmaking!

column22: These moogles have quite a refreshing attitude. They do not ask questions needlessly, nor do they make transparent attempts to curry favor. I have a feeling I shall quite like it here.
“By the hundredth blow.” Long have they been the words of my house, and long have they inspired our crafters. Now, they shall serve to inspire an entirely different group of people.

If you were to have told a young me that I would live to see the day dragon and man labored together again, I would have laughed. Let us hope this era of cooperation lasts much longer than our ceaseless conflict has.
Since they began working to fulfill Gullinbursti's demand, the Mogmenders have approached their tasks with renewed vigor. I suppose I should send the old dragon my thanks!
The new tools are proving even more effective than expected, and the morale of the Mogmenders has much improved. Of course, I would expect no less from tools crafted by <Emphasis>us</Emphasis>.

I am sure you have noticed Mogzin has been in low spirits since the unveiling of the statue. Although you may wish to help him, I suggest leaving him be to solve this problem on his own. Craftsmen must often labor in solitude to perfect their work.

Bahrr Lehs may be looking as splendid as the day it was first built, but we cannot rest on our laurels. We must look forward to the repair of Zenith, which will doubtless prove to be a much more challenging undertaking.
column23: I believe the Mogmenders are more than equal to the task, however, and before long perhaps man will once again offer prayers in Zenith's hallowed halls. If ever you find yourself itching for work, remember that we shall always welcome you with open arms!

column22: Have you ever seen such an unorganized lot? They'll never complete Bahrr Lehs at this rate. But never fear. As the Mogmenders' most brilliant moogle, I will see to getting them back on schedule, kupo!
How hard can it be to build a statue from scratch? With your help, I bet we can build anything, kupo! You <Emphasis>are</Emphasis> helping us...right?
The restoration of Bahrr Lehs is nearly complete, all thanks to yours truly, kupo!
column23: Hm? Well, yes, I suppose my subordinates contributed as well, but it was my leadership that paved the way for them!

column22: Did you know Mogzin was adding a moogle head to the fountain's base? I was quite touched that he would take time to craft a statue in my image. Oh, I'm sure you must think it looks like any old moogle, but I'd recognize that nose anywhere, kupo!
From stone, to wood, to steel, and more, I'm the moogle who can get you what you need, kupo! Master Mogzin said if I do this job well, he might let me manage the kupo nuts again!

We certainly never expected to build a statue, kupo! To ensure we don't run out of stone, I've asked Mogek to make arrangements to have more delivered. Hopefully he gives me more kupo nuts as a reward for such a brilliant idea!
Now that we've completed the statue, it's time to set our sights on Zenith! Of course, we'll need even more supplies─which means even more work for me! And with more work comes more kupo nuts!

What did you think of the moogle statue? Were you surprised? It was all I could do to keep it a secret! One time, I almost gave you supplies that were meant for Master Mogzin. That would've been embarrassing, kupo!
Well met! After much consideration, I have decided to help you and the Mogmenders with the renovation of Bahrr Lehs. If you need anything, big or small, then I am the dragon to ask!
In case you have yet to notice, a friend of mine has offered to help. He would not take no for an answer! If ever you need to call on Whei Ahf, ask him for assistance!

I have little experience with the tools of man, but even I can tell that the Mogmenders' work has improved since you crafted them new ones! Still, I am glad that all I will ever need is my keen claws.
Gullinbursti has seen fit to let us stay in Bahrr Lehs! Naturally, that must mean our work here is finished, right? It is time to plan a celebration!
I cannot believe we managed to make the plaza even more glorious! Truly, it fills me with pride to think that I had a part in this!
It must be hard for one without wings to explore these islands. As soon as I finish readying these cloud mallows, though, you'll be able to ride the wind as easily as we do, kupo!
The cloud mallows are fluffed and ready for riding, kupo! If you ever need one, they're yours for the taking. I only ask that you try not to fall asleep on them.
The others are all but finished restoring Bahrr Lehs, but I think it could stand to use a few more sparkling mallows. One can never have too many mallows, sparkling or otherwise, kupo!
Have you heard? They're going to start work on Zenith soon! I have a feeling we're going to need a lot more cloud mallow, kupo!
A working moogle is a happy moogle, kupo! Who would've thought that by the sweat of my brow would come so much satisfaction? Master Mogzin truly is a genius!

The new tools are absolutely astounding! I shudder to think of all the hours wasted with those clumsy ones! Now, I never need to stop working! From sunup till sundown, we'll work up a sweat with nary a frown!
Are we truly finished with the plaza? Truly, kupo? But whatever shall I do if I can't work? Tell me! A working moogle is a happy moogle! Happy, I say!
I suppose there is a time for work and a time for rest, kupo. Perhaps I was working too much before? Maybe I'll take a nap until we begin repairing Zenith. Yes, a nice, long nap...
On our honor as Temple Knights, we shall endeavor to face every challenge we meet head-on─or at least we intend to, as soon as we ascertain what it is Master Tarresson would have us do!

The Mogmenders couldn't be more excited about the restoration, and I have to say their enthusiasm has been quite contagious! We've sent for Master Tarresson that we might get started, but 'twould seem he must attend to a few other matters first...

The moogles have been teaching us their traditional dance all <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>afternoon<Else/>evening</If></If>. Half the steps still confound me, but hopefully it's nothing a little practice can't fix!

Seeing Gullinbursti smile as he looked upon the fountain made us realize the true worth of the work we do here. I think I speak for all of us when I say we shall see the restoration of Zenith through to the very end, regardless of the obstacles that may bar our path forward!

Ser Hildeth has apprised me of the situation. Impressive work at Bahrr Lehs. You fell the evil Nidhogg, and then raise a monument to friendship and peace. We are truly blessed to have you on our side.

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Master Seika is craftysmart tinkerer and trader! Even gobbieflock can stand to learn from her example.
You a greenthumb? If so, be sure to bring me any rare crops you might harvest. I guarantee you won't find a better price anywhere else!
You a greenthumb? If so, be sure to bring me any rare crops you might harvest. I guarantee you won't find a better price anywhere else!
You a greenthumb? If so, be sure to bring me any rare crops you might harvest. I guarantee you won't find a better price anywhere else!
To think that this was once nothing but a mountain of dirt and rubble. I daresay it might now be the most beautiful plaza in the area!
Ohl Deeh says the repair of Bahrr Lehs is already complete! I know I've only been here a short time, but I am truly impressed by the tenacity of man and moogle!
Before long we'll begin preparations for our work on Zenith proper. If Bahrr Lehs is anything to go by, I believe it's safe to say we'll have our work cut out for us!
<beep> <beep> Please present specimen for analysis.
column23: <bloop> Error. Specimen not detected.

column22: Welcome, welcome! How about a nice cup of shaved ice to quench your thirst? It's made with only the finest of ingredients and is sure to keep you cool on a hot day like this!
As you well know, I <Emphasis>love</Emphasis> yellow. It complements my skin tone and really brings out my eyes... In fact, it's such a fabulous color, I even once thought to add it to my ice.
column23: It was only after I drizzled on the lemon syrup, that I realized perhaps it wasn't such a good idea after all...

column22: I suppose one might call me the chairman, no, the <Emphasis>grand chaperone</Emphasis> of the Moonfire Faire! Ah, but titles are of little significance. The important thing is that we all work together to see that this year's festivities are as successful as the last!
That you agreed to assist the Go Go Posing Rangers with their training is most heartening news, indeed! The Bombard King shall rue the day he came to our lands!

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I don't know what the Go Go Posing Rangers would have done without you! It is only through your silent confidence in us and your support on the battlefield that we were able to see our goals through!

Why, just look at you, so excited about the festivities, even this terrible heat hasn't fazed you in the slightest! Well, we're still taking volunteers willing to pitch in to make this year extra special, so if you're interested do be sure to speak with one of our faire criers!

While Haermaga's been sending me regular updates, I can't help but feel as though there's something he's keeping from me... But now that you're here, perhaps you could shed some light on this mystery?

Haermaga's enlisted the help of the Go Go Posing Rangers to defeat the Bombards!? So that's the secret he's been keeping from me─I hardly dare believe it! And to think, I had to hear this from an <Emphasis>adventurer</Emphasis> and not the man himself!
It would seem this aetherial creation of yours has inspired Lady Ulan to make improvements to Diamond. I should hope her work proves as successful as yours.
column23: Do <Emphasis>I</Emphasis> have a Carbuncle? Well, yes, but it is a rather fickle creature. I am sure it is wandering about somewhere here in Idyllshire even as we speak. If you should find it, would you be so kind as to bring it back?

column22: <buzzzzzz> ...Invalid access code... <buzzzzzz> ...The replication system has terminated in an unusual way... <buzzzzzz> ...Please contact system support and provide the following error code: ...<buzzzzzz>

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Crafty tools, gathery tools. Grinmox sells many, many things. But not now. Uplander comes back later.

If it's work you're looking for, then you've come to the right place─I'm in charge of delineating tasks to willing adventurers. At the moment, there's patrolling the coastline and obliterating Bombards that threaten the festival-goers, or there's auditing. What'll it be?

As Haermaga's most trusted advisor, I've been stationed at this spot to keep an eye out for the Bombard King! Aye, soon as he makes a move, I shall summon the Posing Rangers that they might see that he is vanquished once and for all!
I've been to many a show as a thespian, and I reckon that one was among the top ten performances I've ever seen.  Thank you, adventurer.
Think he's sleeping, or just resting his eyes?
...Let me guess. Wonderin' why I haven't gone and smacked 'em upside the head and put an end to this rubbish, eh?
column23: There's a time for crackin' skulls and a time for lettin' yer idiot of a son deal with his troubles on his own, that's why.

column22: Obtaining permission to peruse the forbidden tomes is no simple matter. The paperwork alone is enough to make even the most dedicated inquisitor think twice, and it can take several moons for a request to be formally processed.
column23: Alternatively, I could probably gain access to the archives given my status as “sweeper in perpetuity,” but I would rather not rely on that particular “privilege” bestowed upon me by Ser Charibert...

column22: Lo, seeker in days unborn, god-blade bearer. Know you: this tower challenges the sky. Ware the watcher, the ward of the Three Waits, soul-hungry, unsated.
Beyond here lies the children's ward of Frondale's Phrontistery. Only physicians, patients, and authorized visitors are permitted entrance─and you do not appear to be one of the three.
Welcome back, friend. We cannot thank you enough for your charitable efforts on the children's behalf. Shall I show you into the ward?

If it's a fight you seek, you'll find the dueling arena just over there, down the pier. Doubtless you'll find no dearth of opponents against whom you might test your mettle. Why, perhaps I myself will even join the fray!
column23: That is, of c-course, assuming that murderous she-devil of a Lalafell is not still there... M-Might you...take a look for me?

column22: What? Never seen a man down on his luck before? Go and pester someone else─I'm in no mood.
column23: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete one of the following main scenario quests: “The Gridanian Envoy,” “The Ul'dahn Envoy,” or “The Lominsan Envoy.”

column22:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Lightkix is watchguard, watching for Illuminati sneakypeekers. Back-fighting Illuminati? Lightkix needs more jinglyshine.
Mew...♪
Mew...?
Poor Mide, eh? The lass truly believed that her beloved was alive somewhere inside that steel beast. Can't imagine how she's feeling now.

The chief says the advanced calculating device inside the colossus─Alexander's brain, if you will─is still running on auxiliary power. See that device glowing red over there? There are ones just like it installed all over the place.
column23: In that sense, I suppose it's like the entire colossus is one giant brain! If Alexander put its full mind to something, why, I bet it could conceive of things beyond our mortal comprehension!

column22: Quickthinx had a few tricks up his sleeve right to the end, eh?
column23: With Roundrox, we saw the codex grant its knowledge to a child with a pure, innocent belief in its ideals. Seeing Quickthinx do the same, it would seem that crazed obsession is a suitable substitute. Not that it availed him much in the end...

column22: I feel the presence of the horn beneath us. It and the core have become as one, forming an instrument of unbridled destruction.
column23: If we do not stop the core now, it will soon grow beyond the ability of anyone to contain. It is little wonder our foe was loath to reach out to it with his own hand.

column22: I...I truly remember nothing. It was as if I was floating in a vast, dark emptiness.
column23: And yet...I was not afraid. For it was as if a great presence surrounding me in every direction was watching over me, its eyes gentle...

column22: Roundrox is so happy that Mide is safe! Roundrox has so many treasures to show Mide back at Shortstop!
Mew...!

I am the mochi daikan, and I have been charged with overseeing the making of rice cakes. The cyclopes will soon set to work so you won't have long to wait for your first taste of this most heavenly of desserts!
Now there's a face I could never forget! How goes it, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Will you be helping us hand out our advent cakes once again this year?
Kweeeh!
Kweh! Kweh! Kweeeh!

column23: Jiromaru stares at you with round beady eyes. While it's close to impossible to read his expression, you get the sense that he is enjoying the festivities as much as everyone else.

column22: Thanks to you, the turnout couldn't have been better, and all the citizens were able to receive their advent cakes with little delay! And just like the rice grains in mochi, I hope our newfound friendship one day grows to be inseparable!
Ever since the inconsistencies in Ishgard's history and the church's teachings were brought to light, I feared it to be the end of an era and, by extension, the scholasticate.
column23: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I cannot tell you how wrong I was. If anything, our fine establishment flourished in the aftermath and, with the help of our dedicated students, will continue to do so.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! How wonderful of you to come visit! We've been working to reform the foundation of our current school system and curriculum and things here have seen great improvement.
column23: Every day, I feel as though I'm moving a step closer to achieving my dreams and bringing about the change Father Choisseau had hoped Ishgard would one day embrace.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! How go your adventures? Since I last saw you, I've had a few of my own─all of which have involved keeping Theo out of trouble.
column23: The only good thing about having Archombadin around is that he somehow manages to sense trouble before it happens.

column22: Welcome back, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! You won't believe how much the scholasticate has changed! The somber atmosphere that hovered over the scholasticate has been replaced by radiant joy and not a single day goes by that these halls aren't filled with the jubilant laughter of seminarians.
Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, with everyone working so well together to make the scholasticate a better place, Theo has never been happier.
column23: His smile grows more radiant by the day, and with each passing week I come to lo—er, admire him all the more.

column22: Recently, Blaisie and I started talking again. After opening up to her about how much her silence hurt me, we reconnected and now our friendship is stronger than ever!
column23: ...There's just one teensy problem. You see, Theomocent is completely oblivious to how Blaisie feels about him but she's too shy to admit anything. The two of them are so frustrating to watch!

column22: I paid a visit to Lebrassoir soon after he was escorted off scholasticate grounds by the Temple Knights. He refused to even acknowledge my presence.
column23: It will take a great deal of time for me to gain his forgiveness, it seems. <sigh> In the meantime, I shall do what I can to see that the scholasticate's reputation is restored. Together with Theo, I feel we will be able to pave the path toward a brighter future for all seminarians here.

column22: The history we were taught growing up was all a lie, the priest and mentor I had come to respect the most was a fraud, Lebrassoir was never loyal to the Dzemaels, and now Archombadin and Theomocent are practically joined at the hip... It's as if the world's gone mad!
column23: But perhaps a little madness was just what I needed, for all these changes have made me realize how narrow-minded and set in my own ways I was. From now on I shall endeavor to be more accommodating and accepting of others' ideas and opinions.

column22: Lately, one of the seniors who had made it his life's mission to observe and criticize everything I do has become almost cordial.
column23: Where before, I would have to endure one-sided lectures, now we have <Emphasis>actual</Emphasis> conversations. I must say this change has made me more receptive to what he has to say, and every day my respect for him grows.

column22: Thanks to you, the teachings of volume eleven are closer than ever to being achieved.
column23: The misfortune I─<Emphasis>we</Emphasis>─encountered here at the scholasticate was the catalyst we needed to bring about the necessary change and I can say with confidence was Halone's will.

column22: Ah, if it isn't <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! What brings you back to our halls? If it's out of concern that you've decided to pay a visit, allow me to put your worries to rest!
column23: The scholasticate has never been better! Ever since Theo and Archombadin set aside their differences and learned to work together, the students have been able to freely express their opinions without fear of retribution. It's opened up the floor for some very interesting conversations, to say the least!

column22: Just look at all these people! Back home in the Twelveswood, I'd have to walk for malms to find a good opponent. Here, I just stand around and smile, and they come to me!
Hmm? Were you talking to me? Ahem...beg pardon. I came here to put my formidable Triple Triad skills on display, not to mingle with the riffraff and rabble.
Hic! Who saysh a girl can't enjoy a shtiff drink and a game of cardsh at the─hic!─same time? Ashk anyone here─they'll tell you Nell'sh at her sharpesht after her shixth flagon of mead!
Far have I traveled in search of a worthy foe... But when I look out upon the sandy wastes and feel the wind beat at my face─ah!─my heart cries out for home...
I took up Triple Triad as a way to pass the time while waiting for my crops to grow─now it turns out I'm better with a deck in my hand than a shovel or hoe. Just you watch!
Looks like I won! Bet you didn't expect a farm girl to play like that, did you? Tee hee!
Whew...you're tough! I've never seen moves like that back in the Twelveswood. Maybe you could teach me a thing or two? Pretty please!
Phew! Looks like we're a close match, huh? You don't find excitement like that back in the forest! Come back some time so we can settle the score!
Triple Triad is a game of wits and skill, far more befitting a person of leisure such as myself than...whatever <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> are. As I will now demonstrate...
Bahahaha, just as I thought! There's the deck of a bloody pauper if I've ever seen one! Ahem...that is to say, 'twould appear victory is mine.
P-Preposterous! They told me that was the best deck gil could buy! I <Emphasis>demand</Emphasis> a rematch! At once, knave!
Hmph! So perhaps you are not as incompetent as you look. Needless to say, had I not deigned to show you quarter, I would surely have triumphed.
Where I come from, a woman ain't a woman unlesh she can hold her own with a flagon in one hand an' a deck o' cardsh in the other. Alright, let'sh─hic!─do thish!
What? It'sh over already? Alekeep! What'sh a woman have to do to get a stiff drink in here!? Speaking o' which─hic!─where are we again?
Maybe it'sh the ale talkin', but your deck'sh lookin'─hic!─better and better by the minute. Care to join me later for─hic!─another match?
Was that you who─hic!─won? Or me? Ah, who caresh! Alekeep! Another round for the both of us. Alekeep!?
How many moons did I travel, till that fateful day when I raised my eyes to see that mighty cactuar towering before me. ...And now fate brings you to me, stranger. Let the battle begin!
My heart aches, to have visited such undue wrath upon a fledgling foe. Pray forgive me, stranger─I know not my own strength.
Have I lost? Mayhap, but I have also won─for in you, stranger, I have found the worthy adversary I have for so long sought. It would be an honor to do battle with you once more.
A draw! Alas, a draw! There is no feeling so empty, so vexing as to fight a battle and yet not know which is the victor and which is the defeated. Oh, for shame, for shame!
You would do battle with <Emphasis>me</Emphasis>? So be it, but be forewarned: I am not wont to show my opponents mercy.
Did you truly expect this to end any other way? I <Emphasis>do</Emphasis> have a reputation to maintain, after all.
...Most impressive. While defeat stings me as it would any other─mayhap more so─I can take solace in knowing that great warriors such as you have done battle in this Battlehall.
You are strong, friend. Continue to hone your skills and your deck in these halls, and I daresay next time you may emerge victorious.
The city is teeming with adventurers. Surely one of them will offer me assistance...
column23: In order to undertake the quest “In a Manor of Spooking,” you must first complete the quest “It's Probably Pirates.”

column22: I imagine my rumors will spread themselves as more folk visit the manor, but I'll be sure to nudge them in the right direction. Thank you again for your aid!
Greetings from the Continental Circus! We shall make mischief with our masquerades below, even as the saints feast up above!

Greetings from the Continental Circus!
We─ Have we met before!? (You mortals all look alike to me...)

Had you not been here I can say with all certainty that this Heavensturn would have been a complete and utter disaster! We shall forever be in your debt, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. That said, there are still many rice cakes that need handing out so if you still feel inclined to help us, we would welcome your assistance!
Hello there, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. The name's Blamprest. If you're in need of a good brew, you'd be hard-pressed to find better stock.
Well if it isn't my favorite customer. I take it Ardashir and Gerolt were satisfied with my wares? If they should have need of more, don't hesitate to ask.
Come for work, have you? I expect no less than your very best if you wish to be duly compensated.
Hey, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>mister</If>, I know this is sudden, but I have a favor to ask. Do you have a moment?
Speak with one of our harlequin guides if you wish to brave the manor! Or has your courage deserted you completely...?
If you're lookin' for Ga Bu, he's not here. I had my men deliver him to Maelstrom Command.
column23: Last I heard, his condition hadn't changed...but rest assured they're treatin' him well. You be sure to tell your friend that too.

column22: The passion of these men and the purpose with which they fight is astounding. Perhaps we finally have what it takes to drive the Empire from our lands once and for all...
column23: Yet they are undoubtedly as reckless as they are brave, and I fear this bold campaign may drag others into the fight. It drew you here, did it not?

column22: It's all well and good that the Resistance is gaining new recruits, but we could do without the help of the Corpses.
column23: I've not forgotten the crimes they committed in the name of the King of Ruin. Nor have any of the older generation. But these young ones, they're all too happy to let bygones be bygones...

column22: What little we have in this world was bought with our blood. Humble as this place may be, it's ours, and I've grown to treasure it.
column23: And so, much as I'd like to take the fight to the Garleans, a greater part of me wants to stay here and keep these people safe.

column22: No one's done us any favors. But it's just as well─I'm tired of asking. I may not be good with words, but I'm good enough with a knife. Good enough to fight for what's mine.
Can't you feel it!? History has its eyes on us! This is our moment, our chance to finally take back our homeland!
<cough> <wheeze> Griffins or masks or whatever, I'll throw me lot in with any bugger who can bring me medicine. What other choice have I got?

The young ones are consumed with a passion I've not seen in years. “Liberation is at hand,” they all say... My fighting days are long gone, but I can still contribute in other ways. Poultices and other simple remedies, for one...

I have heard the refugees talking late into the night─heard them arguing, though about what I could not tell. The air is thick with tension, and I wonder if we should not petition the Hall of Flames for additional support...
I may be a son of Ala Mhigo, sworn to the Resistance like so many others, willin' to fight if it comes to it...but you can only do so much when you've been livin' off scraps your whole life.
He's right, godsdammit! The power to retake our homeland lies within us! We but need to trust in the Griffin to show us the way!

Even if he can deliver on his promises, I doubt I'll live to see it. But...by Rhalgr, what I wouldn't give to fight alongside them─to look into the eyes of an imperial as the light fades from his eyes...one last time...
I had a dream of when I was a child. Of when I was whole...when <Emphasis>we</Emphasis> were whole. It's...it's not too late, is it?
Word of the Griffin and his Masks have spread beyond Thanalan, aye. Like many, we've got our reservations about his secrecy, but it's hard not to be impressed with his results.
column23: A few of my men were even inspired to answer his call to arms after they recovered from their wounds. I've not heard from them in some time, though...

column22: Ah, I shall ever treasure this feeling of accomplishment after a difficult mission! Now then─where to next...
Where to next indeed...
...Oh, it's you. Welcome home, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>...
When you think about it, we have accomplished quite a lot in recent days, have we not?
column23: Though there are of course some few regrets for missed opportunities. A pity we were unable to deal with Ilberd and the Braves once and for all, for example...

column22: I have been thinking, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. When time allows, we should go and pay a visit to Ga Bu with Alisaie.
column23: Though their time together was short, I know she felt a kinship with the young child...

column22: ...O-Oh! I was...I guess I was just so caught up in thinking about, well...everything, that I dozed off for a moment...
I told her everything that happened. She needed to know, and I thought it would be best if it came from me.
column23: It's...strange to think back on the circumstances of our first meeting. We were all so very young. So foolish, so...powerless...

column22: My word, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I must confess to some considerable amazement at the great trials and tribulations you and the others have recently overcame.
column23: I must again apologize for our prolonged absence, and for the fact that we have yet to answer your many questions. As for Yda... Well. All things in time, I suppose.

column22: It's a bit overwhelming, quite frankly, having spent so much time on the road, often by myself... Yet I will try to approach this as a learning experience, as I did my travels.
column23: Had I not kept an open mind, after all, I doubt I would have been able to master the aetherial blade. Nor would I have benefited from the rather pointed advice I received.
column24: There is no one path, as some are given to say, and there is wisdom in exploring every school of magic, as there is in exploration of all things...

column22: (She's still a little shy, but don't you worry! It won't be long before everyone's getting along famously!)

...So Alphinaud, we all know he's got his mind made up─the Crystal Braves are no more! It's all over! Bam! You haven't got to go home but you can't stay here! But Riol, he's not having it─won't even let ol' Alphy finish...
And there I was worried about how to brief Papalymo on the many momentous events which we have borne witness to in recent memory. Little did I know I need only leave Hoary to it.
In that moment she departed this realm for the First, I heard her speak to me. I know this to be true─just as I know that she will one day return to us.
column23: In those final moments, she was smiling, was she not? She was proud and hopeful and looking to the future. So I will too, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I will...

column22: Hah hah hah! Believe me, I know all too well the burden that is a precocious sibling. We should trade tales over a drink sometime─or perhaps even with the four of us!
B-But I have a precocious sibling too! And I'm sure she'd be happy to join us...
Oh, as if you wouldn't try to get rid of me at the first opportunity! Don't you drag me into this mess!
It is not as though I do not enjoy the company of so many motivated youths. However, without Isildaure around, I cannot help but feel somewhat isolated...
column23: He got carried away with his “training,” lest you wonder, and injured his back. Alianne has been looking after him ever since.

column22: Yda's father was one of the finest men I've ever known. A true leader of the revolution. He inspired countless others to rise up and cast down the tyrant Theodoric, and fought tirelessly for the land he loved.
column23: ...But not even he could inspire us to victory over the Garleans. He died...and I grew old. But Yda carried on his legacy─our legacy...

column22: Tataru tells me all of the missing Scions have been accounted for. I imagine everyone must be feeling much better for that.
column23: I think I can speak for all of us here at the Toll when I say we're looking forward to what the Scions do next─and we'll be happy to help in whatever way we can!

column22: Pshkohhh... Slowfix is heartened to see Roundrox return safe. Uplander has much gratitude from gobbieflock!
column23: But what of blue-haired treasure hunter? Roundrox is not herself since her friend went away... Slowfix is worried muchly...

column22: Pshkohhh... Roundrox has changed muchly since uplander brings her back from steel giant. She is more...steady-hearted somehow.
column23: Roundrox still collects junk, but says it is not enough to collect─she must study and learn, that one day she can do great things and change world for better, make friend who has gone away proud.

column22: They say it was you that quieted that big hunk of steel, eh? I reckon all of us here in Idyllshire owe you a debt of gratitude.
column23: I must admit, seein' everything frozen still inside that barrier gives me the creeps. Still, at least now we don't have to worry about it springin' to life and smashin' us to a pile of so much rubble─an' I daresay that's good enough for me.

column22: So you've seen to the primal, have you? Very good. Mayhap I can now return to my <Emphasis>own</Emphasis> research without Shtola barging in and asking me to hold her hand with every little thing.
column23: Aye, everyone's got it in their head that there's some great shining utopia out there, just waiting for them to do the building.
column24: The Illuminati, those Auri treasure hunters...they weren't the first stubborn, starry-eyed buggers to come up with the idea, and─gods help me─they won't be the last.

column22: If not for uplander, Roundrox would still be stuck in the belly of whirlycog giant. Uplander has Roundrox's thanks.
column23: Roundrox is sad that Mide is gone, but...also happy for Mide. Roundrox believes─Roundrox <Emphasis>knows</Emphasis>─that Mide is in good place.
column24: Roundrox must fill braincase with many knowings about junk and treasures, whirlycogs and bittybobs. Roundrox will build great kingdom of treasures─uplander can come live any time!

column22: Oh, Reauverre...why do you resist our efforts to help you so?
I cannot thank you enough, friend. I am heartened beyond words to see Reauverre back to his bright-eyed self, and it was you that made it possible.
column23: As a physician, I am not wont to believe in faerie tales and superstitions, but I daresay your visit to this place truly was a Starlight miracle.

column22: Pshkohhh... Snapclix watchguards steel giant! Steel giant will be going nowhere without Snapclix knowing!
New to Idyllshire? Never fear! I know these parts like the back of my hand, and nothing would give me greater pleasure than to <Emphasis>personally</Emphasis> give you a guided tour!
column23: So what do you say, friend? It'll be the best thousand gil you ever spent! I did mention it costs a thousand gil, yes? Believe me, it's worth that a hundred times over!
