column22: Welcome to the Hard Place, owned and operated by the illustrious Adkiragh. Whether you've come to partake in the finest fare our realm has to offer, or merely to take in the opulent ambience, you've clearly chosen the perfect destination.
column23: Your bemused expression does not escape me. “Whatever is he wearing on his head?” Your mind boggles─and with good reason, for my entrepreneurial genius exists on a plane beyond the comprehension of lesser minds.
column24: I ask you, what is more important to a businessman than attracting the eye of his potential customers? I have attracted <Emphasis>your</Emphasis> eye, have I not? Consider yourself enlightened.

column22: <beep> <beep> Please set desired parameters...
Papalymo and I have known...knew...each other for a long time. When I saw that look in his eyes, I could not refuse his plea...
He saw his duty through to the end, even at the cost of his own life. I shall honor that heroism by watching over those he left behind.

Ala Mhigo has suffered under imperial occupation for twenty years. Long has the Resistance fought and failed to slip free of the Empire's yoke, but I wonder how this latest clash will change the lay of the land.
My apologies, but I'm not quite open for business just yet. Do come back soon, though!
Hoary Boulder and his companions left to continue reconnaissance on the beast tribes.
column23: They were adamant about shouldering what burdens they could while the senior Scions were occupied with this “cocoon” emergency.

column22: Ah, the determination upon their faces. There is nothing more blinding than youth burning with purpose.
Revenant's Toll has expanded so quickly. My, how the days do roll past while our minds are focused on other things...

Back in the Far East, we treat back pain with a long soak in a hot spring. What say you to a short journey, Isildaure? I am told the waters at Camp Bronze Lake are famous for their healing properties!

At last I was able to rise from my sickbed, but the pain when I tried to take up my axe...
Ugh, what a sad, old man I have become.
Should the Archons be called away to Gyr Abania...<huff>...it will fall to us to deal with the Scions' usual obligations. And thus...<puff>...we must remain in...<pant>...peak condition!
Though it might be simpler to surrender to despair, I have chosen to resume my studies in the arcane. I received much wisdom from Papalymo, and I would put his advice into practice...
A fine showing, Brother! But you have yet to outpace Aenor!

I made a fool of myself...<huff>...on our last mission......<puff>...but I will show him...<huff>...what I'm made of!
Come now, Hoary! <pant> Is that the best you've got!?
My sister has the most curious ideas about courtship...
Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. How fare your adventures with the anima? Rest assured all is well here...to the extent that it is possible with Gerolt's indolent ways.

...I suppose it is understandable that Lyse would assume her sister's name that she might carry on her deeds. 'Twould seem that as the daughter of a well-known hero, “Yda” had a special place in the hearts of the Resistance fighters.
If all proceeds to plan, we should soon be receiving word that Alliance forces have secured Baelsar's Wall. Until then, however, we can but ensure we are ready to move the moment we hear the news.
The Scions will be spread thin in the coming days, so Riol and I are discussing assignments. I may have to reorganize my filing system!
I wonder what Isildaure would have to say about our wounded visitor. His own injuries yet keep him abed, and I miss savoring a cup of tea alongside his usual observations.
We have some training in the healing arts, so we shall take turns with Mistress Krile in caring for her patient. Ocher in particular seems rather eager to learn from the experience.
We were all surprised by our sudden visitor, but Hoary was able to gauge the situation at a glance. He realized the Miqo'te posed no immediate threat and permitted her to enter.
column23: But that didn't mean he wasn't alert for some manner of trap! Ah, yes, mayhap the elder is the finer man after all!

column22: Mistress Krile and Archon Y'shtola are truly exceptional healers, and 'twas an honor to witness their ministrations firsthand.
column23:
If only I could tend to my brother's battle hurts with such proficiency...
Aye, I have much study yet ahead of me.

column22: Tataru and Krile took that Resistance fighter to more private chambers that she might recuperate in peace. The poor girl was in quite a state, wasn't she?
Even when casting the same incantation, the mastery of each practitioner greatly affects the efficacy of the spell─a principle that was aptly demonstrated to our two young mages here.
...I believe she said her name was “M'naago”? Her cause appeared to have been genuine, but I must confess to feeling no small degree of trepidation even as I stepped aside.

Sacrificing oneself for one's duty...
Such actions remind me of the warriors of Doma─of the samurai and shinobi who died for our cause.
As much as we wish it were different, there is a limit to what our healing can accomplish. Even the most powerful magicks can do naught for a grieving heart...
I have a long road ahead before I match the Archons in skill and experience, but we must all do our part in times like this. Surely there is something I can do to help...
My brother may wrap himself in steel, but he is a man of tender heart. Witness his concern for the pain his dear friend endures.
Once Yda returns, I'll see that she sits down to her favorite dish. When you feel empty inside, it is easy to forget that your belly needs to be filled...

They told us what happened with Papalymo, and I...
<sniff> Forgive me, there are simply no words...
Coultenet greatly admired Papalymo, and aspired to achieve the same lofty heights of magecraft. His loss was a terrible blow to the Scions...
My own grief is as a crushing weight upon my heart, and when I think of what Yda must be feeling... Papalymo's sacrifice cannot be in vain. We will find the means to deal with this primal.
The containment spell appears stable for now, but it is by no means a permanent solution. We must hold ourselves ready that we might act at a moment's notice.
All I want to do is weep, but right now we need to hold back the tears and do what must be done...
<click> <click> How do you fare, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? I must say, it is still an odd feeling to call you by your name. Very odd.
column23: As for myself, I am occupying myself studying the pranks and tricks of the moogles. Meanwhile, my fellow Vath have taken quite a liking to the traditional dance of the Vanu Vanu.
column24: Things are changing here in Loth ast Vath, but our guild is prospering as never before. I could not be happier.

column22: <click> <click> I spoke with the deftarm. It would seem he is in pursuit of a dangerous man. This is worrying to me.
column23: Yet he has proven himself a capable one, and great hunters such as yourself stand by his side. I trust he will come to no harm.

column22: <click> <click> Hunter of dragons and gods, you have my gratitude for leading the deftarm safely back to Loth ast Vath.
column23: By your efforts, we have made new friends and trading partners, and our colony prospers—not merely in material riches, but cultural riches as well.
column24: From the passionate dances of the Vanu Vanu to the playful pranks of the moogles—doubtless the Onemind could never conceive of such wonders!

column22: Ohl Deeh and Mogzin have agreed to go in search of Gullinbursti, and I trust that you and your pupil will have no trouble tracking down this masked man.
column23: It would have been an honor and a pleasure to accompany you, but I fear I am not the spry young man I once was. Yes, I daresay this greybeard is better suited to serve as caretaker.

column22: You have my thanks, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. For freeing Gullinbursti from his madness, and for leading Mogzin and Ohl Deeh safely back here to Bahrr Lehs.
column23: You will be pleased to hear that Mogzin is more industrious than ever, and Ohl Deeh's roars are so mighty, one would think he was a dragon thrice and again his actual size. Ah, how my grandchildren have grown!
column24: ...But forgive this old man his sentimental ramblings. Rest assured I will see that none shirk their duties until Zenith is restored to its former glory!

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Mogzin told me you had a great feast, and danced night and day! And no one could be bothered to tell me? The mighty Ohl Deeh will not overlook this dishonor!
column23: Yes, Mogzin will feel a roar so mighty it will knock the pom clear from his head!

column22: Would that Linu Vanu accompany you in your quest, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. But Azys Lla is no place for us to tread. Vanu tradition leaves no doubt about this, and tradition must be obeyed.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. The dance you and Linu Vali have brought forth was truly a sight to behold—as bright as if the sun and the moon shone as one in the same sky.
column23: The Vundu will be no match for us now. They will scatter as cowardly korrigans in the face of a thunderous storm!

column22: The fortification directly below us is Castrum Oriens. Baelsar's Wall is the structure you see towering behind it.
My apologies, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. Due to unforeseen circumstances, we have been forced to temporarily close our Little Ladies' Day shops. Please, come back later.
Here you can trade your vouchers for any Little Ladies' Day items of your choice or purchase anything that strikes your fancy the good old way─with gil!
The Songbirds will be taking to the stages momentarily in their new costumes! It's a performance you'll not want to miss!

<blip> Activating verification systems...
The Empire congratulates you on your victory over Zurvan at extreme threat level settings.
column23: As a successful candidate, your cell samples will now be utilized in the mass production phase of the cloning initiative. Standard coercion protocol will provide accelerated growth via Sephirot's life energy manipulation capabilities.
column24: <beep> <beep> Warning. Sensors fail to detect presence of Sephirot manifestation. Cloning manufacture suspended until further notice. The Empire thanks you for your patience and continued cooperation.

column22: Good to see you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Braving new frontiers with the anima, I trust? You needn't worry about me. Research is proceeding swimmingly. Indeed, a world where anima is a commonplace commodity is on the horizon!
Lady F'lhaminn? I sent her outside to enjoy a quiet cup of tea. Much has happened these past moons, and we all can use a rest every now and again.

Things are heatin' up in Ala Mhigo, but we can't afford to lose track o' the trouble what might be brewin' in the rest o' the realm. Don't you worry though! I'll be keepin' an ear to the ground, me nose in the air, an' one eye on the horizon!

Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Slipslix needs creaturebits for research. New knowings await!
I cannot say for certain what madness has taken Gullinbursti, but it bodes ill for our well-being here. We must take action, and swiftly.
Denizens of Gridania, I, Lisette de Valentione, have traveled once more from Ishgard to be with you during this season of ardor and affection.
column23: I hope you are all finding the festivities to your liking! Make sure you do not waste this opportunity to express your love to those you hold dearest in your heart.

column22: I trust that my dearest Hortefense has taught you our house's gesture of love? It has served many generations of my family well, and I am sure you will find it of use when you open up to your special someone.

Our retinue has made the journey from Ishgard, in the hope of helping the people of Eorzea express their deepest feelings, during this season of romance. We shall do our utmost to give succor to those troubled by matters of the heart.
A finer doter I have never seen! Pray go forth and seek out your beloved—that you might forge an eternal bond of your own.
We shall see that this place is well defended. Just as he always did...
My lord will not fail in his duty to fortify our borders. Especially since I shall be reminding him of said duty every hour, on the hour.
I've been searching high and low for a pair of muscled arms that might help us in distributing our Far Eastern mochi. It seems I have finally found what I was looking for!
I'll take you anywhere you fancy for 1000 gil! Ah, I see you managed to find some work for yourself.
column23: Honestly I thought my luck had turned when I got that job, but I'm going to need more work than that if I'm to put food on the table. However, do not despair, I won't be giving up any time soon!

column22: When word reached us that the Resistance was building momentum once more, I could not deny the quickening of my Ala Mhigan blood. Mayhap there is some way I could contribute to the fight...
Glad I was to hear that Yda and Papalymo had been found. The Scions would have been much the poorer without them.

Greetings, good <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, and may I wish you every health and happiness in this, the year of the dog. I am the inu bugyo, and I lead a Far Eastern delegation on a mission to foster the bonds of friendship with the people of Eorzea.
column23: As in the past, we will be hosting a Heavensturn celebration in the style of our land. It promises to be a most enjoyable experience, and I hope that you will participate and urge your friends to do so as well.

column22: I am pleased to report that our advent cakes are proving extremely popular. But they pale next to little Taro, who has endeared himself to the people with his passionate performances and winsome ways.
column23: And to think that we were so close to a complete disaster! You have made our long journey worthwhile, and on behalf of my delegation, I give you my heartfelt thanks.

column22: Ah, if it isn't our heroic adventurer. I pray you are enjoying the Heavensturn celebration, my friend. After all, you helped us save it.
column23: The revelry is at fever pitch in no small part due to Taro's charms...but in most part due to my sublime mochi, of course. There's no greater satisfaction than to behold the smiles upon people's faces as they devour the advent cakes!

column22: Arf, arf!

Papalymo's was a noble soul...
He shall take a place of honor in my memories, alongside A'aba and Aulie.
The light of the dawn is dimmed by Papalymo's passing. Those of us who remain must strive to shine all the brighter.
Hello there, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I pray you are enjoying this year's Hatching–tide.

My thanks again for helping to make my vision reality, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Truly, I am blessed to have such wonderful friends as you. Now, pray enjoy Hatching–tide while it lasts!
Welcome to the heart─or should I say, the yolk─of the Hatching–tide festival. Eggceptional eggcitement for one and all!
Riggy has since come on board as our mascot. The big fellow that he is, he's nigh impossible to miss!
Greetings, adventurer! Soaking in the spirit of Hatching–tide, I trust?
Your measurements were rather larger than I expected.
column23: And no, I shan't tell you which ones.

column22: If Rowena has the gaze of a dead-eyed serpent, then Tataru's stare is alike to a raptor what's sighted prey. Each is bloody terrifyin' in her own way.
Tataru told me of Papalymo and the sacrifice he made. “Unfortunate” doesn't begin to describe the travesty of his passing.
Selecting a leader to succeed Haurchefant at Camp Dragonhead was no easy task.
column23: And yet when Emmanellain sought me out and vowed to serve truly as a knight of Fortemps, I knew I had found my garrison commander.

column22: <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>! I'm honored y-you would stop to speak with me!
column23: I've been run off my feet since Honoroit left for Dragonhead, b-but I'll do my best to see the manor house doesn't fall into shambles!

column22: <cough> <wheeze> Just leave me be. Despair and me are old friends...
Everyone happy! Riggy happy too! Spriggity riggity goooooo!

Tell me, have you ever had any luck at the Gold Saucer? You've never even been, you say? Well, in that case, I'll try searching elsewhere for someone who understands the profound depth of my suffering.
column23: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete one of the following main scenario quests: “The Gridanian Envoy,” “The Ul'dahn Envoy,” or “The Lominsan Envoy.”

column22: I daresay I've delayed you long enough. May the Spinner guide you to fortunes beyond your wildest dreams! Although, as our attractions will reward fifty percent more MGP for the duration of the campaign, you may not even require the Spinner's succor!

Regrettably, I am only permitted to serve those who have presented a rather special card to my fellow attendant Ollier. If you do not already have one, try visiting the Steps of Nald. You may just bump into Lord Manderville himself! He's been greeting adventurers there of late, and I'm certain he will be more than glad to help you. He's awfully generous.
column23: Completing the quest “Golden Rain” will unlock the campaign attendant's shop.

column22: When the order comes, the loyal soldier marches to war─even if that battlefield happens to be the Empire-held lands of Gyr Abania.
To believe that the Twelveswood will remain untouched by the violence in Ala Mhigo is folly. Embers from such a blaze can carry far, and we must stand ready to stamp out sudden fires.
Our duty to the Eorzean Alliance has us shipping out more often than ever before. Mayhap we shall fight together on the shores of some distant nation!
This was a fine spot to build a watchtower, an' that's the Matron's honest truth. Just feast your eyes on that view of Baelsar's Wall...
Ever will the dawn continue to rise. Even as you bring light to faraway lands, we who stay behind shall keep our halls free of shadow.
'Twould seem that the Alliance has committed its forces to the liberation of Ala Mhigo. Will I live to see the day...?
Calamity! The winds that swirl about the Diadem have begun howling with unprecedented fury─any vessel that seeks to approach is swept away like a kite in a storm.
column23: Alas, we must suspend all expeditions unto this land of perilous bounty until these tempestuous gales die down...

column22: Looking to purchase a tank of ceruleum, were you? My apologies, but I fear our missions have been put on hold for the time being. Lord Aurvael will explain the whys and the wherefores.
I'm a personal assistant of Master Wiscard hisself. If you've any prisms you ain't using, then I can take 'em off your hands.
Greetings and welcome to Shirogane, the soon-to-be-open residential district for foreigners.
column23: While land sales are yet to begin, we invite you to explore the island and acquaint yourself with all it has to offer!
column24: At present, Shirogane is open for display only. Land sales will commence at a later time.

column22: This ferry is bound for Shirogane. Are you coming along?
My apologies for the inconvenience, but this ferry is presently out of service.
column23: In order to ride the ferry, you must first complete the main scenario quest “Not without Incident.”

column22: This ferry can either take you to another ward, or to Kugane. Are you coming aboard?

Word has it there are some famous folk from all across Eorzea enjoying the festivities at the Saucer right now. Mayhap you'll bump into them next time you find yourself there; gods know the Spinner's smiled on you in lieu of me thus far.
Beyond this gate lies the East Shroud. Do you wish to return to Amarissaix's Spire?
You're traveling to Castrum Oriens?
We should be happy to serve you when you have sufficient funds, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>.
We should be happy to serve you when you have sufficient funds, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>.
Beyond lies Virdjala, an area home to fell fiends and a hostile Ananta tribe besides. If you must venture there, do so with the utmost caution.
Want to cross back over to Pike Falls, do you?
You're for the Ala Mhigan Quarter, are you? Give us a moment.
You seek access to the waterways? As you like. I can open the gate.
Well, well! <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Woman<Else/>Man</If> such as you hardly needs an introduction. Will you be coming inside?
Never thought the day'd come when these gates were open to all... Oh, you wish to pass through?
Greetings, honored <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. Will you be entering the Ruby Bazaar offices?
You are a warrior of the Steppe, yes? Then fight well, and die well. If your soul burns bright enough, mayhap you will be reborn as Dotharl. Such things have been known to happen!
Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I bid you welcome to the House of the Fierce!
It is a pleasure to see you again, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Shall I show you inside?
My <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, will you be heading out?
You wish to leave the Dawn Throne? Very well. You are free to pass. Do, however, take care not to trip on your way down. It is a long way to the bottom.
Only by the grace of the most radiant may one ascend to the Dawn Throne. Remember this.
Honored hero! You seek passage across the One River?
All are free to travel in and out of the enclave. Do you seek passage?
Do you wish to enter Specula Imperatoris?
Wightrock lies beyond.
Your friend...Hien, is it? He will make a fine slave after you die. Or flee.
Only those deemed worthy by our most radiant brother Magnai are permitted to pass through these gates. You are not one of them. Now begone!

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! You're still in Kugane? I thought you would have sailed back to Eorzea by now. Is there something that keeps you in our fair city, or do you simply enjoy its pleasures too much to leave?
column23: As for me, I will require a little more time to...what did Lady Leveva say? Sit the straight ship? Pah, how I despise your cryptic expressions. Just tell her, if you see her, that I haven't forgot our promise.

column22: There is much one might learn from his rival...especially if he is so forthcoming with sharing his knowledge.
column23: Yet, if he is foolish enough to want to reveal all his secrets, I will not match that foolishness by turning a deaf ear to them.

column22: Just as every rose has its thorn, so, too, does this city have its share of cheats and pretenders. This goes doubly so for our population of geomancers.
column23: The worst offender? That charlatan who claims the blood of the Grandmaster Kazan, the greatest geomancer to ever live and serve the bakufu. Ware his honeyed-tongue lest you find your purse a stone's weight lighter.

column22: Any respectable merchant knows that without the sage counsel of a geomancer, their business is like to fail. Just as any respectable merchant knows that said counsel does not come cheap. If it is our counsel you seek, we can provide you with a reading in...three moons time. That is, unless you pay the expedition fee.

Most all those who work in shipping or in trade will keep a geomancer on retainer whom they call upon before making any significant business decision. They say that behind every wealthy man, flows both wind and water.

Spirits, Coultenet, spirits! Even if we are naught more than bit players in their tale, we must do our utmost to support the senior Scions─and <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> most of all!
Papalymo's absence will be keenly felt for some time. Would that we had the strength to aid others in his stead...

Even Tataru has her limits, and so I have taken it upon myself to assist her in managing communications with various organizations and our members in the field. Riol and the others are counting on us for our support, after all.
Hmm... Even as “bit players” they show such passion, such fervor! Oh, what I wouldn't give to be a bit player too─or better yet, play with their─

<Emphasis>Sister</Emphasis>! Please, you never know who might be listening! And more importantly, we have our own mission to attend to─and if you're too busy thinking such thoughts, you're liable to get us both killed!
What will become of our homeland? I know not what to think of this endeavor...
Were I ten years younger─nay, five!─I would not hesitate to join Lady Yugiri and Lord Gosetsu in their fight for freedom!
Well said, Hoary! Every man to his purpose, and we must not doubt ours!
Per Y'shtola's instructions, we will continue to work with the Ironworks and the Alliance to see if we can't find out where Omega and Shinryu went. I'll be sure to stay in touch!
Keep to the north and cross upstream. The black bridge belongs to the Garleans─for now.

What use 'as the expedition with a birdwatcher, you ask? Well, I'll let ye in on a secret o' mine. I don't just watch the flyin' rats, I run 'em through with me naked steel an' line me frock with their feathers.
column23: Now seein' as I's clipped more wings than I can count, I <Emphasis>suppose</Emphasis> I could part ways with a handful or two...for the right price, o' course. I's no heart for charity, like.
column24: An' don't bother me none with yer fancy gil. Don't trust the stuff, see. I wants me summat what has true value. Say, a sackful o' them protean crystals. That's me offer. Take it or leave me be.

column22: We'll need to call the other senior members together before we can make a decision.
I leave you in my officers' capable hands─and them in yours.
To be honest, I already know I want us to work together. But we've still got to talk it over with everyone.
The tale of our victory in East End will be known to every Ala Mhigan from the Fringes to the Peaks when I am through. You'll see!
So the Gridanians are finally willing to fight, eh...
Ah yes, asking everyone's opinion before making a critical decision. Truly, this is a far better arrangement than having centralized leadership.
We'll have our work cut out for us after the operation, I fear, but we'll do what we can. That's all any of us can do, is it not?
You too are come to inspect their facilities? As you can see, they have done well to set aside this much space, but their supplies are insufficient.
Krile and I shall remain here for now. Should you have need of us, you are welcome to visit.
We examined the patients and offered what assistance we could. However, for many of their injuries, time and bed rest are the only effective treatments.

I briefly dabbled with similar methods involving distillations and infusions of herbal extracts, but I must confess to knowing little and less of Ala Mhigan traditional medicine. Would that I knew more, for its effectiveness exceeds all expectations...
Tataru's entrusted me with the remainder of her responsibilities in her absence. Should you require aught, pray do not hesitate to ask.

I cannot well express how our Doman comrades reacted to the news of their homeland's liberation. They were saddened to hear of the castle's destruction, but they understood that it was in service to a greater purpose.
I will pray for your safe journey.
Free at last, free at last... Never did I think I would live to see this day!
I wish you well on your journey, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>...
Lady Yugiri told us all. Thank you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, a thousand times, thank you!
To know that the fires of war may spread across my homeland once more... Even if freedom is the end result, my heart is...clouded.
After so much death and destruction, the world is turned upside down. My people are free. The feeling is...beyond words.
If Doma knows peace in our time, I should like to see it with my own eyes. Perhaps partake of these hot springs Homei tells me of as well...
The look on Homei's face when he learned of Doma's liberation... The mere thought of it fair moves me to tears...
You wish to train? For you I can do naught. Seek out the great and wise veteran who presides over these grounds. Or mayhap he will seek you out in Rhalgr's Reach?
We all of us here believe in you. Come what may, we will keep our chins up and forge on─for the sake of the realm.
From the political landscape to our struggles against the beastmen, little is certain and less is within our control. We can but focus on those things that we have the power to change.
Arenvald left to join the fight for Ala Mhigo, so we'll all have to do more to make up for his absence. Not that I mind. I'm happy for the boy, I am.
By the Twelve, you all actually did it! Ala Mhigo, free at last! Arenvald must be beside himself with joy...
I feared it would take longer to rouse the people to action after the disaster at the Wall, but it seems our countrymen are not so easily discouraged. Change is on the horizon, my friends.
Stone from Ala Gannha was used to build the royal palace. Aye, the selfsame palace the viceroy now occupies...

We could see the explosions from here. You had men at Specula Imperatoris, aye? I pray you did not lose too many. After hearing of everything you've achieved, I don't think I could bear to see it unfinished.
Do what you will and say what you like. All I ask is that you not bring any trouble to Ala Gannha.
Thank you again for saving Wercrata. These people have known enough tragedy...
We heard from our boys about what happened at the Reach. About what happened to Meffrid. He was a good man, and he will be missed.
Not bad at all for our first joint operation. It will make for a solid foundation upon which we may build a lasting alliance.
We Vira have long memories. We will remember your deeds, eikon ssslayer.
I swore I'd return with an army one day, and here we are. We're almost home.
The bloody commander of the Crania Lupi, in our hands! You've outdone yourselves, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!
Give it your all, and we may live to see tomorrow. That's all there is to it.

The Flames belong on the front line, whereas we are better suited to a supporting role. Owing to their lengthy campaign against the Dravanians, the Temple Knights are a well-rounded force, and the Lominsans, well...woe betide the enemy who has to contend with a pirate and his axe.
Regardless of one's personal misgivings, I for one believe a commander should comport themselves with the utmost dignity at all times.
'Tis a rare thing indeed for the Elder Seedseer to enter the fray...
Those imperial bastards don't stand a chance! We'll blast them to smithereens with our cannons!
Heh heh heh! The streets'll run red with blood. We'll have our revenge for the towers...
Never thought I'd have the chance to fight alongside the Admiral herself! We'll make her proud!
So many lives lost, so much blood shed. But it will not be in vain.
Praise be to the Twelve for your victory. Though many brave souls gave their lives this day, we take comfort in the knowledge it was not in vain.
It's not as though we have to stand around here indefinitely, do we?
It was no small feat, but we brought with us the main battery from the <Emphasis>Triumph</Emphasis>. You should look forward to the show.

Well done, <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/><Else/><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/><Else/><Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/></If></If>. I'll spare you more flowery words. Doubtless you've had your fill of them.
After you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
Hilda and her watch will keep Ishgard safe in my absence. You know I would not miss this for the world, my friend.
You did well to defeat that fiend. Empowered by the eyes I so foolishly ordered you to cast into the Sea of Clouds... What a twisted legacy they have wrought.
The tale will need to be spread far and wide if it is to help the Resistance draw new recruits. Fortunately, M'naago is eager to see to that.
Not since Carteneau have we gathered in such numbers. But this shall be much, much different...
Doma was only the beginning. With our victory here, we send a message to all the provinces. They can be beaten! You can be free!

...Papalymo and I weren't entirely honest with you. Though we were sheltered in Little Ala Mhigo at first, we spent most of our time here, working with Conrad and his people. But you probably guessed that the moment I led you to the Reach, didn't you?
Looking at all these brave men and women in uniform, from all across Eorzea... None can accuse us of being an Alliance in name alone.
<pant> <pant> Mayhap I got a bit carried away... But by the Navigator, that was bloody brilliant!
I wonder what Conrad has planned for us?

Although I have briefed our officers on Garlean tactics and magitek design, I cannot say with confidence it will be of much use. Zenos has employed unorthodox strategies before, and I know little of these new prototypes...
The battle may be ended, but the war goes on. Garlemald will not abide such defiance. However, for this day, we may rejoice in our victory.
If you don't mind, I was thinking of staying here and assisting Meffrid with the training of the new recruits...
Naught would bring me greater joy than to join you on your journey. However, Lady Yugiri made it clear that we were to remain here, and safeguard the community we have built...
Doma! Doma! Glory to Lord Hien! To the Scions! And to you, my friend!
When you and Lyse and Meffrid first came here, I thought you all mad. Freedom was a fool's dream, and helping you would only bring us more grief.
column23: We had grown accustomed to this life, sorry as it was. But Curtis said it best when he spoke out against the mad king. 'Twas naught more than a slow death, and we were the fools, thinking we could do no better...

column22: You should know that even after accounting for the dead, some of our number remain missing.
column23: We've come to suspect that these missing men might've been collaborators who aided the Skulls. I don't want to believe it, but it would explain a great deal...

column22: Thank you for your help in Ala Gannha. I'll admit that I didn't have high hopes when we first set out, but the results speak for themselves. Well done!

I'm not at all eager to lead my people into battle any time soon. But we may have no choice. The Skulls've redoubled their efforts to root out Resistance members. If our brothers need our help, then we've got no choice but to give it.
Keep on your guard. There are many places to hide, affording the enemy ample opportunity to take you unawares.

Welcome to the Peering Stones, home of the M tribe. I must give you fair warning that, while travelers are welcome here, any acts of hostility will be met with an arrow shaft between the eyes. No exceptions.
Welcome, ssstrider, to Vira Nilya. You are among friends here.
You needn't fear any beasssts coming near our home. The poison from my arrows would fell them before they could reach our gatesss.
Welcome to Ala Ghiri, the heart of trade in Gyr Abania. Or at least, that's what it was before the Garleans invaded. Someday soon this place will live up to its reputation again. You wait and see.

The cliffs over there to the east used to be a stairway if you can believe such a thing. Unfortunately, the Garleans destroyed it in the hopes of cutting another line to Ala Ghiri. Hopefully it can be rebuilt someday.
The Lochs are home to many a foul creature. Be sure to have your wits about you at all times.
We are ever on the lookout for any suspicious activity.

Welcome to Sakazuki─arguably the most important of the Confederate outposts. From here we have a clear view of the Ruby Sea in its entirety. Walk up these steps and have a look for yourself if you don't believe me.
This is Onokoro─the Confederacy's headquarters. While we welcome all to visit our island, we will not tolerate any skullduggery, you hear?

The Confederacy's headquarters are located on this island so we tend to suffer the brunt of any attacks upon our organization. Thankfully, there are many places to take cover here and, if need be, we can always escape by sea.
Have no fear, my friend! Be it beast or man or magitek, I shall defend the House of the Fierce from all dangers most...fiercely...
In an emergency, we can seal the inner chambers. Blessedly, we have not had cause to do so for quite some time.
Come, come! Should you desire shelter, Yuzuka Manor is open to all! All deadly beasts I will dispatch!

column23: The guard's intense stare pierces right through you. You sense it would not be wise to cause any trouble in Reunion.
The way the guard furrows her brow suggests she has noticed your formidable strength. She will be keeping an eye on you from now on.

column22: On the Steppe, the strong prey upon the weak. Tell me, which are you?
Blugh! There's sand in my mouth. I have no idea how my previous self was able to put up with this work.
Stop by if you wish to rest and quench your thirst. But be warned. If you come here to do us harm, you will not leave unscathed.
This is Erralig's Burial Chamber, where the dead rest in whatever peace they have found. I stand guard over that peace, and without the proper leave, none shall disturb it while I watch.
Come one, come all! Burns, cuts, embarrassing rashes─there is naught that the mystical waters of the Bokaisen Hot Springs cannot heal!
I bid you welcome to Kogane Dori. Be it goods from near or far, all can be obtained here. For the right price, of course.

Tenkonto is as the crossroads of Kugane─many people pass through it every day, and I have learned to recognize the lawbreaker and the troublemaker. Conduct yourself with respect, and we shall have no quarrel.
Welcome to the Shiokaze Hostelry. Should you wish to sample the flavors of Kugane, or simply to rest and recover from the rigors of your travels, we stand ready to meet your every need.
None but authorized personnel may enter the barracks. State your business or leave at once.
A day of training begins and ends with practice swings. If we are to discharge our duty well, we must be relentless in our training!
The Sekiseigumi's operations are dependent upon bakufu coin, and let it suffice to say it isn't a particularly generous sum. We find ourselves stretched thin at the best of times.
This is the Sekiseigumi Barracks. See that you acquit yourself with propriety.
This is Matsuba Square, and there is great history here. It takes its name from Clan Matsuba, one of the first lines of magistrates in Kugane.
No one may pass these gates without the express permission of the magistrate. Be on your way.
That's close enough, savage.
Yes, this is the Thavnairian Consulate. No, you may not enter without official business.
Have you been for a soak in the soothing waters of Bokaisen Hot Springs? Take the time, and you will not be sorry. My baths will cure all what ails you.
...Phew, felt the blood rushing to my head for a moment there. I'll hop back in once I've cooled down...
There is nothing finer than soaking in a hot spring whilst letting one's mind drift out across the Ruby Sea...
(...Stupid sexy Roegadyn...)
Sake seems a simple drink, but depending on the place it was made and the hand which made it, the flavor is subtly different. I shall have to sample them all...
Ah, an ijin! Come...come sit with me and have a drink. I would hear the fan...hic...the fantastic tales of your travels!

Can I help you with anything? We handle repairs and craft smaller boats like the ones you see here, but if you're after a sekibune or something of similar size, I'm afraid you'll have to try elsewhere.
Our officials have become infatuated with these flying vessels, these “air” ships. How quickly they forget our heritage with the sea.
Our shipwrights can fix anything that floats─even one of your massive foreign vessels!
Are you seeking a particular vessel? This landing sees the arrival of foreign airships from the Garlean Empire and elsewhere, as well as craft belonging to the bakufu itself.

Come to rest your weary bones as well, have you? I'm not sure I can take much more of my master's “gentle” instruction. I should slip away to the flower district and see what pleasures my meager wage can buy me...
Why is that rice not in the damn hold!? Those good-for-nothin' slouches better not have forgotten anythin' else─it ain't as if we can turn the ship about once we set sail!
Life on land is so stiflingly hot. It is truly unbearable. <sigh> I wish nothing more than to sail the open sea and to bask in the ocean winds.

It is my job to procure rare items─more specifically, rare items from the Ruby Sea─for the East Aldenard Trading Company. This, however, has become increasingly difficult of late due to the restrictions that have been placed on trade in Kugane.

The perfect blade can only be forged by those who have cleared their mind of all thoughts not related to the task at hand. Those who do not understand this most basic of swordsmithing principles are banned from taking up a hammer at my forge.
The love I hold for Forgemaster Brithael is only equaled by my passion for swordsmithing. Regardless of whatever it takes, I shall have him and become the greatest swordsmith to have ever lived!
Quality armor cannot be forged without first considering the wearer. A master crafts for the patron's purpose─not to satisfy <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> own.

Kugane teems with merchants, always coming and going, and we receive a great many commissions. It is my task to see that Kokajiya's shelves remain fully stocked with the various materials of our craft.

Ah, if it isn't <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Fancy meetin' ye here. Armory in Kugane─it ain't nothin' like what we do back home. Everythin' from the materials to the techniques that are employed are different.

Waiting on a commission, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>? No? You're still welcome to have a look inside, but please don't yelp when the heat hits your face─it distracts the smiths from their work.
Welcome to the Umineko Teahouse─the best place to drown your sorrows in platefuls of dango and cups of tea. What will you be having today, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>?
To think that all the men here are more interested in stuffing their faces with dango than talking to a pretty girl and offering to buy her tea! <sigh> Are there no gentlemen left in Kugane?
There is no denying that the tea and sweets here are excellent, but that is not the reason I frequent this establishment. I come here to see <Emphasis>her</Emphasis>. Ume is stunning, is she not?
My, you've a sorry look to you. Go on, now. You've no business here. I've nothing cheap enough to sell to the likes of you.
If there is aught you seek, you need look no further than my shop. Come, come! And find all that your heart desires.
We have some of our finest actors performing today! Why deprive yourself of this wondrous spectacle!? Save yourself the stabbing pain of regret and come and see the show!
Piss on those Sekiseigumi clowns. They started out the same as the rest of us, grubbin' in the dirt, but now look at 'em actin' all high an' mighty. Makes me want to puke.
You lookin' to lose your tongue, ijin? You'd best be off on your merry way, then. The Sekiseigumi won't dirty their sandals trudgin' down here to save you.
And then, this absolute beast of a man, he says─ <sigh> Would you <Emphasis>please</Emphasis> stop gobbling your food like an uncultured hog? You're like to choke on your chopsticks!
We have been given strict orders to monitor all foreign vessels passing through this area. It is far more taxing than it sounds for, in addition to that, we must also contend with the Confederates.
It is my responsibility to keep these cannons in working order. I must clean and polish them regularly, else the corrosive winds will cause them to fall into disrepair.
I have the eyes of a hawk. It is both a blessing and a curse. On the one hand, I can see everything, but on the other hand I can see <Emphasis>everything</Emphasis>.
You are to scrutinize their flags and make absolute certain they are an enemy vessel before firing upon them! Whatever you do, you are not to sink an allied ship or allow an unfriendly one passage!
I am charged with both monitoring the ships that pass through this area and keeping a close watch on activity in Hells' Lid.

Me? Slacking off? Nay─this is nothing of the sort! In fact, I would even say this is the most important part of my job. After all, if I do not rest and keep my eyes sharp, I am bound to miss something important.
I am one of the Confederacy's foremost lookouts. It is a position I intend to keep until the day I die.
Tamamizu is open to you, friend. Full glad are we to welcome any and all, and the treasures they might bring unto us.
Haha! Take a look at this─is it not magnificent!? I can see that you want it. For the right price, I might be willing to part with it.
Have you, too, come to offer up your prayers?
She is adorable. Yes, she is! One day this little girl is going to be the savior of these seas.
You look like you might have a few interesting stories to tell. If you have a moment to spare, we would love to hear them.
I am currently in the middle of preparing food for our village-wide banquet. If you happen to know any unusual ingredients or recipes I could use, do tell!
That's it. Just keep on rubbing it just like that. You are doing great.
I am praying to the kami for luck since I am about to leave on a treasure hunt. Would you like to join me?
One wrong move and you will have the pleasure of being acquainted with my lance.
...We have naught to discuss. Nor have you aught to discuss with Isobe, I should think. Therefore you have no reason to remain.
Has something happened at Shisui of the Violet Tides? Rarely are we kept informed of the ongoings of the castle. I mean, none of us even know what our own ruler, the Ruby Princess, looks like!
Hey, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>mister</If>, what is the surface like? Is it a nice place? Or is it scary? Do you have seaweed that grows up to the skies? Or do you have...
If I may ask, what brings you to our humble village, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>? It is not every day that we receive visitors from the surface.

The Kojin of the Red have become even more aggressive of late. It has caused our people no end of trouble. <sigh> If only they were a bit more like their amicable cousins in Tamamizu, perhaps we would not have to suffer so...
It is my dream to one day meet the Ruby Princess. I bet she is beautiful! Have you ever met her, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>mister</If>?
I am currently in the middle of delegating fishing tasks. Unless what you have to say is of great import, pray come and find me later.
Oh, dear... <sigh> What have my sons done this time?
I could have sworn there were at least two fish left on this line. Did someone sneak off with them?
Ah, there is nothing better than having a smoke after a long day of fishing...
Selling all of this should earn me enough money to make it through to the next moon.
Nothing can compare to the seas' magnificence. Standing here and looking upon their beauty always helps me clear my thoughts.
While many of us prefer the taste of fresh fish, we must preserve most of what we catch for days our hauls are not so bountiful.
This meager haul will fetch us but a pouchful of coins at the market. <sigh> It seems every day the number of fish we catch dwindles. We really must look into finding new fishing grounds.
Quiet. Do not break my concentration. The very clothes on my back ride on the outcome of this game.
I do not know how I am going to carry all of this to the marketplace on my own...
I am about to set out on a fishing voyage and am inspecting my boat to make sure everything is in working order.
The both of us were born and bred in Isari, which is presumably why the chief has stationed us here. It is good to be home for a time.
I am looking to make a rod that will not put any strain on my back. My friend is in the middle of testing my latest design for me.
While the Coral Banquet is primarily a lookout post, occasionally we will also conduct rituals here to ensure the safe return of those going out to sea.

From here we survey the northern expanse of ocean. Most enemy fleets will approach our island from these waters, and it is for this reason alone that the Coral Banquet is considered to be the Confederacy's most dangerous post.

Please, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, do not break my concentration. Were enemy troops to approach and I failed to raise the alarum, the deaths of my fellow Confederates will be on my hands.

There is a real technique to this. You cannot just go spreading fertilizer anywhere. You must take account of the different types of rice plant and their individual needs. It is a lot like raising children really.
They say persimmons taste better the longer you stare at them. This one is going to be positively delicious.
Namai may seem like a peaceful village, but believe me, we have had our share of troubles. Too many to count.
I would love nothing more than to devour an entire tiger right now.
The Empire said I was too sickly to fight for them. I was glad to avoid conscription at first, but my joy was short-lived when I realized they had taken all of my closest friends.
All of my closest friends have been conscripted into the imperial army. I spend most of my days now just watching my daughter over there playing. She is all I have left.
We have suffered a great deal, but when I gaze upon these flowers, I am able to forget all our troubles. If only for a moment.
Have you already taken in our paddies? We raise them as if they were our children. They are a rare source of happiness for me in these dark times.
Agh, all this labor is not helping my poor old back.
Ah, I see you there. Admiring my bamboo pole collection, were you not? Always nice to meet a fellow enthusiast. It has taken me a not-insignificant amount of time to amass all of these.
So much rice, so little time.
I knew Lord Hien only by name and reputation until today. There is no denying that he has a presence...
In the midst of training I was, my body aflame, my garments soaked through with sweat, when these kindred spirits begged leave to train together! You are welcome to join us too, my friend!
While you were away, others came unto us, eager to pledge themselves to the cause. Namai was only the beginning...
Lord Hien has returned! Lord Hien has returned! And together we will drive the imperials out of Doma once and for all!
I have tried to hone my skills in preparation for this day. I have no burning desire to spill blood, but if I must...then so be it.
Used to be I couldn't imagine it being any better, but now I can see it. One day someone will ask me who I am, and I will tell them I am Isse of Doma, not with shame...but with pride.
column23: But I know we can't do it alone, so I hope...I hope you'll continue to help us. Please.

column22: The Drunken Toad was made using parts from an old riverboat. It carried rice used to make alcohol up and down the river─that's where the name comes from.
You needn't worry for your safety within these walls. No, no. The Namazu here are civilized─we would never attack man.
You are aware that we Namazu can read and write, yes? Quite literate, quite smart. And I have the finest writing of all here in Yuzuka Manor. I just wanted to share that with you.
All of the Namazu here are quite civilized. Very dignified, very sophisticated. The bells you see at our necks are proof enough of that.
You are an accomplished and traveled <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> of the world. Yes, yes. I wish very much to be like you one day.
We were just discussing what might make a good gift for the people of Namai. I believe a vase would do quite nicely, yes, yes.
Those fools are off hiding again drowning themselves in tea. And after I've told them so many times not to. All Namazu know that stuff is for drunkards and mummers.
This must seem like a sad place to an outsider. It used to be quite lively before half of the blasted village was conscripted into the Empire's army.
This area's water comes from the Heron's Flight. Truly, I have not seen a cleaner waterfall in my life. I am ever thankful as it nurtures the fish my husband and I use to trade for rice.
Abandoning my post? I'll have you know I'm more than capable of keeping watch and fishing at the same time!
Hmm yes, it seems there is indeed some water leaking from these rocks.
When the Empire came, I begged them to take me instead of the young ones.
I miss Geser terribly, but I know I need only be patient. He will return─I am sure of it.
Have you business with me? No? Then away with you!
Every day with my boy brings new discoveries. He reminds me of the man he was in many ways, but in others he is much different...
It may take many years and much work, but I will become the warrior I once was!
This is more than just a game. This is war!
Do not disturb me. I must be ever vigilant.
It is neither easy nor enjoyable work, but someone needs to keep a record of our supplies.
We are worthy of neither Azim nor Nhaama's protection. We do not even deserve this fire that keeps us warm.
I did not ask for the title of udgan and I do not enjoy holding it.
column23: Those who cling to such concepts are doomed to walk a path of greed. Our tribe will not make that same mistake again.

column22: These murals tell stories of our ancestors' greed. Whenever our tribe gains something, we make sure to look upon these walls, that we do not fall victim to the same temptations as those who came before us.

column23: This seems to be the Qestir tribe's khan. He welcomes you to Reunion with a smile.
Khaishan eyes you with suspicion. It seems he is wary of you bringing harm to Iturgen.
Cotota meets your gaze for a second before looking away shyly.

column22: The Qestir believe all words are merely lies. That is why they do not speak.
column23: It is also why I am forced to deal with so many troubled travelers, unable to understand Reunion's ways. I do not enjoy the role, but there are few others here willing to explain things orally.
The glint of confusion in Beki's eyes suggests she is not entirely sure why you have come up here.

column22: I have many goods from far beyond the borders of the Steppe. Mayhap they are common trinkets to you, traveler...but should you desire the familiar, you need only ask!
Why, that exotic aura you emit... You must be a traveler from far-off lands! Can I interest you in some kumis?
I came here to sell my wool, but no one seems interested. I suppose the only tribes who would be are those that live to the north.
Tell me, as a fellow outsider, what do you think of Qestiri customs? They are a bit of an odd bunch if you ask me, but at least they are willing to let non-Xaela trade here as well.
Travelers from without are always welcome! Travelers with a taste for organs and coin to pay, that is!
Many plants found on the Steppe may be used in medicines and poisons. To a traveler, it may be difficult to discern the difference. Safer to buy what you seek from me.
Buuz! Fresh buuz! Guaranteed to satisfy! Made with game caught daily by the finest Dazkar hunters, and prepared by our husbands! Fresh buuz!
One must remember to reward their beasts of burden for their service. Were it not for her, I could not have crossed the northern mountains, nor brought so much to market.
All tribal rivalries are to be forgotten while one is in Reunion. That is the principle the marketplace was founded on. I truly hope the day comes when we are all at peace.
All tribes may come and go freely from Reunion. Those who we consider friend...and those who we do not.
column23: Vexing, perhaps, but such is the law. Few are so foolish as to break the peace, so precious is this place.

column22: One never knows when they might be attacked on the Steppe. As a result, I have to keep watch all day and night. The rare times when I do sleep, I do so up here.
All is in accordance with their design. Mol Iloh is your home.
I would caution you to comport yourself with dignity in the presence of Temulun Khatun...but I sense that will not be necessary.
The gods said I should cook steak today, but they neglected to say if it should be rare, medium, or well-done...
We all have our own roles to play to keep order in our tribe. That is why I trade.
She is lovely, is she not? The gods told me to feed her until she grew nice and plump.
Apologies, but I can spare no time for you. Once I have finished taking stock of these supplies, I must spend time with the children.
I feel such a strong connection to my darling sheep. I have even given them all names. Would you like to hear them?
The other day the gods told me to tell a friend, one I had been fighting with, five things that I appreciate about them.
column23: Unfortunately, I was unable to overcome my own pride to actually speak with my friend that day. However, I have since learned the importance of being humble. I decided to apologize to her and we are now once again on good terms!

column22: Nothing relaxes me more than listening to someone playing the morin khuur. My mother often used to lull me to sleep with one when I was a child.
These sheep are the best family I have ever had.
My dreams of late have been haunted by images of my mild-mannered pup here devouring my flock. I cannot think why. He has never even growled at them.
Today's enemies are tomorrow's allies. Remember this.
Sheep are essential to our survival here on the Steppe, and it is my primary responsibility to take care of our flocks.
Beyond these doors is the throne room of our most radiant brother Magnai. You are to approach him with the utmost respect.
Do not be deceived by my frailty. I too am Oronir, and I once fought with the ferocity of my brothers. Now I serve the tribe in a different manner.
All those who live here in the Dawn Throne are extremely capable warriors. Many, however, have grown a little too confident in their abilities and might need to be brought down a peg or two.

Regardless of the heavy rains or winds that sweep through these areas, the flames of these torches shall always burn bright, here in the Dawn Throne, where the first children of Father Azim were ushered into this world.
What business brings you to the Dawn Throne? Answer wisely.

While being so high up makes it almost impossible for enemy forces or wild animals to attack us, it does come at a price. We must regularly herd our sheep to the fields below and back. Trust me when I say it is not nearly so easy as it sounds.
I have no use for you.
Do not even think to sneak even a spoonful of our food. We barely have enough rations to feed our own people. We cannot afford to provide for all the hungry mouths that pass through here.
I am observing the movements of the Dotharl. After all, they have launched a countless number of assaults on us in the past.
While I will not deny that there are many disputes between our tribes, we somehow always manage to resolve them. Allying ourselves with the Oronir was the best thing we could have done.
Please, move away from the sheep! Can you not see you are disturbing them?
<If(PlayerParameter(4))>...We have naught to discuss, woman.<Else/>Hmm... Yes...yes... This one is special.</If>

Have care, my friend. The area beyond is fraught with danger.
...Well? I'd wager that served to awaken the explorer within you.
I've been watching these two play for a while now, but the rules don't make much sense to me. Much more of a Triple Triad man myself. Do you fancy a match?
Zenos may be dead, and the XIIth defeated, but the Empire's not going anywhere. Ala Mhigo still needs the Resistance.
column23: My father used to say that freedom is just an opportunity. A chance to build something better. Well, now that we've got it, it's up to us what comes next.

column22: The children are away tending to the herds. When they learn you were here, they will doubtless shed tears of sadness, for you are well-liked.

It is all too easy to lose sight of our place within the grand scheme of things. That is why I traveled the world, pen in hand, and endeavored to record the events I saw. Even now, my habits remain─whenever I find a few moments to myself, I write.
There's never enough of anything to go around, which is why they put a man like me in charge of the stores. Some folks have trouble saying no. I don't.
Fassster! Fassster! Be quick or be dead! The imperials will show you no mercy!
The path ahead leads to the Temple of the Fist, and it is my duty to ensure that only those of sound body and mind are permitted to pass.
We have been trying to concoct a potion using only materials easily found in Gyr Abania, but it is proving to be anything but a simple task.
Our fighters never know when they'll be able to take a meal. All I can do is try to make sure that when they do, they'll have something to look forward to.
Moaning about our dearth of supplies isn't going to change anything. It is up to me to find some way of replenishing our stocks or people's lives may be at risk.
If you're looking for the tunnel to the Peaks, it's right this way.
I have been told to destroy the aetheryte should the imperial army find its way here. Though I truly hope it does not come to that.
Ours is a cause that knows no boundaries. Ala Mhigan, Ananta─all are welcome in the fight for freedom!
Not bad, eh? These bastards'll turn magitek armor to scrap in the blink of an eye!
The Vira have no love for the imperials. Full glad are we to pledge our blades to the Resissstance.
Do watch yourself around these chocobos. They're trained for combat so they're a bit more aggressive than your average bird.
Too many wounded, too little medicine, too much to worry about. So I don't. Instead, I pray every day for the fighting to end.
I fear there may not be much I can do for this man...
You wouldn't believe how many bandages we go through in a day. I pray we get more soon...
Bastards got me in the shoulder... I've still the strength to stand on a battlefield, but I'm no good to anyone like this...
You learn to live off the land when you're in the Resistance. You'd be surprised what herbs people carelessly trample underfoot.
This is the Barber. You'll find countless injured fighters here either undergoing treatment or awaiting it. Tread softly should you go inside.
There is much to be learned from the magitek weapons left by the Garleans along Baelsar's Wall. If all goes as planned, we will soon turn their own technology against them.

I'd be careful out there if I were you. <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(71),3))>A <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> your size─the beasts out there would swallow you whole. And you wouldn't be the first, either.<Else/>There are beasts out there big enough to swallow a man whole. Well, a man my size, at least.</If>
It's been far too long since the four great nations of Eorzea fought together under a single banner. Soon the Garleans will learn the folly of encroaching on our lands.
It's been no easy task distributing provisions with so many soldiers. I shudder to think what would happen should our supply lines be cut off. There's barely enough to go around as it is.
I've been so anxious to do battle with the Garleans, I sometimes find myself tightly gripping the hilt of my blade without realizing it. Perhaps that is to blame for the blisters on my hand.
We recently seized a suit of magitek armor from Baelsar's Wall. Until we've completed its examination, civilians are not permitted inside─not even adventurers.
It will not be easy, but we must do all we can to reverse the damage done to the land here.
It's actually quite nice having this post to myself. A great view, and no one to spoil it.
This was simply called Velodyna bridge before the Garleans arrived. They saw fit to transform it into a base for their supply trains.
column23: What's more, atop this tower they could survey the area for malms around. Their ambition knows no bounds, nor does their villainy.

column22: The presence of imperials forced us to abandon much of our hunting grounds. With our resources diminished as they are, relations with the Ananta have proven invaluable to our survival.
Though it fills my heart with pride to know that my daughter is fighting for this noble cause, a part of me wants nothing more for her to come home.
column23: That said, I know better than to try and stop her. So I wait and I hope and I pray...

column22: The three of us have hunted together for as long as I can remember. When tracking our prey, it's as if we're of one mind.
The Garleans aren't the only thing we have to watch out for, you know. Why, some flyin' abomination could swoop down and snatch you up just like that.
These two will make fine hunters someday. But first, they'll need to improve their marksmanship.
The Lady of Blisss embodies freedom─that which the imperials would take from usss. As her children, there is but one path: to fight, and to fight, and to fight.
We make great effortsss to preserve not only our own beauty, but that of our home. That is why we asssk those who visit Vira Nilya take care not to make a messs.
It ssstill amazes me how you striders maintain your posssture atop those stumps you call legsss.
I've been told there are fanaticsss among your kind who covet our ssskin. Is that true? I underssstand they may envy our beauty, but that is sssimply revolting.

<If(PlayerParameter(4))>Is it not inconvenient to require a male to reproduce? What exactly do they... On sssecond thought, perhapsss I shouldn't ask.<Else/>The females of your kind require a male to reproduce, correct? How exactly do you... On sssecond thought, perhapsss I shouldn't ask.</If>
Our leader Sarisha has ever been one to sssee the good in others. Even now she sssends envoys to the Qalyana in the hopes of underssstanding their people.
I'll never underssstand why your kind needs fire to work metal when any number of magicksss can do so just as easily, if not more so.
<pant> There're beasties about what burrow underground an' lie in wait for prey. <pant> Gotta keep nimble, like, so as to not get caught by one. <grunt>
Hatred leads to war, war incites revenge, and revenge breeds hatred. It is a vicious cycle I pray we someday break. But it is hard in the face of the ruin brought upon us by the Garleans.
The Qalyana are sssuch cowards. Our sisters continue to be ssslain and yet they refuse to draw their bladesss. The world crumblesss around them, and all they care for is their gemcraft.
Every time I close my eyes, I see their faces. Their wild eyes, their hungry smiles...
When the quarry stopped providin' for us we decided to build our homes in it instead. I've seen a crack or two appear in my walls lately, but I'd still put money on this house outliving me!
When my sister first went to work at Byron's Bread I had hoped she might be able to share some of their harvest with me. Alas, it does not seem like they produce much in the first place.
All of my friends left the village quite some time ago. I would be lying if I said I hadn't considered joining them, but had I gone as well, there would be hardly any young people remaining.
As I'm too weak to do any hard labor, Raganfrid tasked me with managing village affairs. It's not the most enjoyable work, but then there's little enjoyable about Ala Gannha in the first place.
This here's the leftovers. Dust and gravel and the like. Us too, you might say. We've shaped the Peaks, and they've shaped us in turn.
My brother over there is on the lookout for nasty people. Not really sure what he plans to do if one does happen to appear.
We still receive orders for stone now and then. Though they're so few in number I can more than handle them all myself.

Cooking up a tasty stew to fuel our friend quarrying over there. I'd help him by taking up a pickaxe myself, but we'd end up with more stone than we could ever sell. There just isn't that much demand for it nowadays.
There's no poetry in this work. No fulfillment of a job well done. You do it cause you've got no choice, and that's that.
Oh, my poor back. I spend every waking hour working these rocky fields and for what? One of the most pathetic harvests I have ever seen.
There must be some use I can find for this pile of hay...
I do hope you haven't come looking to buy crops. 'Fraid we've nothing to sell at the moment.
Now that those damned imperial dogs are gone, we can get to rebuildin' and make Ala Ghiri a <Emphasis>real</Emphasis> tradin' center like it used to be.

I'll admit I did less than honorable things to make my fair share of profits when the Garleans were here. I'm a merchant, after all. That said, I plan to use my savings to get this place on its feet again. Just a matter of how...
If you ever need a drink, stop by my pub any time you like for one on the house. Any friend of the Resistance is a friend of mine.

At last, Ala Ghiri is free to become the trading center of Gyr Abania once more. And more trade means more profits! All of those deliveries for the Resistance without compensation are finally paying off.
Sorry, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>, but you'll have to move along. I'm meetin' someone regardin' a rather urgent matter, and they should be here any moment.
That crystal up there's a beauty, isn't it? Only thing that could improve the view is a nice, cold bottle of arak.
If there's something you need, I'd suggest speaking with officer Brazen Brook. Things tend to go much more smoothly when he's involved.

The people of Ala Ghiri will be safe so long as our men keep in line, but for the moment we're still only a pack of faceless soldiers to them. If we don't do all we can to make things better here, we're no better than the Garlean bastards who were here before us.
No need to be concerned of enemy movement to the north. If anything moves even an ilm out there, we'll see it.
Times are changing, and with change comes opportunity for business. It's only a matter of finding that special something to catch the customer's eye.
Have you seen any trees in need of attention? Sagging boughs? Rotting roots?
Anything you need? Give me a hand with my stock, and I'll see about lowering my prices.
Ah! Oh gods, please don't do that. I thought the Empire's soldiers had come for me...

I'm afraid we've nothin' to offer you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. Barely anythin' grows here, and most of our able-bodied men and women either fled or were conscripted. I reckon this place only has a few years left...
Raubahn was the one what led the armies to free Ala Mhigo? My, he's grown to be quite the soldier, hasn't he?
Ma said all the Garlean people ran away. Pa will be so happy when he comes home. He's been gone an awfully long time, though. I hope he's okay...
These crates are─or rather, were─filled with food. I thought it'd last longer, but it looks like we're nearly out. I pray we have enough to buy more.
Hm? Weren't you going to do something about the shellbacks?
Well then. I can only assume your affairs in Yanxia were not as pressing as I thought.
column23: Or were you worried about us? Don't be. We've had some skirmishes with the imperials since Isari, but we've managed to hold our own. This state of affairs cannot be sustained indefinitely, of course...so I would ask that you hurry.

column22: The Confederacy is of a thousand nations and of none. I, for example, was born in a fishing village, whereas this one hails from the plains of Yanxia. His stories never cease to entertain!
This sekibune may be past her prime, but that gives her all the more character, I say! A pity she so rarely sees combat.
column23: Alas, none can deny that a flotilla of smaller ships is more effective in most cases. Easier to trap a larger vessel and less danger to us all should they be armed.

column22: Never underestimate the importance of guard duty, I say. If one truly values his freedom, he must be ever ready to defend it.
If you refuse to pay the Ruby Tithe, we will strip you of everything you have─including the very clothes on your back! Gahaha!
Aye, I'm a pirate and aye, I'm a cook. And a good one at that! I know the best seasoning for any dish: plenty of drink to wash it down!
By the look of it, our new recruits have, once again, charged into a head-to-head battle with some deadly sea beasts. Those fools never learn, do they?
Ahhh, is there aught in this world finer than strong spirits and tobacco? I think not... <hic> Hm? What is it? A game of chance? Another time, perhaps... <hic>
This is a much safer place for lookouts to be stationed than the Coral Banquet. That is why most new recruits start here.
If you set your net according to the position of the moon and rhythm of the tide, it won't take long for it to become full. Most days I can catch enough food to feed our entire crew.
We help clean ships and fix nets. When Mister Tsukikage deems our work done, then we go off to play!
The past holds no power over us. What you are is what you do now and ever after. Such is the way of the Confederacy.

As you can imagine, many of the men and women here have rather murky pasts. While what they have done in their former lives is of no concern to us, any who break Confederate law will have to answer to me.
It is not uncommon for us to find ourselves under attack. That is why we have heightened the security in this area and carefully monitor all activity in the waters surrounding our island.
Turn around and go back whence you came. This is a restricted area.
I suppose I could try dragging this stone along the ground if no one comes to help me...
I've not even done much today and I'm already knackered. Some days this village just saps the life out of me.
Ah, the old joints aren't what they used to be. I can hardly believe I used to go up and down these slopes with ponzes of stone in hand.
We're all equal in the eyes of M'rahz Nunh. His fair-mindedness is part of what makes him so well loved among our people.

That settlement down there in the distance is the Qalyana tribe of the Ananta. For one reason or another they've chosen to keep out of the fighting. Even when their fellow Ananta from the other tribes come under attack they do nothing. Strange, isn't it?
The fires of war spread across Gyr Abania, and soon we ourselves may be forced to enter the fray.
column23: Should it come to pass, then it will fall to me to guide my people through the flames, for I have the rare and unfortunate honor to serve not only as nunh, but as leader of my people.

column22: Aye, this one can't fail! I can feel my purse growing heavier already...
There are broken warmachina all over the place if you know where to look. Someone should probably salvage them...
Leave me be. I just need a moment or two, then I'll get back to work...

Even a woman in my profession has standards, you know. The imperials were nothing but brutes and pigs. You, and the good men and women of the Resistance, on the other hand, are more than welcome to partake of my services.

You'll find there are quite a number of taverns and inns here in Ala Ghiri. After all, this was originally a trading hub. The Garleans saw little need for trade, however, and used our village only for drink and debauchery. Good riddance, I say.
I'm glad to be rid o' those godsdamned imperials. Maybe now we can finally get back to tradin' like the good ol' days.

This beauty of a bird has been leading our caravans, transporting all manner of provisions for the soldiers here in Ala Ghiri. Now that we've arrived, she'll have plenty of rest and all the gysahl greens she can eat.

I'm thankful for all the Resistance has done, but I still worry for the future. We've lost so many over the years, and if the Garleans should ever return... No, I don't think it's time to celebrate just yet.
It's not easy keeping watch out here with only Guntmar to keep me company. But if we don't do it, I'm afraid no one else will.
I just finished slaughtering these two lambs for their wool and meat. Their bleating yet fills my ears. Unlike we Dotharl, they shall never be reborn.
Look at them. So full of vigor. Few things bring me more pleasure than seeing my sheep happy.
You wish to train with us? It will not be easy. We live to do battle.
I must get home quickly and feed my little brother and sister. But not quite yet. I must hand out just a few missives more.
Absolutely beautiful. Would you not agree?
It is not easy living in these caves. When the fire fades, you cannot even make out your own hands in the darkness.
column23: However, this is the life our tribe deserves. We must never be tempted by greed again.

column22: I'll have you know that in all of Yuzuka Manor, none is more knowledgeable about the value of things than I. Nobody, no one. If you wish to gauge the worth of something, you need only come and show it to me. Yes, yes.
I'd only ever heard tell of Ala Mhigo in the reports─it is a far grander city than I expected.
I have traveled here from distant Coerthas to support the efforts of the Alliance. Pray call upon me should you have need of a chirurgeon's skills.
They say merchant caravans once used this juncture as a waypoint before setting off from Ala Mhigo to other lands. I hope to see it returned to such a use one day...
My poor chocobos are exhausted. I should organize the wagon while they rest...
To see Ala Mhigo right in front of us like this... Aye, it makes the pulse quicken!

It was an honor to meet you, <Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>!
Don't you worry, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>! We'll make sure the supplies are in order!
Have you familiarized yourself with the lay of the land, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>? There are a number of structures and formations we need to see secured...
This place is a bit too dusty for my taste. I find myself missing the forest...
The smell of saltwater in the air here reminds me of home. I find it quite comforting.
Ssso, thisss is Ala Mhigo. These ssstrider cities are all edges and corners─they lack elegance.

I say, weren't you one of the ones who was with my grandson Wiscar? I knew I recognized you. My heartfelt thanks, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>, for liberating our homeland. I didn't think the day would come, leastwise not within my lifetime.
