column23: To be sure, there's still much and more work to do before Ala Mhigo can know her former glory, but together we'll rebuild her, one block at a time. Young ones like you and Wiscar have already put in the hardest yalms; it's time for this old fossil to put in some of his own!

column22: Livin's hard enough as it is...
I do wonder just what will become of us. We have been under imperial rule for over two decades. What are we supposed to do now?
There is still much work to be done, but I'm prepared to do whatever it takes to get Ala Mhigo back on its feet.
Go and bother someone else.
I know what you're thinking: a defenseless Garlean rat, just my luck! But please, resist the urge to cut me open and trample my entrails! I did not choose to enlist!
column23: I too want nothing more than to flee from here, but I cannot find my way out─it's like a blasted maze!

column22: You seem a decent sort, and I would love nothing more than to tell you about a number of profitable ventures...but I'm not at liberty to do so without the express permission of Geimlona in Idyllshire.
At Aunt Rowena's behest, I've brought the House of Splendors to Rhalgr's Reach. We hope to rely on your continued support!
My apologies, but I can only accept scrips from individuals who stand in good stead with the House.
If you have scrips you wish to spend, I would be happy to assist you.
Forgive me, but we are not allowed to do business with just anyone. You must be known to the House first.
Ah, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>, always a pleasure. Please feel free to browse our selection of tools and gear.
As much as I would like to assist you, I'm permitted to do business only with referred individuals.
If you have scrips with you, I'd be glad to take them off your hands in exchange for an item of your choice.
Sorry, love, but I can only assist them as the House knows.
If ye got scrips, I got all sorts o' fine wares ye can exchange 'em fer.
I offer wares in exchange for scrips, but my services are available only to those whom the House knows and trust.

Good <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morrow</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If> to you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. If you are in possession of any scrips, I can offer you myriad useful wares in exchange for them.
Nice to see you again, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! No problems to report here.
...You are certain that you are dry? Flesh and clothing both? Go and stand by a cookfire outside if any water remains.
You are returned from Bardam's Mettle...but alone? What of Hien and the others?
Brilliant. I'd been itching to play for a while now.
Sorry, I can't play right now. I need to see which one of these two is going to win.
Ah, that was quite enjoyable. It'd been a while since anyone here was brave enough to challenge me to a match. Better luck next time.
Even the best of champions lose sometimes. Let us play again in the near future. I expect you to give me a chance to reclaim my honor.
Ha ha! I have not enjoyed myself that much in a good while. I hope we have a chance to play again someday.
Triple...Triad? Oh yes, I remember now! A sailor once insisted that I accept some of the cards as a gift. I would be glad to play a match with you, but please do not expect much skill on my part.
My apologies, but I cannot play games while there are customers to be served.
Oh, I won? Well, that was rather enjoyable for a game I barely understand. We decided that the loser was to order a glass of junmaishu, did we not?
I am not sure why I lost, but it does not make losing any less frustrating. Gather your cards, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, and we shall play another round!
A draw? Hm, I would prefer to play until the victor is clear. Another match!
Triple...<hic>...Triad, you say? Bahahaha! Very well! <hic> I have had enough to drink to indulge your request. Break out your cards and prepare to lose, my friend!
Ah, I would love nothing more than to join you for a round of cards, but now is not a good time. I must keep my eyes and ears peeled─there are traitors among us.
Don't worry. Few can best me at this game. You are always welcome to challenge me again─if you dare, that is! Bahahaha!
...You won? B-But how!? I never lose! Take your cards back out. We are playing another round.
A draw? You got lucky this time, friend. You, however, won't be so fortunate this next round.
Ah, I was hoping someone might come along and challenge me to a game! Well, what are you waiting for? Pull out your cards and let us begin!
Thank you for asking, but I am afraid I do not have the time for games right now. I would, however, be more than happy to play a round with you after I finish polishing this shell.
Haha! Victory is mine! No doubt it is the kami's way of thanking me for all my hard work!
I...lost? Kami, forgive me! I should never have dozed off while polishing our guardian spirit's shell! I promise it shan't ever happen again!
A draw? <sigh> It seems the kami favor neither one of us this day.
These cards can be used to play a game? I traded a barrel of fish for them in Namai! Yes, yes, I was told they were very precious, very rare.
My apologies, but I must tend to the flowers.
Victory is mine, yes, yes? And to think, I almost threw my cards away! I licked them, I did, and they did not taste as good as they looked...
You are as skillful in play as you are in battle! It must be dull to excel in everything, to always be showered in praise...
Difficult, difficult, this game is very difficult. But I am enjoying the learning of it, nonetheless! Let us play again, yes, yes?
I was in Reunion earlier and one of the merchants there gave me a rather interesting card. I would quite like to try it out. Could I interest you in a match?
I am sorry to turn you down, but the gods have given me other duties to attend to. Let us play again another time!
I am victorious! Just according the elder gods' plan.
I lost? Did the elder gods not send me to Reunion so I would be victorious? Perhaps they only wanted for me to enjoy a match with you. Yes, that must be it.
A draw! Quite a match indeed. Let us play again sometime.
You wish to challenge <Emphasis>me</Emphasis>─the undisputed champion of our tribe─to a game of Triple Triad? You are a daring <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If>.
Forgive me, but I must tend to the sheep. Come back later and maybe we can play a round then.
Haha! Now do you see why I am the undisputed champion of the Oronir!?
You only won because I...I was distracted! Come, let us do it again!
It seems we have tied. Come challenge me again sometime that we might declare a true winner.
A match of Triple Triad? That is a fine idea. I only began playing a short while ago, but that will not hold me back.
I cannot play at this moment. Return later.
Let this be a lesson to you. Experience means naught if you lack the desire to win.
The taste of defeat is new to me. I will ensure this does not happen again.
You have taught me much. Next time I shall use this knowledge against you.
You wish to challenge me? ...To a game of cards? ...Right now? Well, I suppose it would not hurt to forget our troubles for a time.
It has been some time since last I played, but it seems I remember the strategies. I thank you for the pleasant distraction.
Strange. Though I lost the match, I still feel oddly satisfied.
I did not claim victory, but it was a good match, nonetheless. I'd almost forgotten how it felt to enjoy myself. Mayhap I should challenge some of the others to a game...
Ah yesss, Triple Triad. My sssisters fighting with the Resistance taught me this game. If you wish to challenge me, then let usss begin.
Sorry, but I have no time for games. I must be ready should my sssisters need me.
Hah! Are you sssurprised? You may see this as jussst a game, but we Ananta take all battlesss very seriously. Even Triple Triad.
How disssgraceful. What will the others think if they find out about this?
Hmmm. Perhapsss I've underestimated you. Care to play again? I won't hold back thisss time.
Please, before you kill me, let me play a game of Triple Triad!
column23: You have a deck, do you not? Please, I beg you.

column22: I cannot play at the moment. I am far too busy trying to keep my head attached to my body!
Feel it! Feel Garlemald's might! How foolish you were to think your rebellion could ever succeed.
column23: Oh no. I-I didn't mean it, I swear! Please, spare me my life!
column24: My darling chocobo awaits me back home. Do not make an orphan of her!

column22: How dare you raise your hand against your imperial master? You are nothing more than rebel scum!
column23: Ah, that is to say I am incredibly sorry! Do not butcher me! I still have so much to live for.

column22: A draw? You have quite the nerve standing up to me. You do understand what this armor signifies, don't you?
column23: But of course you do! I was an absolute fool to think otherwise. Please, do not skewer me before tearing me limb from limb! I am so very sorry!

column22: I am sorry, but I have nothing to offer you. Come back again some other time.
column23: You must meet the following conditions to undertake the Kugane sidequest “One-star Veteran Clan Hunt.”
column24:
1. Complete the sidequest “Elite and Dangerous.”
2. Complete the main scenario (Stormblood) quest “By the Grace of Lord Lolorito.”

column22: If you wish to trade in Centurio Seals, then you'll first need Estrild's approval. A tall order, indeed, but surely not insurmountable for one who has stared death in the face once or thrice...
column23: ※ In order to be eligible for the quest “One-star Veteran Clan Hunt,” you must have met the following requirements:
column24:
※ You must have completed the sidequest “Elite and Dangerous.”
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “By the Grace of Lord Lolorito.”

column22: The Hounds'll show the rest of Ishgard that we lowborn can make a difference. I promise we'll devour every scrap of trainin' you care to throw our way!
How about that, eh? Our first big mission, and we recovered a sacred bloody sword. I'm still a bit curious about that firearm, but I'll let Rostnsthal deal with it for the now.
If there's aught wrong with that sword, Lord Stephanivien'll soon find it. And we'll be ready and waitin' to act when he does.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! The Hounds are trottin' along just fine thanks to you an' that ol' pirate.
column23: I've even been workin' with Muscadain to coordinate our efforts with the Temple Knights. Afore long, it'll be as if the watch was always a part of the city─like we was one of them stones in the wall.

column22: The Hounds of Ishgard, eh? Aye, I like the bloody sound of that! Let's get on with this training already!

What do you think of that, then, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Not bad for a motley lot of lowborn, I reckon! After a mission like that, we should have no trouble keeping the peace at the ceremony.

Now, I know I'm not the sharpest fork in the drawer, but after this odd business with the sword, I'm starting to think that maybe I need to change that. Our job's more'n just scrapping with thieves─sometimes we need to use our heads.
I've been spending my spare time learning how to tinker with this and that over at the manufactory. Should come in handy seeing how we handle firearms in the Hounds.
For years we've been spittin' curses at the bluebloods from the shadows of the Brume, but at long last we've found ourselves a place in the sun. I'm glad I chose to throw my lot in with the Mongrel.
Bah, I can't believe we let that bastard get away. Feels like the mission ain't truly over till we catch him, but maybe that's just me.
If Rostnsthal hadn't pointed it out, I never even would've guessed there was someone else pullin' the strings. I s'pose we're still new to this investigatin' business, eh?
Hilda says the Hounds'll be doin' some trainin' alongside the Temple Knights. Probably best that we know how the other does things so's we don't end up steppin' on each other's toes.
The watch has its detractors, but it has its supporters as well. House Dzemael has become one of our staunchest allies, and Lord Tedalgrinche himself has been championing our cause.
column23: Ishgard is changing for the better, my friend, and Hilda rides the crest of that wave. I pray you see to it that she and her colleagues are not pulled under or swept away.

column22: I remember well the day I met young Hilda. I shan't dwell on the details, but the first words she had for me were...bracing, to say the least. And yet, my prospectometer chirped in her presence, even as it did in yours.
column23: 'Tis with a deep well of emotion that I see her now at the forefront of Ishgard's social revolution. Glad I am that my gift to her put a sliver of doubt into her previously unshakable prejudices.

column22: Ah, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>. You honor us with your presence. Are you enjoying the sights in Kugane?
column23: I have been giving considerable thought as to how best go about introducing Eorzean fashion to my homeland. I expect to be enlisting your services sooner rather than later.

column22: <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>. Ever since Kotocho took the stage wearing your marvelous creation, orders for Eorzean fashions have been trickling in slowly but surely.
column23: Needless to say, it will take time until Western aesthetics find wide acceptance, but in the meantime, it is heartening to know our efforts have not gone for naught.

column22: <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>, thank you for coming. Both Kotocho and I truly appreciate your concern.
column23: It is a hard time for her, but do not worry. She is a strong girl, and she will emerge from this hardship all the stronger─I am sure of it.

column22: <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>! I am pleased to say that after Kotocho and Kototsuru's legendary performance, orders have been pouring in night and day! It is all Yagiri and I can do to keep up─not that I am complaining, of course.
column23: Meanwhile, Kotocho has firmly staked her claim as Kototsuru's successor atop the Hanamachi. Everyone who is anyone in Kugane names her their favorite.
column24: And yet, whenever I go to meet her, she is still the same, sweet, humble girl I have ever known her to be. I do not deserve one as beautiful as her in my life, yet I cherish her all the same.

column22: Welcome to Daitenya, purveyor of the finest silks and garments in Kugane. Our name is taken from Daitenzan, the mightiest peak in Hingashi, and symbolizes our unwavering resolve to achieve the absolute height of elegance and fashion.
column23: Master Keimei recently took over the business from his dear father, and has made it his personal mission to uphold the proud tradition of the Daitenya name, while also introducing worldly fashions befitting our modern age.

column22: <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>. I am pleased to report that Eorzean fashions are beginning to find a receptive audience among the Kugane elite.
column23: At first, I too was skeptical, but there is something about your work─a universal quality that touches one's very soul. I cannot thank you enough for all you have done on our behalf.

column22: Welcome back to Daitenya, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>! Thanks to you, business is better than ever. These days, Daitenya rises high above all our competitors─just as the great peak from which we take our name.
column23: Speaking personally, I have been pleased to observe that it is not merely the wealthy, but the commonfolk as well have turned an eye to Eorzean fashions.
column24: Still, it would seem the young master has bigger dreams still. I suspect he will be calling on your services again soon.

column22: <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>! I cannot thank you enough for all you have done. Thanks to you, my career as a geiko has been a success beyond my wildest dreams!
column23: Just between the two of us, there are times when I wonder if I truly deserve this success, and I lose heart.
column24: But when I do, I look at this dress. I think of all the sacrifices that you and Master Keimei made for me─and I vow to myself that I will make you proud.

column22: Live, love, and craft to fulfill the needs of others─that is the way of the carpenter. From this day forward, that is exactly what I shall be doing!
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, you and Timbermaster Beatin have helped me come to an important understanding of what it means to be a carpenter.
column23: I shall continue to practice, practice, and practice some more that I might one day become as good as the two of you!

column22: Hey, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Have you seen our mount? Hearer Marmaduke said we can keep it here for everyone to see. A shame Miss Atelloune isn't here to speak with all the people who stop by.
column23: I'll have so much to tell her when she gets back, and show her as well. Thanks to all of Guildmaster Geva's teachings, I bet I'll even be able to make an animal mount all by myself by the time she returns.

column22: Between you and me... I've never been that skilled at astrology. Two winters here and I still haven't opened a single heaven. I can't even <Emphasis>spell</Emphasis> half of the ridiculous terms we're supposed to memorize!
column23: But since the arrival of that mysterious Easterner, I seem to have found a renewed interest in his body─I mean, my studies!

column22: Now that Kyokuho is gone, it is back to assisting the Lady Leveva with her preparations for the symposium. At least the work keeps my mind off his arse─I mean, my mind on the stars!

The symposium was a success, and now there is news that Kyokuho may soon return to the Athenaeum to resume his studies! Perhaps Lady Leveva will put us in the same kisses─I mean, classes! In the same classes.
While I am happy for Lady Leveva, the Vault's newfound interest in Sharlayan astrology has increased our workload here tenfold.
column23: Alright, that may be an exaggeration. Sevenfold, then! And not a fold less!

column22: When Chief Astrologian Forlemort assigned me here for “further training” I knew my accidental killing of his cat in that experiment with the Earthly Star was not to be forgiven.
column23: But now that Lady Leveva's teachings have garnered the attention of the Vault, it appears our stars have finally risen. The arrival of the brilliant and talented and handsome and talented Kyokuho is just further proof of this!

column22: He's gone...and he didn't even say good-bye.
column23: Now, I look up into the heavens and all I see is the black of the void. Even the stars refuse to smile anymore...

column22: Have you heard the news? Of course you have! But I'll tell you anyway!
column23: They have made me an assistant professor at the Scholasticate! I will be teaching Lady Leveva's courses to all the young, handsome students... Oh, and the old, ugly ones as well. Of course. Why wouldn't I?

column22: Why hello, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! If you haven't noticed, the Athenaeum is practically abuzz with talk of wind, water, and the optimal position of your bed pillows if you wish to avoid ill fortune in commerce. In other words, it hasn't changed since Kyokuho arrived...

To keep her mind off Kyokuho's sudden return to his homeland, Lady Leveva has buried herself in the preparations for her symposium, locking herself in her alcove for days on end. Free from her usual nagging, I've found myself with a considerable amount of time on my hands...and decided to take up fortune-telling! Allow me to read your future.
column23: Ahem... The Bole...then the Spire...then over here goes the inverted Arrow...then down here another Arrow... Wait! Another Arrow? Who put two arrows in my deck!? If I find out who did this─!

column22: We have seen quite a change in Lady Leveva since her little sojourn in the Far East.
column23: Where once one could rarely find her in her study for the wanderlust which kept her ever abroad, she now has taken to remaining within the city's walls, content on guiding budding young minds to bloom.

column22: Ahhh, Shirogane... One day─<Emphasis>one day</Emphasis> I'll wake up to your pristine white sands...
We won, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. We...we won...
I gave you leave to come and go as you like. So go.
You are returned. For what purpose? To wait until the Naadam as part of a stratagem? Hah! Do as you will...but know I will come for you first.
Best of luck to you in all your revolutionary endeavors. After all, the Empire takes a dim view of free trade, whereas the company is of, how shall I put this...rather the opposite opinion.
You needn't worry about the other units. I am well aware of their disposition and will see that each receives the necessary support.
'Twas heartbreaking to watch the keep collapse...but I know it had to be done. We can and will rebuild, for we are free, my friend. We are free!
Today is the day for which we have trained body and mind with passion and vigor! We will not fail─Doma will be free!
They will use everything at their disposal to defend against our assault. All their men and all their magitek...and mayhap the twisted hybrids spoken of only in hushed whispers...
We have begun studying the magitek used in the defense of Doma Castle. There may be a way to repurpose it for the reconstruction efforts...
The memory of our defeat a year ago still burns within me. Yotsuyu and her imperial dogs will pay for their crimes!
Doma belongs to her people once more! We could not have achieved this great victory without the help of so many. You and yours will not be forgotten!
As I am not skilled enough to stand on the front lines with the others, I will remain here in reserve. But have no doubt that I can and will fight...
I need an adventurer with crafting experience. If you've a steady hand and a keen eye, I might have some work for you.
How am I supposed to concentrate on my duties with the sea taunting me like this? My hand itches for a fishing rod, it does...
Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Work on the Gobroller is proceeding as planned for the moment. I shall be in touch again when we need you to mine something for us.
It is time for one last push! There may have been a few problems along the way, but now everything is in place for us to succeed.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, how nice of you to stop by! We are still in the midst of testing the Gobroller prototype.
column23: The more tests we run, the more issues we find. At times it all feels a bit overwhelming, but I know we can overcome whatever issues the project throws our way. The previous performance test is proof of that!

column22: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Splendid to have a miner of your caliber on board! I can fully concentrate on my own work knowing that we shall not want for the minerals we require.
Pshhh... Shkohhh... Founding this manufactory was far from easy. Working with Rowena in particular was a challenge the likes of which I had never encountered before.
column23: However, seeing how far the team has come makes me certain that my struggles were all worthwhile.

column22: It's hotter than Ifrit's arse after a peck of dragon peppers.

Now that I think of it, I'm certain I've heard your name somewhere before. Yes, a legendary miner that just so happens to be an equally legendary adventurer. If you're even half as good as the stories, I'm sure we'll have no cause to regret hiring you.

Fohcwyda has quite the mind! She thought to carve glyphs into each type of sheet metal to help with combining them. Such an idea would never have come to me; her help is going to make all the difference!

I was not aware of it until now, but I had never stopped to truly consider what it meant to work at the Bangpots. I must thank you and Nonowato for opening my eyes. I am ready to see this project through to the end.

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Word of your recent adventures has reached us even here in Idyllshire. You may no longer be mining for us, but you continue to be a great source of inspiration.
I cannot see worth a damn in this wretched thing!

Thrilled to pieces to have you here, friend! You may find us to be a somewhat eccentric bunch, but I am sure you will come to enjoy our company in due course. My advice: enjoy the journey─we are on the verge of <Emphasis>greatness</Emphasis>!

I have been researching the anatomy of other races and it has proved to be quite an enlightening experience. Did you know an average Roegadyn female's foot is approximately three times as long as a Lalafell's knee is wide?

Sorry for how long it has taken to sort ourselves out, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. But do not worry, it will all have been worth it when you are able to feast your eyes on our glorious Gobroller! Please continue to lend us your pickaxe until that time comes.

When I was working on the Gobroller's controls with Stackblox, I developed quite an interest in the anatomy of various races. I have challenged myself to create a single set of controls that is equally convenient for the biggest of Roegadyn and the tiniest of Lalafells.
It might help if I had some ink to go with this quill.
It is truly quite amusing. Just as I had been wishing we had someone else to help realize our vision, you appeared! Just to check, you <Emphasis>are</Emphasis> positive you cannot read minds, yes?
Krystrymm is considering boosting the armor's defenses by inserting elementally charged jewels directly into the sheet metal. Who knew he had such a magnificent brain beneath that thick skull?

It is all well and good just throwing yourself head first into your work, but we really could have done with being a bit more flexible. I should have listened to my own words when I complained about Krystrymm refusing to adapt to a different way of thinking. My apologies for involving you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.

Hello again, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! We have heard much of your latest adventures─it sounds like you are having quite the journey. Do not hesitate to ask for our succor should you require it.
Pshhh... Shkohhh... Gobbies and uplanders sweatworking together to make new technology!
Pshhh... Shkohhh... Plenty of rocks in Stickqix's Bangpots, but Stackblox needs uplander to mine more!
Pshhh... Shkohhh... Uplanders and gobbies are not so different. Stackblox and Zansei will fancycraft whirlycog insides that suit all races!
Pshhh... Shkohhh... Stackblox should have done more hand-lending for the others. Stackblox won't make the same mistake twice!
Pshhh... Shkohhh... There is nothing uplanders and gobbies can't achieve together. The future is bright!
May the gods spare me further bloodshed and let me live out my days in peace, as a humble trader. I have no talent for war...
From traveler to warrior, and now to khagan. What will you become next, I wonder?
Khagan, know you will always be of the Mol, wheresoever you go. Ours is the soil.
So it is true... A falling star bears down upon us from the heavens.
column23: As always, I stand with you. If there is aught Kazagg Chah can do to aid, you need but say the word.

column22: My friend. In all my years, I have seen no mage attain the heights of power you now possess. I stand in awe and amazement.
column23: But pray forgive me my empty words. After all, your mastery of our art has been recognized by none other than Lady Shatotto herself.
column24: I will say only this─I am honored to know you and call you friend.

column22: All heals with time, and I am no exception. If I am needed for the next Naadam, I will be ready.

The other day, I stumbled into a body between here and the Sepulchre. Done in by the Corpses, most like. Don't know who the poor sod was, but he was Ala Mhigan, far as I could tell. Couldn't well just leave him there, so I took the liberty of burying him.
Father has dreamed of this day for nearly half his life. Just one more step.
I've trained with countless weapons, but none compare to Tizona. That Father saw fit to honor me in this way still fills my heart with pride...
You are a wise <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If>, Commander. The duty of the strong is, and always will be, to protect the weak.

I cannot believe I will have the chance to work with Fufucha and you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I will do my best not to disappoint, although I can't promise anything...
I promise I will prove myself worthy of the title of first botanist of Idyllshire. It's the least I can do to repay Fufucha's faith.
I've thought about the path, and whether I want to walk it myself someday. But after everything that happened with Myste, I think I might want to pursue conjury instead.
column23: Sometimes we have to do bad things for good reasons. I know that, I do...but I'd still rather try to avoid it if I can. If I was a better healer, then maybe I'd have more options...or something.
column24: That Padjal, E–Sumi–Yan. I could write him a letter...

column22: Is it true that you have come from the far side of the world solely to aid us in our fight? If so, then you have my utmost gratitude.
How bold of you and Lady Yugiri to face Zenos by yourselves! But reckless too, I must say. Had either of you perished in the attempt, it would have been a terrible blow to our cause.
Eleven...<huff>...twelve... <puff> If I am to help free Doma from the yoke of imperial oppression, I must train my body to its physical peak! A daily regimen of vigorous exercise is essential!
One hundred and eleven...<huff>...one hundred and twelve... <puff> Pain is but weakness leaving the body! Pain is but weakness leaving the body!
More allies to aid the Doman Liberation Front? We should be glad to receive you!
That you and Lady Yugiri and all of the villagers returned alive is nothing short of a miracle...
If the tales are to be believed, you are a warrior of peerless skill. I pray they are no exaggeration.
Failure or not, that you held your own against Zenos in a duel for even a moment is a testament to your strength!
As you have seen, we are few in number and our resources are limited. Our every action must be planned with care, for we can ill afford to suffer losses.
...Any mission from which one returns alive is, in my opinion, not a failure.
Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, welcome back. You are looking well. Tell me, how is that lecherous forgemaster of yours doing?
To scour the sweeping seas for a single species of fish, root out the reason for its rapid disappearance, and save it from certain extinction...
column23: A tall task, this is true, but one worthy of Wawalago and his wealth of wits and wisdom!

column22: Sisipu's still steaming about my surreptitious little sojourn in Isari. Why can't the girl just forgive and forget, I say?
column23: She's watching me with as wary an eye as ever. Hah, but worry not─that hasn't stopped me from sneaking out to my favorite fishing holes!

column22: I have heard all about your most recent adventures from Reyna and Master Wawalago. Oh, if only I could join you on your search for these shooting stars─what I would not give to see them with my own two eyes!
I daresay that taking part in the Wadatsumi festival was the most fun I've had as a fisherman in─well, as long as I can remember. You have my gratitude for letting me join you.
The rebuilding of our homeland will be no less demanding than our efforts to reclaim it. We will need to train our bodies to their physical peaks! Daily and no less rigorously than before!
To my relief, there was no need for me to take the field. Now I am free to lay down my blade and devote my energies to the rebuilding of our nation!

For an age, I felt as if time had stopped for me. But now, for the first time since Nielle passed, I feel as though I can move forward. And so I will, but ever will I carry with me the memory of him and our time together.
When I first knew I'd lost my memories, I was confused. Frightened, even.
column23: But ever since I started training as a red mage, it's as if none of that matters anymore. Thanks to you and X'rhun, I have so much to look forward to! My life is my own.

column22: How Revenant's Toll has changed since last I was here! Naught makes a man feel his age as much as knowing how things were and seeing how things are!
One never knows when they might be attacked on the Steppe. Doubly true now that we have won the Tsagaan Sar.
Now the Tsagaan Sar has come to a close there will doubtless be plenty of merchants keen to resume trading. I will need to make sure I have an ample supply of wares to sell.
I wonder whose spirit will find its way into my child's body. I eagerly await the day when the khatun is at last able to gaze into my baby's eyes.
Do not disturb me. I must be ever vigilant. This does not change now that Tsagaan Sar is over.

"<If(PlayerParameter(4))>She<Else/>He</If> who fights with strength of stone unyielding, breathes deep of boundless sky and embraces serenity of rolling sea, against <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>him</If> none can stand.“
column23: ...I haven't the foggiest what in the hells it means, but you've got to admit that it sounds like something a clever man would say.

column22: Hello there, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I trust things are well with you. They couldn't be better with me and my little kitty. He is just the sweetest thing!
column23: ...Hm? H'mhasi who? I'm sure I've no idea who that worthless piece o' turd is.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, allow me to thank you again. I've always looked up to you, and it's nothing short of a dream come true to have your help.
Don't worry, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. No matter what, I've no intention of giving up. I've learned that much from you.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, great to see you. The café is doing well, I'm happy to say. Folk are coming from far and wide just for our Far Eastern dishes.
column23: Things are positively rosy with Anzu and her father, too. Life's good, all in all, and I've nothing to complain about.
column24: ...Well, to be completely honest, my fire for adventure has flared up again, and in my spare time I've been off collecting tomestones with the old crowd. Needless to say, not a word of this to anyone!

column22: Delta IV eliminated. No more Deltascape subjects remain. Initiating world shutdown.
We await good tidings from the Far East, my friend. In the meantime, the Alliance will continue to aid the Resistance and help it to rebuild.
Glad to have you with us again. Hmm...you seem stronger than I remember─hard though I find that to believe. One would almost think you'd spent the whole time fighting. Well done, by the way.
We bought this freedom with blood. That of our friends and our enemies. I'll be damned if we're going to give it up again.
...Be honest: is it unbecoming? I am told there are those whose heads are suited to the style, but never did I consider mine to be one.

Apropos of nothing, allow me to thank you for your deeds in service to the Holy See of Ishgard. I understand you were instrumental in bringing an end to the Dragonsong War, thereby saving countless lives from a fiery doom.
column23: I say this, of course, only as a man concerned for the welfare of his fellow man, as I have no vested interest in the affairs of the cold and dreary North.

column22: I daresay our voyage to the Far East was one of my most profitable yet. We had the good fortune to meet with many vessels on the way back, all of which were eager to trade─and with such generous terms, I might add.
The days ahead are dark indeed, and so we will aid you to the best of our ability. May you walk with the Warden ever at your side.
All is well, all is well. My daughter lives, and our homeland is free. Blessed are we to have come through the fires so unscathed...
Keep an eye on my daughter, would you? And yourself while you're at it.
I am glad to see the imperials driven from our lands, but more than that I am relieved that my daughter survived the campaign. Doubtless I have you to thank for that...
Now comes our part to think on the future. For the Ala Mhigan refugees in Ul'dah to decide whether or not they want to return and help rebuild...
Our bloody campaign is ended, and we may begin to return home. That said, our work is far from finished. We've yet countless wounded to tend to, not to mention prisoners of war...

Seven hells, is it true? Did you really best Zenos and that bastard primal─just you and seven stalwart adventurers whom you had the wisdom and foresight to recruit? No wonder they call you a bleedin' hero!
What can you do at a time like this other than curse the gods and your own powerlessness...
I should have been there with you to the end. If only I hadn't been so reckless...
I swear to the Twelve and all the kami in creation, if he says another word about politics and organizations, I'm going to scream.
Master Kemp seems quite shaken...
We'll find Krile and bring her home. After all, I need her to tell you to stay in bed.

What sort of nation is Ala Mhigo to become? That is the question on the lips of every man, woman, and child in Gyr Abania. Establishing an interim government after a twenty-year occupation is a massive undertaking, never mind running it.
column23: In these crucial first days the Scions must offer our full support, or else everything we fought to achieve could be lost.

column22: I should've died a thousand times over, but I'm still here, and I owe it all to the friends─nay, the family who fought by my side. I owe them everything.
I'll continue to serve as a proud member of the Resistance! Though, now that I say it...if there's nothing left to resist, does it make any sense to go on calling ourselves the Resistance?
Even assuming that the people of Gyr Abania need not fear imperials or primals or other threats, there are yet other places fraught with peril, where innocents cry out for heroes. We could be them.
I set out on this journey with a single goal, and it has been achieved. Once more do I put up my spear, this time for good, I think. Arenvald and the other young ones can carry on in my stead.

Though I was born in Ul'dah, my mother's actually from Ala Mhigo, so you could say this is my half-homeland, which makes this my half-homecoming, but I find myself wholly touched to be in this awe-inspiring place!
Orders have been flooding in from Ul'dah and it's all we can do to keep pace, but thanks to the fine spectacles you crafted for me, I can tackle all that work with clarity and confidence!
Thing's are chaotic here as always, but it's a nice to have some old faces nearby.

Carryin' the Gemworks name, I feel pride an' pressure at the same time. Mostly pressure, to be honest. But then I think back to your masterpieces, an' it reminds me that the most important thing is betterin' myself.
I had no idea you fight for the Resistance as well! It's like you're good at everything!

Er, Schoolmaster? Is it true the Syndicate picked you for this job? ...No? But Wido said─
...Godsdammit, not again! How do I keep on falling for his hogwash!?
While they are still green in many ways, our apprentices are undeniably gifted. Best not to tell them that, though, lest it make them complacent.
Ah, Schoolmaster, what a pleasant surprise. Lest you wonder, all is very well here. In spite of our youth, the Gemworks is already a respected name, and it's in no small part due to your leadership.
I am given to underssstand that, when three children of man of mixed gender gather, there is guaranteed to be ssstrife. I am curiousss to see what happens between our apprenticesss.
Our apprenticesss seem to get along very well. Not a hint of the ssstrife I was told to expect when three young ones of mixed gender are gathered. I must confesss to being a little disappointed.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>, pray accept mine apologies and gratitude both for agreeing to the request in spite of its abruptness.
column23: Her Grace has every faith in you, as do I, and I wish you every success in the initiative─not only as one who is involved, but as a humble citizen of the realm as well.

column22: I am truly heartened to see the Crown Gemworks achieve so much in the short time it has been in operation.
column23: All of this was made possible thanks to your tireless efforts and, of course, Her Grace's astute choice of schoolmaster.

column22: If truth be told, I was aware of your observing Lady Lilira from the shadows in the markets. Knowing you, though, I believed that you had good reason, and so pretended not to notice.
column23: Suffice it to say I was beyond delighted to see the lovely orchestrion you and yours had crafted for my lady. You truly made her day, and in so doing made this old man's as well!

column22: It feels like only yesterday that you walked up to this counter, fresh-faced and eager to learn goldsmithing. But here you are now, among the lauded ranks of those who not only practice, but teach our craft. Seeing you come so far, I cannot help but feel a sense of pride.
column23: Yet, by the same token, I cannot help but feel a little worried too. As I am sure you will appreciate, goldsmiths have a high profile in our city, and you are liable to attract more attention, for better or worse, like the guildmaster does. Do take care, now.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, my honored friend! What a pleasure to see you here in the enclave!
column23: At the risk of repeating myself, Doma owes you and yours a debt that can never be repaid. And before you think to say it, our part in the siege of Ala Mhigo does not even begin to redress the balance.
column24: Perchance you wonder how we fare? As you can see, our work is far from finished, but have no doubt we are wholly committed to the task. One day you will look on this place in wonder!

column22: Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! That you are here can only mean that all is well in Ala Mhigo? That is good to hear...
column23: For our part, Yanxia continues to enjoy a measure of peace. Our efforts to spread word of the rebellion in other provinces were successful in spreading unrest, and so it would seem we have successfully forestalled any reprisals by the imperials.
column24: Doubtless events in Ala Mhigo have only served to strengthen the narrative of an Empire weak and in disarray. It will only last for a time, of course, and so we must never take our eyes from the enemy...but for now, we are free to rebuild. To begin anew.

column22: Both my house and the smithy next door were reduced to rubble. Bah! Just give me a roof to put over my tools...
The Empire's forces are no more to be seen, but our people yet suffer in the aftermath. It is in times like this that pleasant distractions are the most welcome...

The people of Namai have been most generous with their rice. Before we were at the mercy of the imperials and their restrictions, but now we have food enough to feed our people, that they may have the strength to rebuild!
I mislike the sight of that imperial tower on the docks. Mayhap we can use it for our own ends, but I would much rather see the wretched thing razed to the ground.
Let me know what needs doing, and I'll see it done.
We must rebuild the enclave if we are to restore our nation to its former glory. People from all across Yanxia are coming here to join in the work. My family, too, will join me soon.
Enthusiasm is all well and good, but we cannot permit people to build whatever wherever they please! I am drafting a comprehensive reconstruction plan to present to Lord Hien for his approval.

Do not misunderstand. I am searching the rubble for valuables not for personal profit, but to further the reconstruction efforts. Their former owners should be glad to see them repurposed for this great endeavor!
Zenos took many of my brothers to the West as slaves to fight in his army. When they return, as I know they will, we shall welcome them home to a Doma reborn!
These caves make for a natural hideaway, and could be easily defended in the event of an attack. That said, the entrance is not the most convenient...
Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! What happened to the villagers? Are they all right? Do you need my help?
Yotsuyu was once a spy for the Liberation Front. She used her talents to beguile imperial officers and learn secrets which she shared with us...
column23: Little did we know it was all in service to a larger plan: to ingratiate herself with us, that she might betray us to Zenos when he marched on Doma. And it worked.

column22: This may be our final chance to win Doma her freedom. We dare not take any chances, for if we fail...
Much has changed in my absence. The state of the enclave, in particular, concerns me...
column23: But it would seem Alphinaud understands the importance of ensuring their safety. You Scions are no ordinary mercenaries, that much is plain.

column22: ...I have seen you in my dreams, traveler.
You have been entrusted with a great task. Do not underestimate the Dotharl. Especially the mad woman who leads them.
Ho, the khagan comes! I must confess, when I spoke with you and the Doman, I thought you no more than common warriors. Skilled, yes, but capable of such feats? Nay...
We will be watching you and yours during the Naadam. If your men impress, we will make them ours.
The gods saw fit to return you to us. But what of your comrades? Where are they?
May you treasure the morin khuur for years and years to come.
You wish to reaffirm our commitment to your cause? Be at ease, my friend. The Mol will answer Doma's call.
A new day dawns, and with it new challenges...
You have passed through your trials here unscathed, it is true. But every star must follow its own course. Be ready.
Though all Xaela know well the violence of war, the battle for Hien's castle was unlike anything I had ever seen. Such chaos and destruction...and death...
Only men may be of the Buduga. Such is the gods' will. And so we take from others fresh blood to sustain our tribe.
column23: Alas, as our strength wanes, so too does our ability to sustain ourselves. Alliances become necessary, such as ours with the Oronir...
column24: We too are “allies” now, I suppose. But who can say what the morrow will bring?

column22: I hope he's not doing something foolish...
Everything well with the investigation? I sent a man to keep watch by the Yawn, by the way. You need to head back down, just let the fellow know.
Omega will stop at nothing─not even massacre─to find a stronger foe... Whose damfool idea was it to program a thing like that?
column23: When they thought to make a self-evolving weapon, didn't it occur to them that things might get out of hand? Hmph! If I ever meet the creators, I'd give 'em some choice words!

column22: Kweh?
That went better than expected! But let's not get ahead of ourselves here!
Call it a showmaster's instincts, but from the moment I met Musosai, I knew he was no ordinary old man. I knew he was going to bring in money, and lots of it!
It hasn't sunk in that Musosai is gone... I'm going to put my traveling on hold and remain in Ul'dah for a while.

Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, always good to see you. So, did you decide to lend Makoto and her crew a hand after all? Seemed they could really use the help, and it'd be an opportunity to give the old man peace.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, a personal thanks from me for taking care of business in Hingashi. I've no doubt that Musosai sleeps more soundly now.
column23:
As for me, I've a mind to linger a while and scout out new talent to showcase.
...You wouldn't be interested, would you? People would pay good coin to see the sublime skills of an Eorzean samurai, returned from honing <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> art in the exotic Far East!

column22: Samurai or no, I cannot believe that Makoto would see fit to take an ijin into our confidence. I shall speak plain: I do not approve of your presence here.
You may have dealt with the traitor Shiden, but it will take more than that ere I consider you a comrade.
But of course you had a secret to hide. I know not what is worse─that you were pupil to the craven Musosai, or that the captain is sister to the insurgent Ugetsu.
I am ashamed for having doubted you. I admired Kogarashi in my childhood, and I believe I speak for all here when I say that I am both honored and grateful for your aid.
If we are to defeat the forces of Ugetsu, we must be relentless in our training!
To think that our own would be seduced over to Ugetsu's side... It must be for want of training!
If even Captain Kongo could not defeat Ugetsu, no amount of training will avail us...
If we are to approach the mastery of Master Musosai and your good self, we must be relentless in our training!
You must be the foreign samurai whom Makoto called upon. I bid you welcome. Makoto trusts you, and so shall I.
So Lieutenant Shiden was a traitor... A sad turn of events. Close as they were, it must be especially hard for Makoto.
It has to be a lie... Makoto couldn't possibly be Ugetsu's sister...could she?
By defeating her brother, Makoto has severed all ties with her past. If there had been any who doubted her fitness as captain, there are certainly none now.
This is the Sekiseigumi─ Ah, 'tis you, my friend. Pray come in and take your ease.
Ye've the makings of a fine warrior. But don't you go forgettin' what ye learned here at the guild. All them fancy new techniques mean nothin' without good basics an' fundamentals.
Would that I had good news to report, but I fear that Karasu has proven as elusive as ever.
column23: While I continue my search, I have asked Tsubame to tell the elders that I am pursuing, ah, a mysterious renegade ninja who stole the scroll from Lord Hanzo and fled to Eorzea. Thankfully, they have not yet questioned my telling of events.

column22: Excuse me, but could I have a moment of your time?
Seems to me there's less food to go around than the last time I was here...
Eh? What's this about?
The captain's word is final. Can't say I didn't warn you.

All ties that bind a man must be renounced, without exception, if he is to find a place here. Former lovers and bitter enemies alike must learn to bury their past and work side by side, or else be cast out.
column23: ...No matter how deep a man's hatreds may run, he cannot let them dictate his actions. The good of the Confederacy takes precedence over all.

column22: Beneath the waters to the west of Sui–no–Sato lies a cave that will lead you to the Isle of Zekki. May the kami watch over and keep you.
The fog of Yanxia has been likened to a shroud of silence. A gift of the kami, some say, that the people of these lands may enjoy quiet, peaceful lives...
Brother's still too shy to speak to Lady Yugiri, by the way. He can't even say thank you!
It is...comforting to see you hale and healthy. We heard tell that the great kami Susano revealed himself to you in the treasure vault...
column23: 'Twas not our intention to spur his intercession. At the very least, I pray it was not a wholly objectionable experience. Capricious he may be, but...boring he is not, no?

column22: We are glad to have been of assistance to you and yours in the siege of Doma Castle. Now that peace reigns, it is our hope that we can build a lasting and...profitable relationship between us and the people of Doma.
Hmm... You seem more...refreshed and relaxed than before, as if a great weight has been lifted from your shoulders. As if you walk with the divine. That is well...
If ever you come across treasures precious and sacred, I pray you consider bringing them to us.
I know how much you cared for the samurai, and so I searched the waters once more ere I returned. Alas, like before, I found naught...
column23: But take heart, my friend, for that may mean that he lives! The current is most swift, and it could well have carried him out to sea, to any number of islands...

column22: Hancock tells me that you fought in a great battle in the West, and that you won. Is it true?
column23: How wonderful! Kami are drawn to the victorious, and with them come great fortune. Mayhap even great treasure?

column22: What the─ We heard you and the others left for Kugane! We wanted to thank you, of course, but we never had the chance...
column23: I, uh, I suppose I could... Ahem. Thank you. For everything, that is... Anyway! I won't keep you. I know you have another war to fight.

column22: Of all the people! I knew Lord Hien and the others went west to join in your fight, but I didn't think you would be coming back with him!
column23: Still, it's a relief to see you alive and well. If you've got time, you should stay a while. I'm sure the others would be glad to see you.

column22: So I hear the little miss has a twin brother, who by all accounts is quite the strategist. I pray he is indeed every bit her equal.
I am told you have been busy. As have we, lest you wonder. None here shall perish for want of proper treatment.
Been to the Peaks and back, have you? Glad to see you're in good health.
More men means we need more arms and armor, but we'll find a way. We've come this far, haven't we?
Oh, where to begin? Thank you, perhaps. Your companions are still in the West, then? A pity. I truly did enjoy their company. Swagger and all.

Now that our many battles are ended, we can return to our old way of life. Alas, this means that you will be expected to pay the Ruby Tithe on subsequent visits.
...Oh, do not scoff. It is merely a Hingan jest!
Well, well, well! What a pleasant surprise this is!
We shall observe the Red for a time. If they withdraw from Isari, I shall consider this proof of your deeds, and we will strike.
Doma yet languishes in peril, but I trust that is in spite of your efforts. The Empire's eyes remain firmly fixed upon us, but we will endure for as long as we are able. We believe in you, my friend.
I am familiar with the plan, and I support it wholeheartedly. At the appointed hour, we will strike at the heart of Doma with all our might. Together we will triumph, or together we will fall.
...I distinctly recall taking you to Kugane that you might return to the West with all haste. But I suppose there is an ebb and flow to war, and a reason you can afford to be here for a time.
...Twenty-five years ago, when Doma first fell to the Empire, my family was murdered by imperial soldiers.
column23: For a long, long time I believed that no one had the strength to stand against them. But I never forgot that scared little boy, and I never stopped hoping I was wrong. And I was.

column22: I thought her possessed of greater sense than this. Why is she so eager to risk everything with this mad plan?
It might be stupid and reckless, but if she's going to do it anyway, then maybe...

Everything in Yanxia proceeding according to keikaku? Very good. I must confess that I was most saddened to see Master Alphinaud go, but duty calls and so forth. Rest assured that Tataru and I will keep you abreast of all developments we deem worthy of your attention.

I can see it now. Confederate ships sailing up the One River, equipped with the finest Lominsan-made cannons, provided by the East Aldenard Trading Company. The world is not as big as it once was, my friend.
I say, I consider myself to be a man of impeccable timing, attuned to the rhythms of the cosmos...and I have a sinking suspicion you shouldn't be here. Not yet, that is.
Setting your sights on Ala Mhigo next, I presume? Excellent. The chairman is most interested in seeing how that whole affair plays out.
column23: Hm? Is the company willing to openly aid the Gyr Abanian campaign? Oh, heavens no. Far too close to home. 'Twould be an unconscionable risk.

column22: First Doma, then Ala Mhigo. Well done you. I doubt not even the chairman expected you to be so damn good at warmaking!
column23: Owing to your efforts, the company is now free to expand into several emerging markets. At the risk of waxing poetic, I think this may be the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
column24: Who knows─we may even come to call one another “aibou,” as the Hingans do. 'Tis a most deep and meaningful word, aibou─some translate it as “friend,” but I think it better not to even bother trying, so unique and quintessentially Hingan the concept is...

column22: All's quiet at the Garlean embassy─so far as we can tell from the outside. Anyway, carry on with the Doman business! We have matters here well in hand. Trust me!

Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! You didn't come all this way just to see little ol' me, did you? Silly me, of course not! You want the latest news about the Garlean embassy, don't you?
column23: We've observed visitors from Garlemald coming and going from the embassy day and night. I think it's fair to say that events in Doma have them very, very concerned.

column22: Congratulations, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! You all managed to beat the bad guys and win the war! Then everything is wrapped up in a neat little package!
column23: I suppose it's a little more complicated where Lyse is concerned, but she's got to follow her heart, and I'd rather be happy for her. I hope you are too!

column22: Ordinarily I teach but one student at a time, but it will be a refreshing challenge to instruct the two of you together. I look forward to the experience.
How fares your craft, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? As a teacher, there is no greater joy than seeing a former apprentice excel in our chosen art.
Have you gained a feel for the Hingan style of armorsmithing? I am here should you have any questions for a senior apprentice!

When time permits, I have been learning the Eorzean style of armorsmithing from Blanstyr. Providing you with materials has given me some idea, but there are so many differences in method and technique!
I have given the Doman my word, and I will not break it. Call upon us when you are ready, and no sooner.
column23: ...And spare me the company of the udgan, if you would.

column22: We have fought, and the Doman has reclaimed his homeland. May he and his people have joy of it.
I am told you were victorious in yet another war in the West. Hardly surprising. For you are the khagan...for now.
column23: Seasons turn, and bodies mend. Even Brother Baatu, once bedridden, has regained his former strength.
column24: How fortunate he was to be wed to a woman so skilled in the arts of healing. How...fortunate...indeed.

column22: It warms my heart to see you again, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, and to have a chance to congratulate you on your great victory in the West!
column23: As Bardam's deeds endured for generations, so too shall yours. In our songs, and in the songs of your people. So it is always with they who walk in crimson.

column22: Cirina told me of the samurai's fate. You have my deepest condolences, child.
column23: The design can be difficult to discern for those within it. So it was when Cirina brought Hien unto us, bleeding and broken. Yet from that tragedy he rose, strong and resolute, and reclaimed what was lost...

column22: Well met, Ssscions. I am Vajra. She who shines bright and unbroken.
column23: I ssstand ready. We leave upon your command.

column22: What's that? You wonder if I am an Adarkim?
column23: Hahaha! Y-You are quite a comedian. No, no, I am just a regular piggy. Even if I were an Adarkim─which I'm not─I wouldn't dream of trying to become the next khan.
column24: Someone with such dreams would be putting their very life at risk! Adarkim males will do anything to become khan─or so I hear. Now be off with you! Here, have some buuz for the road.

column22: Why, Father? Why?

My father, he...he didn't make it...
They killed him! Those thrice-damned imperials killed him!
I thought long and hard about walking away after what happened to my father. But the others, they convinced me it was better to stay the course. That's what my father would've wanted, after all...
Ala Mhigo is ours! Ala Mhigo is free! At long last, my father can rest in peace...
All of my wares have gone up in smoke. I almost wish the fire had taken me too. I've nothing left...
I suppose the wise course of action would be to pack up what little I've got left and leave...but I've never been all that clever. It may take an eternity to rebuild what I've lost, but I will.
Been a while since you came through, aye? As you may have noticed, things are looking up in the Reach!
With freedom comes prosperity, my friend! In time I'll build a fortune to rival any Ul'dahn merchant prince!
I'm pathetic. Everyone's off fighting for Ala Mhigo and I'm stuck here with my useless arm.
They say you helped liberate our home. Thank you. I wish I could've been out there fighting with you.
Everyone here has been on edge of late. No one's quite sure just what is going on in Gyr Abania.

I've decided not to make the move. It's been so long since we first arrived here it feels more like home than Ala Mhigo ever could. What's more, should Ala Mhigo want to trade more with Ul'dah, they'll need someone to act as an intermediary.
On my good days, I've been able to help out Alfan with his work. He's been making medicine to send to those putting their lives on the line for Ala Mhigo.
Me chest is burning...<wheeze>...with the fire that inspired my brethren to take back our home. Ugh, I feel like I'm dying, but I couldn't be happier.
Everyone's been so excitable of late. Keep wonderin' if there ain't somethin' I can do to help too.
Can you bleedin' believe it? They've only gone and freed Ala Mhigo. Can't remember a time I was last this happy.
I have been working together with Meffrid to see that all the refugees are given shelter and properly fed. It is no easy task, but it is our duty to protect these people.
I have heard about Meffrid... Slain by a fellow Ala Mhigan. I cannot believe it. I do not want to believe it.

For a while there I was overcome by anger and grief. The captain did not deserve such a cruel fate. However, I eventually realized that he would have been appalled to see me moping around in such a state. It is time I did my part so that I do not dishonor his memory.
Now that the fighting has finished, I would very much like to visit Rhalgr's Reach and pay my respects to the captain.

To think you would end up liberating my homeland. You have my sincerest thanks, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Though words will never be enough to truly express my gratitude.
column23: Now I simply need decide whether to stay here or move back to Ala Mhigo. I'm sure it's quite a bit nicer now those imperial whoresons have been driven out.

column22: <cough> <wheeze> Well, I can hardly die now, can I? I've got to see Ala Mhigo once more with my own eyes.
No one is happier than me to see Ala Mhigo liberated, of that you can be certain.
column23: However, it is too early to be patting ourselves on the back. The Empire still has plenty of troops in reserve, and we do not yet know if the Corpse Brigade will attempt to reclaim power.

column22: Oh gods, don't tell me you came all the way back here just to look in on me? That's kind of you, but really, you should be with the others in the Lochs, finishing what we started. Go, go!
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, you are returned!
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! That you are here gives me cause to hope!

Our victory at Castellum Velodyna has earned us a strong foothold here in Gyr Abania. But the road before us is still quite long. We will need to be duly prepared before our plans can proceed further.
Now that Ala Mhigo has been freed from the imperials, trade with Gridania is likely to increase. It falls to us to ensure any trade lines established remain safe.
Aye, we've won, but our work is far from done. The people of Ala Mhigo are faced with the not-so-small task of rebuilding their lives, and it's our duty to help them.
Castellum Velodyna is ours! With this victory, we are one step closer to guaranteeing the freedom of Ala Mhigo and her people.

The greater part of our work here in Ala Mhigo is done, but it seems duty would bid me stay here a while longer. A small portion of our forces are still needed here, and I have been charged with overseeing the delivery of provisions from Ishgard.
At last, the fighting has stopped. It was all I could do to manage the constant shipments of provisions. Perhaps now I can make a proper record of our inventory.
Word has it you played a rather pivotal role in routing the Garleans. On behalf of the M tribe, you have our thanks. I pray those who fell in battle will at last find peace.
I'm glad to be rid of the Garleans, but it's no reason for us to let down our guard. There's still the threat of cloudkin to worry about.
Freedom, that virtue which Sri Lakshmi extols above all others, is ours once more. Yet there is no guarantee that it shall remain ssso. We must remain vigilant, now and ever after.

It ssseems the Garleans have finally fled. Though we mourn the losss of our sisters who fell in battle, we are also quite proud of their sacrifice, as we are of the great many others lost in the fighting.
Medicines, is it? Come on, come on, take what you need! I'm not about to be a stickler when there's lives to be saved!
Wish I could say it's gotten a lot better in your absence, but we still have trouble obtaining even the most basic supplies. Still, we make do with what we've got.
After what everyone's been through, I think I might rummage around and see if I can't find some spirits to pass around. If ever there were a time to bend the rules, this is it, aye?
Valiantly did we fight, but ultimately for naught...
Fassster! Fassster! Look them in their eyes and ssstrike them in their heartsss!
Fassster! Fassster!  Wassste not these preciousss hours, but in quiet preparation make ssstrong the body and mind!
What's done is done. The dead are dead. All I can do is feed the living and pray it helps them to grow stronger.
For a while after the attack, folks ate their food in silence. Slowly but surely, though, things have gotten back to normal. They're starting to believe again...
A right and proper feast is long overdue, I say! We've got cause enough to celebrate, don't we?
Bastards paid no heed to whether or not the men they slaughtered were armed. Some of the sutlers... Damn it all!
The sutlers have pulled out all the stops and managed to secure us some new supplies. It may not be by much, but things are steadily improving.
I would have you remember that we owe a great deal to all the merchants that supplied us. Ala Mhigo could not have been freed without their help.
The imperials came from the Peaks. Somehow they knew about the tunnel...
Ala Mhigo may have been liberated, but the Empire is still out there. We must not let our guard down.
We came together as best we could, but in the end, there were just too many of them.
All of us are eager for a chance to strike back at the imperials. Our day is coming!
It's like the commander said: freedom for all, a home for us all. That's what we've won, and that's what we've got to defend from now on!
I don't know... If we'd noticed sooner we could've used the cannons, but by the time we did, it was too late...
They'll not surprise us again, oh no. We'll be ready next time─my cannons too!
I know you were busy dealing with Fordola and all those weapons in Castrum Abania, but if you'd been outside, you'd have seen my cannons sing!
There will be a reckoning. Mark my words...
Gyr Abania belongs to man and Ananta once more. Let us pray that it is always ssso.
No time to talk. I must prepare more medicines.
A healer's work is never ended. If anything, I'm busier than ever. But, for a mercy, I have medicines enough...
I know there were spare bandages here somewhere...
We still need all the bandages we can get. An awful lot of our men were wounded in the battle for Ala Mhigo...
Gah... In the heat of battle I barely felt the pain, but when the fighting died down, it was all I could do to stay standing...
The tide's turning, I can feel it! I've got to heal, got to get better...got to get back to the front with the others...
I recovered in time to join the siege...only to injure my shoulder again. But I was there! I stood shoulder to shoulder with my brothers and sang till my throat was hoarse!
Herbs for the poultices, herbs for the poultices...
All these new recruits and allies means that we'll need even more herbs! I've got to pick up the pace!

I know what you're thinking. “Hughoc, you don't need to keep gathering herbs for everyone. Can't somebody else do it?” And you're right, but the thing is...I like it! Damned if I know why, but I just can't stop!
I hope you like it hot, because the Moonfire Faire is here! This year the festivities are being held on the Isle of Endless Summer. Enjoy the heat while you can!
Not now. I'm busy. I've no time for idle chatter or more rumors. But gods, that last rumor... I can't get it out of my head.
You're doing the gods' work by helping with the Moonfire Faire. Nobody expected it to be such a success. We're all grateful for everything you adventurers have done.
As of now, no trouble has come of this treasure nonsense, and it looks as though the Bombards are staying away. There was a moment I thought this Moonfire Faire might go smoothly.
column23: But that proved to be no more than a mummer's thought. The biggest problem is we don't have the staff to accommodate all these faire-goers. Please, friend, lend us a hand where you can.

column22: The Moonfire Faire is being held here on the Isle of Endless Summer. And it is drawing more people than anyone thought possible. If you care to know more about the festivities, you need only speak to one of the faire chaperones.

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Allow me to thank you for your help with the faire. You know as well as any how shorthanded we always are. Feel free to lend a hand if you find the time.
Begging your pardon, but I am afraid I am extremely busy now. If you'd like to place an order, would you mind waiting a spell?
I've no idea what it is about the Moonfire Faire that makes everyone crazy for battered fish. Nobody gives it a second thought the rest of the year. What a strange thing, indeed.
The ingredients I prepared are nowhere near the amount we need for all these orders. The vegetables and seasonings I can acquire more of, but the fish... My gods, the fish!
Bugger me─we're still short on fish. Nobody could have possibly known we'd need this much.
Hello, and welcome to the Isle of Endless Summer. The isle is currently hosting the Moonfire Faire. I hope you find your stay a pleasant one.
I did what I could to promote the isle and draw as many visitors as possible to this year's faire. Based on what I've been hearing, it seems my labors have borne fruit.
I am grateful beyond words when I see everyone toiling to make the Moonfire Faire as great a success as possible. You adventurers are a gift from the gods, truly.
It is a relief to hear that the civilians in the Ala Mhigan Quarter are under our protection. However, there are still many others who are in danger...
I understand you rescued Krile, and that is well. But we have no time to pat ourselves on the back. Not while the battle for Ala Mhigo yet looms.
I heard you and yours caused quite a commotion in the quarter. A pity I was not there to enjoy it.
The scouts said the dragoon's armor was unmistakable. But surely he would not...

Even on the verge of this siege, Ser Aymeric will not forgo his tea. To see him drink it, so calm and composed, you would think him anywhere but a battlefield. You too are the picture of composure, though that is hardly surprising given your combat experience.
It's over, they say. As if all that blood'll wash away the years of pain...
In retrospect, I'm glad I chose to remain here. I cannot wait to welcome back all of my friends who left so long ago.
Knowing that I've paid my last tributum is a beautiful feeling. Maybe now I'll have enough money to enjoy myself once in a while.
I'm sorry, but I really must tend to these chocobos. Perhaps we can speak later.
If you need something it'll have to wait. I caught these two lackwits trying to shirk their duties, and they need a good dressing down.
Ala Ghiri used to be somethin' special. A place where folks from all over would gather an' do business. <sigh> I wonder how long till we get back to the way things were...
That crystal up there's a beauty, isn't it? You won't see one like it anywhere else.
Sorry, sweetling. I don't think you're quite ready for the games I like to play.
Sorry, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. I'm in the middle o' business. You understand, right?
Gossip around town is that Ala Mhigo's been liberated from the Garleans? But that couldn't be true...could it?
Terribly sorry, but I have nothing an adventurer such as yourself could find useful. You might have better luck asking one of the other merchants here in town.
Whatever it is will have to wait. I need to take this gentleman's order.
You're looking parched, friend. How's about stopping by my tavern to put back a few?
So, the Empire has withdrawn...? I wonder if he knows...wherever he is now.
Change is always a time of opportunities. Now that Gyr Abania is free, there'll be a need for folk willing to start up a new trade.
Ah! Oh gods, I─ Well, I suppose the Empire's soldiers are long gone by now. I still don't care for being startled like that, though!
Ma said we could eat as soon as she finished. But that was a few bells ago...
If you're lookin' for a hot meal or a warm bed, you won't be findin' it here. To be honest, you won't be findin' much of anythin' here.
This is Isobe. A long time ago, I was returning from a business meeting with the Kojin in Tamamizu, when he appeared and followed me home. He has been with me ever since.
Isobe is an otter, and I cannot count the number of times I have told Her Highness as much. <sigh> She, however, continues to insist he is a wartfish...
Please, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. You have to find my brother. Heavens only know what trouble that lovesick fool has gotten himself into.
A group of the villagers have decided to join the fight to liberate Doma. I can only pray that they all come back safe and sound someday.
They did it! Doma is liberated at last!
All of my friends have returned! I did not think I would ever see the day.
It pains me more than I could ever express that I cannot fight alongside my fellow villagers. All I can do is pray for their success.
I never thought the day would come when our small village would be filled with war heroes. I am so proud of every single one of them.
Some of my friends returned just a short while ago. I have no idea if the Empire let them go, or if they escaped, but I am thrilled to see them safe regardless.
My friends say they are going to join the fight against the Empire and I have a mind to join them.
We did it! The Empire rules us no longer! Oh, I cannot wait to tell my daughter all about how we bested those imperial dogs.
The beauty of these flowers may be ethereal and fleeting, but that is precisely what makes them so precious.
Namai may be a sad village, but there is life left in it yet. Those willing to rebel against our imperial overlords prove that.

I do hope the village becomes a bit livelier now that we are free of the Empire. I still remember fondly how nice a place it was to live before the invasion. Hopefully I will live to see Namai's fortunes continue to improve in the near future.
The villagers! They have returned! They said something about being tricked by some woman. I am not sure exactly what they meant, but I am truly glad they are back where they belong.
All those capable of fighting have agreed to go rebel against the Empire. I would love nothing more than to join them, but I cannot even go to relieve myself without the aid of this cane.
I cannot believe it. We are finally free...
Now that the battle is ended, I suspect there will be a flood of Ala Mhigans seeking to return to their homeland. We must be prepared.
One does not neglect a patient once the wound has been stitched. No, I shall remain a while, and see that Gyr Abania is fully healed.

What a battle...
We paid for it in blood, but by Rhalgr, we won!
I wonder how many soldiers survived thanks to these brave birds! I think they deserve extra feed rations for a moon or two, don't you?
We've won for now, but the Empire won't relax its grip so easily. We need to keep our soldiers in fighting shape!

<Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>! Help yourself to a bowl of soup, if you'd like.
Seems we'll soon be turning our efforts to rebuilding. Our new orders should be coming in any day now!
Ala Mhigo will not soon forget your name, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. For my part, I'll be sure to teach it to my children's children!

Tales were told of your deeds in battle, <Clickable(<If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(52),0))><Sheet(GCRankLimsaMaleText,PlayerParameter(52),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(53),0))><Sheet(GCRankGridaniaMaleText,PlayerParameter(53),8)/><Else/></If><If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(54),0))><Sheet(GCRankUldahMaleText,PlayerParameter(54),8)/><Else/></If>)/> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>. Another chapter in the book of Eorzea's storied hero!
The battle is won, but our return to Limsa Lominsa will have to wait until we've sorted out the aftermath. Ah, if I could but step through a magical door into the Drowning Wench...
It was an honor to fight at the ssside of you and your allies.
Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. We have seen a steady increase in people passing through here ever since the fighting ceased.
Damn it, Alisaie! This is serious! You need rest!
Heh...heh heh... You seem ready to burst into tears. I'd...fetch you a handkerchief, but...
There may be hope for Coldhearth yet if that Baut fellow can really persuade the folks in Ala Ghiri to help with plantin' our dates. If only Erart could be here to see the palms grow...
