I take it now you see why I've been tryin' to keep this quiet? One misstep and there'll be blood in the streets for sure. I'm countin' on you to help bring him in.
Thanks again for your help. Baut's been surprisingly cooperative. In fact, my superiors are saying he may be pardoned.
Good seein' you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. If you're lookin' for Baut, he's still up at Coldhearth helpin' with the crops.
column23: When those dates get to growin', we can finally get to replenishin' our stores of arak. I've worked up a thirst just thinkin' about it.

column22: Taking Velodyna will be the first significant step toward wresting Ala Mhigo from the Empire's grasp─but make no mistake: there will be many more such steps, each one taken at a cost.
Lord Hien saw fit to pardon me and my men for our crimes, and bade us return with him to Doma to help our countrymen rebuild.
column23: Alas, there are other Lupin still bound by imperial chains to serve. Still others have turned to banditry, the wretched fools. It is enough to make me long for my brother's aid...

column22: If this sodding leg of mine was any good, I'd...
Kami take me, I never believed this day would come! I'm sorry I doubted you before, my friend.
It's you! The <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> who came to set us free. Of course. You must have had a hand in this. My thanks to you.

Enjoying the festivities, I trust? Indeed, it is a time of celebration, but also a time of reflection. The Rising marks the anniversary of the realm's rebirth, and the selfless sacrifices of those who made it possible.
column23: Please do partake in the revelry, and always remember: to ensure a bright future, we must never forget the past.

column22: Thank you again for your help. Even with the bugs vanquished, I would find no joy in our celebration had it cost the wandering minstrel his life.
column23: But let us not worry ourselves with things that will never be. Please do partake in the revelry, and always remember: to ensure a bright future, we must never forget the past.

column22: Have you heard? They're selling all manner of commemorative goods in Ul'dah to celebrate the Rising. Fireworks, furniture, orchestrion rolls, you name it. If I were you, I'd go and have a look before their stocks are gone.
The surest way to hasten our progress is to improve our fare. Feed a man the same bland gruel weeks on end and see what you get!
Me? I've come on behalf of the House of Splendors. Got an assortment of uncanny knickknacks, as it happens. If you've got what I need, we could make ourselves a trade?
Do you seek passage to the <Emphasis>Prima Vista</Emphasis>?
No one goes in without the commander's permission.
The Resonatorium is a restricted area. I can't let you in without the proper authorization.
There's a hundred and one things to do, but I'll see the Saltery running again─you mark my words!
We've gone ahead and set up patrols like we talked about. Thanks to your advice, we shouldn't have any trouble keeping the area safe for the Saltery workers.
My thanks for your help.
I still have much to learn.
If not for you, the vault would be barren. <sigh> Perhaps Tsukumo was wrong to choose me...

The Divine Circle is engrossed in other work at present. Even with our combined strength, though, I fear we're still no match for the Red. We will require aid from all of Tamamizu if we're to succeed.
Whether it be scouring the ocean floor or bartering in the markets of Kugane, there are myriad ways to obtain treasure for the vault.
Kabuto is much too concerned with measuring himself against you. I pray he comes to understand this is not a competition, lest he lose sight of our goal.
I apologize for Kabuto's behavior earlier. It would appear he still has much to learn about what it means to work as a team.

For a time I think everyone feared that peace would not last, but there is no denying it now. The reconstruction has begun in earnest. Nevertheless, we must not neglect the simple pleasures in life, else why bother carrying on living at all?
I realize now we're only as strong as we are united. What a fool I've been, thinking I could support the Blue on my own. If only I had come to understand sooner.
column23: Even if we don't always see eye to eye, I think of Tsukumo, and remember there is nothing we can't resolve with discussion.

column22: Tsukumo granted me a great blessing in the Divine Circle. The bonds between us have never been stronger, and I will do all I can to honor and protect them in his memory.
I was all puffed up with pride when they chose me to speak for the Ala Mhigan Quarter─I sure didn't expect to be fleeing for my life!
column23: ...And, aye, I saw what Fordola did for us. She ain't forgiven─not by a damn sight─but we've better things to do than spill new blood for old wrongs.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! What brings you to Doma, my friend? I'd heard that the aftermath of Ala Mhigo's liberation brought its own trials, but can I assume the worst of it is over for the moment?
column23: I know firsthand how difficult rebuilding a nation can be... After attending the kami know how many councils, I almost yearn for the simplicity of battles where one knows exactly where one stands.
column24: We must, however, be thankful for the agony of choice─it is the undeniable proof of our freedom. Pray send Lyse my regards. I hope we soon find our present struggles relegated to amusing stories to share over a cup of wine!

column22: Bandits have been attacking our workers, seeking to steal the materials we use to rebuild. I am most pained to see Lupin amongst their dishonorable ranks, slavering and snarling as if they were no more than common beasts.
Greetings, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! As you can see, there is yet much to be done before we can fully erase the scars of war from the fair face of Doma.
column23: I would have our people wielding tools rather than weapons, but we must also nurture the strength to protect our hard-won freedom. 'Tis a matter that I must discuss at length with Lord Hien...

column22: We've cleared the streets of rubble for the most part, but...well, just look for yourself. I don't care how ramshackle it is─I need my smithy back! Too much time wasted coming back and forth from Kusakari. Too much!
We need to break up this fallen masonry and cart it away before we can think about building. It took some work, but the main thoroughfares are mostly free of debris now.
All are free to travel in and out of the enclave. Do you seek passage?
Repairing our homes is tiring work, but the exhaustion is accompanied by a great deal of satisfaction. Yes, indeed.
Is the conflict in Ala Mhigo nearly over? Do you think my conscripted brothers will be able to come home soon, as Hakuro's soldiers have?
Phew. These big stones are why the word “backbreaking” was invented, but you'll see─we'll have this area all cleaned up soon enough!
Did you notice how some of the buildings were left untouched? Like that damnable tower on the docks, or the mansion where the overseer lived?
column23: Say what you will about the imperials, but they are nothing if not practical...

column22: I must designate a priority for each structure, ensure that the necessary materials are delivered to the correct site, gather competent workers and see that they are properly fed, and then there's the─
column23: Ah! How can one person keep track of so many details!? I shall have to find myself an assistant!

column22: I find it reassuring to watch the children at their games─even with their homes in ruins, they still find ways to play. If only we all had such resilience.
One wrong step, and I would've lost my will to that fiend for the rest of my days. 'Tis a sobering thought...
We encountered our fair share of enthralled outside the palace. Enough to delay us from lending you a timely hand, I'm afraid...
I think I shall make a habit of checking for primal influence before our meetings from now on.
That was unlike any battle I've ever seen. I'm not entirely sure how I survived it, to be honest.
Lyse is certainly living up to her own ideal. Not every commander would choose to enlist a former enemy's aid in battle.
Kweh, kweh!
I have some of our best people deciphering the tomestone we retrieved from Omega's control room─you can browse their latest results on the terminal over there.
column23: Rowena charged a pretty pile of gil to loan us a scholar to handle the translations, but I think I can chalk that up to “project expenses.” If that knowledge allows you even the slightest advantage, then no cost is too great...

column22: Pray do not concern yourself with me, my friend! Should I chance upon the fiend, I shall cry “Wolf Burglar!” at the top of my lungs!
Would you look at these pretty houses! I mean, they could use a little work, but they've all got potential!
He will not escape. Not this time...I hope.
It'll be nice to have some Resistance lads and lasses around to watch over us. No one wants to worry about being dragged into the loch while you're just trying to get an honest day's work done.
Aye, the gate at the top of these stairs leads into the Palace. Nay, I can't let you in without the proper say-so.
To commemorate the gathering of Ala Mhigo's envoys, they've decided to open the rooftop gardens to everyone in the city. Would you like to take a look?
Come to check on me, have you? Well, thanks to the excellent care I've received, I seem to be on the mend.
column23: Not that that's stopped Alphinaud from insisting I continue my convalescence. I swear he decides to act the part of a concerned big brother at the most inconvenient of times...

column22: It seems I'll be serving as the contact between Ala Mhigo and the Scions for the time being. Naturally, my duties will also include spying on beastman strongholds.
Now that freedom is won, we'd be fools to let it slip through our fingers. Though mayhap not on the front lines, I will lend what support I can to our Ala Mhigan brothers and sisters.
The kami has spoken, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. It falls to us to see the vault is filled to bursting with resplendent treasures.
Since beginning trade with the Namazu, opportunities to barter for goods have led us all across Othard. Truly, your meeting with their people was a blessing.

We must do our due diligence if we are to maintain good relations with the Qestir. Trading with them has taught us to be less reliant on our words as well, a valuable skill when dealing not only with the Qestir, but all the Xaela in Reunion.
What good fortune that Kabuto would be friends with a smith of the forge in Kugane? We are certain to have need of their services before facing the Red.
column23: Few, if any of us, will cross blades with them, mind you, but I plan to do all I can to see we are duly prepared.

column22: We've cut off the head of the snake, but it is only a matter of time before another grows in its place. Until then, Hirumaki's absence should deter the Red from interfering with our work.
The vault is a glorious sight, isn't it? It would likely still be empty if not for your efforts.
column23: I cannot recall the kami Kabuto spoke of, but the blessing of your friendship to the Blue is undeniable.

column22: Kabuto has never been one to work with others, but please, do what you can for him.
Have you heard? Kabuto has been helping tend to the rays! I would never have believed it had I not seen it with my own eyes.
column23: If there was any doubt he was blessed by a kami, it's been washed away by the tide.

column22: Our wares are mostly what we find or goods we've received but have no need for. Have a look and see if there's anything you need.

If you're interested in owning a striped ray, you're in luck. I've spoken with Makura and Takotsubo, and they've given me leave to sell them to adventurers such as yourself who've made considerable contributions to the Blue.
Ladies and gentlemen, young and old! Once more the Songbirds will grace the stages of Ul'dah in celebration of Little Ladies' Day.
column23: Indeed, it shall be a performance for the ages, one wherein <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> will have the opportunity to take part. If you would join in the revelry, pray make for Ul'dah with all haste.

column22: Once again, the Starlight Celebration is bringing joy to children far and wide. We've been so busy that we'd be glad for any help you might offer!
So, you've spoken with Baenfaeld? It's a crying shame what happened in Bentbranch, it really is. Please, help him bring cheer to those dear little children!
Baenfaeld tells me you were instrumental in recovering the decorations. We are eternally grateful!
column23: When I look at you, I cannot help but recall the Ishgardian knights from the tale of the first Starlight Celebration. Such selflessness and generosity─ You truly are an example to us all!

column22: Greetings, good <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. I am the inoshishi bugyo, come with a delegation from the Far East on a mission to deepen the bonds of friendship with the people of Eorzea.
column23: It is my honor and privilege to share our Heavensturn customs in this, the year of the boar. To mark this momentous occasion, I will be serving traditional sweets to the good people here in Limsa Lominsa. If you would care to sample a taste of the Far East, you need only come and join the celebration.

column22: Ah, come to join the celebration, have you? With the neko bugyo gone, this year's Heavensturn has been a smashing success.
column23: Though I cannot help but wonder if he truly intends to return... In any case, I will personally see to it the next year's bugyo is prepared. On that, you have my word.

column22: <grunt>
Oink, oink!
I'm a personal assistant of Master Wiscard hisself. Don't know the big man? Then, all the 'stounding wares I have─you don't know these either. Farewell!
You know Master Wiscard? Why didn't you say so! What can I get you?
I live to see my clients dressed with style and finesse. Only those I deem suitable are permitted to browse my stock.
It seems you too appreciate the importance of outward appearances. Pray, view my wares.
We'll be watching the Qalyana even more closely now, ready to jump if they try summoning Lakshmi again.
column23: Papalymo taught me a lot about the dangers of being enthralled, and I'll be passing on that advice to our fighters. Can't be too careful when there's a primal involved.

column22: The sultana's relocation project appears to be proceeding as planned.
column23: With the mad king's gold at our disposal, we've already begun preparing the Saltery to accommodate the returning refugees. At this pace, Ala Mhigo will be thriving again in no time!

column22: I know I'm not the best fighter, but that battle against Lakshmi brought home how badly I need to train. I'll be putting myself at the mercy of J'moldva and V'mah until I feel ready to face a primal on my own!
They've been quiet since their treachery in the throne room, but the Qalyana are a problem we'll need to solve at some point...
Lyse took on a great deal of responsibility with very little warning─I expect it's a considerable relief to know that Raubahn is in Ala Mhigo to stay.
Not once, but twice now have you besssted the Qalyana's mockery of our goddess.
column23: Our wayward sssisters would have rent this land asssunder with their misssplaced faith, and on behalf of the Ananta I both thank you and beg your forgiveness.

column22: You saved my life, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, and I welcome you without hesitation. I doubt I could ever say the same for the Butcher, though, no matter how heroic her deeds...
Greetings, my friend. Following the Qalyana's treachery, we have been scrutinizing their movements even more closely than usual.
column23: I would not be known as the nunh who allowed the Ananta's goddess to make slaves of his people.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Welcome, welcome! I hear your negotiations with our chairman went splendidly!
column23: Offering up the Saltery as a potential investment was a master stroke, I must say. Like many a gourmand, the way to Lolorito's purse is through his stomach! Ahahaha!

column22: Alphinaud has been sending me detailed reports on the happenings in Ala Mhigo. The war is over, but there are still a few battles left to be fought, eh?
Hoary Boulder and the others are off visiting the more troublesome beast tribes. It seems that business with Sri Lakshmi inspired an unscheduled scouting expedition...
We've had a few setbacks this Hatching–tide, but you needn't let that stop you from enjoying the festivities!
Traveling troubadour and master minstrel, at your service! I shall be stopping here in Gridania for a time, and keeping my senses open to new inspiration.
How fare you in your impromptu performances? Mayhap one day we could play a duet together...
I know Grandfather and Homei have yet to discuss it, but with the liberation of Doma, it is surely only a matter of time before the refugees decide to return to the Far East, no?

Don't you worry about ol' Riol─let him worry about you. I'm keepin' my ears to the ground, havin' 'em listen for anythin' an' everythin' what might cause us trouble. I'll not suffer any more knives in the dark. Save ours, that is.
Garnering support from the others to face the Red will prove difficult, more so for one of Kabuto's reticent disposition. May the kami grant him strength.
Kabuto's command of the Blue on the Isle of Zekki was above and beyond my wildest expectations. Not only that─he was able to defeat their general. The kami smile upon us.
Thanks to you and the tsukumogami, Kabuto has become an exemplary leader for the Divine Circle. I confess I had my doubts at first, but he has proven himself quite capable.
Leave the underlings to me. You have a primal to fight!
column23: Head outside to prepare?

column22: The troupe's nefarious plan to sow terror with their costumes seems to have spiraled out of control, leaving them with little time to engage in other mischief. And the manor is of no moment.
column23: Nevertheless, I will remain vigilant, for evil never sleeps! And if it does, it sleeps in shifts!

column22: Hmm... Surely someone will come along...someone both willing and able to help...
column23: In order to undertake the quest “An Othardian Wolfman in Gridania,” you must first complete the quest “It's Probably Pirates.”

column22: We were visited by a refugee just the other day. He said he had come to share the news of his impending move to the Saltery.
column23: It would seem that a companion─one who did not survive their flight across the badlands all those years ago─is buried here in the lichyard... I feel I was afforded a glimpse of the bittersweet joy that many an Ala Mhigan must surely now endure.

column22: ...He truly has no idea what those fiends are really about, does he? Well, the least we can do is try to keep him from getting into even <Emphasis>more</Emphasis> trouble, for his sake and for ours.
With Lord Hien's return, I can rest easy knowing that Doma is in good hands.
column23: ...Still, after hearing the tales of Ala Mhigo's restoration, I am tempted to rush home and put these old bones to work alongside my countrymen.

column22: It seems an age now since we first imposed upon your kindness. We have strived to make ourselves useful here whilst our homeland lay in turmoil, but the time has come where we must choose our path forward...
I cannot return to Doma with head held high until our debt to you has been repaid. Honor demands that I stand ready to perform any task you may require of me. And so I train!
Ah, how I miss the inexhaustible font of Lyse's energy. The Rising Stones is a sadder place for her absence...
column23: Yet I cannot begrudge her the vital duty she performs in the name of her homeland. Indeed, she sets a shining example for the rest of us to follow!

column22: Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Is there no way we can arrange for Homei and his kin to return to Doma? I know he will not ask it for himself, but it's plain to see where his heart yearns to be.
I'm bound for Sakazuki. For a few coins, you can come too. Interested?
I'm bound for Sakazuki. For a few coins─ Eh? You haven't even got that much? Never mind.
Got a mind to head to Onokoro? I'll take you there, for a pittance. You have my word that no harm will come to you...
Got a mind to head to Onokoro? I'll take you there, for a pittance...or <Emphasis>would</Emphasis>, if that weren't beyond your humble means.
Clean as a baby's behind, it is! But when we get to work, it will be anything but, heh heh! Day and night, day and night I will soon be laboring. Far too much to be done!
If you need someone to lift a sledge, I'm your man, but if the hammer in question is a fair bit smaller, you'd be better served by another. Either way, I'm taking a rest.
The others saw fit to entrust this site to me, and I will not let them down.
Have you heard aught of the other Lupin conscripts in Eorzea? Surely there is no reason why they would not have left by now, but the lack of news is concerning...

I oversee the distribution of materials and the delegation of various essential tasks. It is a great responsibility that the elders have given me, and I shall prove to them and everyone else that I am up to the challenge!
Woodworking, now this is more like it! Far less exhausting, and it provides greater opportunities to express myself artistically. Why, it's so engrossing I almost forgot how hungry I am...
Curious about where these doors lead? Nowhere particularly interesting, really. We had to demolish a number of unsafe structures, and have yet to build anything in their place.
column23:
You could say we bid farewell to those lingering remnants of a tragic past. An ending to mark a new beginning, so to speak.
...Hmm? Did I say something odd?

column22: Every stone is in its place once more. Parents need not fear for their children tripping over debris as they run. Still, I would rather they played on softer grounds...
If necessary, we will evacuate the civilians into the mountains.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, should you not be with Lord Hien at Castrum Fluminis?
Doma has but regained her freedom. We will not give it up again so soon. Whatever should be the Empire's intent, I stand ready to protect the people with my life.
The residents took the news of the imperial delegation well enough. It should be business as usual.
So it's to be a peace negotiation. I am curious to see what the ambassador brings to the discussion table.
Thanks to Master Alphinaud and Mistress Alisaie's assurances, the people are reacting calmly to imperial presence.
We're finally back to working in earnest. We've even got merchants passing through from time to time. Things are finally turning around for the Saltery.
As the Saltery prospers, so too will Ala Mhigo. All the more reason we have to keep the area safe for the workers.
With production back on track, the Saltery is bustling in a way I've not seen in years. You've given us the tools to build a future for ourselves as well as for Ala Mhigo!
It's all coming together. With the return of our brothers and sisters, we've workers to spare─not that I'm shirking my patrol duties, you understand!
You stand before the Kienkan, residence of Lord Hien.
Between my findings here in Kugane and Riol's in Eorzea, I'm quite certain we can learn all there is to know of the growing divisions within the Empire.
Whatever Asahi is planning, we cannot let him have his way. After all Lord Hien has done, the Empire cannot be suffered to hinder Doma's restoration.
<sigh> Just when I thought Alphinaud had grown more dependable... Ack, but complaining about it won't bring back the coin. I must think of ways to recoup our funds.
I will replenish our coffers, you wait and see. If all goes as planned, we will recoup the cost of Gosetsu's blade ten times over!
I hope Soroban is doing all right. I may have to pay him a visit to make sure he isn't growing lax in his training...
The Empire's recent movement presents an opportunity for profit. You may leave it to me to sniff it out!
More often than not, it seems opportunity is wont to come knocking when the Scions are about. So long as you and yours remain here in Kugane, I'm certain a profitable venture will present itself.
In my mind, Yotsuyu is deserving of only one fate─memory loss be damned. And if you don't have the stones for it, we would be happy to take on the burden. It'll be over nice and swift.
To think that that she-devil yet lives to breathe Doman air... No good can come of this, mark my words.
Forgive me, but if you wish to peruse those particular tomes, I must ask that you first speak with Guiding Star. You can find him over yonder, with Talan.
Afraid I can't oblige you just yet. There's a fellow in Revenant's Toll you'll need to see first─Guiding Star, I believe is his name?
Those tomes are reserved for only the most skilled individuals. You will need to go and see Guiding Star in Revenant's Toll before I can show them to you.
Haven't got anything for ye, friend. Not until I hear ye've spoken with Guiding Star in Revenant's Toll.
Let's not put the cart before the chocobo. You need to go and see Guiding Star in Revenant's Toll before I can sell you any of those tomes.
A thousand pardons, my friend, but those tomes can only be purchased by a select few that have received the approval of Guiding Star in Revenant's Toll.
If you're an artisan with an interest in certain esoteric tomes, you would be well served by paying a visit to Guiding Star in Revenant's Toll.
In the market for master crafting tomes? Well enough, Eorzean, but you'll need to see a man in your homeland first─one Guiding Star in Revenant's Toll.

Tell me, is Alphinaud doing alright? Before leaving to Kugane, he insisted I accompany him to Loch Seld to oversee his swimming practice. The waters there are so rich with salt a boulder is like to float in them. The open sea, however, is another matter. I pray he doesn't do anything foolish.
I never realized Raubahn was so affluent in matters of money and politics, though in hindsight it should have been obvious. He was a member of the Syndicate, after all.
column23: His help has been invaluable, but I cannot depend on him forever. I have to be ready to stand on my own, even if I have to study... So long as the books aren't <Emphasis>too</Emphasis> large, of course.

column22: We've got a lot of work to do before Mother sheds her ssskin!
With the help of the griffin riders, we'll be able to patrol much farther afield.
When Gales is working, he's like a man possessed!
I quite like having M'zhet around. No matter how much of a messs I make of things, I can rely on him to make me look good by comparissson!
I thought the other Gatekeepers would be against taking in the Qalyana ssseparatists, but our new recruits were given a surprisingly warm welcome.
The Gatekeepers have come a long way, but as J'olhmyn sssays, “It's too early to rest on our laurels!”
Keeping Alpa out of trouble seemed like a daunting task at first. Now that you're here, I can breathe a little more easily...
The “down with the castellum” mob came to cause a fuss, but they soon shut their traps when they saw the griffin statues!
With Alpa as captain, we had enough strangeness to deal with already. Now that we've got this Gales bloke, it looks like things'll get even weirder around here...
I gave M'zhet quite a pummeling but it didn't seem to do him any lasting damage. I guess all the beatings he's received over the years have toughened him up.
Despite starting with just a handful of troops, the Gatekeepers have become a force to be reckoned with!

I'm happy that Alpa can stand on her own two feet─figuratively speaking of course! Although my work as her mentor is done, I'll be carrying on as a member of the Gatekeepers. What can I say? I like it here!
I am resssponsssible for asssigning tasks to adventurers. I can give you work should you wish to aid our cause.

I cannot help but envy the ssstriders who sssoar through the ssskies on the backs of griffins. Unfortunately, it ssseems that griffins have a natural aversion to the Ananta and will not allow us to ride them.
I never knew that ssstriders are unable to sssleep coiled up like Ananta.
column23: It must be terribly inconvenient having sssuch a rigid body. You always look ssso uncomfortable!

column22: That man's bizarre behavior was caused by lovesssickness?
column23: Although we Ananta are aware of the concept of romantic love, we have no need for it. Compared to familial love, it ssseems frivolous and unnecesssary.

column22: The new Qalyana recruits have already settled in well and their commitment to the cause is beyond question. We still have plenty of work to offer adventurers though, ssso let me know if you wish to help.
We Vira have watched over Alpa sssince she came into this world. It brings us great joy to sssee that she has grown into a ssstrong and dependable leader.
column23: As one of her most loyal friends and a sssteadfast comrade to the Gatekeepers, you have our deepest gratitude.

column22: Full glad am I that us griffin riders can help keep the Velodyna region safe. It's not the easiest place to patrol on foot, so I'm sure we can make a difference.
That Alpa─she's quite the leader, wouldn't you say? I get the impression those new Qalyana recruits would lay down their lives for her.
The Gatekeepers can rely on us griffin riders to be their “eyes in the sky”! We're also the first to get stuck in when fighting breaks out.
What do you think of our marids? In times of peace, their ssstrength makes light of the most demanding physical work. But in times of war, a rampaging marid is unssstoppable.
We Ananta ride marids by twisssting our tails around their trunks. I always find it ssstrange to see you ssstriders riding on their backsss.
Sometimes I get so engrossed in my work that I forget myself and say things I later regret... I'll try to exercise more restraint from now on.
Now that we have a garrison for the new Qalyana members, I've had the chance to see even more examples of Ananta culture. It has been quite the learning experience!
Alpa and the others don't seem to mind my eccentricities at all. I suppose it takes more than a little shouting and fist-waving to scare these soldier types!
We have a ssselection of wares for friends of the Gatekeepers. Feel free to peruse them at your leisure.
Would you like to be the proud owner of a mighty marid?
column23: Your deeds in ssservice of the Gatekeepers have earned you the recognition of the marid handlers. They have granted you the right to keep one of your own.

column22: These statues look just like the real thing─apart from being all golden and shiny, of course.
Everyone that's passed through these gates has been impressed by the statues, especially the Ala Mhigans. Their faces light up when they see them!
Thisss is the garrissson of the Ananta members of the Gatekeepers. It is the perfect place to ressst after a day of patrolling.
I can ssscarcely believe the day has come that Vira and Qalyana can live and work together. Captain Alpa has ushered in a new era.
We have much to learn from the ssstrider chirurgeons. They can even treat afflictions that we Ananta thought to be incurable.
column23: On the other hand, Ananta medicine relies sssolely on local ingredients, so it's useful when there's no time to get supplies imported from other lands.

column22: More and more people passs through here every day, many of whom have injuries and afflictions which require treatment. Even with our combined efforts, it is a ssstruggle to keep up.
column23: Providing sssuccor for those in need is a worthwhile cause, but I do wish our patients would take better care of themssselves!

column22: These rooms have been set assside for those passsing through the castellum. The sssoldiers stay in the garrison, while adventurers are asked to make their own arrangements.
Gyr Abania is prossspering now that the Garleans have gone. We have ssseen a dramatic increase in merchants crosssing the Velodyna, bringing goods from lands afar.
I can't help but feel envious of Alpa. She already has the respect of her whole tribe, including the broodmother!
column23: I can't afford to waste any more time. My legend begins right here, right now!

column22: Working with Alpa, I've realized that if I were serpent marshal, I wouldn't have to take part in any fighting.
column23: All I have to do is become more qualified than Serpent Marshal Brookstone...which is a fair bit easier said than done, I suppose...

column22: Heading towards Virdjala, are you?
Another mission fraught with danger, yet here I am still... Quiet moments such as this, spent in carefree conversation with comrades, I have grown to cherish most.
As you may have heard, we recently stepped up our surveillance of the beast tribes. My brother and I, we were out scouting near Zahar'ak when we were ambushed by an Amalj'aa.
column23: But if our assailant was quick as a coeurl, Hoary was a lightning bolt. In one fluid motion, he parried the blow and ended the encounter with a sublime shield bash. 'Tis a sight I shan't soon forget!

column22: Hoary returns from every mission a finer warrior than when he set out. I must work harder if I am to keep up.
Those of us who were afield have finally returned. Full glad am I to have everyone back─the place had been too quiet.
(I know I need to give Isildaure my undivided attention, but these waves of brotherly love make my mind drift to naughty places... Focus, Aenor! Focus!)
(I hope Isildaure can find someone to keep him company. With our missions, we can never linger very long.)
Seeing Homei going about his duties with a smile lifts my heart even as it brings a tear to my eye. Glad though I am for his nation's liberation, I shall be saddened to see him go.
I appreciate the young ones' concern, but as Isildaure has taught me, age is but a barrier in one's mind. These old bones can still put in a good day's work, and the spirit is amply willing besides!
Revenant's Toll has grown tremendously. As we move forward, instead of breaking new ground, perhaps it is time to focus on refining that which already stands.
Every time word reaches us of developments in Doma, we are stirred to greater effort. Our countrymen work tirelessly to rebuild our homeland, and in applying ourselves here, we join them in spirit.
Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, what a pleasant surprise! Whatever business brings you here, I pray it will keep you a while. Do make yourself comfortable.
The Domans have as much claim to Revenant's Toll as you and me. They're family. Thank the gods I made it back in time to see them off.
Will Isildaure be all right without Homei? They're practically inseparable these days, and I don't think he has many other friends...
It is for the best. It is. It is their past and their future. Their home. And I...I could not be happier for them...
You needn't worry for my grandfather. If he should grow lonely and start to long for Homei's company, he will purchase passage on the next ship bound for the Far East. I couldn't stop him if I tried!
I have been charged with preparing food for the Gatekeepers, though I've yet to find aught that suits the tassstes of striders.
My cooking ssskills only continue to grow here at Castellum Velodyna, and the work has actually grown to be enjoyable.
column23: It has also grown easier, thanksss to the newly furnished kitchen here. Soon even the ssstriders will salivate at the sight of my cooking.

column22: I'm convinced now that cooking is my passion. To see the look of sssatisfaction on travelers' faces after sampling my cooking... I never knew such joy exisssted.
column23: And never would have had I not joined the Gatekeepers. Thanksss to Alpa's vision, and your dedication to our cause, I have found my true calling. Thank you.

column22: Though we drove the Garleans out, 'twould be foolish to expect that they will give up so readily. We must redouble our vigilance and work closely with our comrades at the enclave.
I heard the Empire has proposed an exchange of prisoners. To speak plain, I am quite skeptical of their intentions. Still, I hope the arrangement goes as planned.
Fear not, my <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>lord</If>. Should Yotsuyu attempt to escape, these finely honed muscles will stop her dead in her tracks.
The Empire promises peace with Doma, but I will not let down my guard, nor will I slacken my training. Come what may, I will be ready.
Lord Hien bade us keep Yotsuyu's presence the strictest secret. Should even the whisper of a rumor reach the people's ears, all hells would break loose.
If our brothers and sisters are returned to us, mayhap we can at last restore Monzen to its former glory. Of course, we would first need to do away with my creations still roaming the ruins there.
That we should reclaim our freedom only to be afflicted with that woman...
Though I despise the thought of bargaining with the Empire, I agree with Lord Hien's decision. If there is even the faintest chance our people can be returned to us, we must try.
Doma has only begun to rebuild. I can only pray that we do not suffer another war.

Peace with the Empire could mean the beginning of open trade with Doma, and more supplies to bolster the rebuilding effort. Yet I cannot help but wonder what our conscripted brethren would think of us working with imperials.
There will come a time when we will call upon you again, but not yet. For now, I advise you to rest and regain your strength.
The boundless rage which once threatened to consume me has abated. This I owe to you, brave warrior.
(This...this began with a petition seeking <Emphasis>your</Emphasis> aid, not mine...)
If you chance to meet Tamamo Gozen, I pray you tell her that we all miss her dearly.
I'm Nue. If you ever need someone to call lightning down upon your foes and whatnot, I'm your auspice.
column23: 'Course, some faerie tales would have you believe I'm something altogether different. A monkey's face, a lion's legs, a snake for a tail─ridiculous, am I right? Not as bad as that horse with the head and body of a rabbit, to be fair, but still...

column22: Inugami is my name. Men speak it in hushed tones, mistakenly believing me to be a vengeful spirit that murders indiscriminately.
column23: There was a time when I killed men by the hundreds, but that was in retribution for the countless creatures they themselves mercilessly slaughtered. It was most deliberate.

column22: You will go no further. The reason should be plain─beyond lies the prison of Koryu. Were you to damage the wards, he would break free, and all would fall to ruin.
Headed to the surface? Follow me!
Alphinaud's been keeping a <Emphasis>very</Emphasis> careful count of his coins lately. I doubt he'd ask for a sip of water without asking the price first! Hee hee hee!
Headed for the temple or just taking in the wonderful smoky air?
Oh my, yes, I remember those two. The young girl scoffing down dango and the grizzled samurai. I can only tell you what I've heard, but it seems they're seeking a boat to cross the Ruby Sea.
Thank you again for saving me and Azami from the Kojin.
column23: Though to be honest, I was terrified when that imperial first arrived. I thought he'd come to finish what the Kojin had started.

column22: Isse invited you all to visit, but I was hoping we could go to the enclave. I'd very much like to see Lady Yugiri again.
Until we know what Asahi is after, we can but wait and prepare for the exchange of prisoners.
column23: Have you come on business? Or perhaps to observe our work in rebuilding the enclave? Feel free to look around. The people would be glad for your presence.

column22: If you are looking for Gosetsu, he is with Yotsuyu, keeping close watch of her. Yes, quite close indeed...
We have spared no effort to increase the guard at every settlement here in Yanxia. The Red Kojin will trouble us no more. On that, you have my word.
Me? I'm an engineer, here to assist with the development of the Saltery. And yes, I suppose building a crane or two here would be easier than hauling it up the steps...
One shouldn't rely overmuch on one's tools. It's like they say: to a man with a crane, everything looks like─ Wait, that's not right...
Everything's moving much faster with the help of these cranes. It's like they say: give a man a winch, and he'll eat for the rest of his─ Wait, that came out wrong...
This year's Little Ladies' Day celebration is well underway. I certainly hope you will find time to take part in the festivities.
Triple Triad? The Western game, yes? I learned the basics from a traveling merchant long ago. If you would like to play a game, I have my own cards!
Forgive me, but I cannot indulge in games when I am this hungry. It is enough to impede my concentration...
Well, would you look at that! I win! This is more fun than I remember. I ought to try and teach the others how to play again.
I blame this empty belly of mine. Hunger is a terrible distraction. You would not expect a soldier to fight in such a condition, would you?
It would seem we are more evenly matched than I thought. Perchance you are hungry too?
<chirp> <chirp>
<chirp>
<chirp> <chirp> <chirp>
<chirp>
<chirp> <chirp>
I wouldn't say no to a game or two. Although I must warn you: I'm known as one of the best in the Confederacy.
Having spent longer than I care to think about surveying the horizon, my eyes need a rest. If it's a game of cards you're after, I suggest asking someone else.
You're not the first to lose to me, and you won't be the last. Normally, I'd celebrate with a few swigs of something strong, but I'll need a clear head when I'm back on duty.
You certainly know how to play, unlike most of the drunkards and swindlers around here. I've no qualms about taking their coin, but they don't offer much in terms of practice.
While a draw seems like a fair result, it's not in a pirate's nature to leave things unsettled. I trust you'll oblige me another game?
I would be delighted for the chance to hone my skills. Rounds of Triple Triad often serve as a precursor to negotiations with our Eorzean clients, so I am no stranger to the game.
I'm dreadfully sorry, but as you can see, I'm rather busy.
Try not to be disheartened. I daresay I'm a cut above the amateurs you're used to playing.
That was somewhat unexpected. I admit that I will often intentionally lose to clients to keep them...malleable. However, a client you are not, and your win was entirely deserved.
A draw─in which we are both spared the bitter sting of defeat, yet deprived the sweet satisfaction of victory. It would be a shame for our contest to end so inconclusively. Care for another round?
Triple Triad? Little do you know I used to be a regular at the Saucer! I've got time to spare, so let's have ourselves a game or three.
Looks like it's my round! Gods, I needed that. Been drowning in work ever since I got here, let me tell you.
Blast. I'm too out of practice. Tried playing a couple of the folks here, but I wasn't feeling it. Best to keep business and pleasure separate, you know?
Pushed me to the limit, you did. You're a good opponent. If you ever want to have another go, let me know!
I have the pleasure of selling myriad fashion supplies, but I am afraid I can offer them only to those who take part in the Fashion Report. My sincerest apologies.
All of the items in stock come highly recommended. Pray browse to your heart's content.
I never would have <Emphasis>dreamed</Emphasis> that Jihli was the egg thief all along!
column23: But I forgive her the deception. After all, if she hadn't followed her vision, imagine all the wondrous encounters that never would have taken place!

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! It's so good to see you. As you can see, this year's Little Ladies' Day celebration is off to a smashing start. I trust you will find time to take part in our merrymaking, yes?
The Songbirds' performance was simply wonderful wasn't it? Well, if you should have the time to attend their show again, they have performances scheduled until the very end of the festival.
Giff has ssset aside one of his griffins for you to keep as your own. A beautiful, white true griffin, at that.
column23: He cares for those beasssts as though they were his children, ssso you should consssider it a great honor. I trussst you will take good care of it.

column22: I wish I could join the Doman Adventurers' Guild and go on special adventures and wear special hats!
Valentione's Day is upon us once more, and I, Lisette de Valentione, have come to fill hearts the realm over with the warmth of love, passionate and pure!
column23: Come one, come all─but ideally, come in pairs─and partake of the revelry! Let your innermost feelings be known unto the object of your ardor and affection, and love shall surely bloom!
column24: In order to undertake the quest “Lessons in Love,” you must first complete the quest “It's Probably Pirates.”

column22: Ah, 'tis you, my dear adventurer! How are you liking this year's festivities? They shall continue on for a little while yet, so pray enjoy them while you still can.

Our retinue has made the journey from Ishgard, in the hope of helping the people of Eorzea express their deepest feelings, during this season of romance. We shall do our utmost to give succor to those troubled by matters of the heart.
Lest you wonder, Astrid and Lisette are in fact cousins, but they are so close as to be like true sisters.
column23: Now, if only Astrid would come to accept me as a brother...or simply not despise me so. I know not what I have done to offend her...

column22: G-Good people of Gridania! V-Valentione's Day is upon us once more! S-So embrace your feelings... Open your hearts... Something something true love...
column23: (Gah, Fury take me, why am I so terrible at this?)

column22:
I can't thank you enough for helping to make the ceremony a rousing success. Please enjoy the festivities while they continue, and encourage your friends to─
...No, that won't do. Let's try that again.
column23: Ahem! Love comes not to those who wait, but those who participate! So take part in the heartwarming fun of the Valentione's Day celebration, and seize love by the...by the...tail?
column24: <sigh> This will take some getting used to...

column22: You there! Would you like to know if you are meant for love? If so, you need but participate in the Valentione's Day festivities, and I shall reveal to you your fortune as it is writ in the cards.
Do riches lie in your future, or rags? By my esoteric powers I shall divine for you the answer. I ask only that you take part in the Valentione's Day celebration with your object of your adoration.
I shall test your compatibility with any adventurer who strikes your fancy. Simply join in the revelry of Valentione's Day, and I should be glad to offer you a reading!
The village has been abuzz with talk of Alpa's exploits. I will have to ensure these sssuccesses do not go to her head.
I've spoken with Raubahn, and we've decided to keep quiet about Zenos until we have undeniable proof. There's no sense in upsetting everyone if there's a chance we're wrong.
So the grave was empty. By Rhalgr... How many people did we lose bringing that bastard down─and now he might still be alive?
There's nothing like the thrill of the hunt to set one's heart to racing.
column23: Yes, and you seem to have the gait of one familiar with the sport. But have you strength enough to be considered my rival? I'd very much like to find out.

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, as I live and breathe! The hunters of Clan Centurio speak quite highly of you.
column23: I can see there's much to be done if I'm to compete with a hunter of your renown.

column22: Off on another hunt, are we? Be sure to leave a few marks for the rest of us.
The hunt is on, my friend, and that means work for me and my hammer.
column23: My partner here's mainly in for the bounty, but he never fails to bring me back something for the forge. If you ever have something what needs smithing, maybe I can lend you a hand as well.

column22: Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Good to see you. You've any more scales for me?
Lyse told me about Alphinaud's little jaunt into the Empire. I can't <Emphasis>believe</Emphasis> he left without telling me─I've half a mind to dunk him in the lake when he gets back!

As promised, the conscripts without families have found a home with the Confederacy. I almost wish we had thought to poach imperial soldiers earlier─there is an undeniable strength and confidence to those who survive the front lines of the Empire's wars.
So the witch is dead, is she? I'd celebrate more were it not for the hurt I saw in the old samurai's eyes. Never have I seen a man more broken...

Soroban was terrifying! I mean, who could have predicted he had the potential to become a rampaging auspice of death and destruction? Anyone's carbuncle would've run. Anyone's. Even yours<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),26))>─and if you're about to tell me yours wouldn't, don't.<Else/>!</If>

There's still no word from Alphinaud.
<sigh> Patience has never been one of my virtues, but I suppose there is little else to do but wait...
You've heard naught from our intrepid Alphinaud? He travels under my protection as an emissary of Doma, and I would share any news of his journey.
column23: In the meantime, you might enjoy seeing what the act of rescuing our conscripts has done for the enclave's restoration efforts. Their homecoming has been as an invigorating wind, and we return to our labors with renewed purpose.

column22: Seeing these families celebrate the return of their loved ones... It has rekindled a yearning for my homeland I had thought long buried. But my duty is to Lord Hien─I swore allegiance to Doma, and it falls to me to fill the void left by Gosetsu's departure.
As a former soldier of the Empire, I have been chosen to oversee the handover of our imperial prisoners. Whilst I am so occupied, I must ask that you provide steadfast support for Lord Hien.
With the departure of the general, the defense of Doma rests in my hands.
column23: And yet they do not tremble. The return of our conscripts has swelled our ranks to a most formidable number. Glad I am that I need not turn to my brother for reinforcements.

column22: We were Domans before the imperials drafted us into their armies. But with our families dead and gone, the Confederacy is to be our home now. Compared to the hell the Empire put us through, though, this is a kami-blessed paradise.
When the time comes, I will send for you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Be ready for whatever lies ahead.
Soroban, was it? He surpassed all expectations...to your temporary dismay, perhaps, but to our ultimate benefit, I should think.
column23: Though, regardless of what Genbu may have told you, if you had failed to subdue him, I would have intervened. The wards would have held long enough, I am sure.

column22: <huff> <puff> I'm...I'm not going anywhere. I promise...
Wouldn't do for a guardian stuck on a mountaintop to lose his touch, am I right? So every now and then I'd come down to visit Byakko and goad him into a sparring match.
column23: I tell you, they're not called the Four Lords for nothing. Even when I gave it my best shot, he won. Easily. And you know what makes it worse? I <Emphasis>know</Emphasis> he was going easy on me!

column22: Back to the <Emphasis>Prima Vista</Emphasis> so soon?
This spot the Mol have lent us has a beautiful view. Quite spectacular! One time I almost blinded myself staring at the sunset, but it was worth it!
Once we prepare a new gift for the Big One, we can eat the old offering. Yes, yes. I have already consumed several dozen fish, and only a few came back up!

Wasshoi! Though I am often too busy to carry the mikoshi, I make sure to practice so I will not forget how to be most loud and boisterous. Gyofun dropped a book on my head yesterday to silence me, but I persevere!
I got ever so slightly, just the tiniest bit carried away and built a full archery range in the open area behind the main pavilion. I am sure you will love it, yes, yes!

All sorts of people have come to see our Namazu effigy! Their openmouthed gaping can only mean that they are in awe of its majesty. Yes, yes. It is just a matter of time until tales of its glory reach foreign lands.
Now that we have made our festival a success, we need only continue at this pace for the next seven years! I have not slept since we arrived here, and I will not start now. No, no.
I am happy to sew festival attire for each and every one of our participating Namazu. Yes, yes. Seven down, seven hundred and seventy to go!
The whole world seems brighter with our altar all aglow. Yes, yes. I wonder if our ancestors felt this way, too.
Between carrying the mikoshi and shouting, crafting and shouting, and his usual routine of getting injured and shouting, I worry that Gyoshin has been taking very little time to rest.
I suppose it was too much to hope that Gyoshin's carelessness would be cured so easily. Yes, yes. If he were just a bit more astute, he might realize I─ Never mind. Forget I said anything.

I hesitate to mention this, as I am afraid the other two might start trying to sacrifice each other again, but making the dolls to burn is no easy task. They require all sorts of materials. Yes, yes. Aaall sorts.
As careless as he is, Gyoshin cuts quite a striking figure when he sets his mind to something. Yes, yes...

Welcome, welcome! I have been assigned this prominent counter space for one reason─to provide material rewards to our loyal volunteers. The more people who come to lend a fin, the more items we can offer!

Great news, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! We have gone from offering many items to offering many, many items! I recommend our new authentic Namazu effigy─live sacrifice not included, no, no.
You can finally purchase a mikoshi of your very own─are you not delighted? Now the melodious squeaking of Namazu steps and a chorus of cheerful “wasshois” will accompany you wherever you go. Forever!
You want to try your hand at being a mikoshi bearer? I am afraid we built the poles at Namazu height and for Namazu fins. You, my friend, are more suited to being the one carried! Yes, yes.
There is a trick to bearing the weight of a mikoshi comfortably. It takes time and practice, and Namazu who lack discipline do not remain bearers for long. It has become something of a problem...

We might have become ever so slightly carried away with our plans for mikoshi mass production... On a completely unrelated note, we have decided to reward our invaluable festival assistants with their very own mikoshi!
column23: You need only give a shout, and your bearers will come waddling! Go forth, and share the wondrous spectacle of our mikoshi with people near and far!

column22: Is it true!? Did Alphinaud really board a vessel bound for the imperial capital!? Well, if anyone can negotiate a peace with the Empire, it will be our young diplomat!

We gathered what scraps of intelligence we could─meself from within Eorzea, an' Alphinaud from his Far Eastern sources─but there's a limit to what a bloke can learn about the Empire from outside its borders.
column23: Still, I'd never think to invite meself aboard an imperial bloody airship! 'Twas impulsive. Reckless. Ye've got to admire the lad's style!

column22: 'Twould seem Master Alphinaud has placed himself squarely in the path of danger. As a fellow Scion, I shall render whatever aid I can to ensure his safe return.
Though he is but half the size of my courageous brother, 'twould seem Alphinaud's bravery looms twice as large. Even Hoary might hesitate before embarking alone into the heart of the Empire!

It is my sacred duty to stand guard over the altar. Yes, yes. You never know when someone will get hungry and try to purloin an offering for a snack. That is why I keep my eyes wide open day and night.
column23: But I do understand how they feel, yes, yes. Those ripe vegetables, those succulent fish... And with guarding being such hungry work and all... Sometimes the food is halfway to my mouth before I realize what is happening!

column22: Now that the Xaela come to visit our festival, my time on duty─which is all the time, yes, yes─is much improved. The festival is more lively now...and they often bring gifts! <Emphasis>Edible</Emphasis> gifts.

I love how these Xaela festival activities give me the chance to experience new things! Yes, yes. Back at Yuzuka Manor I only sorted jars, but look at me now! Sorting targets, sorting ropes, sorting thicker ropes...
Quite a few of our many, many attendees have come bearing gifts. Sorting through them all is hard on the fins, but fascinating. I can even taste the ones I think are food! I am sometimes wrong.
What a realistic depiction! As I stand here, gazing into his eyes, I can almost feel his pain as he succumbs to the dizzying heat. And yet, he smiles. I think I...understand him. Yes, yes...

Do you ever think about what it would be like to be one of those dolls─to know that your fate is to die in agony as you are consumed by flames, yet be unable to scream? No? I cannot be the only one...
The moment I saw the archery demonstration, I knew I must take up the bow! That is why I volunteered to run the range here. Soon, I too shall stand with tranquil power, and shoot with fluid grace!
<sigh> I still cannot get the hang of it. Who knew archery would be so difficult with fins... Wait, you knew? You knew and didn't tell me!?
Would you care to ride this noble yol to Dhoro Iloh above?
Would you care to ride this noble yol to Nhaama's Retreat below?
Greetings! If you love the Moonfire Faire as much as I do, you should go and see the main attraction in Costa del Sol!
Glad you could join us! If you need anything related to the Moonfire Faire, from information to fireworks, you can find it all here!
So, what do you think of the Eorzean Nimble Warrior course? It's not going to be there forever, so enjoy it while you can!
Of all the challengers to complete the course, you're one of the most popular with the crowd. Why not give it another try?
Now <Emphasis>that's</Emphasis> the way to do it! The other Nimble Warriors can learn a lot from watching you.
column23: You know, if you register first and complete all three sections in order, you'll receive a prize!

column22: I think Haermaga will want to see you. He likes to personally congratulate every competitor that completes the course! Not that there are many of those, unfortunately...
If you fancy running the course again, be sure to speak with Beaudefoin first. I can only give prizes to registered competitors, so don't forget!
How goes your exploration of the tower? I expect that running around slaying fiends is second nature to you, but be sure to keep your wits about you.

After I became the leader of the Confederacy and defeated Hiruko, I went back into the tower for a second helping, so to speak. I thought I would be able to reach the top, but I could climb no higher than the fiftieth floor.
column23: It was then that I realized how our founder must have felt all those years ago. A dead leader is no use to anyone, so like him, I withdrew. Though it still galls me to this day, I know I made the right choice.

column22: Have you heard? The Immortal Flames will be conducting massive military maneuvers as part of the Rising's remembrances. And you can bet your bottom britches that this </Emphasis>Mythril Eye</Emphasis> reporter will be there to summarize the story for our respected readers!

Full many did we lose to the fires of the Calamity. During this period of remembrance, let us pay tribute to those who are no longer with us, that their memory might shine the way to a brighter future.
Have you heard? They say there's trouble at the Gold Saucer! As a matter of fact, there's a woman on Emerald Avenue who came back from there not long ago. Claims something awful happened to her.
If you're thinking of heading to the Gold Saucer for the festival, I'd think twice if I were you. Word has it something strange is going on there.
I was hoping to attend the festival at the Gold Saucer. That is, until I heard the rumors. Anyone who steps foot in there is either brave, or an incredible fool.
If you've a mind to pore over these tomes, perhaps you should go and speak with Guiding Star in Revenant's Toll first.
'Tis still somewhat strange to speak with you here, in a place I once thought neither of us would find ourselves. Not that your presence is unwelcome, of course!
column23: By the way─I told the children that you sometimes visit the enclave, and that they should pay their respects, but they seem to be very busy with their guild. I expect they will seek you out in due time...which is to say, when they want to involve you in one of their adventures.

column22: You look well, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Hale and healthy as ever. I am perhaps a touch less so, though I did manage to survive the long journey across the seas not once, but twice now!
column23: Since my return, I have taken to sharing my experiences with any who would hear them. In this way, I can broaden the horizons of those around me─or so I like to believe. Isildaure would surely agree!

column22: <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, is that you? I certainly did not expect to see you <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>this eve<Else/>today</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>today<Else/>this eve</If></If>!
column23: As you may have guessed, when I am not on patrol, I put my culinary talents to use here in the stalls. I hope to share with the others F'lhaminn's wisdom, and see what other original dishes we can create!

column22: Good <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morrow</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If> to you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Our dearest friend who helped us to return to Doma!
column23: It should come as no surprise that the mood during our voyage home was rather unlike our first across the seas. Singing, dancing─you would have enjoyed it very much!

column22: I'm terribly sorry, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, but until we have discovered the source of the disturbances here at the Gold Saucer, and dealt with it accordingly, we are not permitted to sell any festival merchandise.
As part of the celebration, the Gold Saucer has made a number of extravagant items available for purchase with MGP. But you must act quickly, for they will only be available for a limited time.
Lasting change must be built upon a stable foundation. The Ten Thousand Stalls are a good start, but we should strive to do more to see our people fed.
Progress and pleasure go hand in hand. Which is to say that, for all we have accomplished in improving the lot of our people, we must never forget to enjoy the benefits for ourselves.
column23: ...And no, this is not simply an excuse to justify my love of Triple Triad. It is one of many excuses, I will have you know.

column22: ...Hmm? Did you hear that? No? Must've been my imagination, then. Carry on!
What fools, these Xaela! Thinking no one would notice their clumsy attempts to sneak inside the Kienkan!
column23: Little do they know how lucky they are to have been caught by me and not Hakuro─he would have cut them all down without a second thought!

column22: Not bad, eh? Hard to imagine that there was once a pile of rubble where I stand, is it not? At this rate, we'll have the whole of the enclave cleaned up in no time!
Good to see everyone taking up their old trades, like these ones here. It may well be time for me to follow suit...
column23: ...What was my old trade, you ask? Heh, what do <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> think it was?

column22: Whatever happens out there, I have to believe everything will be all right here. So long as someone─be it me or another─remains to watch over these children. Especially those who have no one else left...
I'll never forget what that woman did to us. But as long as Azami is happy, that's all that matters.
She seemed so sad. All she wanted was a persimmon...

You really did Idyllshire a favor by clearin' out the Arboretum. Thanks to you, Edgyth was able to uncover all sorts of Sharlayan secrets. Hopefully, it'll lead to better produce bein' grown around these parts.
As a mage, I have some few scholarly acquaintances of my own, and will reach out to them for their insights. It may not be much, but 'tis my own little way of aiding Mistress Alisaie.
We Scions who can still perform our duty must take up the burden of our comrades who cannot. We will continue our watch over the beast tribes and do whatever else may be required of us.
Riol has left to rendezvous with Alliance forces. He means to serve in Thancred's stead in their infiltration missions.
Ocher, Sister, and I will take turns to keep watch over the slumbering Archons. We'll not leave them untended even for a moment.
Confound these old bones... Useless as I am, I should have been the one to be struck down...
It cannot be discounted that Mistress Krile has heard the voice as well. I will ask Tataru to send her word of what has come to pass.
When the call comes from the Mol, the Sun will rise to stand with you as we did in Doma.
No man can behold the Buduga in battle and fail to be moved by our courage. If we can but capture Hien's imagination with our valor, the rest of him will surely follow...
The Dotharl are ready to fight. We always are.
Strange... Amidst the radiance of your being, I sense a shadow. I pray it is but my imagination.

In a place such as the Steppe, where myriad tribes exist side by side, it is important to respect each other's ways. And it would be wise indeed to respect the beliefs of those who would gladly render up body and soul to the Dusk Mother.
I have heard the tidings. To think that Y'shtola and Urianger should be struck down as well... If the Ascians are indeed the culprits, what exactly is their goal?
Many of our neighbors have sent emissaries to treat with Lord Hien. I dare to hope that our alliance will grow into a formidable force.
I am minded to dispatch more shinobi to the provinces. We cannot have too many eyes searching for Master Alphinaud nor too many lips whispering the rumors pertaining to Zenos.
First Thancred, and now Y'shtola and Urianger... I'll consult the scholarly types around here, but I really wish I could do more. Keep looking after Alisaie and everyone else, all right?

There's a lot on Alisaie's mind at the moment, but she's as determined as ever. I could see it in her eyes when she came to discuss the Ironworks. It inspires me to redouble my efforts here in Kugane!
Greetings, my friend. If you are looking for Tataru, she has left with Mistress Alisaie to speak with the good people of Garlond Ironworks.

I'm reliably informed that Doma seeks to forge an alliance... The thing about alliances, of course, is that they can be so very <Emphasis>expensive</Emphasis>. While I daresay it's within the company's means to provide the necessary funds, it is for the chairman to decide whether such an investment would be worth the risk.

As Antecedent, Minfilia fostered connections with numerous scholars and research organizations. There's the professors Erik and Lamberteint, the scholars of the Sons of Saint Coinach, the myriad guilds of Eorzea, the Council...and the list goes on.
column23: Owing to her foresight, we have many allies to which we might turn in this dark hour. Minfilia might not have stood upon the frontlines like some of us, but without her work the Scions could not have functioned half as well. There's a lot I can learn from her.

column22: On the matter of Nhaama's power and the alliance, the gods have remained silent. That is their way of telling us to choose with our hearts.
Though the Mol have no love for war, we love our home fiercely. Should the Steppe be threatened, we will rise up to protect it─as will full many other tribes, I believe.
The council has resumed, and the leaders offer their assurances that they have the remaining agenda well in hand. They bid you godsspeed in shedding light on the mystery.
The most important thing when building a playground is to make it safe. No sharp corners for the children to bash their heads on!
The entrance is rather grand, wouldn't you say? The little embellishments were my idea.
Not wanting the steel from the imperial tower to go to waste, we took it to Tsuranuki. He was practically jumping for joy!
Of course, I could not disappoint Master Ishibushi after he put me in charge of constructing the pavilion. It is coming along rather nicely, if I do say so myself.
If you ask me, I have more cause to be upset. With him in such a state, any visitors are sure to assume he is Genbu, not I!
Have I truly become host to a great kami? What if it does not wish to leave?

It took me centuries to come to terms with Tenzen's passing. That Suzaku had not came as no surprise. Like us, Seiryu cared for him deeply, and I cannot help but worry that he too may struggle to accept your part in this...
Oh, my beloved, I pray you yet watch over me...
I know she says she isn't, but boy does she look like the Firebird of legend! I bet she gave you the fight of your life, too! I might have to ask for a sparring match...
Are you sure you have not crossed paths with Tamamo Gozen? No? And you would tell me if you had? Ah, yes, of course. Why would you not...?
Seeing as we're already nearby on Scion business, we volunteered for the security detail at the council meeting. None of us could have foreseen what unfolded there...
It pains me to see the young ones suffer so. While 'tis true that we are hardened by adversity, such a weight is heavier than anyone has any right to bear.

Wherever he is at the moment, I'm sure Alphinaud is doing the best he can. That's all that any of us can do, and I mean to do just that. We'll continue keeping an eye on primals, don't you worry, and tend to them as well if needs be.
I've taken excerpts from the chief's report on Omega and loaded them onto the terminal there. Feel free to take a look.
column23: I would've liked to add Nero's observations as well, but that man is nowhere to be found. Did you know he sold Rowena the pattern for a new uniform!?
column24: Oh, and speaking of nowhere to be found, I wonder how far Alpha has gone. Not outside of Eorzea, surely... You haven't spotted our little chick on your travels have you?

column22: When the Ala Mhigans left to return to their homeland, we felt as though <Emphasis>we</Emphasis> were the ones left behind. But things are starting to look brighter for us as well. After all these years, to think that there's still honest work for honest pay... I'll earn the coin to get back into the city yet!

The other day, a man from the East Aldenard Trading Company paid us a visit. He said that they needed hands for the rebuilding effort in Gyr Abania. That they were looking to hire folk among the poor and the displaced.
column23: Long have I cursed my lot and the powers that be. I thought that I would die with a curse on my lips. To suddenly be given another chance... Can this be true? Can there really be a better life for us?

column22: Me? I'm recruiting workers to help bring Gyr Abanian salt to Ul'dah. It's a business venture that aims to help both refugees and Ul'dah's own poor to begin anew.
Perhaps if I remain here, she will return. Yes, yes. Surely that would be the best course of action...
I tell you, I've got a bad feeling about this...
Some folks crave excitement, but if you ask me, nothing beats peace and quiet.
There are few in whom I would place my faith without question. I count the Four Lords among these. They will not fail.
I had made peace with death before Koryu returned. This, I believed...until he stood there before us all, and the long life I had lived felt not at all satisfying...
I don't know why everyone's so worried. I mean, we've got the whole gang back together, right? The Four Lords! What could possibly go wrong?

Doesn't speak too highly of the rest of us that we could only hang back and watch while the Four Lords did all the hard work. But hey─we've got a few more millennia till we have to do this again, right? Time enough for me to train that I can do my bit when the time comes!
So it has come to this...
You may think it a dull, thankless task to stand watch over the sacred crystal for several thousand years. Frankly...you would not be entirely wrong to say so. Nevertheless, it is our duty.
First he was consumed by his raging aramitama, and now he's become an even bigger turtle! And I thought I led a charmed life.
I'll do my best to live up to Genbu's name. That said, it would be nice if you came by every so often to cheer me on...
Whatever is the matter, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Could it be that a tiger...has your tongue?
column23: Ohoho! Do not pretend you are not amused. Genbu taught me that one.

column22: If only Koryu were the sole source of tragedy in this world of ours. But we know better, do we not?
column23: Though it perhaps is not on such a grand scale, our work continues, for it falls to the Four Lords to safeguard this realm.

column22: I overheard some of the younger auspices whispering how odd it was that “Seiryu” is a giant snake. Some rubbish about ancient Hingan etymology.
column23: My name is my name─that's what I have to say on the matter. If my appearance is somehow at odds with your expectations, then that is the fault of you and whatever wild fantasies articulated by wandering minstrels you have elected to believe.

column22: Master Gosetsu will not return to find us soft and sagging, oh no! Constant training and iron discipline for these warriors!
With the return of our brothers and sisters, the repair of the enclave proceeds with ever greater momentum! Soon our eyes must fall upon Monzen, and the bitter task of dismantling my poor children...

It would seem that peace with the Empire was not so simple after all...
Be that as it may, I take great joy in the return of our countrymen─the reunion of family means more to Doma's restoration than any amount of supplies.
I was not surprised to hear the Empire played us foul at the prisoner exchange, but at least our people were able to escape. It is good to see new faces here at the House.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Thank the kami for you and Lord Hien. Our people have come home, and Doma rejoices!
Don't you worry, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Inspector Hildibrand will be back in a jiffy!
All this time, the Ame-no-Murakumo was in the Red's treasure vault. And there I thought it was no more than a story...
Triple Triad? If you promise to leave I shall humor you this once, but let us be brief.
I have no time for games. Unless you have business with the magistrate, I suggest you be on your way.
If you would feel shame, let it be for distracting an officer from his duties, not defeat in some childish game.
Well, what did you expect? I am a guard, not a Triple Triad duelist. Now please, be on your way.
A draw... I suppose this means you wish to take up more of my time?
Triple Triad? Yes, I am familiar. For better or worse, I was often in the company of Garlean officers who enjoyed the game. If you wish to play, you need only ask.
Yes, I am familiar with Triple Triad. For better or worse, I was often in the company of Garlean officers who enjoyed the game. But I'd rather not dwell on such dark times.
It seems I learned more from the Garlean officers than I'd care to admit...
Impressive. It would seem the Garleans have more to fear than your prowess in combat.
Well played, my friend. Would you care to play again? I'd rather not end things on a draw.
A game of Triple Triad? I was hoping you might ask. At last, an opportunity to test my stratagems.
My apologies, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>, but might I have a moment longer to think? Devising a winning stratagem for my cards is proving more troublesome than I thought.
I won? I won! Oh, that was absolutely splendid. If you care to play again, I would be more than happy to oblige.
Oh dear. It would seem my stratagems are not quite enough to compete with a true Triple Triad duelist. You have given me much to think on.
That I could hold my own against an experienced duelist is more than I could have hoped for, but are you satisfied with only a draw?
Thanks to the efforts of Lord Hien and his allies, my brothers and I are finally free from the Garleans. It feels a dream even now.
Tell me, have you heard of Triple Triad? It is a most wondrous game. The researchers here at the pier have been teaching me how to play.
column23: It seemed simple enough at first, but it is actually quite complex. Why, I could spend all day sitting here thinking of stratagems. In fact, I often do just that.

column22: Curses! We can't leave this devilry uninvestigated, but if I leave my post, no one will be keeping an eye on the Impresario. If only an obviously skilled adventurer would pass by...
column23: In order to undertake the quest “The Sinister Soirée,” you must first complete the quest “It's Probably Pirates.”

column22: Have you gained access to the masquerade yet? I hear tell that the Continental Circus has quite outdone itself with the decor this year. No doubt in order to lure in more innocent victims!
Never fear, I will continue to monitor the Impresario's activities without rest! You are free to keep an eye on the happenings within the manor.
What a peculiar costume! Absolutely perfect for our marvelous masq─ Oh, that's your real face, is it? Well then, carry on.
As long as there are nights, there will be devilry. Mark my words... Er, mark them down as another outstanding idea for a slogan, I mean!
Come one, come all, to the marvelous masquerade!
column23: Ah, another vict─ahem, visitor! Are you ready to revel?

column22: This is the greatest day of my life! It's also the only day so far!
Hey, you're back! Are you tempting fate? Can I come?
<sigh> Being alive is all well and good, but this floating and bobbing is exhausting...
I don't mind the company, just...revel quietly, please.
None of the other decorations ever had faith in me to achieve my dreams. But look at me now! I'm a bat!
How do I look? Do you feel like I'm peering into your soul? I mean, I'm not, but don't I look like I could?
To think that I, once a mere ornament, would someday send people into shrieking fits of adoration!
I must say, the thought of singing in front of everybody does make me rather nervous. But then again, they might not be able to hear me above Baenfaeld, anyway.
I think we can all breathe a sigh of relief now that all of our plans have come together. Thankfully, the festival-goers seem to be equally delighted!
column23: As for the choir, I think we know the songs well enough to perform without a conductor, but we would be delighted to have you lead us again!

column22: Have you heard? We've got a choir comin' for a singsong! That'll get everyone into the festive spirit!
