Apparently, we'll have some musicians performing for us this year. Not exactly my cup of tea, but I suppose some people might enjoy it.

Oh, you're the conductor, are you? Good luck with that choir─you'll need it. The only one who seems to know what he's doing is that Augustiniel fellow. I'm surprised he's willing to put his reputation on the line by singing with a bunch of complete beginners.
Come one, come all! Welcome to the Starlight Celebration! Prepare yourselves for the greatest show the realm has ever seen!
Do I have the honor of addressing the esteemed conductor of the choir? My heart soars to imagine the spectacle of musical genius that awaits us!

Timber gathered from near the One River is highly resilient to water and humidity, making it incredibly durable. In fact, most of the reconstruction plans rely heavily on these kinds of local resources.
You think I am being lazy, don't you? I would have you know, stepping back to see the bigger picture is an important part of our work.
Even simple structures like this have their challenges.
I have a feeling the ceiling is a bit higher than we need it...
Seems like a lot of effort for a bunch of volunteer guards, but we have our orders.
Watching the construction of the school is a wonderful opportunity for the children to learn of traditional Doman joinery.
So this will be the new headquarters for the Doman Adventurers' Guild? I can hardly wait!
I heard you've been making lots of donations! That's what Miss Minazuki says anyway.
We're not playing, this is serious! I'm making sure the others are training properly.
Miss Minazuki told us to keep away from the builders. It's dangerous, she says.
History's interesting but I like doing sums. There's always a right answer!
I'm looking for creepy-crawlies! Watch out─you'll step on them!
A great big school, just for us! How exciting!
It's funny sitting in a school while it's still being built! Maybe there's something we can do to help?
The grown-ups made this lovely garden for us! We can play here whenever we want!
Miss Minazuki is very clever, you know. Even our Master of Lessons used to do everything she said!
I love school! Can we still come here when we're older?
Sometimes I miss my friends in Eorzea. There aren't many Miqo'te or Lalafells around here, are there?
Where should I go on my first adventure? Maybe I can go to see Mister Boulder!
The enclave would be a great place to play hide-and-seek, don't you think? We should play after school!
I can't wait to be grown-up and go wherever I like! Then I'll travel all around the world!
I want to help Yozan and Koharu when they get in trouble. If I read lots of books, I can give them good advice!
Although Master Ishibushi has taught me so much already, I feel like it will take decades before I even begin to approach his level of competence.
Minazuki has asked me to help look after the children, but they are generally so well behaved there is not much for me to do.
The children cannot spend all of their time studying. It is good for them to get outside and stretch their legs, especially after sitting still for such a long time.
I am often asked to relate tales of our time in Eorzea. Although I wish we could have gone there under happier circumstances, I have a wealth of pleasant memories to share.
Have you happened to see Isildaure on your travels? I do hope he is well. Perhaps one day we can enjoy tea together in this pavilion.
Those children certainly keep me on my toes! Not that they mean to cause mischief, but they are so adventurous that I cannot help but worry.

I cannot describe how much it means for us to return to our homeland and lead meaningful lives. The people of Mor Dhona showed us incredible kindness but I could not escape the feeling that we were a burden to them.
I find myself unsure as to how I can contribute to the enclave. I lack Tsuranuki's skill as a craftsman, nor do I have a gift for the culinary arts like Higiri...
Perhaps the enclave guard will be a chance to make something of myself. I have always fancied becoming a fighter of some sort!
Mitsuba and I have been attempting to recreate Eorzean dishes using local ingredients. While there are a few differences, I would say that we are getting closer to the flavors I enjoyed in Mor Dhona.
Thanks to you, I was able to return to Doma to live with my father.
column23: I still feel enormously grateful for everything the Confederacy did for me. In fact, I am able to put the skills to good use, and I continue to work as a shipwright.

column22: Clearing away the rubble is only the beginning! We plan to fill the area with a host of new buildings to encourage the rebirth of the enclave.
Kozakura and the Shazenkai hold the purse strings around here, it seems. Time will tell if we were right to place our trust in them...
Oh, hullo! If you are hoping to peruse our selection of festive wares, I am afraid they are not quite ready!
Hello, my dear. The prizes for this All Saints' Wake's most raucous revelers aren't ready just yet, but you can soak in the haunting atmosphere while you wait!
Slowly but surely we're rebuilding our fortunes, one day at a time. Before long we'll be buying land and building homes, and then...then they have to accept us, right?
Some people will tell you that all you need to change your stars is a chance. A steady job with a modest salary. These people are fools.
column23: The important thing for us now is not to fall prey to the lie that is the Ul'dahn dream, for that is but a tool they use to divide us. Only through united purpose and collective action will we achieve lasting change for ourselves and our children.

column22: I reckon you saw Pearl Lane for yourself. It's still got a ways to go, but it's a start. Here, too. Call me naive if you like, but I sincerely believe it.
It's not every day you make friends with a secret collective of talking animals, after all! Even if Soroban hadn't decided to remain at Reisen Temple, I wouldn't have wanted to stay away.

I still struggle to believe that Soroban has been chosen for such an important duty. Not that he is undeserving or ill-suited to it! But I knew him when he was very young, and oh, the stories I could tell you...
His grand plan is to bring about <Emphasis>more</Emphasis> calamities!? This is insanity! This madman must be stopped at all costs!
Now that we have learned the Emperor's true purpose, war has become an inevitability. 'Tis times like these I curse my own uselessness in battle...
The Ascians are terrible beings indeed that they would found an entire nation to further their dark designs. 'Twould seem that the Empire's history is as sinister as Ishgard's own.
The Empire exists to wage war, and war it shall have. But its vast armies pour in like the tides themselves─this could very well be the greatest military threat Eorzea has ever faced...

It makes a twisted kind of sense that the Empire was built by the chaos bringers themselves. The revelation yet rattles me, but now that we know our enemies are one and the same, we have a target upon which to unleash the full force of the Alliance!
We suspected Ascians meddled in the shadows of the Empire, but the truth is far beyond my wildest imagining. At least now we know the face of our enemy, and need not hesitate to strike at its heart!
I refuse the Emperor's words with all of my being. What justice is there in an ideal that demands the sacrifice of so many?
I was born in the Empire, but I will never serve the Emperor. Only the Seedseer commands my loyalty.
I am glad we arrived in time to aid in the battle. Though our vanguard may be small, these few are our chosen elite─the finest warriors of the Far East.
Send me to the front lines, if you please. We'll give the imperials a taste of the Maelstrom's cannons─not to mention my axe!
The Temple Knights have deployed in full strength. Eorzea's future is Ishgard's future, and our fates ride upon the outcome of this conflict.

My first engagement as Flame General, and it is full-scale war with the Empire...
I feel some measure of nervousness, of course, but I swear I will make Father proud in the battles to come!

In case you were wondering, we won't be sailing off to fight in Eorzea in the foreseeable future. Our ships just aren't equipped for that kind of voyage. But you may be sure we'll do our part against the Empire closer to home.
Many tribes have pledged their warriors to the alliance that they might protect the Steppe and our way of life. Perhaps an outside war is what is needed to end the conflict amongst my people.
What is it now? I've already spoken to one of your “Scions” about this disappearing aether business.
column23: I consider myself an expert in such matters, but never have I heard of a soul's trail ending without a trace. It's unprecedented. Preposterous!

column22: The greater part of the Temple Knights have been dispatched to hold the Ala Mhigan border. Though only few remain here in Ishgard, I assure you our people yet remain in good hands.
The Confederacy bows to no one...but I see the wisdom in joining Lord Hien's alliance. The Empire threatens us all, and only by banding together can we hope to keep what is ours.
Word of your exploits at lord Hien's side have reached even here. Though it pains me that I cannot join him in battle, our duties here are of no less importance. I pray you, keep him safe.
We can barely find time to rest now that the fighting's started. I had a mind to join in the fighting myself, but Lyse insisted that I see to things here.

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I thought you would be with the others defending the border at Ala Mhigo. I intended to volunteer my services, but alas, my dear brother was a few steps faster. With him gone, it falls to me to keep watch over House Fortemps.

Worry not about Lord Emmanellain. He appeared devastated at the news that he could not venture to Ala Mhigo, that much is true. But deep down, I believe he is quite relieved that he can stay here at the manor.

Don't look like that. Shtola survived being cast adrift in the Lifestream, didn't she? Her soul is nothing if not resilient─and the same goes for all of Louisoix's students. So stop worrying about whether you'll see them again, and focus on what can be done in the here and now.

Is it true!? The other Scions have fallen ill!? Gods...
Please, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, be careful. If we should lose you too, I...I don't know what I would do.
I heard of the misfortune which befell young Alphinaud, and it pains me that I have neither the skills nor the knowledge to be of help to him.
column23: I can but do my part to defend Eorzea, and ensure the world is no worse off on the day he finally awakens.

column22: You must be the one Leofard keeps talkin' about. He sent me here to pick up a few things, but I thought I'd stick around and take in the sights. These goblins make some interestin' machines, you know!

What a wonderful <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>night<Else/>morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>night</If></If> for gathering herbs! Do you know, I found some lovely little cards with pictures and some numbers on them. I wonder if they are used for some sort of game?
Now that the whole episode with the interdimensional rift has come to an end, life has returned to a state of relative normality. Perhaps I should take up a hobby to occupy my spare time...
For patrons who prefer intellectual stimulation, we have mahjong. For everyone else, we have Cuff-a-Cur.
Tell me, do you believe in luck? When the final tile to a winning hand falls into place, is it divine providence that grants you victory, or your own foresight?
Time for a quick game? There are a few things I'm supposed to be doin', but they can wait.
Sorry, but I'm tryin' to remember all the things Utata sent me to get. Lost my list, see?
I can't wait to tell the other Redbills about beatin' the famous <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. No need to mention it was only in a card game, is there?
Oh. That's not what I was expectin'... Maybe I should get some better cards?
Well, all things considered, I'd say that was a fair result. But I think I can spare the time for another hand, if you're game.
Would you care to indulge me in a game using these charming cards I found amidst the undergrowth?
I am dreadfully sorry, but Master Matoya has expressly forbidden me from partaking in such leisurely pursuits until my errands are done.
I say, that was rather enjoyable! This will be one to tell my tadpoles!
Oh dear. Perhaps the cognitive faculties that Master Matoya has bestowed upon me are insufficient in some manner...
Now that is a surprise! To think that a mere poroggo such as myself could stand on equal footing with someone so abundantly intelligent!
While I cannot permit any unauthorized persons beyond this point, our rules do not prohibit anyone from standing where you are now. Or from playing cards, for that matter...
Although I am partial to the occasional game of cards, I sense the presence of my ever-watchful superiors nearby. Perhaps another time.
I must say, I was expecting a little more competition. Nonetheless, I thank you for helping me pass the time.
Had I known you would prove such a formidable opponent, I would have played my best cards from the outset. Should you agree to another match, you will not find me such easy prey.
Now that the warm-up is over, perhaps we can both start playing seriously.
I'm sure these crates won't go anywhere while I have a game of cards. Just promise not to tell Master Garlond!
I would love to play cards, but Jessie told me to watch these crates like a hawk. Not to mention, I think she's watching <Emphasis>me</Emphasis> like one, too.
I can't believe it! I won! Wait a moment─are you sure you didn't lose on purpose?

Hmm... A slight miscalculation on my part. I'm probably just tired from looking at crates all <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>night<Else/>morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>night</If></If>.
Interesting... Our individual strengths and weaknesses in perfect equilibrium. If we were to play again, would the outcome be the same? This warrants further testing.
The imperials have not gained any ground since our last battle, but neither have we. I fear this stalemate can only continue for so long.
Gods, nobody annoys me more than Whastrach. We were what you might call “friends” at one point, but even then, he always looked down on me.
This sickness which plagues Alphinaud and the others is unlike anything I have ever seen. To see them as they are and be powerless to help them... It is a pain beyond words.
Both Mistress Krile and Master Matoya have taken up the search for a cure to this strange sleeping sickness. I pray they find a remedy soon.
If you've come to ask after Y'shtola and the others, I'm afraid there's been no change. Rest assured we're doing everything we can to help them.
Welcome to the Hard Place!
Welcome! May I interest you in a bottle or three of our house spirit?
This costume is surprisingly comfortable, but the headpiece does begin to feel heavy after a while. How ever does Master Adkiragh manage to wear it all the time?

Greetings, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I’m pleased to report that our Ishgardian cuisine has proven tremendously popular.
The chief suggested that we wear the same headpiece. We...politely declined.
The two brothers were once close, but at some point Bulugan began to drift away. And despite his boisterous demeanor, the chief can be given to bashfulness. So the distance between them remains.
To be a blue mage, you need to go and discover things for yourself! You'll be doin' a fair bit of walkin', too, so it might be worth investin' in a sturdier pair of boots at some point.

Let me tell you somethin', <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. There are more important things in life than money. I once knew a man who forgot that, and─well, never you mind. Just remember what I said.
Hello, mate! How's the spellbook comin' along? Filled it up yet?
column23: As for your performances, if you keep this up, you'll have nearly as many fans as me!

column22: Latool Ja and Gaheel Ja know Martyn for many years. Guide him around New World, we did. Now we assistants. Pay not so good, sometimes dangerous, too. But we like Martyn anyway.
Some people think Latool Ja is Gaheel Ja and Gaheel Ja is Latool Ja! Ha! Silly Eorzeans!
Martyn love blue very much. Blue clothes, blue hair, blue underwear, blue assistants. Ah! Maybe that why he hire us!
Every day, Martyn fight in arena. He have so many bruises, his skin slowly turning blue.
Martyn must stay in infirmary. Martyn ask for blue bandages, but only have white. Silly Martyn! Always thinking “blue this, blue that”!
Ul'dah very interesting city! Even have cornmeal, like Mamool Ja recipe. So much cornmeal, Latool Ja need two heads to eat it all. But Latool Ja only have one head...

I first met Martyn when he came to live with us, along with Whastrach. While they were both committed to their research, they always helped around the village however they could. <sigh> It all seems so long ago now.
column23: Martyn has hardly changed at all since then, but Whastrach... It saddens me deeply to think of what he has become. Please, you must make him see sense!

column22: You did it! Whastrach was more powerful than I could've imagined, but you beat him!
Valentione's Day is upon us once more, and I, Lisette de Valentione, have come to fill hearts the realm over with the warmth of love, passionate and pure!
column23: Our events will capture your heart, too, adventurer! Or, at least they will once you've done me the tiniest of favors...
column24: Would you mind checking in on little Astrid for me? She's still quite new to all this, and I'd feel sooo much better if someone lent her delicate efforts a steadying hand.

column22: How are you enjoying the festivities? Have your fortune told! Your affinity divined! Let us all celebrate this wondrous day of love together!
Thanks to your timely aid, our celebrations have reached new heights of song-worthy passion!
column23: And yet I cannot help but worry that those less pure of heart turn these giddy festivities to their own unsavory purposes...

column22: You have discharged your duties, my champion of love! Go now, and enjoy the celebrations with a heart full of frolicsome fun.
column23: Lisette eagerly awaits those who would know their fortunes! Or if you would undertake the ceremony once more, a House Valentione servant stands ready to conduct you to the venue!

column22: Taggy has embraced the spirit of the celebrations with more enthusiasm than I expected...but it does bring me joy to see her so joyous.
Did Lisie tell you!? Our next attempt at the ceremony was smooth as Ul'dahn silk! In fact, it was such a lark, I think we might go through again!
Gimme a miracle elixir!
Have you done your part for the Valentione's Day celebrations? Once you've assisted Lady Astrid, I should be happy to give a free reading on romance for you and a partner of your choice.
Heading out on an adventure? Forget the weather─you need a forecast on treasure! Assist the Valentiones with their festivities, and I shall share with you the fate of your material fortune.
As part of the Valentione's Day festivities, I can offer you an affinity reading of indisputable accuracy. Come stand before me once you have discharged your duty to ardor and affection.
Valentione's Day is upon us once more, and I, Lisette de Valentione, have come to fill hearts the realm over with the warmth of love, passionate and pure!
column23: How stands the reservoir of rapture within <Emphasis>your</Emphasis> bosom, adventurer? Whomever your favored partner might be, our fortune-tellers can help sound the depths of your unplumbed affinity!

column22: Latool Ja cannot wait to see Azulmagia lose! Send him and silly costume to seventh hell!

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> beat Azulmagia! But now Latool Ja must give Gaheel Ja ten gil... Why, say <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Ha ha! No reason...

The other day, a man from the East Aldenard Trading Company paid us a visit. He said that they needed hands for the rebuilding effort in Gyr Abania. That they were looking to hire folk among the poor and the displaced.
column23: Long have I cursed my lot and the powers that be. I thought that I would die with a curse on my lips. To suddenly be given another chance... Can this be true? Can there really be a better life for us?

column22: Do you not feel it in the air, adventurer? 'Tis Valentione's Day, and love, uh...runs rampant through the streets!
column23: We of House Valentione have returned to spread our message of <Emphasis>Ardor and Affection</Emphasis>, and honor the pure pursuits of our ancestor, Countess Arabelle.
column24: In order to undertake the quest “A Many-splendored Thing,” you must first complete the quest “It's Probably Pirates.”

column22: Hmm, how very odd. You, I mean. Your appearance, rather...
You have been warned, mortal. Bear this in mind should you choose to stay your course.
